Section 1
Start of Tanker Chapter – Prior to Olga Battle
Opening
Cutscene
Caption: George Washington Bridge, Manhattan
The Hudson River roils in the storm. Snake stands on the bridge (George Washington Bridge). Only his silhouette, outlined by the constant shafts of water glancing off the invisible figure, can be made out. Visibility is close to zero due to heavy rain, high winds, and dense fog. Snake dives off the bridge strut, a thin wire attached to his body. The tanker's deck looms before him.
Snake lands on the tanker's deck, to the stern of the ship. The impact of the landing renders his stealth camo inoperable. Snake is forced to deactivate it and become visible.
Cut to binoculars (night vision) zoomed-in view (green). Snake is in the center of the circular field of vision. The view is from a helicopter above the tanker (very high altitude).
A man (Ocelot) is looking through the binoculars from inside the chopper.

OCELOT

Our boy is right on schedule.
Ocelot touches the revolver on his lap with his right hand.

OCELOT

He'll know soon enough...
Snake quickly ducks behind a windlass. A close-up of his face is shown for the first time. The face is shadowed with a stubbly growth, and his hair is now shoulder-length. He could be in his forties; overall, he looks very different—much older—from the Snake in the previous game. Only the signature blue bandanna reminds us this is him. The stealth suit is not a top-of-the-line military issue, but his old gear from Shadow Moses, showing signs of repair in several places. No protective pads are evident. He's armed with a Beretta, carried in a hip holster. Snake looks toward the stern, the windlass at his back.
Opening
Codec Call
Snake contacts Otacon. To Codec screen.
Otacon looks more mature than in the previous installment. He wears the same pair of glasses.

SNAKE

This is Snake. Do you read me, Otacon?

OTACON

Loud and clear, Snake.

SNAKE

Kept you waiting, huh? (Directed at the player.) I'm at the "sneak point."

OTACON

Everything going okay?

SNAKE

The stealth camo's busted. Landing impact.

OTACON

We must have overused it. Sorry, but you're gonna have to deal with it. You're not in the military anymore.

SNAKE

Right. I didn't plan on relying on this gadget anyway.

OTACON

The private sector's not so bad, is it? Privacy guaranteed...

SNAKE

I'm happy as long as no one gives me any more unwanted gifts.

OTACON

You mean that thing with Naomi?

SNAKE

And I can't say I miss the chattering nanny.

OTACON

Mei Ling's not so bad. That reminds me, I have to get in touch with her again about that new Natik1 flashware.

SNAKE

Diverting toys from the SSCEN (U.S. Army Soldier Systems Center)2 again? Give her a message from me: someone will find out sooner or later. She's better off assuming it's sooner and quit while she's safe.

OTACON

Too true. Okay, Snake, let's get to work.

OTACON

You know how the technical specs of Metal Gear were sold on the black market after Shadow Moses?

SNAKE

All Ocelot's doing...

OTACON

Exactly. And now every state, group and dotcom has its own version of Metal Gear.

SNAKE

Not exactly a classified weapon for today's nuclear powers.

OTACON

This new one seems to have been designed to wipe the floor with all the other models. The only consistent description is that it's an amphibious, anti-Metal Gear vehicle...

SNAKE

That explains why this one is under Marine Corps jurisdiction.
Explaining Objectives
Cutscene
The disguised tanker travels down the Hudson River (wide shot).

OTACON

The mission objective is to make visual confirmation of the new Metal Gear being transported by that tanker and bring back photographic evidence.

OTACON

But I want you first to go up to the top level of the infrastructure, to the bridge. We need to find out where the tanker is headed.

SNAKE

A little reconnaissance, huh?

OTACON

There's too much we don't know about this new prototype. Capabilities, deployment method -- we don't even know how close it is to completion. If we know where the testing arena is, I can start to draw some reasonable conclusions.

SNAKE

All right. I'll head to the bridge ASAP.

OTACON

Try to avoid confrontations. Our goal is to collect evidence on Metal Gear development and expose it to the world. It would be best if you could get out of there without alerting anyone.

SNAKE

Don't worry. I know the drill -- we're not terrorists.

OTACON

Very good. Don't you forget that you're part of "Philanthropy" now -- an anti-Metal Gear organization and officially recognized by the UN.

SNAKE

Recognized, but still fringe, Otacon.
Explaining Equipment
Cutscene
Back to game screen. Display weapon window and introduce equipment.

OTACON

All right. Let's look at your gear.

OTACON

Your weapon is a tranquilizer gun converted from a Beretta M92F.
Beretta is displayed on screen.

SNAKE

M9...

OTACON

It's a little hard to work with, because you'll have to reload after each shot since the slide locks.
Snake aims the gun and demonstrates stepping left and right and peeking.
The red gleam of the laser sight can be seen at the end of M9's barrel.

SNAKE

Better than scavenging at the mission site. Good suppressor too.

OTACON

The chemical stun will take effect in a few seconds and last for hours. You can take down an elephant with that thing. Check out the laser sighting too.
Shift to First Person View (FPV) screen. Snake aims the gun and the Beretta's sight appears on the screen.

OTACON

The effects of the anesthetic round will vary depending on what part of the body is hit. We're talking about a difference of tens of seconds between hitting limbs, chest or head.
End of weapons briefing. Return to overhead view and onto equipment.

OTACON

As for the equipment...
Item window opens.
The first item is Snake's cigarettes.

OTACON

Hey Snake! Cigarettes? What is wrong with you?

SNAKE

It's kind of a lucky charm.

OTACON

You haven't read the Surgeon General's Warning, have you?
Next, the camera appears.

OTACON

Here's the digital camera. Works almost the same way as your old one.
Camera Tutorial
Cutscene
The item window disappears from the screen.
Snake is concealed behind the giant windlass on the deck.
He aims the camera, substituting it for binoculars, to survey the superstructure (back of the crew's quarters) and the guards.
Maintenance workers (sentries) dressed in rain gear can be seen patrolling the second, fourth, and fifth decks of the superstructure (crew's quarters).

SNAKE

They don't look armed...
Snake zooms in on their hands and murmurs.

OTACON

Hey, Earth to Snake. These are nice, upstanding Marines, not terrorists. Don't get caught; you're in stealth mode here.

SNAKE

Sure. And if it comes to that, a little beauty sleep never hurt anyone.
Pan camera up and down. At least three sentries are in evidence.

SNAKE

By the way, Otacon, are you sure of this intelligence?

OTACON

Absolutely. Hacked it out of the Pentagon's3 classified files myself.

SNAKE

No traces?

OTACON

Oh please. I'm too good for that.

SNAKE

But this might be a trap. Remember, there's a price on our heads.

OTACON

You're just being paranoid.

SNAKE

I hope so.

SNAKE

Those men -- you wouldn't think they were anything but civilians from here.

OTACON

With all the ships passing on the river and in the harbor, putting uniformed Marines on the deck would be a bad idea. People can get a clear view of the water from riverside, too.
Pan camera to right as Otacon talks. A tight mass of buildings cast their light faintly through the downpour.

SNAKE

The waterline is too high... According to the navigational plans, this ship should have discharged its cargo upriver.

OTACON

It's in there. No doubt about it.

SNAKE

The military trains you to watch for threats from the stern on a boat. That's SOP for counter-terror ops, too. Security should be tighter.

OTACON

You worry too much.

OTACON

Satellite surveillance is a major international pastime these days. I'd say the cargo holds, safely below the deck. Do you see the entrance to the holds?
Snake zooms in with the camera, searching for a way in.

SNAKE

Looks like there are a few entryways into the crew quarters.
Suddenly, he picks up the whine of a helicopter nearby.

SNAKE

A chopper?
A sudden disturbance in the scene framed by the camera; Snake lets out an exclamation.

SNAKE

Wha -- !
A figure materializes behind one of the crewmen patrolling the deck, and a blade flashes at the sentry's throat. Even at a distance, Snake can see the blood. The victim is helpless against a clearly professional killer. The man behind him wears brownish camouflage gear and a balaclava (headgear) through which only his eyes show. On his back is a boxy rucksack. Snake pans the camera to the upper left, just in time to witness another camouflaged newcomer cut a crewman's throat.

SNAKE

Looks like we're not the only ones after Metal Gear tonight.

OTACON

Is that a chopper I just heard?

SNAKE

Affirmative. Probably another cavalry...
Snake searches for the third crewman at the location of his last check. The sentry has already been killed, and a camouflaged figure is dragging his body along. The camera tracks to the left, and captures the attacker tipping the body over the low deck railing into the river.

SNAKE

What's their game? Hijack?

OTACON

They're probably targeting the ship's controls.

SNAKE

Otacon, how many men do you need to take over a tanker of this size?

OTACON

The ship is run by a computer so... I'd say about eighteen people.
The camera, once again on the superstructure area. The camouflaged men have finished disposing of the bodies. They've taken up their stations and checked their gear. Each now sports an AKS-74u, the stock extended and a silencer attached to the muzzle.

SNAKE

AKS-74u?
Snake pans the camera until his eyes come to rest on an older (late 60s-70s) man. He wears a fur coat and is giving orders to the soldiers, gesticulating with his arms. Though the rain continues to beat down, the man seems utterly indifferent to its force, and his appearance is clearly a class above that of the camouflaged figures. Snake zooms in on the man's face.

SNAKE

Russians?
He isn't wearing a balaclava, and his coat collars are up, framing a conspicuous mustache. This is Colonel Gurlukovich. The Colonel seizes a radio clipped to the chest of one of the soldiers and shouts something into it.
Having completed the communication, he thrusts the radio back to its owner. His dignified air and the complete attention he commands from the soldiers suggest both his years and status as a military man.

OTACON

You sure?

SNAKE

No Marine barber touched that head of hair.
Snake presses the shutter and the man's image is automatically saved. The face momentarily freezes on the screen.

SNAKE

I'm transmitting a photo. Let's get an ID on him ASAP.

OTACON

I'm on it.
Kamovs Appear

SNAKE

Looks like the tanker's theirs now.
At that moment, the whir of the choppers (two crafts) starts up again. (The sound of the guerilla transports departing after dropping off the first teams.)
Snake is looking up at the pouring sky; the choppers cannot be seen, but Snake identifies the model from the turbine sound. (Because Kamovs are equipped with a Fenestron-type tail rotor, they make a distinct sound in flight.)

SNAKE

KA-60. Kasatka.

OTACON

Kamov chopper, right? "Killer Whale"...
After Kamovs Appear
Codec Call

SNAKE

We need to get a fix on who they are.

OTACON

Judging by their transport, aren't they some kind of military commandos?

SNAKE

Not necessarily. It could be the KA-62, the civil model.

OTACON

*anxiously* Look, Snake, all we need is the photographic evidence of Metal Gear. (Providing Snake with a clear explanation.)

OTACON

As long as we have those, we can put it online and blow the whole thing wide open. So no pyrotechnics, okay?

SNAKE

All right. I'll do my best.

OTACON

This isn't like Shadow Moses. Reach me if anything happens.

OTACON

The frequency is 141.12.

SNAKE

How can I check in and save my progress?

OTACON

I'll do it. There's a frequency set aside for it -- 140.96. Sorry, but no Mei Ling this time.

OTACON

Call me on the Codec when you want to save.

SNAKE

Got it.

OTACON

I'll be waiting just past the Verrazzano Bridge. You need to be off that ship by then.

SNAKE

I'll be in touch.
Kamov Discovery
Cutscene
Snake moves across the storm-lashed deck and infiltrates the tanker's interior. He reaches the bridge without being spotted.
Snake walks up to the window in front of him. Two transport helicopters (Kamovs) hover over the deck at the bow. Overcome by a sudden flashback to the heliport on Shadow Moses (déjà vu), Snake murmurs:

SNAKE

So it is the Kasatka... Russian choppers...!
The black Kasatkas look futuristic, and the design of the signature Fenestron-type tail rotors add to the distinctly un-Russian impression.
The high winds make it difficult for the helicopters to maintain their balance, and the two crafts give each other a wide berth, one below the other, to prevent collision. Cables are thrown down from the choppers, and soldiers, armed to the teeth, descend with fluid rapidity through the drenching waves and near gale-force winds. They are Gurlukovich men. Snipers on both helicopters keep watch over the safe descent of the men. Once on the deck, the soldiers quickly infiltrate the tanker's interior through the various entryways; the precision of the process implies thorough training. Having boarded the last man onto the ship, the choppers veer up.
Bridge
Codec Call
*After in-game sequence where Snake checks the tanker's course from the bridge

OTACON

Snake, did you find out where that ship is headed?

SNAKE

I'm looking at it -- 35 degrees longitude, latitude around 58.

OTACON

More than 500 miles off the coast of the Bermudas, out in the middle of the Atlantic... So the prototype is ready for solo testing -- it's basically combat-worthy. That area is outside the Second Fleet's operational range, too. It must be a stand-alone Marine Corps project -- which means this prototype Metal Gear - must be designed for independent deployment, without any Naval assistance...

OTACON

Anyway, analysis can wait till later. Snake, you need to go down to the holds and locate the actual Metal...
Pre-Olga Battle
Cutscene

SNAKE

Huh!?
Outside the tanker's superstructure (5F). Snake exits from the port entryway.
The faint sound of radio communications can be heard through the rainstorm.
A woman's figure is silhouetted at a slightly higher point.
Snake quickly conceals himself behind some structures (cargo, containers, etc.).
Outside the bridge (on the deck), Olga holds a radio to her ear. From it comes the voice of her father, Colonel Gurlukovich.

GURLUKOVICH

... Shalashaska has landed. I'm on my way to the tanker holds... Report your status.

OLGA

Control room, communications and engine room are under control. All entry and exit points to the tanker holds secured. Infrared sensors placed and operational.

GURLUKOVICH

Good work. Are the explosives in place?
The Colonel's voice is tense and intermittent, as though in motion.
Olga presses the radio against her ear, trying to make out his words.
Olga is dressed in camouflage pants, combat boots, and a military-issue tank top. The last bears the distinct horizontal striping of the Russian Army, and in the rain, her drabs have a flattering effect the Army never intended. She has a PSS pistol and an NR-2 Special Scout Knife on her waist, and an Army cap is pulled down over her forehead, shading her face. Only the firmly closed mouth, a trace of lipstick on it, is visible.
She is wiry in build, her muscular frame almost boyish. A hint of Meryl can be detected.
Olga speaks, as though seeking her father's praise.

OLGA

Yes, they're all planted.

GURLUKOVICH

Listen. Once we have what we came for, the tanker will be scuttled.
Snake edges toward Olga with his Beretta (tranquilizer gun) ready.

OLGA

And the vehicle's pilot?

GURLUKOVICH

He's the only one who underwent the VR training. No one else can do it.

OLGA

*anxiously* Are you sure you can trust him?

GURLUKOVICH

Your part in the mission is complete. You are to leave at once.

OLGA

No, it's not over yet!
She swings her arm in dogged defiance.

GURLUKOVICH

I can see the moon... even in this storm. Pale as death. I have a bad feeling about this mission...

GURLUKOVICH

You swore this to me. That you would leave the unit, once the mission was complete.

GURLUKOVICH

Do not worry. This is a country of "liberty."

OLGA

No! This is where I belong, with the unit. I have nowhere else to go.
Olga pulls the gun out of the holster. She cradles the 7.62mm PSS pistol against her chest, as though reassuring herself.

OLGA

Father, I want to stay and fight.

GURLUKOVICH

There is no choice to make here, Olga!

GURLUKOVICH

Need I remind you that you are carrying my grandchild?

OLGA

...
She silently stares down at her own stomach and gently places a hand on it (she's about 3 months pregnant; no clue given as to the identity of the father).

GURLUKOVICH

You will be on the helicopter out of here, now!
The radio abruptly cuts off.

OLGA

Damn it!!
Olga stares at the radio and lets out a frustrated grunt. In her right hand is the PSS pistol.
The roar of the chopper (Kamov) grows louder; one has already taken off from the deck and has pulled away. Olga waves away the other chopper with a big swing of her arm, but the pilot (in the right-hand seat) still gestures toward the chopper. Olga indicates a refusal, and after hesitating momentarily, the chopper turns and speeds away.
Olga stares at the departing craft, returning the radio to her waist.

SNAKE

Freeze!
Snake takes aim with the Beretta and moves toward Olga. (He is unwilling to shoot, because of her resemblance to Meryl and his desire to know her identity.)
Olga becomes aware of Snake's presence for the first time.

SNAKE

Hands over your head! Now!
Olga slowly complies, trying to buy time. Her underarms are unshaven. Snake stands motionless, his gun pointed straight at her forehead.

SNAKE

Toss your gun overboard! Slowly.
Olga, seeing the look in Snake's eyes, makes up her mind (it helps that she has a backup concealed behind her). She takes her silenced PSS pistol and throws it in a wide arc into the sea. The PSS disappears into the mist.
Snake, slightly more relaxed now, begins interrogating her. The distance between them is approximately 10 meters (about 35 feet).

SNAKE

A woman...? Show your face.

OLGA

You men -- you're all the same. (Talking about sexism on the battlefield.)

SNAKE

Who are you?
Olga takes off her cap and lets the wind snatch it from her hand.
She reveals a short, boyish head of hair. Olga is expressionless, without a trace of fear about her.

OLGA

We are nomads. Wanderers.
Olga, her hands still raised, is inching sideways. She has a USP tucked behind her back. She is waiting for a chance to get to the weapon.
Snake's retrains his gun on Olga as she moves, but still he does not fire. He thrusts his weapon at her again.

SNAKE

I said don't move!

OLGA

Americans... So you shoot women too?

SNAKE

I'm a nomad too.
Olga grins.

OLGA

... (We're cut from the same cloth, huh?)

SNAKE

What else do you have there?
Snake spots the knife on Olga's hip.

SNAKE

Take the knife and toss it.
Olga looks like she has an idea.
Still keeping her gaze on Snake, she slowly pulls the knife out of its sheath.
She grips the handle, holding the knife so the blade points toward herself.
She leans down to place the knife on the deck.

SNAKE

Not there. Toss it overboard!
Snake indicates the river with a jerk of his head.
Olga straightens up and glares at Snake defiantly.
Snake, suspicions aroused, is trying to watch his back.

SNAKE

Hold that position. Now, turn around.
Olga, impressed, smiles.

OLGA

You know what you're doing.
As Olga slowly starts to turn, another wave hits the ship and rocks it.
The spray washes over Olga. Suddenly, she murmurs in a strangely sultry voice.

OLGA

It's stopped raining...
She looks up at the sky. The rain has let up and the sky is momentarily clear. Behind Olga is the familiar Manhattan nightscape, with the Statue of Liberty. A full moon broods over a cluster of skyscrapers. Olga raises her hands further skyward.

OLGA

Not too shabby, is it? New York, I mean? (With her head raised.)
Olga delivers her line with a flourish. She is seeking to divert Snake's attention with the performance.
She succeeds, as Snake's watchfulness falters for an instant at her sudden change of mood.
Olga points the grip of the knife toward Snake and pulls its trigger. The chamber concealed inside the grip propels a single round at Snake.
Snake, reading the movements of the muscles in her arm, bends backward to dodge the bullet.

SNAKE

! (Inhaling as the bullets intersect.)
Olga has forced Snake's attention away from herself. She leaves her knife to lie where it fell.
Olga immediately conceals herself.
She pulls out the USP from behind her back (tucked into her pants) with a quick motion.
Snake regains his balance and quickly finds his own cover.
The cloud covers the moon and rain starts to fall again!

OLGA

And that brings our tour to its conclusion!
She yells from the shadows.

SNAKE

Scout knife with a surprise -- you a Spetsnaz4?

OLGA

I think you deserve a little credit. No one's ever dodged that shot of mine...

OLGA

But no one gets lucky twice, either!
To game - Olga battle
Footnotes
1A city in the U.S. state of Massachusetts; in this case, Otacon is referring to the Natick Soldier Center (NSC) located there. This is the research arm of the U.S. Army Soldier Systems Center, conducting R&D primarily on military technology.
2Its official name is the U.S. Army Soldier Systems Center.
3The headquarters building for the United States Department of Defense. Its name comes from the shape of the building. The nerve center of America's national defense.
4Special forces that handled military intelligence and reconnaissance activities for the former Soviet Union and have continued to operate for the Russian military since the end of the Cold War.
Codec Conversations
•Otacon
Prior to Olga Battle
Enter from a hatch on the port or starboard side - stern deck

OTACON

Snake, you need to get to the bridge on the top level of the infrastructure. First, find a door that leads into the tanker's interior and infiltrate the ship.
How to open watertight hatches (incoming call)

OTACON

Snake, go through that door into the ship's interior.

OTACON

Push the Action Button down in front of the door and wait until the door opens before letting go.

OTACON

If you need to open the door faster, hit the Action Button repeatedly while you turn the handle. Make sure you keep doing it until the door is open.
Hatch that doesn't open

OTACON

Snake, it looks like that door can't be opened from the deck. You can infiltrate the ship through other doors.
Near a lifeboat

OTACON

I see a lifeboat. That's a fully enclosed, fire-resistant model, equipped with its own oxygen pump.
*First time only

OTACON

Those have a water-based cooling system and self-contained air supply on board. This means that even if the boat is sealed, there would still be air available for the crew and engine operation.

OTACON

It automatically rights itself if it's overturned, and can withstand contact with fire for a significant period of time.
*Second and subsequent times

OTACON

But you won't be able to use that lifeboat. It's too noticeable, for one thing, and it just doesn't have the kind of speed we need.
Locations where bodies can be thrown overboard

OTACON

It looks like that part of the railing flares out. Once you take out someone, drag the body there and throw it over.

OTACON

It's a bad idea to leave the body around. You wouldn't want to alert the enemy of your presence.
Use First Person View attacks to take out enemies on the second deck

OTACON

Snake, switch to First Person View and look at the upper decks. See the sentries? Take them out in First Person View before they see you.
-->First Person View attacks (p. 96)
Releasing photos of the new Metal Gear

OTACON

When the photos are in, we'll put them online and blow this whole thing wide open on the Web.

SNAKE

Don't you think that the authorities will just shut us down?

OTACON

Probably. But it won't matter -- there'll be mirror sites spawning within minutes after those images go up. We won't even have to ask; people will be grabbing the pictures. There's no way anyone can stop it.

OTACON

Information has a life of its own, and as long as it lasts, it'll keep existing-- even if it has to change its form or location.

SNAKE

Life?

OTACON

Yeah -- the desire of people to learn. The demand for data.

SNAKE

That's called idle curiosity in my book.

OTACON

Everyone's got some of that. And sometimes, it can pave the way for truth. That's what I believe.
The new Metal Gear

OTACON

According to intelligence, this new model was designed to combat all the clone models of Metal Gear floating around in the world.

OTACON

Ocelot sold the Metal Gear specs to anyone with hard cash after he survived Shadow Moses --

SNAKE

And raked in enough money to buy a decent-sized country in the process.

OTACON

But was that -- was money really Ocelot's end objective?

SNAKE

You think he had a deeper plan?

OTACON

I do. Nothing definite, but acquiring a large sum of money is always a good starting point for another project.

SNAKE

Hmm...

OTACON

Anyway, every country that paid off Ocelot is racing to produce its own bipedal tank -- one that can launch the so-called "invisible nuclear warhead."

OTACON

If the whole world has a Metal Gear, the military dominance of the U.S. will disappear.

OTACON

In a world where Metal Gear has become commonplace, the only way to regain the upper hand is to possess a weapon even more powerful than Metal Gear.

SNAKE

And that means a new Metal Gear.

OTACON

Exactly. The arms race must go on.
The new Metal Gear (2)

OTACON

The Metal Gear that the tanker is transporting is being developed under Marine Corps jurisdiction.

OTACON

But -- I've also heard a rumor that the Navy is working on its own Metal Gear.

SNAKE

Any more info on the Navy's model?

OTACON

I tried to hack some out, but security was too tight.

OTACON

There's a lot of money being allocated -- that's for sure. But every one of my investigations takes me to one name, then hits a brick wall.

OTACON

The name is "The Patriots."

SNAKE

Who are they?

OTACON

I wish I knew. I have no idea if this is an individual, or an organization, even.

OTACON

But once we expose the presence of this Marine Corps Metal Gear to the world, maybe that will shake the "Patriots" out of the tree.

OTACON

This mission is partly about that too.
Get back inside

OTACON

Snake, you need to get to the bridge on top of the superstructure. Get back inside the ship and head upstairs.
Head deeper inside - make your way to the bridge (Deck-A, Crew's Quarters)

OTACON

There are stairs in the North Block that will take you up. Head north for now.
Head up - make your way to the bridge

OTACON

Snake, go to the bridge first and find out where this ship is headed.

OTACON

The bridge is on the top level. Go up.
Watch out for footprints

OTACON

Snake, watch out for the floor there. It's wet from the rain. You'll leave tracks if you just walk on it.

OTACON

If someone finds your prints, they may decide to raise the alarm. Crawl instead and you won't leave any traces.
Near a locker

OTACON

See those lockers? It's a good place to hide yourself if you're in a pinch.

OTACON

Push the Action Button near the locker to open the door. Walk into it for a quick concealment.

OTACON

You can see out from the slit in the door. Make sure you check the area using First Person View before you go out.

OTACON

Push the Action Button once more to get out of the locker.

OTACON

You can also hide enemies you've knocked out in the locker. Just open the locker, then drag the body to the locker.
Using locker doors as a shield

OTACON

If you open the locker, you can use the door as a cover during an exchange of gunfire.

OTACON

But of course, this is a pretty flimsy door -- there are limits to how many bullets it can withstand. Don't count on it too much, okay?
Inside a locker

SNAKE

This reminds me of when we first met.

OTACON

I was the one inside the locker that time. We're equal now, huh?

SNAKE

Not unless I wet my pants.

OTACON

That's a low blow, Snake!
Near steam pipes

OTACON

Snake, those pipes you see along the wall and ceiling are steam conduits. They're thin enough to penetrate with gunfire.

OTACON

Don't touch the steam -- one of those blasts from the hole will burn your skin off. You may be able to use it as a trap of some sort, though.
Hunched over
*While looking at a poster of a pinup model inside a locker

OTACON

*annoyed* What do you think you're doing, Snake? You don't have enough to keep you busy? Try to remember the mission, if you can.
Door that won't open in south area of Deck-A, Crew's Quarters

OTACON

Snake, that door is probably busted. Try the other ones.
TV showing the holds

OTACON

Look at the TV over there. It's showing the hold.
*First time only

SNAKE

So that's...

OTACON

The new Metal Gear.

SNAKE

Why are they broadcasting this?
-->TV broadcast
TV broadcast

OTACON

They probably want to keep a record of this exercise -- and maybe give a little presentation?

SNAKE

Presentation?

OTACON

That ship's been transmitting a live video feed via military satellite uplink for a while now.

SNAKE

So there's some brass out there, smacking their lips over this little home movie.

OTACON

I've been trying to pinpoint the receiving location, but I haven't had much luck. There's a heavy duty firewall in the way. I'll try some more, though.

SNAKE

Wherever it is, it must be a warm, dry office with hot coffee on tap.

OTACON

A far cry from that tanker, huh? That's what happens when the battlefield has a Revolution in Military Affairs.
TV (2)

OTACON

Snake, how long are you going to stand around watching TV? Get back to the mission.
Crew's lounge

OTACON

That must be the crew lounge. The tanker's crewmen would relax here when they're off-shift.

OTACON

There's a lot of stuff there. Make sure you don't move it around too much.

OTACON

Someone may notice that it's been tampered with. Leave no traces -- that's common sense when infiltrating a target, right?
Hallway nook - Deck-B, Crew's Quarters

OTACON

The hallway's pretty narrow, but there is that alcove to the side. If you're about to run into someone, you can always hide in there and let them pass.
Near Deck-B watertight hatch

OTACON

Snake, that door opens out onto the deck.

OTACON

You still have to get to the bridge to find out where this transport is headed. Go up.
Surveillance camera - Deck C, Crew's Quarters

OTACON

Snake, there's a surveillance camera in place. Once you're in its field of view, an alarm will go off. You can't afford to be seen.

OTACON

Wait for the camera to point the other way, then run past it. There's also a blind spot right beneath the camera. Use it to buy some time.

OTACON

You can also use the chaff grenade to set up some electronic interference. The camera will be ineffective for a while.
Mess hall – Deck D, Crew's Quarters

OTACON

That must be the mess hall.

SNAKE

It's pretty small considering the size of the ship...

OTACON

I guess modern tankers are so automated that you only need a crew of about twenty.

OTACON

That's not a lot to feed.

OTACON

There's a lot of things there, but make sure you don't disturb anything and leave traces. The enemy might notice.
The pantry

OTACON

Snake, that's the pantry -- where they keep the food supplies.

OTACON

Hm, lots of cardboard boxes. You could probably use one to blend in and avoid being discovered.
Near the body of a Marine
*First time only

OTACON

So he was about to have dinner...

SNAKE

And got a bullet in the head instead. Poor bastard.
The tanker - autopilot

OTACON

This is the bridge -- but it's not just a place where you steer the ship.

OTACON

In a modern tanker, navigational, engine control, communication, and all the other major operational functions are consolidated in the bridge.

OTACON

The ship is auto-piloted via a global positioning satellite system. This is a precision instrument we're talking about here, so it's probably best to leave it alone.
Gremlins at the stairwell
*On Hard difficulty or higher, if player attempts to go up stairs to the bridge during Alert Mode

OTACON

Snake, they're waiting to ambush you on top of the stairs! There's no way you can make it up while being sniped from above.

OTACON

You can't get up those stairs until you've shaken the enemy from your trail. Get out of there for now!
Prior to Olga battle

OTACON

There's something about that soldier who was standing outside the infrastructure. I think you should check it out -- use the hatch on the port side of the infrastructure to get out onto the navigational deck.

OTACON

That's where you need to go.
Kasatka facts and figures

OTACON

So that's the Ka-60 Kasatka -- a multipurpose military helicopter built by Kamov, the Russian aerospace firm.

OTACON

It adapts to a variety of missions: troop and weapons transport, MedEvac, target marking for attack choppers, even all-weather surveillance missions.

OTACON

It uses Fenestron-type tail rotors. That's what makes the distinct rotor sound that you picked up.

OTACON

It is a Russian helicopter, but we can't be sure that the hijackers are Russian military.

OTACON

After all, Kamov did make a civilian version, the Ka-62, and there's also the Ka-64, the export model.
Section 2
Olga Battle – End of Tanker Chapter
Post-Olga Battle Victory
Cutscene
Snake emerges victorious from the gunfight with Olga.
Olga falls to the deck, unconscious. Because Snake's gun fires anesthetic rounds, she is not permanently harmed. Snake walks up to Olga and acquires the USP lying by her side. The slide is locked back, indicating the magazine is empty.
Snake finds it ironic that Olga was carrying an American-made sidearm.

SNAKE

...
The rain and the wind step up in force. Through the hoarse whistling of the gale, a steady, metallic droning sound approaches. Snake turns around to discover a donut-shaped remote camera (reconnaissance craft) suspended in mid-air. The camera's lens is focused on Snake.
A red glow of laser beam flanks the lens. The thing resembles an airborne jellyfish.

SNAKE

CYPHER!?
The remote camera zips away and disappears into the rain. Snake raises Otacon on the Codec.
Post-Olga Battle Victory
Codec Call

SNAKE

Otacon, the ship appears to be under their control. The men have Russian gear, but I haven't been able to find out anything else about their origin.

OTACON

*seriously* I know who they are.

SNAKE

You do?

OTACON

We've ID'd the old man.

SNAKE

Who is he?

OTACON

Sergei Gurlukovich.

SNAKE

Gurlukovich...! One of Ocelot's allies?

OTACON

Yeah... The GRU1 colonel. He's the one Ocelot was supposed to meet up with, after Shadow Moses...

SNAKE

They're after Metal Gear...

OTACON

Everything's changed. This is not going to be as simple as we thought.

SNAKE

You could say that. I saw a surveillance remote just now, it looked like the Cypher.

OTACON

A Marine Cypher-T?

SNAKE

No, Army.

OTACON

*anxiously* First the Marines, then the Russians -- now the Army...?

SNAKE

You're right, this isn't going to be simple.

OTACON

*thinking* Snake -- There's something I have to tell you.

SNAKE

What?

OTACON

We didn't dig up this info -- about the new Metal Gear -- on our own. Not like usual...

SNAKE

How did you find out, then?

OTACON

It was a tip. An anonymous tip.

SNAKE

Anonymous? You've never trusted those -- why would you start now?

OTACON

*embarassed* I, ah -- I have a younger sister. A stepsister. We have different parents...

OTACON

I only knew her for two years.

SNAKE

You've never mentioned her before. So...?

OTACON

The sender of the tip was "E.E."

SNAKE

"E.E."?

OTACON

Her name is Emma, but I always called her "E.E."...

SNAKE

Emma Emmerich?

OTACON

Yeah. It just caught my eye, you know? I figured it was a coincidence, but I couldn't get it out of my mind. There's really no one out there who knows about her.

SNAKE

When was the last time you saw her?

OTACON

Over 10 years ago.

SNAKE

You think it's a trap? To lure us out here...?

OTACON

I don't know. After I got the tip, I did break into the Pentagon system to get confirmation.

SNAKE

Okay...

OTACON

Watch your back, Snake. Maybe I screwed up.

SNAKE

I've got a light-equipped USP; I can take them on now. There's no ammo, but it takes a 9mm, just like the Marines' M9. I'll find those somewhere around here.

OTACON

Don't raise too much racket with that thing.

SNAKE

I hear you.
Raven's Shadow
Cutscene
(small room off the engine room, starboard side)
Having defeated Olga and descended to the tanker's lower levels, Snake finds himself in a small room. The engine room is just ahead. A giant shadow has been cast on the wall in front of him.
Snake stops in his tracks. It is a figure of a man, wearing what appears to be a massive, barrel-shaped tank on his back and a great cannon-like weapon cradled in his arms.
The shadow is clearly that of Vulcan Raven from MGS1.

SNAKE

*with surprised tension* Raven!?
(In reality, it is the shadow cast by a figure of Raven that was placed in the small room. This is a joke designed to toy with the player's expectations.)
Sealing the Hatches
Cutscene
(before the long corridor)
Three Gurlukovich soldiers are in front of a dividing wall. Soldier B closes the hatch.
Soldier A takes out his radio and contacts the Colonel. Soldier B begins to carefully tighten the hatch handle. Snake, hidden behind the wall, listens to the radio communication.

GURLUKOVICH SOLDIER A

Colonel, we have sealed the stern hatch.

GURLUKOVICH

All right.

GURLUKOVICH SOLDIER A

The lift is also under our control.

GURLUKOVICH

We're on the foredeck. About to descend to the holds.

GURLUKOVICH SOLDIER A

Sir, the Marine commander has started his speech already.

GURLUKOVICH

We will complete the preparations before the end of the speech.

GURLUKOVICH SOLDIER A

All communications to the holds have been severed. No one is aware of our presence.
Soldier B finishes tightening the hatch handle.

GURLUKOVICH

Let no one down into the holds until we are out.

GURLUKOVICH SOLDIER A

Yes sir! We will secure your exit, with our lives if necessary.

GURLUKOVICH

There is one more thing...

GURLUKOVICH SOLDIER A

Yes sir?

GURLUKOVICH

My daughter -- keep her safe.

GURLUKOVICH SOLDIER A

Yes sir!
Ocelot and Soldier
Cutscene
(tanker holds)
Snake goes through the door to the tanker's holds and finds himself in the lower parts of the ship.
A Gurlukovich soldier closes the watertight door (but doesn't seal it).

GURLUKOVICH SOLDIER

*little sigh of relief*
Footsteps approach (cowboy boots, with spurs) in a slow, measured gait. The soldier raises his head. The outline resolves itself into a man with long hair and a duster (Ocelot). The soldier draws his gun.

GURLUKOVICH SOLDIER

Who goes there!
The man continues walking forward, ignoring the soldier's query. The light is behind him, and his face is in the shadows. The footsteps grow louder. The soldier finally recognizes the interloper, and lowers his weapon.

GURLUKOVICH SOLDIER

Oh, Shalashaska.
The man stops in front of the soldier. The latter, relieved, allows his guard to drop.

GURLUKOVICH SOLDIER

Why are you here? We thought you were with the Colonel.
The man raises his own weapon. The muzzle gleams in the dark. The gun is a Single Action Army.
The guard stares, unbelieving.

GURLUKOVICH SOLDIER

!?
His exclamation is cut short by the impact of a bullet through his forehead.

GURLUKOVICH SOLDIER

*screams*
The killer slips the SAA back into his holster with a flourish and tightly seals the hatch. The clang echoes down the long corridor.

OCELOT

The Colonel will be joining you soon... Comrade...
Ocelot departs leisurely, his coat flapping.
Tanker Holds
Codec Call 1
Incoming Codec call from Otacon.

OTACON

Snake, are you in yet? Have you made it to the holds?

SNAKE

It's taking longer than I expected. We've already passed the Verrazzano Bridge.

OTACON

All right. We'll use another recovery point.

SNAKE

They may be planning to change course.

OTACON

What?

SNAKE

The exits to the deck are all sealed.

OTACON

What are they planning?

SNAKE

If they get Metal Gear, we're going right off the fringe.
Soldiers in the Holds
Cutscene
Snake listens to Otacon as he studies the soldiers below.
Normally, these tanks would hold crude oil, but because of the ship's true purpose—the transport of the new Metal Gear—the tanks are empty. The landing at the hatch is over 30 meters (about 100 feet) above the floor, and there are orderly rows of Marines lined up below. Their attention is on a large screen on the wall. There are approximately 50 men in four rows; they are watching their Commandant's speech on the monitor.

SNAKE

The men down here are definitely Marines.

OTACON

If the deck is sealed off, they have no way of knowing that the ship's been taken over.

SNAKE

I'm not interested in fighting these guys. The weapons won't do me much good here.

OTACON

Can you see Metal Gear?

SNAKE

No. I'll have to go around to the bow. They have some serious defenses here. I doubt the recent arrivals want to blast their way through the Marines either.

OTACON

Wonder where they're headed.

SNAKE

I don't know... Not the beach, that's for sure.
Tanker Holds
Codec Call 2

OTACON

OK, Snake. Let's go over this one more time.

OTACON

Use this camera to get photographic evidence of the Metal Gear prototype.

OTACON

Now, do your thing and take pictures that speak louder than the government's plausible denials.

OTACON

We need four shots: Metal Gear from the front, front-right, and front-left, and a close-up of the Marine Corps marking.

SNAKE

Marking?

OTACON

There should be a "MARINES" insignia on the body of Metal Gear. Just let someone try explaining away a clear shot of that.

SNAKE

All right.

OTACON

There's actually one little thing...

SNAKE

Just spit it out. I'm used to things going wrong.

OTACON

It looks like someone's monitoring our transmission. (It's the Patriots.)

SNAKE

Who?

OTACON

I don't have a clue. All they're doing is watching -- it would creep me out less if they tried to interfere with our communications.

SNAKE

Could it have something to do with that Cypher we saw?

OTACON

Maybe. I've switched the encryption protocol for our burst transmission for now. What I want to do is use a different method for sending those photos, just in case.

SNAKE

Instead of using the Codec?

OTACON

Exactly. There's a workstation in the southeast corner of the block where Metal Gear is housed. I've made arrangements so that you can send the pictures from the machine.

SNAKE

"Arrangements"?

OTACON

I hitched a ride on Link-16 into U.S. military's proprietary network. Managed to get into that workstation and overwrote a part of the system software—so I could remote-install a little app I wrote...

SNAKE

Why bother with anything that complicated... (He's bad with computers.)

OTACON

No, it's pretty simple, really. Look, all you have to do is stand in front of the machine and push the Action Button. The app will automatically launch and download the image data from the camera, split the files and encrypt them individually. The data packets can then masquerade as...

SNAKE

*interrupts because the process is tedious* OK, OK. So all I have to do is push the Action button in front of the computer once I have the pictures, right?

OTACON

*unhappy he was interrupted* Well, sure, if you put it that way.

OTACON

And one more thing... The Commandant's already begun his speech, but you need to get the pictures before he's done talking. Otherwise, they'll spot you. OK?

SNAKE

How much time do I have?

OTACON

I hacked into his personal files and took a look at the text of that speech. I'd say you have seven more minutes -- longer if he throws in a joke or two.

SNAKE

A seven-minute time limit, huh?

OTACON

Remember, Snake, just the photos, OK?

SNAKE

With these kinds of odds, I won't be making any sudden moves.

SNAKE

But that doesn't mean we can just let Metal Gear be hijacked.

OTACON

Okay, okay, but first, the photos...

SNAKE

All right. We'll deal with the rest when we get there.

OTACON

Stay low.
Ship Bow, Metal Gear Appears
Cutscene
(holds, bow, in front of Metal Gear)
Snake enters the forward (bow) block of the holds. The gigantic shape of Metal Gear RAY looms ahead. The new incarnation has the kind of presence and heavy, brooding feel that bears no resemblance to the technology of its predecessor. But a closer look betrays subtle details that remind players of the REX model. The new Metal Gear, lit by the dim phosphorescence of the tanker holds, is almost organic, with a parched look of a beached marine creature. Its surface appears to owe more to biology than metallurgy, almost opalescent, with the soft gloss of sea shells. Because of the lighting, only the legs and the head (beak) are completely visible. The unit is clearly battleworthy.
Right in front of RAY (at its feet), a small podium has been erected. The Commandant of the Marine Corps is standing at the podium, giving a speech. About twenty Marines stand in rigid formation, listening attentively. Snake is overwhelmed by the sheer power this new Metal Gear exudes.

SNAKE

...Metal Gear!? (Repeating something he said before.)
The camera pans up from behind Snake. A long shot of the tanker's interior. The camera takes in the whole of Metal Gear RAY.
Title drop.
"METAL GEAR SOLID 2: SONS OF LIBERTY"
Sound effect: *metallic crash*
Editor's Note: The timing of the title drop was changed. In the release version, it occurs when Snake lands on the tanker.
Metal Gear Seized
Cutscene
(holds, bow, in front of Metal Gear)
Snake creeps from blind spot to blind spot, evading the Marines, and takes the necessary photos.
At the same time, the Commandant finishes his speech and salutes the Marines. The men immediately snap to attention and return the salute. A dull crash reverberates through the hold, and Snake flattens himself behind a pillar. Suddenly, a dry clap starts up from somewhere (it doesn't ring out since one hand is balled into a fist).
The Marines maintain their posture (still saluting), but their eyes move furiously, trying to locate the sound.
The Commandant is also attempting to determine who is responsible.

OCELOT

Excellent speech, my friend...

CMC

Who the -- !?
The sarcastic clapping ends and footsteps can now be heard, accompanied by the jingle of spurs. The man is walking out from behind (and at the foot of) Metal Gear RAY. Snake leans out from behind the column.
A man (Ocelot) emerges from the darkness.

OCELOT

Gift of the silver tongue -- they say it's a mark of a good officer -- and of a liar.
Both of Ocelot's arms swing free by his side. A glimpse of a gun belt underneath the coat, a Single Action Army revolver in the holster. Ocelot's expression cannot yet be read.

OCELOT

Americans are too in love with the sound of their own voice... to speak the truth.
The Commandant watches Ocelot warily. (Since Ocelot isn't holding a weapon, he isn't truly alarmed.)

CMC

Identify yourself!
The Marines position themselves around the podium and raise their weapons in unison!

OCELOT

I am Shalashaska! Also called Revolver --
Snake mutters uncontrollably in his hiding place. His line is uttered at the same time as Ocelot.

OCELOT

Ocelot.

SNAKE

Ocelot.
Jump cut to several images from MGS1. A single shot of Ocelot.
The men are itching to take action; the Commandant restrains them with a motion.
He is relatively relaxed, sure of his safety under their protection.

CMC

What do you want?

OCELOT

This machine will be quite useful.

CMC

What are you planning to do-- steal this thing?

OCELOT

Steal? No, no, I'm taking it back.
Snake moves from column to column, slipping in closer to the front. The Marines' attention is on the podium, so no one notices Snake.
All of a sudden, Gurlukovich appears behind the Commandant without a sound and pins his arm behind his back. The Commandant is momentarily struck mute by the pressure of a Makarov (pistol) jabbed against his throat. The Marines are startled, at a loss as to what to do.
Snake moves in closer to the podium to get a better look at the new arrival.

SNAKE

Gurlukovich...
Ocelot raises his voice and addresses the Marines.

OCELOT

Nobody move! Understood?
Gurlukovich, still holding the Commandant in a tight grip, slowly begins to back away.
The scene is being relayed in real time to the men in the stern block via the cameras that have been capturing his speech.
The Marines break into an uproar.

MARINE

*exclamations of surprise*

CMC

...
Ocelot slowly raises his right hand high to show the Marines something.

OCELOT

This ship now carries enough Semtex on its key structural points to blow it out of the water -- at the touch of this button.
The Marines gaze at the detonator in Ocelot's hand in shock.

MARINE

*exclamations of surprise*

OCELOT

That's right -- ... No one has to die needlessly.
Several coils of wire drop from above and Gurlukovich men (3 to 5) in camo fatigues drop down to the holds. Once on the ground, the soldiers surround the Marines, their weapons raised against the American soldiers. Several of the Gurlukovich men position themselves near Metal Gear RAY's legs and back and begin the activation procedure.

OCELOT

We're almost at the target. Get a move on!
The Commandant recovers some of his calm and rasps out a question.

CMC

What do you intend to do with RAY -- sell it on the streets?

GURLUKOVICH

I was raised in Snezhinsk, formerly known as Chelyabinsk-70, the nuclear research outpost.

CMC

What are you talking about?

GURLUKOVICH

After the Cold War ended, my home was bought out by the Americans.

CMC

Is there a point to this sad story?

GURLUKOVICH

Not that you would understand. Land, friends, dignity... All sold to the highest bidder -- the United States of America. Even the technology that gave birth to these weapons is Russian, developed by us!

CMC

What do you intend to do?

GURLUKOVICH

Russia will rise again -- and RAY is the key.
Gurlukovich glances at Ocelot, seeking a show of solidarity.
But Ocelot smiles, caressing the detonator with his left hand.

OCELOT

I regret to inform you that I have no intention of selling Metal Gear. As I said, I came to take it back.
Gurlukovich is bewildered by Ocelot's words.

OCELOT

Yes -- returned. To the "Patriots"...
The CMC jerks at the mention of the "Patriots."

CMC

The "La-li-lu-le-lo"! How's that -- possible!?
Gurlukovich gazes at Ocelot with growing suspicion.

GURLUKOVICH

Ocelot, you...! Have you sold us out?

OCELOT

I was never in your employ, Gurlukovich...

GURLUKOVICH

Are you still in league with Solidus...!?

OCELOT

No hard feelings, Colonel. Mother Russia can rot, for all I care.

GURLUKOVICH

Since when, Ocelot! When did you turn?

OCELOT

I'm glad you noticed comrade. I abandoned "her" during the Cold War.

GURLUKOVICH

Aargh...!
The Colonel is trembling with rage. Ocelot calls out to the Gurlukovich soldiers.

OCELOT

Metal Gear only has room for one!
Gurlukovich's men, waiting for a cue from the Colonel, are showing signs of confusion.

OCELOT

Gurlukovich, you and your daughter will die here.

GURLUKOVICH

Damn you!!
Gurlukovich releases the CMC and shoves him forward.

CMC

*grunts from being shoved*
Gurlukovich's Makarov swerves towards Ocelot. At the same time, Ocelot throws his duster into the air, like a matador flourishing his cloak. The coat sails out, twisting and rippling (high-speed shot) in front of Gurlukovich, blocking his view. (The cloak is almost organic in behavior.) The CMC stumbles forward.

GURLUKOVICH

Die, you dog!
Gurlukovich fires, and a hole appears on the duster. Ocelot, however, is no longer in the bullet's trajectory. He moves in rhythm to the duster's progress, shielding himself from view as he pulls out his revolver with his left hand. He fires six rounds in rapid succession; the slugs punch through the coat.

GURLUKOVICH

*screams from being shot*

CMC

*screams from being shot*
When the duster clears the camera's view, the bodies of Colonel Gurlukovich and the CMC are revealed lying on the floor. Ocelot tosses his emptied gun away without a glance.

OCELOT

Sergei! Looks like you were long overdue for retirement.

GURLUKOVICH

Traitorous dog...
The Colonel's face hits the floor. The Gurlukovich soldiers, confronted with the evidence of the Colonel's wounds (several rounds in the chest), grasp the fact of Ocelot's treachery and regain their presence of mind. The CMC is already dead, a bullet hole in his forehead.
Gurlukovich's men raise their assault rifles. Ocelot is on the move again, and, drawing another Single Action Army from the back holster with his left hand (the C4 detonator in his right hand), he pulls the trigger rapidly.

SOLDER 1-6

*screams from being shot*
Gurlukovich guards are cut down en masse. Several Marines also go down in the hail of bullets. The Marines look on, stunned by the strange turn of events.
Ocelot spins his revolver and returns it to the hip holster without emptying the cylinder.
He moves the detonator from his stiffened right hand to the left.
The Marines regain some semblance of composure and raise their weapons. However, the men are confused and shaken by the loss of their commander.
Ocelot speaks, his eyes glittering.

OCELOT

Show's over! If you wish to live, I suggest you run now!

OCELOT

This ship is still in the Lower New York Harbor. You may yet make it to shore if you swim for your life!
Ocelot presses the detonator button without hesitation.
The tanker rocks violently as the ear-shattering blasts fill the holds. Ocelot starts climbing into Metal Gear, already in standby mode, and Snake makes a run toward RAY. The tanker's holds ring with a disjointed babble of shock, anger, and the echoes of the explosions. The men are in a state of panic.

GURLUKOVICH SOLDIER

*screams*

MARINE

*screams*
The explosions blow numerous holes in the hull, and water begins to rush in. Ocelot is climbing the ladder at Metal Gear's leg. Alarms go off, and the Marines fire their weapons in unison. The water is rising rapidly, and the rotating emergency lighting flashes continuously as the Gurlukovich men who were getting Metal Gear ready are swept away by the incoming flood.

GURLUKOVICH SOLDIER

*screams as the water sweeps them away*
Snake jumps out from cover.

SNAKE

OCELOT!!
Ocelot reaches for Metal Gear's controls with one hand.
At the sound of a well-remembered voice, his dead right hand twitches.

OCELOT

!?
The dormant personality within him suddenly takes over. A momentary flashback to images of Liquid (a rush of several still frames from MGS1).
Snake, standing in Metal Gear's way, raises his USP. The image should remind players of his previous confrontation with REX.
Ocelot's right sleeve has been ripped off, his forearm a pallid color. Ocelot slowly turns around.

LIQUID

It's been a while, brother!
Ocelot's mind has been completely hijacked by Liquid Snake. Even his body language is that of Liquid, not Ocelot.

SNAKE

*confused* Who are you?

LIQUID

You know who I am.
He clenches his right hand, a habit of Liquid's. Liquid's right hand is controlling Ocelot's mind and body. Snake recognizes both the gesture and the speech, but cannot quite believe the evidence of his senses.

SNAKE

Liquid?
Ocelot narrows his eyes as he examines Snake's appearance, almost nostalgic.

LIQUID

Not so young anymore, eh, Snake...

LIQUID

You're drowning in time. I know what it's like, brother.
Snake, reminded of the accelerated aging he has been experiencing recently, falls silent.

SNAKE

...

LIQUID

No wonder Naomi passed you over for the FOXDIE program.

LIQUID

Aaarrrr!
Ocelot suddenly tries to grab his right hand with his left, as though it is an organism in and of itself, out of his control.

OCELOT

*speaking to his right arm* Out -- get out of my mind! Liquid...
Snake looks on in confusion at Ocelot's bizarre behavior. Ocelot bares his teeth and savages his own hand, drawing blood. It is to no avail, however, and the right hand once again suppresses its host personality. Ocelot's pupils are fully dilated.
Liquid continues.

LIQUID

The price of physical prodigy... Few more years and you'll be another dead clone of the old man.

LIQUID

Our raw materials are vintage, brother. Big Boss was in his late fifties when they created his copies.

LIQUID

But I -- I live on, through this arm.

SNAKE

Liquid's arm?
The two men face each other in the chaos.
The hold continues to fill with water, and the Marines and the Gurlukovich soldiers ignore Snake and Ocelot as they desperately attempt to escape.

MARINE

*screams*

GURLUKOVICH SOLDIER

*screams*
Colonel Gurlukovich remains face down on the podium.

GURLUKOVICH

Olga... Ah!
The water rises, laps against, and finally swallows the podium. Gurlukovich gurgles out a last lung-full of blood-laced air into the water.
The swirl of bright, fresh blood spreads through the tide as the swelling sea chokes the life out of the immobilized Gurlukovich. The water continues to rise and whirl, and the bodies of the Russian Colonel and the Marine Corp Commandant now lie submerged on the podium. Ocelot's duster is swept away by the current.
Another explosion rattles the stricken tanker, and Snake loses his balance. He falls into the water with a muffled grunt.

SNAKE

*cursing being knocked back*

LIQUID

*exhales*
With a sharp grunt, Ocelot leaps into the cockpit (same type of movement as in MGS1). He is unbelievably agile for a man in his fifties.
Ocelot takes control of Metal Gear; he is terribly like Liquid.
Ocelot has put on a pilot's headset and placed an eye module used in attack helicopters over his right eye. He rapidly locks the restraining belt in its place.
The cockpit snaps closed and Metal Gear RAY starts to move.
Snake rises and looks up at RAY.

LIQUID

*loudly* You don't have what it takes after all.

LIQUID

*loudly* You're going down, Snake -- with this tanker!
RAY bounds off its perch behind the podium. The impact scatters Snake and the others; a sheet of water hits Snake, and he goes flying straight into the hull.

SNAKE

*groans*
Soldiers run in terror from the now fully activated Metal Gear.
Snake uses the Codec as he gets back up.

SNAKE

Otacon, we have a problem...
The RAY swings it head around as if to take in the sight of the men, then lowers its beak into the water. The machine starts to drink deeply, drawing seawater into its system as though sating a thirst for energy. Once it is saturated with water, noticeable changes come over its body; the surface is now glistening. It is like it has been revitalized.
A tumorous, cylindrical growth emerges from its midsection and underbelly, rotating steadily. Seawater starts to drain from these jutting cylinders like pus from a boil. The jaundiced waste water washes over RAY's surface, and the weapon takes on the look of a once desiccated slug now rejuvenated. It stretches like a satisfied animal to unlock stabilizers on either side; the slug is now a monstrous bird on the verge of flight. Corrugated thrusters attached to the stabilizers writhe about independently of one another.
RAY raises its head towards the ceiling and lets out a terrible howl. White vapor escapes from the open beak. RAY's shrill cry echoes in what is left of the hold, and the little glass that is still intact shatters. Soldiers, their eardrums lacerated, clutch their heads.
Editor's Note: These sequences are not seen in the release version.
RAY spews a torrent of seawater from its beak. The fouled water, tinted a murky yellow, bursts forth (in seemingly irradiated bundles) from RAY's beak and tears through the hull, the sea rushing in. RAY lets out a howl of delight like an animal that finds itself back in its element.
Snake is hurled backward, and Otacon shouts urgently!

SNAKE

*groans as he's thrown back* !

OTACON

Snake!!

OTACON

Snaaaaake!!
The water rises abruptly, and RAY submerges. When the water washes over the (cone-shaped) tumor embedded in RAY's atrophied tail section, the cone shoots out, lengthening into a tail.
Metal Gear Escapes
(holds, bow, in front of Metal Gear)
The stern begins to sink as the ship's huge and deadly cargo makes its way from the bow to the stern, disturbing the ship's balance. Snake manages to fight his way to the water's surface.

SNAKE

*taking a breath lightly*
From his seat in the cockpit, Ocelot stares at Snake's image on the monitor, then contacts Solidus.

OCELOT

No problems... Proceeding as planned, sir.
Falling debris from the ceiling forces Snake's head underwater once again. He chokes as water rushes into his lungs.

SNAKE

*choking as he swallows water*

OCELOT

... Yes, at the location we discussed...
RAY has shifted into its submarine configuration, and speeds away from the sinking wreck. The tanker, along with Snake and its other captives, continues the long progress down to the harbor's bottom.

OCELOT

Yes. I have photographic evidence of Snake on the scene. The Cypher was most useful...
Metal Gear glides through the water, as efficient and graceful as its namesake, the manta ray.

OCELOT

I look forward to tomorrow morning's news flash...

OCELOT

I would say the Marine Corps' plans are on indefinite hold...

OCELOT

... Yes, of course, Mr. President.
It once again shifts shape, and in its new high-speed configuration, accelerates in a single thrust of power.
RAY disappears into the darkness of the Atlantic Ocean. Otacon's shout echoes in the silence.

OTACON

SNAKE!!
Footnotes
1Acronym for the former Soviet Union's Glavnoye Razvedyvatelnoye Upravlenie ("Main Intelligence Directorate"). Since the end of the Cold War, it has continued its activities as part of the Russian military, and its subordinate organizations utilize Spetsnaz special forces.
Codec Conversations
•Through End of Tanker Chapter
You have to fight Olga
*If player tries to escape

OTACON

Snake, are you trying to run away? I don't think she'll let you. You have to stand your ground here!
*If Snake is at a disadvantage (determined by difference between his and Olga's Life)

OTACON

Don't tell me you're getting discouraged! You're supposed to be great under pressure, remember?
*If Snake has the advantage

OTACON

She's almost done. Hang in there!
Shoot from cover

OTACON

Snake, you're not the only one with a gun. If you don't take cover, you'll get hurt. Hide behind something.

OTACON

She may be hiding too, but you have a clear shot whenever she decides to attack. Use the First Person View Attack!
First Person View attacks, strafing, standing on tiptoes

OTACON

Snake, she's shooting from concealment. You should use the First Person View Attack.

OTACON

Push the First Person View Button to change to First Person View. Then use the Weapon button to raise the gun and you can attack from that viewpoint.

OTACON

Push the Equipment Window and Weapon Equip Buttons while in First Person View to strafe left and right.

OTACON

Push the Equipment Window and Weapon Equip Buttons at the same time to stretch up on your toes while still in First Person View. These moves can be useful.
Make use of Corner View

OTACON

Snake, use the Corner View to watch for a chance to attack while hidden.

OTACON

Push the Weapon Equip or Equipment Window Button while in Corner View to take quick looks out.

OTACON

You can also move the right analog stick while in Corner View to survey other directions.

OTACON

If you have a weapon selected, push the Weapon Button while in Corner View to jump out from concealment and aim your weapon.

OTACON

Your best opportunity will be when she tries to attack. Shoot before she does!
Gaps between obstacles

OTACON

If you use a First Person View Attack, you should be able to strike from between containers. You'll have an element of surprise on your side.
Watch out for grenades
*After a grenade has been thrown

OTACON

Snake, she has grenades -- you can't stay in one place. Keep moving around and you'll be safer!
Can't see through the tarp

OTACON

Snake, she's shooting at you from behind the tarpaulin. She can see you, but the tarp's completely blocking your view.

OTACON

You haven't got a prayer like this. Do something about that tarp!
Headshots

OTACON

The handgun's effects vary depending on where you manage to land a shot.

OTACON

Aim for the head for the highest degree of damage. Use the First Person View to take aim.
That blinding light

OTACON

Snake, get rid of that light! You can't see anything with that glare. Shoot it out or you're a sitting duck!
Who is Olga?

OTACON

Who is she, anyway?

SNAKE

That scout knife had Spetsnaz written all over it, but...

OTACON

Spetsnaz? That's the special ops of the Soviet GRU. So she must be Russian...?

SNAKE

Who knows. All I'm sure of is that she shoots like a commando.

OTACON

Be careful.
Near Olga's body

OTACON

She's not dead, is she? (He's worried because Olga reminds him of Meryl.)

SNAKE

No, just knocked out.

OTACON

Good.

SNAKE

Looks like a little angel, doesn't she?

OTACON

What's gotten into you?

SNAKE

Nothing.

OTACON

Sleeping Beauty may have been awakened by Prince Charming's kiss, but you'd better not try it here.

SNAKE

I'm with you. Besides, I've had enough of tomboys.
Cypher infodump

OTACON

The Cypher's what it looks like -- a flying surveillance saucer. It's an unmanned aerial vehicle used for ground and ocean surveillance, and it also assists in communication.

OTACON

It can take off and land vertically, and uses a ducted airstream from its rotors and the surrounding shroud to fly.

OTACON

The one you saw was the type used by the Army, if I recall.

OTACON

But I can't see the Army officially cooperating with a top-secret Marine Corps project...

SNAKE

No. Which means that there's someone besides us and the Russians that are interested in the new Metal Gear prototype...

OTACON

Cyphers can stay airborne for about three hours, so there should be an Integrated Mobile Ground Station controlling its flight pattern and output nearby -- it's got to be on land.

OTACON

I'll bet you anything it's disguised as a regular truck or something, driving along riverside. Let me check it out.

SNAKE

Good call.
The backstory with Gurlukovich

OTACON

Didn't think Gurlukovich was involved, of all people.

SNAKE

Ocelot's former CO -- and a man with a private army of ex-Russian military and GRU soldiers. I don't like it.

OTACON

And Liquid was planning to team up with that bunch at Shadow Moses.

SNAKE

All he managed to do back then was to provide a toy or two. Looks like he's had enough of sponsoring insurrections.

OTACON

So this time, he's out here himself. I guess he's after Metal Gear?

SNAKE

History repeats itself. Metal Gear has enough strategic clout to upset the balance of military power overnight. He must be dreaming of Mother Russia's return to glory.

OTACON

Like you said, history repeats itself. Some people never change.

SNAKE

Maybe it's the world that doesn't -- or won't -- change.

OTACON

Maybe. But we're fighting to upset the status quo too, aren't we?
Post-Olga battle - about Olga

OTACON

So who was that Olga person?

SNAKE

Don't know. I'm guessing she's Gurlukovich's daughter. She said "nomads"...

OTACON

Didn't she -- you know, look a little like Meryl?

SNAKE

... I didn't notice.
Careful with that USP

OTACON

Hey, Snake, you found a handgun.

SNAKE

It's a decent one -- USP.

OTACON

The USP fires real bullets -- not the knockout rounds the M9 uses. You know that, right?

OTACON

The USP isn't equipped with a suppressor, either. If you fire it when there are enemies nearby, they'll probably hear it.

OTACON

Keep that in mind.

OTACON

Having the USP will make combat easier, but being undetected is still the best way to go. OK?
Head for the holds

OTACON

Snake, Metal Gear is in the holds below the tanker's deck. Go down.
Shot Olga's body

OTACON

What are you doing? How could you shoot someone who's unconscious! What are you, some kind of a monster!?
Top of the mast

OTACON

*a bit annoyed* Snake, I know you're into high places, but do you think maybe you can head down into the hold sometime this year?

OTACON

You're here to take those photos of Metal Gear, remember?
Post-Olga battle - bridge basics

OTACON

Ok, now infiltrate the holds and get those photographs of the new Metal Gear. Head downstairs.
Near Raven's shadow – engine room starboard side

OTACON

Snake, that shadow -- it's--

SNAKE

It's him, no doubt about it.

OTACON

But Raven was -- you know, out in Shadow Moses...

SNAKE

I know. Maybe it's the last of his nine lives, or maybe his Maker decided to give him another chance...

OTACON

You're not serious, are you?

SNAKE

Maybe I am, maybe I'm not. Either way, we'll find out soon enough.
*Second and subsequent times

OTACON

Snake, watch your step, okay...?
Locker that won't open

OTACON

It doesn't look like you can open that locker. It must be locked or something. Try another one if you really need to use a locker.
Head for the west side of the engine room

OTACON

Snake, there should be a door into the holds in the northwest section of the engine room. Head west.
Engine room structures

OTACON

Snake, the engine room is full of solid structures -- you could probably use them to get away when the enemy is chasing you.

OTACON

Use the Hanging mode wisely.
Enemies won't hear very well in the engine room

OTACON

That's the engine room. You can see the tanker's engine in the middle there.

OTACON

The engine noise is pretty loud, but that means the enemy's hearing will be hampered too.
The engine

OTACON

The reason the ship's drive section is in the aft area is so that more oil tanks can be fitted into the middle part. A shortened propeller axle is another benefit.

OTACON

The simplification of the drive structure means a greater emphasis can be placed on hull strength.
Falling from there means certain death

OTACON

Snake, if you fall from there, even you won't make it. You can't fall, no matter what. OK?
Infrared sensors - engine room port side

OTACON

Snake, wait! Don't move!
*If player tried to pass through them

SNAKE

What?

OTACON

Look at the walls on both sides of the hall.

SNAKE

I see something -- infrared sensors!?
*If player stopped for a moment

SNAKE

I see it. Some kind of device on both sides of the hall... Infrared sensors?

OTACON

Right. And they're linked to --

SNAKE

Let me guess. Semtex.

OTACON

Exactly. Plastic explosives.
*Only if player heard about them in the cutscene

SNAKE

So this is what they were talking about.

OTACON

Looks like it.

OTACON

If you trip the sensors...

SNAKE

I'll be sleeping with the fishes along with this entire ship.

OTACON

That sounds about right.
Infrared sensors (2)
*If player saw infrared sensors before engine room

OTACON

Snake, there's another set of infrared sensors in place. If you touch that, the explosives will detonate and that ship will be pulverized.
Infrared sensors (3)
*First time destroying control units

SNAKE

I'm not in the mood to go sleep with the fishes, but... There are too many sensors. Looks like I'll have to find another way.

OTACON

No need to worry. There's a way through.
Infrared sensors (4)
*How to destroy control units

OTACON

Take a close look -- do you see the thing with blinking green light right next to the explosives?

OTACON

That's the control unit for the sensors. Destroy that and the sensors stop functioning.

OTACON

You can't get in close enough to touch it, so you'll have to shoot it out.
*If player doesn't have the USP

OTACON

But your M9's knockout rounds won't work. Find a gun somewhere.
*If player has the USP

OTACON

But the M9's knockout rounds won't work. The USP you picked up should do the trick. Use that gun.
Don't shoot the infrared sensor explosives

OTACON

The actual explosive device is the one with a blinking orange light on it. Don't even think about shooting that.

OTACON

Any significant impact will set off the detonators, which is not good.

OTACON

Just aim for the green lights and take out the control unit.
Destroy all the infrared sensor control units

OTACON

Looks like there are several control units. Unless you take out all of them, you won't be able to get through.

OTACON

Once you've destroyed a control unit, the IR beam should shut off. If the beam is intact, that means there's a control unit you haven't managed to take out.

OTACON

You need to destroy every single control unit.
Target the infrared sensor control units in First Person View

OTACON

Use the First Person View Attack to target and destroy only the control unit.

OTACON

You should be able to target the partly concealed unit by climbing on top of objects, crawling, or stretching.
Infrared sensors - slip through them

OTACON

Hm, there aren't that many infrared beams. Maybe you can get past those without setting off the explosives.

OTACON

If you need to see exactly where the beams are, you can use the usual method.
*If there's a fire extinguisher nearby

OTACON

There's a fire extinguisher over there. Break it open and try scattering some of the extinguishing chemicals.
Don't touch the infrared beams

OTACON

If you trigger the sensor, the explosives will detonate. Don't ever make contact with the beams. This is very important.
Shoot the infrared sensor control units

OTACON

Aim carefully and take out just the control unit from the infrared sensors. Use the First Person View for accuracy.

OTACON

The control unit is the one with the green light.
Infrared beam Semtex

OTACON

The plastic explosive is probably Semtex.

OTACON

It was developed in the former Czechoslovakia. As easy to use as C4, and just as powerful.

OTACON

The composition is a mix of RDX and PETN, with a detonation velocity of over 26,000 feet per second, with temperatures reaching up to 3,000 degrees Fahrenheit.

OTACON

It was probably the explosive used in the Pan Am 103 bombing over Lockerbie in 1988.

SNAKE

If this much Semtex goes off at the same time, the tanker will disappear in two seconds flat.

OTACON

Make sure it doesn't go off, then. Don't trip the sensor, don't touch the Semtex.

SNAKE

Are they planning to take Metal Gear, and then sink the ship...?
Head for the holds - not in long corridor

OTACON

Snake, the Metal Gear prototype is in the holds.

OTACON

You took out the infrared sensor trap just now. Go through that section to reach the holds.
Head for the holds - in long corridor (Deck-2, port)

OTACON

Snake, the Metal Gear prototype is down in the holds.
*First time only

OTACON

That corridor wraps around the holds. There are several doors into the holds from the corridor, but it looks like most of them are locked.

OTACON

But I think the farthest door isn't locked yet.
*In west corridor

OTACON

You can get into the holds from the door at the end of that corridor. Head north.
*In north corridor

OTACON

You can get into the holds from the door at the end of that corridor. Head east.
*In east corridor

OTACON

You can get into the holds from the door at the end of that corridor. Head south.
Shoot out lights

OTACON

Shoot out the lights to darken the corridor. The enemy will have a harder time finding you.
Watch out in the long dark corridor

OTACON

Snake, use the flashlight in dark places like this.

OTACON

Your USP is equipped with a flashlight. All you have to do is select the gun and aim it with the Weapon Button, and the light will go on.

OTACON

Not that I need to tell you this, but the light will turn you into a better target if there are enemies nearby. Be careful.
Near watertight hatch that won't open (1)

OTACON

That door probably can't be opened. Try heading north.
Near watertight hatch that won't open (2)

OTACON

That door probably can't be opened. Head east.
Near watertight hatch that won't open (3) (Deck-2, starboard)

OTACON

Doesn't look as though you can open that door. Just keep heading south.
Near door from long corridor

OTACON

Snake, that door is locked from the other side. There's no way back now. Keep moving.
Fight back in long corridor (Gurlukovich soldiers battle)

OTACON

Looks like they plan to stop you from getting through. You've got no choice but to fight back. Use the First Person Attack mode.
Use jump-out shots in gunfights

OTACON

I don't think they're going to let you into the hold so easily.

SNAKE

I'll have to stand my ground and fight. I can try a Jump-out shot from Corner View.

OTACON

Good idea.
*Second and subsequent times

OTACON

If you go with Jump-out shots, you can wait behind cover for the right time to get in a shot.

OTACON

Select your gun and flatten yourself against an object, then switch to Corner View.

OTACON

Hit the Attack Button to pop out and catch the enemy off guard. Let go of the Attack Button to get back behind cover.

OTACON

Wait for a lull in the enemy fire to strike.
Tactical reloads

OTACON

Snake, what if you run out of ammunition during an exchange of fire? Leaves you suddenly vulnerable, doesn't it?

SNAKE

That wouldn't happen with Tactical Reload.

OTACON

So change the magazine before it becomes empty. That way, you would never run out when you're actually facing the enemy.

SNAKE

Exactly.
*Second and subsequent times

OTACON

To perform a Tactical Reload, unequip the gun, then equip it again.

OTACON

The gun should now be loaded with a fresh magazine. Use the quick change button -- the Weapon Equip Button -- for this one.
Hide behind cover

OTACON

Snake, you can take cover behind objects. Get down and fight back from a safer spot!
Watch out for grenades

OTACON

Snake, they've got grenades. If you see an incoming one, just get the hell out of there.
You have to take them all out

OTACON

Snake, the enemy's serious about not letting you through. You have no choice but to take all of them out. Start firing.
Head for the deepest part of the holds (Hold No. 1)

OTACON

Snake, the tanker's holds are divided into three separate blocks, and Metal Gear is in the farthest hold. You need to head north.

OTACON

You know the number you're up against. If you're spotted, there's no winning that fight. You have to stay out of their sight, okay?
Finish up before the speech is over

OTACON

Snake, take those pictures before the Commandant finishes his speech. It's the only chance we've got.
*First time only

OTACON

As soon as he finishes up, the Marines will go back to their posts.

OTACON

That's way too many pairs of eyes watching out for Metal Gear. There's no way they'll let an intruder with a camera slip past.

OTACON

Do what you have to before that happens.
If you're spotted you're dead (Holds)

OTACON

You absolutely can't let anyone see you in there. There are too many Marines in there to handle, even for you.

OTACON

If they see you, you're dead. Caution's the key word here.
The CMC's speech (1)

OTACON

The Marine Corps' defining character is that of an emergency response team in crisis situations.

OTACON

But the Army's been steadily enlarging its own crisis response capabilities, building on the strength of their Medium Brigade.

OTACON

Analysis is that the Marine Corps sees this as an infringement on their own domain, and is more than a little alarmed.

OTACON

We both know that Metal Gear REX was being developed for deployment by the Army.

OTACON

So it does make sense that the Marines are trying to compete with their own version of Metal Gear.
The CMC's speech (2)

OTACON
