So the Commandant says the Navy is leaning on them, huh?

OTACON

I'm sure the Navy isn't happy about the new Metal Gear prototype being developed.

OTACON

From what I can tell, the new model can make an approach, launch an attack, and execute take-offs from the ocean without any support.

OTACON

If the weapon makes it past the testing stage, it could render aircraft carriers, battleships, even submarines obsolete.

OTACON

It's a matter of life or death for the Navy as an organization...

OTACON

And if it's true that the Navy has its own Metal Gear in the works, that's another reason for them to get nervous.
The CMC's speech (4)

OTACON

You heard the Commandant mention the NMD -- the National Missile Defense program.

OTACON

It was conceptualized late last century as a defense network to detect and engage enemy ICBM's launched at the continental United States.

OTACON

But at the same time, it came under fire for contributing to nuclear proliferation. The MIRV'ing of ballistic missiles and the increase in weapon lethality were some of the byproducts of these defense R&D's.

OTACON

There was a lot of opposition from the international community, on the grounds that the program violated the Anti-Ballistic Missile Treaty. Russia and China were especially vocal in their criticism.

OTACON

Program deployment is a ways off, in any case. The military hasn't been able to come up with a good technology to discriminate between actual targets and decoys. There are also other tech issues that have to be addressed.
Near ladder - how to climb up and down ladders

OTACON

Snake, face the ladder and push the Action Button to grab onto the ladder.

OTACON

Push the Action Button again at the top or the foot of the ladder to let go.

OTACON

Remember, while you're going up or down a ladder, you won't be able to use any weapons.
Watch out with the projector

OTACON

Snake, you see that projector there? See what comes up if you turn it onto the screen in front of you.
*First time only

OTACON

I'm guessing there isn't enough space for all the Marines in that farthest hold where Metal Gear is.
*Only if player didn't hear the Codec call in front of the TV in the crew's lounge

OTACON

So they're broadcasting the live proceedings --

SNAKE

Why risk broadcasting in the first place?
-->TV broadcast (p. 28)
*Second and subsequent times

OTACON

Don't cut across in front of the projector, or the enemy may spot your shadow.

OTACON

Crawl across if you need to move in front of the projector.
Watch out for noisy floors (Holds No. 1 & 2)

OTACON

Snake, you can't walk on that floor without causing a racket. You'll be in trouble if someone hears you.

OTACON

To move more quietly, try crawling, or walk slower by pushing the left analog stick a little bit at a time.
Use the Action Button to open hatches

OTACON

Snake, look at that hatch over there. It probably connects to a below-deck network of ducts.

OTACON

Face the hatch and push the Action Button to open it.
Room under the floor - you still can't make any noise

OTACON

Snake, they'll find you if you make any loud noises, even inside that duct.

OTACON

There's no way you can take on that many of them.

OTACON

Don't even think about firing a gun, okay? Please?
Near cameraman soldier - about cameraman soldiers (Hold No. 3)

OTACON

Oh, so he was broadcasting all this stuff.
*If player hasn't heard Codec call about the TV, continues to "TV broadcast"
Near upper level fire pole

OTACON

Snake, you can use that pole to get down to the level below.

OTACON

Face the pole and push the Action Button to grab a hold of the pole.

OTACON

But once you slide down, you won't be able to go back up. Make sure you're finished with this floor before going down.
Near bottom of fire pole

OTACON

Snake, you're not going to be able to climb back up that thing. You should forget about going up to that level.
Near workstation

OTACON

Snake, that workstation is the transfer point between the tanker's intranet and the outside world. Use it to send those pictures over.

OTACON

All you have to do is face the computer and push the Action Button, and the photos will be sent.

OTACON

Hope you took a good one!
Workstation explanation - second time only

OTACON

That workstation is hooked up to the greater military network; the speech in the holds is being relayed out through that machine. We'll be making use of it too.

OTACON

I managed to get in through an Army IC router in Ohio.

OTACON

All I had to do from there was use the Link-16 to remotely install a few drivers and an application onto that workstation. So your camera can talk to their computer now.

OTACON

Hey, even military networks use products based on commercial technology. Nothing too unfamiliar there.

OTACON

Besides, I cut myself a back door when I still had access. I had a lot of access privileges while we were developing REX.

OTACON

Hey, are you listening?

SNAKE

Oh, ah, yeah...

OTACON

Really? Anyway, the program will compress, encrypt, and packetize the photo's image data. I used BATON for encryption, by the way.

OTACON

And the beauty of it is -- the packets are disguised to look like the TADIL-J message format. Get it? It's the standard Tactical Digital Information Link message format, and the packets will be sent out cloaked by their own speech broadcast.

OTACON

Tell me that isn't brilliant!

SNAKE

...

OTACON

Want me to go over it again?

SNAKE

No, once was enough.
Tanker camera facts and figures

OTACON

I'll explain how to use the camera.

OTACON

That digital camera you have was specially made to take pictures of the prototype Metal Gear.

OTACON

When a picture is taken, the screen data is first stored in the camera's internal memory.

OTACON

Then it's automatically processed through various algorithms to protect against tampering.

OTACON

Each picture is electronically stamped and distinctively encrypted. So, in the off chance that someone alters the data during transmission, we'll know immediately.

OTACON

Oh -- there's a limit to the internal memory's capacity.

OTACON

If the memory becomes full, overwrite the pictures you don't need anymore.

OTACON

When you're ready to take a shot, use the Lock-on and First Person View Buttons to scroll left or right among the picture previews at the bottom of the screen.
*If player is in Hold No. 3

OTACON

Send the pictures to me when you're done.

OTACON

Press the Action Button when you're in front of the workstation southeast from there, and the pictures will be sent to me. Get some good shots!
Send the photos

OTACON

Once you've got the photos, use the workstation in the southeast end of that room to send them over to me.

OTACON

But if they aren't what we need, I'm going to have to ask you to take another set.
Take photos of the Metal Gear - explaining the requirements
*First time only

OTACON

Ok, we're finally there.

SNAKE

So this is the new Metal Gear...

OTACON

Yep. And we're going to show the whole world its baby pictures.

OTACON

Get the prototype on camera.
*Second and subsequent times

OTACON

We need four images. One from the front-right, the front, and the front-left, and a closeup of the "MARINES" marking on the prototype.

OTACON

Once you have the photos, use the workstation in the southeast end of the area to transmit them over to me. Send me something I can use!
Remaining photos
(1)

OTACON

Ok, we're done with the image from the right. Three left to go -- one each from the front-left and front, and a closeup of the "MARINES" lettering. Good luck.
(2)

OTACON

The picture from the left is perfect. There's three left to go. One each from the front-right and front, and a closeup of the "MARINES" lettering. Have fun.
(3)

OTACON

The front shot works. Three more and we're done. Take a picture from the front right and front-left side, and a closeup of the "MARINES" lettering.
(4)

OTACON

We're good on the image of the lettering. Three left to go -- one each from the front-right, front-left, and the front of Metal Gear.
(5)

OTACON

I have the photos from the right and left. We still need two: one from the front and a closeup of the "MARINES" lettering.
(6)

OTACON

The photos from the right and front are good to go. We need two more. One from the front-left and a closeup of the "MARINES" lettering. Be careful.
(7)

OTACON

We can use the photos of the right and the insignia, but we're still missing one from the front-left and the front.
(8)

OTACON

The photos from the left and the one of the lettering are great. The two we need are the ones from the front-right and the front. Good luck.
(9)

OTACON

The photos from the left and the front are good to go. We have two left: One from the front-right and a closeup of the "MARINES" lettering.
(10)

OTACON

We already have the pictures from the front and the one of the lettering. Take two shots of Metal Gear from the front-right and the front-left. Send it over as soon as you can.
(11)

OTACON

The photos from the right, front, and left are ready to go up. The only one we need is a closeup of the "MARINES" lettering. We're almost there.
(12)

OTACON

The photos from the right and the left and the one of the lettering look good. The only one we need is of Metal Gear from the front. Good luck.
(13)

OTACON

We're okay on the photos from the right, front and the one of the lettering. The only one we want is of Metal Gear from the front-left. I know you can do it.
(14)

OTACON

I have the photos from the left, front, and the one of the lettering. The only one we still don't have is of Metal Gear from the front-right. That's the last one!
First time accessing workstation

OTACON

So, any Codec moments from you, Snake?
*If player has photo data (first time)

OTACON

Ok, I'm receiving the images...
*If player has photo data (second time)

OTACON

Looks like I have your photos now. Let's take a look...
*If player doesn't have photo data

OTACON

Huh? You haven't taken a single photo. There's no point in using this terminal if you don't have anything to send.
Player has a photo when accessing workstation
*First photo

OTACON

Ok, first up --

OTACON

The first image is --

OTACON

The first one I'm seeing is --
*Second and third photos

OTACON

What's next?

OTACON

And the next one is --

OTACON

The next one's --

OTACON

Ok, what am I seeing now...

OTACON

Next up is --

OTACON

The next image is --
*Last photo

OTACON

The last one is --

OTACON

OK, the last one's coming up.

OTACON

So, what's the last one gonna be...
Photo deemed OK when accessing workstation
*Right OK

OTACON

Ok, that's good. The shot from the right is in the bag.
*Left OK

OTACON

You're a pretty good photographer. We can definitely use this left shot.
*Front OK

OTACON

Ok, this works. It's a great front view.
*Insignia OK

OTACON

This is great. The "MARINES" lettering shows up really well.
Photo deemed no good when accessing workstation - general
*Completely unusable, selected at random

OTACON

Oh -- I don't think we can use this.

OTACON

Sorry, but this doesn't work. I hate to ask, but can you try again?

OTACON

It's almost right, but not quite. We can't use this.

OTACON

I'm sorry -- you need to take another one.

OTACON

Hmm. It needs to be a little more clear. What we need is top-notch quality here.
Photo deemed no good when accessing workstation - too close

OTACON

You're too close. We need something that shows Metal Gear as a whole.

OTACON

I think you're too close to the target. Let's pull back and get the whole thing in the frame.

OTACON

I can't tell what this is -- the camera's too close to the object. You need to pull back and take another one.
Photo deemed no good when accessing workstation - too far

OTACON

You're too far away. Get in closer and try again.

OTACON

No one will be able to tell what this is because it's too far away. What we need is a closer look.

OTACON

This isn't close enough. You need to take another one from a shorter range.
Photo deemed no good when accessing workstation - right duplicate

OTACON

We already have a good photo from the right.

OTACON

We have the shot from the right covered already. You didn't need to take another one.
Photo deemed no good when accessing workstation - left duplicate

OTACON

We don't need another one from the left.

OTACON

We can use the left shot you took earlier. You don't need to take another one.
Photo deemed no good when accessing workstation - front duplicate

OTACON

We don't need a shot from the front -- you took one already.

OTACON

The other photo of the front works. You don't need to take another one.
Photo deemed no good when accessing workstation - insignia duplicate

OTACON

You already took a good one of the side lettering.

OTACON

We only need one good shot of the lettering.
Photo deemed no good when accessing workstation - ridiculous
*Player took a ridiculous photo

OTACON

... What is this? Snake, this isn't a game we're playing here.

OTACON

Snake, get serious, will you? We need those pictures.

OTACON

...You're on a mission here, remember?

OTACON

This is NOT what we came for. I can't believe you're clowning around at a time like this. Really...
Photo deemed no good when accessing workstation - Commandant
*Player took a photo of the Commandant

OTACON

Hey, this is the Marine Commandant. Are you a fan or something?

OTACON

The Commandant again... Look, if you like him so much, I'll print this out and make a panel out of it. Put it over your bed or something.

OTACON

*fed up* Will you PLEASE stop sending me pictures of the Commandant?
Photo deemed no good when accessing workstation - butt
*Player took a photo of a soldier's butt, etc.

OTACON

... So, ah, this explains a lot. Not that there's anything wrong with keeping it to yourself -- I mean, you know, it's your life and everything...

OTACON

But you're going to have to take those Metal Gear photos now.
*Second and subsequent times

OTACON

More of these? Is that all you think about? Hey, what you like is your business, just get those Metal Gear pictures.
Photo deemed no good when accessing workstation - hilarious
*Player took a funny photo

OTACON

This is hilarious! This rules!

OTACON

But we can't use it. Get the shots we need!
Photo deemed no good when accessing workstation - mystery
*Mystery (pin-up girl photo)

OTACON

Ah! This is a -- !

SNAKE

What?

OTACON

Nothing, it's nothing...

OTACON

But this isn't a photo of Metal Gear anyway. Sorry, but you're going to have to go back and shoot another set.

OTACON

*whispering* I'll just make a backup of this one...
Photo deemed no good when accessing workstation - Olga
*Player took a photo of Olga

OTACON

Hm? Isn't this that soldier on the deck? Olga?

OTACON

I can't believe you took a picture of her. All things considered...

(2)

Yaagh! Another spooky photo!? I told you to stop, didn't I?

OTACON

I need to go get some holy water or something...
(3)

Stop it, okay!? Are you trying to freak me out?
All photos deemed OK when accessing workstation

OTACON

Okay, now we have all the photos...

OTACON

When accessing workstation - time to stop
*If player has to abandon effort due to lack of time

OTACON

Snake, the speech is about to wind up.

OTACON

We'll have to give up on the front view.

OTACON

We'll have to give up on the picture from the right.

OTACON

We'll have to give up on the picture from the left.

OTACON

We'll have to give up on the closeup of the "MARINES" lettering.

OTACON

Forget the photos and get out of there now.
Don't backtrack

OTACON

Why are you turning around? Metal Gear is in the farthest hold, I told you.
*If time is running out

OTACON

The Commandant is almost done with his speech. We're just about out of time -- hurry!
Codec Conversations (Tanker)
•Otacon
Basic Controls and Combat Explanations
Stand against a wall and knock

OTACON

Move the left analog stick in the direction of a wall and keep it there to flatten yourself against the wall.

OTACON

Push the Punch Button while in that position to knock on the wall and create a diversion.

OTACON

If you plan carefully, you'll be able to lure sentries away from their posts.
Hanging - drop and grab

OTACON

After pushing the Crawl Button in Hanging mode and falling, if you see a good handhold, try pushing the Action Button.

OTACON

If you hit it just right, you should be able to grab on. It won't matter if your direction if off a little bit. Experiment with it.
Hanging - kicking when climbing back up

OTACON

When you're springing up from Hanging mode with the Action Button, you can use the momentum to knee someone.

OTACON

If you see an enemy walking near the railings, give it a try.
Throwing from cover

OTACON

Select the grenade when you take a peek. You can then use the Weapon Button to throw the grenade while taking cover behind objects.
Getting items out of a soldier after a holdup

OTACON

If you get lucky, you could seize an item from someone after you hold them up.
*Dog tag holdups only

OTACON

There are some items you can only acquire from holdups. If you've got the time, try it out.
Hanging

OTACON

Push the Action Button near a scalable railing to hang off the other side.

OTACON

This is called Hanging. You can use it to move around, hide, and even maneuver around an enemy's back.

OTACON

You can move left and right while Hanging by moving the left analog stick or using the Equipment Window and Weapon Equip Buttons.

OTACON

When you're ready to pull yourself up, just push the Action Button again.

OTACON

A Grip Gauge appears below the Life Gauge during Hanging.

OTACON

The Grip Gauge indicates how tightly you are holding on, and steadily decreases as long as you are in Hanging mode.

OTACON

When the Grip Gauge goes to zero, you won't be able to hold on anymore. You need to hoist yourself up before you fall off.

OTACON

Push the Crawl Button while Hanging to jump down straight below.

OTACON

If the ground is too far below, you'll lose some LIFE. In some places, you won't make it at all. Be careful of that.
Grip strength increased from pull-ups (incoming call)

OTACON

Congrats, Snake! Looks like those pull-ups were worth it. Your grip strength is up!
Scaling obstacles

OTACON

If it's about waist-high, you'll be able to climb up or over things with the Action Button. Keep that in mind.
First Person View attacks (strafing, standing on tiptoes)

OTACON

Change to First Person View with a weapon selected. Once you aim your weapon with the Weapon Button, you're ready to attack in First Person View.

OTACON

Using the First Person Attack allows you to shoot high or low; you can aim for the enemy's head or even feet.

OTACON

The Equipment Window and Weapon Equip Buttons let you strafe during First Person Attacks. You can crouch, too, with the Crawl button.

OTACON

Once you've mastered all the moves, you'll be able to do things like jump out from concealment, fire at a target, and then drop out of the enemy's view again.
Lock-on button

OTACON

Aim the gun and push the Lock-on Button to automatically lock onto the target.

OTACON

You can use this feature from First Person View or from Top View as well.
Lowering your weapon

OTACON

You can aim the handgun with the Weapon Button, then lower it without firing if you let go of the button slowly.

OTACON

It saves ammunition, and besides, it could be useful after you've disarmed an enemy at gunpoint.
Bloodstains can get you spotted

OTACON

Snake, if you sustain damage from enemy attacks, it could increase your chances of capture. The bloodstains would lead them right to you.

OTACON

That's another reason you should stay away from trouble as much as possible.
How to stop bleeding

OTACON

Snake, are you bleeding!?
*If player calls while they aren't bleeding

OTACON

If your Life Gauge is down to the point where it's red, the bleeding won't stop.

OTACON

As long as you're bleeding, your Life Gauge will keep dropping gradually. Besides that, the bloodstains could put the enemy on your trail.

OTACON

The only way to stop the bleeding for good is to let your body recover until the Life Gauge is green. Rations are the best way to do that.

OTACON

Try to crouch down or assume Crawl position and stay still while you're bleeding. Your LIFE will recover bit by bit.

OTACON

I'd recommend that you stay in hiding until the bleeding stops, if possible.
Body part damage differences (tranquilizer rounds)

OTACON

Snake, the M9's anesthetic rounds have different effects depending on where it hits.

OTACON

If you manage to land them on the head or the heart area, the enemy will go down immediately. If it's hands or feet, it may take a while for the anesthetic to take effect.

OTACON

Try using the First Person View to aim with higher accuracy.
Forward roll

OTACON

Push the Crawl Button as you're running to go into a tumble and a forward roll.

OTACON

Make good use of it -- maybe when you need to move from cover to cover quickly?
Walking quietly

OTACON

If you tilt the left analog stick at a smaller angle, you'll be able to walk more slowly and stealthily.

OTACON

Speed isn't everything. Try moving over noisy surfaces this way.
You have to hide bodies

OTACON

Snake, don't just take out enemies and leave them there. That's a bad idea.

OTACON

Finding their dead friends on the ground will probably make sentries raise an alarm.

OTACON

Once you've dealt with someone, put the body somewhere out of sight.
How to drag bodies

OTACON

Bodies can be moved to another location by dragging.

OTACON

First, make sure no weapon is selected. Then push the Weapon Button near the body to grab it.

OTACON

As long as you have a hold on the body, you'll be able to drag it. Let go of the Weapon Button when you're done.

OTACON

It's a bad idea to leave enemies where they've fallen. Hide the bodies to make sure no one sees them.
Rigor mortis

OTACON

I recommend you hide the enemy's body as soon as you've taken them down.

OTACON

The tranquilized and unconscious enemies will wake up sooner or later. As for soldiers you've killed, the body will become too stiff to move in a short while.

OTACON

Keep that in mind.
Hiding bodies in lockers

OTACON

You can also hide the enemy's body in a locker.

OTACON

All you have to do is open the locker and drag the body there.
Body part damage differences (conventional rounds)

OTACON

The handgun ammunition and other live rounds have different effects depending on where the bullet hits.

OTACON

If you hit the hand, the enemy won't be able to use it, and a round to the leg and feet will take away their mobility. If you manage to land them on the head or the heart area, the enemy will go down immediately.

OTACON

Destroy the radio on their right hip, to the back, to prevent the enemy from calling for backup. Use the First Person View when you need to aim accurately.
Corner View peeking, left/right movement

OTACON

Push the Equipment Window or Weapon Equip Button while in Corner View to move your head and take a quick look in that direction.

OTACON

You'll be able to see farther in Corner View, but there's a greater chance of being discovered. Keep that in mind.
Corner View jump-out shots (standing or crouching)

OTACON

If you have a weapon selected while in Corner View, push the Weapon Button to jump out of concealment and aim your weapon.

OTACON

You can use this while you're standing or crouching. It should help during gunfights.
Corner View, right stick movement

OTACON

Move the right analog stick while in Corner View to look in that direction.

OTACON

The difference between this and using Equipment Window and Weapon Equip Buttons is that you won't be exposing yourself to possible enemy fire. At the same time, because you are staying in the same position, your range of vision is more limited.
Shadows can get you spotted

OTACON

Snake, in some locations, the lighting makes your shadow longer and more noticeable.

OTACON

The enemy might spot your shadow, so you'll want to watch out. Turns and corners are especially dangerous.

OTACON

But the same holds for the enemy. If you spot someone's shadow ahead, you can avoid unnecessary risks.
Suspicious objects (broken objects) can get you spotted

OTACON

Don't break things if you can help it. Any sign of infiltration will put the enemy on a lookout. Exercise caution.
Search mode

OTACON

Even if you've successfully thrown the enemy off your trail, don't ever relax your guard once you've been spotted.

OTACON

They'll be looking for you, and security will be tighter. Don't underestimate what you're up against.
Clearings
(1) *Incoming call

OTACON

Snake, get yourself out of sight now! Enemy search parties are on the way. It's a Clearing.
(2)

OTACON

These aren't sentries you're dealing with; they're searching for you, and they know you don't want to be found.

OTACON

You can't make some feeble attempt at concealment. Make sure you're completely hidden in some place they wouldn't think of searching.
Gunfights

OTACON

If you're spotted and it comes down to an exchange of gunfire, don't stand out in the open. Find cover ASAP.

OTACON

Strafe and stretch up from your concealed position to get a good shot on target while in First Person View.

OTACON

But if they come at you in droves, even you won't be able to fend them off. You need to avoid discovery at all costs.
Enemy radio transmissions

OTACON

As soon as you're spotted by an enemy soldier, he'll call for backup on his radio. The search party that's going to show up as a result is a tough bunch.

OTACON

For one thing, they have better equipment, like body armor. But the main thing is that they're highly trained in search-and-destroy types of activities.

OTACON

They'll come as a team and attack as a team. Don't try to take them straight on.

OTACON

If you're spotted, you need to stop the sentry from calling for backup.

OTACON

Take him down before he has the chance to use the radio.

OTACON

You can also break out the chaff grenade and interfere with the message transmission to prevent any alerts from being issued.

OTACON

If you take out the radio, the sentry will have no way of calling for help.

OTACON

Radios are worn behind the right hip. You should be able to target it in First Person View.

OTACON

If he does manage to call for backup, get yourself in deep hiding before they arrive.
Hiding spots

OTACON

You'll be less likely to be spotted in the dark. But this won't work during a Clearing, so I recommend you try something else.
Throwing magazines (only when player has one)

OTACON

Select the magazine and throw it using the Weapon Button. The noise will draw enemy soldiers toward wherever the magazine lands.

OTACON

How strong you push the button determines how large a swing you take. Take aim using First Person View and try to land it where it will lure the enemy away.
Holdups

OTACON

You can hold someone at gunpoint by getting behind his back with your gun ready. What you choose to do with a hostage making no resistance after that is up to you.
Item boxes

OTACON

Whenever you see an Item Box, you should acquire it. Take a closer look to see what the Item is.

OTACON

When you take out an enemy, move his body out of the way and check for an Item Box. Don't leave it behind.
Codec calls
*If player hasn't accepted a single optional incoming call

OTACON

Snake, when I have something urgent to tell you, I'll raise you on the Codec.

OTACON

When you see the CALL sign, hit the Codec Button to receive, all right?
Throwing enemies

OTACON

As long as you have no weapons selected, you can throw an enemy with the Weapon Button and the left analog stick.

OTACON

Just get in close and hit these controls at the same time. They'll be down on the ground afterwards, and you may even be able to knock them unconscious.
Choking enemies

OTACON

The other attack option when you're unarmed is the chokehold.

OTACON

Move in close to the enemy from behind and push the Weapon Button without moving the left analog stick. Hit the Weapon Button repeatedly to break the enemy's neck.

OTACON

Keep it pushed down if you want to move around and drag him away with you.

OTACON

Remember, you can only do this from the back. You can't perform a chokehold while facing someone. Be careful.
Corner View overview

OTACON

When you're flattened against a surface behind a corner, you're in Corner View. You'll be able to survey the area without exposing yourself.

OTACON

The Corner View lets you take a look ahead with the Equipment Window and Weapon Eqiup Buttons, or you can jump out with your weapon ready. Take advantage of all the action.
Don't let the enemy spot you

OTACON

Snake, don't let the enemy spot you. Once you've been discovered by a sentry, he'll call in reinforcements and there will be an attack.

OTACON

Even you're no match for that level of organized assault. They have better weapons too, remember?

OTACON

We aren't terrorists, okay? Avoid unnecessary confrontations and go for total stealth. All right?
•Otacon
Weapon Explanations
M9

OTACON

What you're wielding right now is a converted Beretta M-92F, designed to fire tranquilizer rounds. A direct hit will knock the target unconscious.

OTACON

Think of those rounds as tiny syringes.

OTACON

The impact of the round causes the mixing of two chemicals in the shell. The resulting gas compresses a tiny piston and injects the tranquilizer in the bullet's tip into the target's skin.

OTACON

The tranquilizer's effects are felt at different times depending on where the bullet lands.

OTACON

A head or heart shot will take effect immediately, but a round that hits somewhere like feet or hands will take a while.

OTACON

Use the First Person View Attack for maximum accuracy. The gun is fitted with a suppressor, so there is no need to worry about alerting the enemy with the noise.

OTACON

But since it is a tranquilizer gun, the M9 has its limitations. All it can do is knock the enemy unconscious. Keep that in mind.
Grenade

OTACON

I see you have the grenade equipped. It's an anti-personnel frag grenade -- throw it at the enemy and the blast and fragments will take the enemy out.

OTACON

Watch out -- pushing the Weapon Button will pull out the pin. Release the Weapon Button to toss it. The throwing distance depends on how hard you push the Weapon Button.

OTACON

After pulling the pin, you'll have five seconds until the grenade explodes. Get familiar with changing the timing and throwing distance of the grenade before it goes off.
Chaff Grenade

OTACON

Hey, you have a chaff grenade. You can use that to interfere with enemy radio communications... and electronic devices for a short time.

OTACON

The chaff grenade is a weapon that disperses aluminum foil or metal coated glass and plastic fibers to confuse the enemy radar.

OTACON

What you have is a portable application of the chaff- launchers built into fighter planes.

OTACON

When detonated, the grenade releases tiny chaff pieces as well as miniaturized active jammers using a small amount of explosives.

OTACON

The grenade can't create full-scale chaff corridors or chaff clouds, but will form a Radar Cross Section area large enough for single-personnel use.

OTACON

This weapon is for electronic interference only, though. It has no effect on enemy personnel.
Stun Grenade

OTACON

The stun grenade in your equipment is for incapacitating enemies without killing them.

OTACON

Stun grenades are non-lethal weapons that knock out enemy personnel with an intense flash of light and a burst of sound.

OTACON

Once the grenade is airborne, a timed detonator ejects an internal cartridge using a small amount of explosives.

OTACON

The cartridge then explodes, and releases a flash rated at over a million candlepower, with an accompanying bang of over 200 decibels.

OTACON

The combinations of the flash and the bang temporarily overwhelms human sensory perceptions. There are no projectiles released, so it can only knock out enemies, not wound them. Keep that in mind.
Magazine

OTACON

Snake, you have an empty magazine in your hand. Why are you still carrying that around?
•Otacon
Item Explanations
Thermal Goggles

OTACON

You have the Thermal Goggles equipped, huh? They provide night vision by using variances in heat distribution to create an image.

OTACON

It uses a two dimensional solid state projection system to create high-res images at sixty fps in real-time.

OTACON

By using the Thermal Goggles, you can take a look at the enemy's neck to see if they have dog tags or not.
Rations

OTACON

So you've got rations now. These are military food supplies, and allow you to recover some LIFE with use.

OTACON

If it is equipped in advance, the ration will automatically be used and LIFE will be regained when you receive damage.

OTACON

You can select it in the window and push the Confirmation Button to use the item on the spot.

OTACON

Rations were designed to be carried and eaten on the field. They're all about functionality and calories.

OTACON

They use a special freeze-drying methods developed by NROC. They're compact, portable, and last for weeks.
Bandage

OTACON

You've picked up gel bandages, I see. When you're bleeding, select the bandage as an equipment to stop the blood.
*If player hasn't heard "How to stop bleeding," continues to that conversation

OTACON

The bandage is a type of alginate dressing. It's a highly absorbent pad that gels blood and other fluids on contact.

OTACON

It releases calcium ions during absorption, hence the coagulating effect.
Cigarettes

OTACON

Snake, are you smoking? You really should quit.

OTACON

First of all, it turns you into an instant target in the dark. As for what it means to your health, I won't even go there.

OTACON

Remember what Naomi said about lung cancer rates? Everyone knows that it's a dangerous substance.

SNAKE

So's war, and I've done that all my life.

OTACON

Well, you can screw up your own body if you like, but think about other people, okay?

SNAKE

This is the new kind that has almost no second-hand smoke. It won't bother anyone.

OTACON

Oh really? Didn't I see you toss the butt off the bridge? Littering, polluting...

SNAKE

Ummm...

OTACON

You have a long way to go, my friend.
Pentazemin

OTACON

You have Pentazemin in your inventory. If you need to take some, select it in the Item Window and push the Enter Button.

OTACON

Pentazemin is a mild tranquilizer used to treat clinical depression, obsessive-compulsive behavior, and anxiety.

OTACON

It belongs to the benzodiazepinate family, and along with its antidepressant and anti-anxiety qualities, it suppresses convulsions.

OTACON

Take it when you have a tough shot ahead with the sniper rifle and you need to minimize shakiness. But I guess you don't have one of those yet.

OTACON

Well... you can also try some if you're feeling really seasick.
Seasickness gone?
*After hearing "Pentazemin" conversation, use Pentazemin and call Otacon

SNAKE

Otacon, I took the Pentazemin and you're right -- the seasickness is gone!

OTACON

Wow! Really!?

SNAKE

What do you mean, "Really?" You said...

OTACON

Drugs are mostly about placebo effect. If you believe it's effective, it is. You're more naive than I thought.

SNAKE

...
Cardboard Box

OTACON

Using the old cardboard box trick, huh? Looks good on you, Snake. Camouflage is the best way to slip past enemy surveillance.

OTACON

But cardboard is just paper when it comes down to it. It won't withstand any serious assault for long.

OTACON

Don't rely on the trick too many times, either. And I recommend you keep it dry.
Anti-personnel Sensor

OTACON

You're using the Anti-personnel Sensor, I see. It measures the electromagnetic fields and heartbeat of life forms and converts the data into vibrations.

OTACON

If an enemy draws near, it will vibrate. The stronger the vibration, the closer the enemy is.

OTACON

But, remember, when using the Anti-personnel Sensor, you'll only be able to feel the vibrations coming from the sensor.

OTACON

It'll also be harder to hear, so it may be better to leave it off unless you're using something like stun grenades.
Binoculars

OTACON

Good, you have a pair of binoculars. You'll be able to use them to survey enemy territory from a distance.

OTACON

They come with a zoom function and auto-focus, and have all the durability of military equipment. You won't have to worry about breakage with these.
•Otacon
Save Conversations
Before Save menu appears
*Status: Normal (1)

OTACON

Do you want to save, Snake?
*Normal (2)

OTACON

Time to save?
*Normal (3)

OTACON

Oh, you need to save. Just a second.
*Normal (4)

OTACON

Oh, Snake, you want to save?
*Status: Tense (1)

OTACON

Need to save, right, Snake?
*Tense (2)

OTACON

You all right, Snake? I'm ready to save whenever you are.
*Tense (3)

OTACON

Snake! Thank God! I can do a quick save if you need.
*Tense (4)

OTACON

Snake! Do you need to save?
If player chose not to save
*Status: Normal (1)

OTACON

OK, see you, Snake.
*Normal (2)

OTACON

Hang in there.
*Normal (3)

OTACON

Oh, you're not going to save? Well, okay, just let me know when you need to.
*Normal (4)

OTACON

OK, Snake. Stay out of trouble.
*Normal (5)

OTACON

Look, Snake, this frequency is for saving only. Remember?
*Status: Tense (1)

OTACON

Hang in there, Snake!
*Tense (2)

OTACON

Let me know as soon as you need to save, okay? Don't let them get you!
*Tense (3)

OTACON

Don't give up!
*Tense (4)

OTACON

Snake! You've got to stay alive!
General-purpose silence
*Silent

OTACON

...
Poor man's proverbs, after saving
*After first save

OTACON

Snake, you of course know the saying "One for all, all for one."

SNAKE

What is this, all of a sudden?

OTACON

Oh, I figured you'd need a lot of motivation, so I came prepared.

OTACON

It's from 'The Three Musketeers' -- the book, not the candy bar.

OTACON

Anyway, it means that if you go up against everyone by yourself, they'll gang up on you too. I think.

OTACON

Since you're on your own on that ship, you need to take this to heart and avoid confrontations.

OTACON

How was that? Just like the old days, huh?

SNAKE

Almost reminds me of Mei Ling, but... You sure you got it right?

OTACON

*with baseless confidence* Of course! And I'll teach you a lot more of these, you can count on it.

SNAKE

Great... (It's an unwelcome favor.)
*After saving (1)

OTACON

Okay... There's a saying that goes "Even a bird on high dies a glutton's death, as do the fish of The Deeps."

OTACON

The lesson is -- er, don't be greedy.

OTACON

The fish that belonged to a family called the Deeps died from overfeeding, and so did a bird that got high on something -- probably fermented fruit.

SNAKE

... Okay. If you say so.

OTACON

I do, Snake. Don't take unnecessary risks just because you're greedy for more Items. Remember the Deep family's fish.

SNAKE

...
*After saving (2)

OTACON

Another Chinese proverb: "Those who look to the Heavens prosper, those who defy it are no more." Do you know this one?

OTACON

The meaning here is -- hold on a sec -- that you can only survive as long as you're a part of the natural order of things.

OTACON

You remember pre-ripped jeans?

OTACON

Manufacturers thought that just because people loved old, broken-in jeans, they would want to buy new jeans that looked old. So they purposefully --

SNAKE

What do jeans have to do with nature and order?

OTACON

Denim should fray and rip on its own, naturally. Right? Some designers tried to go against that, and -- no one bought them! The earnings report from that fiscal year is enough of a proof!

SNAKE

*unconvinced* Earnings...?
*After saving (3)

OTACON

Hey, Snake, what's "Hardest won, most easily lost"?

OTACON

It's time, get it? Amazing how relevant these Chinese proverbs still are!

OTACON

Once the moment's gone, it's gone. Except for daylight savings time, of course. That extra hour to do anything you like with every autumn... gotta love it.

OTACON

Then again, you lose an hour every spring, so I guess the proverbs are right. Wow, they thought of everything.

SNAKE

Did they even have daylight savings back then?

OTACON

Of course not! They knew how to save time. We're the ones that need to be tricked into it.

SNAKE

But you said --

OTACON

The moment never returns, Snake. Let's not waste it on idle questions.

SNAKE

Okay...?
*After saving (4)

OTACON

The Chinese have a saying: "Those who are lost never question a path, and a drowning man doubts not the shallows."

OTACON

And it means -- means that you need to make use of other people's help. Otherwise, you could be in trouble.

OTACON

If you're lost, you don't even know whether a road you come across is a right one, and, uh, what's the difference between shallow and deep if you've already drowned... right?

OTACON

Anyway, the point is that help is always a good thing to accept. So make good use of the Codec.

SNAKE

Look -- this stuff seems nothing like what Mei Ling used to talk about.

OTACON

*confidently* Hey, she couldn't do better herself!

SNAKE

...
*After saving (5)

OTACON

"Acquaintances agree. Friends argue."

OTACON

That's a straightforward one. The better friends you are, the more openly you can disagree with each other.

OTACON

So feel free to present a counterpoint if you don't agree with what I'm saying. Argue away!

SNAKE

Sure. All right.

OTACON

... Not a promising start. OK, forget what I said -- just go along with my advice.
*After saving (6)

OTACON

Do you know the saying "One forgets the hurt once the wound has healed"?

OTACON

*quietly* And that of course means -- uh -- where'd I put that piece of paper --

SNAKE

Did you say something?

OTACON

No, nothing. So, uh, forgetting the pain when the wound's healed means... Um --

OTACON

That you have to get better fast! Yeah, that's it. So stock up on those rations and bandages.

SNAKE

Is that really all it means?

OTACON

*confidently* Hey, I'm the expert here.
*After saving (7)

OTACON

Snake, have you heard this one? "Evil is human nature, and his entire being, falseness."

OTACON

The concept of so-called Original Sin. The idea that you're born bad, so you can't help doing bad things...

SNAKE

Hold on. I thought the idea of Original Sin was that you had to work even harder at being good because you were born evil!

OTACON

Er -- oh yeah, that too. Very good, Snake.

SNAKE

...
*After saving (8)

OTACON

You know the story about Achilles and Paris?

OTACON

The moral here is -- er -- something about his heel?

OTACON

Anyway, even the great and virtually immortal hero Achilles was finally done in by Paris.

OTACON

Talk about a dangerous city. So don't get complacent. The mission can turn around and get you.

SNAKE

Wasn't Paris a person?

OTACON

What?

SNAKE

Paris. I thought he was a --

OTACON

*sighs* Snake, there's a time and place for conspiracy theories. Please, I'm trying to concentrate here.

SNAKE

Huh? Ah, sorry...?
*After saving (9)

OTACON

Do you know the saying "Those who walk a hundred leagues think not that their journey is half ended until the ninetieth league"?

OTACON

That means... -- what does it mean --

OTACON

OK. It means that if you're planning to walk that far, you'd better damn well know how to do simple arithmetic. Study! Stay in school!

SNAKE

This seems to be getting more and more random.

OTACON

Correction -- it's becoming more deep. Trust me.
*After saving (10)

OTACON

The Chinese have a proverb that goes "Scholars hold in esteem knowledge, not acts."

OTACON

See, they just sit around thinking, instead of actually doing something. Which doesn't make them too useful. Action is what matters! I think.

SNAKE

Look, what I heard from Mei Ling was that --

OTACON

Snake, have you noticed that you bring her up a lot?

SNAKE

Huh? That isn't the --

OTACON

Here we go again. What am I going to do with you?

SNAKE

Like I was saying --

OTACON

You and your hyperactive libido. It's a good thing one of us can keep all the details straight.

SNAKE

...
*After saving (11)

OTACON

This is my favorite Chinese saying: "Better to be first among roosters than last among bulls."

OTACON

Of course, the meaning's clear: If you have to choose between being a chicken or a cow, pick the chicken. Cows are always being messed with by aliens -- cattle mutilations are up, you know. Why go looking for trouble, right?

OTACON

If an enemy spots you, you'll be in more trouble than a cow on a UFO. You stay out of their sight!

SNAKE

Why would aliens be in an old Chinese proverb?

OTACON

Everyone knows they've been visiting us for thousands of years.

SNAKE

... News to me.
*After saving (12), Mei Ling appears

OTACON

Snake, do you know the Chinese proverb "Care avoids err"?

OTACON

"Err" is thought to be a Kung word meaning "what."

OTACON

There are some linguists who think that this accounts for an almost universal utterance of the syllable "er" when people are at a loss for words. A kind of vestigial --

MEI LING

Hey!

OTACON

Ack!

MEI LING

What a crock! What did you do with that little cheat sheet I made you!

OTACON

Er --

MEI LING

*surprised* Oh, there it is -- Hey!

OTACON

Er, that's really a...

MEI LING

*furiously* How could you do that! You know how busy I am and you -- !!

OTACON

It's not what you think...

MEI LING

Oh, so what am I thinking?

SNAKE

What's going on over there?

MEI LING

Oh, hi, Snake. Do you know that Otacon's been --

OTACON

Er, Mei Ling, we're in the middle of a mission and everything! So can we, you know...

MEI LING

...

OTACON

...

MEI LING

*unhappy, but agrees* Fine. Sure.

MEI LING

And Snake, the real meaning of "Care avoids err" is that if you're cautious, you can avoid making serious mistakes.

MEI LING

Even if you've gotten used to the mission, watch what you do. Good luck!

OTACON

Yeah, Snake! Good luck!

MEI LING

You, I'm not done with.

OTACON

Ack...

MEI LING

Let's discuss this, shall we?

OTACON

Err...
*After saving (13), regarding Mei Ling

SNAKE

What happened to Mei Ling?

OTACON

Hehe. She got mad and went offline.

SNAKE

What did you do?

OTACON

Nothing! Now don't we need to get back to the mission? So much to do, so little time...

SNAKE

...
•Commandant's Speech
Played in the background during gameplay

CMC

You're all familiar with the Shadow Moses incident during the Sears administration. The current state of nuclear proliferation is a direct result of that event. You remember how the existence of Metal Gear Rex and the development program for new warhead technology was exposed to the public. What you should also know, even though we have never officially confirmed the fact, is that the data for the research was stolen and sold on the open market.

CMC

We initiated development of Metal Gear RAY as a countermeasure to these pirated weapons forces. The only thing that can stand up to a Metal Gear is of course, another Metal Gear. With RAY, the hundreds if not thousands of Metal Gears that exist all over the world are no longer a threat. The blind rush to nuclear proliferation will be contained and it will be the Marine Corps, and our RAY, that will accomplish this.

CMC

At the moment, every industrialized nation on the globe knows the specifications for Metal Gear. Worse yet, so do a number of rogue states. They are all working on deploying their own Metal Gear force to compete with the U.S.'s nuclear strike capability. The world is about to see a swarm of these Metal Gear derivatives.

CMC

Ours is not the only military project (talking about Arsenal Gear) devoted to Metal Gear development, but it cannot be more different in nature from the Navy's. Theirs is a program that will add fuel to the uncontrolled fire of nuclear proliferation. It is a fact that players in favor of such a policy are attempting to derail our own RAY project. But I promise you that they will not succeed.

CMC

This weapon will render all other Metal Gears obsolete. Nations building up their own Metal Gear force will think twice about their nuclear strategy in the light of the military dominance spelled out by RAY. The shift in the balance of power will mean a new world order. And we, the Marine Corps, will play a central role in its military affairs.

CMC

Some say that the strategic importance of aircraft carriers will be reduced by the completion of RAY. The opposition from the Navy is an undeniable fact. There is a lot of pressure from Navy brass, especially those with submarine and air background. Not to mention interference from a major player (the Patriots)... But this project is vital to the Marine Corps. The enemy is sometimes closer to home than you think, gentlemen. Always bear that in mind.

CMC

I have a daughter, and it is my greatest wish never to have her, or her children, experience the horror of nuclear war. As a father, I want to leave a better world for the future generation. As a soldier, I know that is my duty.

CMC

Metal Gear RAY is amphibious, unlike the Army's REX. It can cruise deep underwater, move in undetected and make its landing on any shoreline. Its onboard, Joint Tactical Information Distribution System identifies targets with unerring accuracy, and takes them out with massive firepower. It is the ultimate weapon, and it is yours to guard. I'd like you all to think about what that means.

CMC

The National Missile Defense program was initiated in the end of the 20th century, projected to completion in 2005. However, the NMD trial conducted in the year 2000 was a complete failure, and the success of the 1999 trials is now considered a chance happening. There was no technological solution in sight and the program was already attracting strong criticism from Russia and China for its potential violation of the Anti-Ballistic Missile agreement. The fact that any development in missile defense would trigger accelerated weapons development has been pointed out from the very beginning. President Sears forced the NMD proposal through and succeeded in deploying the program. Some say that it was a military (the Patriots) interest—with plans for the hundred billion dollar program budget that actually arranged the legislative approval.

CMC

Former President Sears did also act towards reducing the nuclear stockpile while nurturing the NMD concept. It was he who lowered START3's ceiling for tactical nuclear weapons in order to bring Russia around to approving a revision to the ABM treaty. Everyone believed the world was headed for the end of the arms race when Shadow Moses happened. Even though the development of Metal Gear REX is still outside the bounds of official truth, everyone in the international military community knows the facts. Its specs spread across the globe like wildfire, and the nuclear race is on again. The only thing that can reverse its course is this Metal Gear RAY.

CMC

The Metal Gear REX development on Shadow Moses was supposedly the first preparatory measure taken against the future possibility of reduced nuclear defense capability. An NMD technology leak to other nations would make that contingency likely. But if this theory is correct, it means that there was a calculated intent to cash in on this opportunity by specific interests within the military-industrial complex. We are here today to flush out and rid our country of these corrupting forces. That is our mission, and you will bear that in mind.

CMC

George Sears surrendered his presidency in the aftermath of Shadow Moses. The official reason given did not of course include the development of Metal Gear REX and next-generation nuclear warheads. But even you will have heard rumors that he was forced to resign after the failed coverup cost him his influence in the political community.

CMC

This Metal Gear RAY is a prototype, designed to be operated by an onboard pilot. In its final form, RAY will be unmanned, driven by tele-existence and an autonomous control system. The importance of next-generation technology such as C4ISR and RMA in battle situations has been discussed time and again, but RAY is the first to deploy it so fully. With RAY's completion, the Marine Corps will lead the way for a new age of military tactics.
*If additional time is added to the time limit

CMC

I'm on a roll here. Let's go on a little bit longer.

CMC

We will proceed out of New York Harbor and conduct top-secret field testing of RAY. Shadow Moses has turned public opinion against weapons development, and this training needs to stay covert. We cannot risk jeopardizing the program on the eve of its completion. The disguised oil tanker is a part of our cover. RAY is well worth all these precautions. Trust me.

CMC

It is an undeniable fact that there is a force at work in our government (the Patriots), and within the military, seeking to control national affairs to suit its own interests. Metal Gear RAY bears the burden of confronting this party, thwarting their plans and guiding this nation back to its original path. This exercise is but a first step towards that goal, the future of the country rests with you tonight.

CMC

The brain drain of nuclear specialists and the black market trade in weapons-grade plutonium has been fueling a cottage industry in nuclear weapons since late last century. Add Metal Gear to the mix, and the result is the renewed proliferation you see the world over. We once lived in the shadow of the doomsday machine. This Metal Gear RAY can bring other Metal Gears under control—and ensure that we never know that fear again. And we the Marines, will be the guardians of this peace.

CMC

This new model of Metal Gear is codenamed RAY after the great Manta Ray. Our RAY has a sting that nature never gave the Manta. With this latest Metal Gear, we can rule the sea and land as we never have before.

CMC

The proliferation and development of Metal Gear technology are about to render agreements like the NPT and START obsolete. There are also forces at work trying to exploit this disturbing trend to further their own power and influence. The human race is about to slide back into the endless arms race of that last century, and we cannot afford to play that Russian Roulette again. The Metal Gear RAY you see is here to prevent that possibility.

CMC

We the Marines will lead the charge into|a new world order with Metal Gear RAY.

CMC

That is all. Dismissed!
Section 3
Start of Plant Chapter – Meeting Stillman
Opening Infiltration 1
3D Cutscene 1
((MC) Verrazzano Bridge)
April 29, 2009 (The exact year is not revealed in the game, just the date.)
The sky is a deep, cloudless blue. Two Navy Sikorsky HH-60H helicopters whizz under the Verrazzano Bridge, their dark gray bodies lit by the glare reflecting off the water's surface. The bridge has been closed off, and military and police personnel have taken up positions on it. The scattering of bright points of light over the harbor area reveals the scope of the security forces at work keeping an eye on the plant. From the bridge railing, police officers follow the path of the choppers through their binoculars.
Big Shell is explained during this sequence.
A simple audio briefing consisting of the Colonel's voiceover starts.

COLONEL

Snake, do you remember the sinking of that tanker two years ago?

RAIDEN

Of course.

COLONEL

Terrorists blow a hole in an oil tanker full of crude, barely 20 miles off the shore of Manhattan -- your classic nightmare. It didn't take long for the government to put an oil fence around the whole mess. And then that massive offshore cleanup facility went up inside.

RAIDEN

The "Big Shell." I hear the cleanup isn't quite over yet.

COLONEL

It takes time. But in the meantime, the Shell's become a landmark, a symbol of environmental protection.
The choppers are flying low, almost skimming along the ocean surface. Military and police vessels bob on the water by the bridge, blocking sea traffic into the harbor. The camera pans to take in the giant offshore plant. The plant consists of two structures, hexagonal units clustered on a north-south axis. An oval oil fence (its shape resembling a tortoise shell) surrounds a patch of the sea, with Shell One and Shell Two at the center.
Caption: Offshore decontamination facility, the Big Shell
As seen from a helicopter, the structure lies on the ocean's surface like a giant tortoise shell, or to the more fanciful viewer, a hex-shaped area straight out of a simulation game.
Audio from SEAL team leader's radio transmissions.

COMMANDER

Calling teams Alpha and Bravo...

COMMANDER

Deploy at the Big Shell as scheduled...
Raiden surfaces in a flurry of bubbles (reminiscent of ninjutsu water escapes) after the choppers pass overhead; the elaborate scuba wear obscures his appearance entirely, save for a trace of blonde hair. The idea is veteran players will mistake him for Snake. In Raiden's mouth is a cylindrical oxygen module (the design is such that it looks like he's holding a scroll in his mouth), and the plant and two choppers reflect off a curious pair of goggles, which cover his eyes completely. After ascertaining the direction of the choppers' flight, Raiden once again dives out of view.
Terrorists' background is explained during this sequence.

COLONEL

Approximately six hours ago, the Big Shell was seized by an armed group.

RAIDEN

Do we have an ID?

COLONEL

Former members of the Navy SEAL's1 special anti-terrorist training squad, "Dead Cell." Russian private army members may also be involved. It's a highly trained group and they have the Big Shell under complete control.
The Big Shell.
Aerial shot of the plant's massive, alien form. A chopper moves in close to the structure. The color (texture) of the ocean surface is clearly different inside the fence. The oil slick covering the fenced-in water deadens the surface to the point that there is almost no reflectivity.
Inside the chopper, a man calls out.

SEAL α 0

Come in from downwind, then pull up fast!

SEAL α 0

Get ready to fast rope down to Shell One!

SEAL α 0

Five minutes to ETA!

COMMANDER

Alpha, your top priority is to rescue and safeguard the President!

COMMANDER

Team Bravo, watch out for Stillman's back, and get those C4s2 disarmed...
The chopper's rotor whips the ocean's surface (and the oil slick inside the fence) into a frenzy. On the other side of the structure, the diversion team's helicopter circles in a bid to distract the enemy.
Underwater, close to the Big Shell.
Raiden swims below the surface.
Raiden cautiously approaches the oil fence. The closer he gets to it, the lesser the amount of light penetrating the ocean surface above. Raiden checks the high-voltage fence; numerous dead fish float nearby, killed after coming into contact with it. A hole has been cut in the fence, large enough for a single person. There are signs that the hole was made for infiltration purposes. Raiden slips through the opening, taking care not to come into contact with the fence.
Terrorists' demands are explained during this sequence.

RAIDEN

What are their demands?

COLONEL

Thirty billion dollars.

RAIDEN

Thirty billion dollars!? What makes them think they can get that much?

COLONEL

There was a government-sponsored tour going on at the Big Shell that day.

RAIDEN

Hostages, huh?

COLONEL

A VIP from one of the major conservation groups, and one from our own government -- the Most Important Person in a sense.

RAIDEN

The most important person --

COLONEL

James Johnson.

RAIDEN

The President!

COLONEL

Unless the demands are met, the terrorists intend to blow the Big Shell out of the water.

RAIDEN

And the crude will ignite, turning the Manhattan Harbor into an inferno.

COLONEL

That's not the worst-case scenario. If the chlorides being used to decontaminate the seawater go up with the oil, toxins containing catastrophic levels of dioxins will be released.

COLONEL

In other words, the bay's ecosystem will be wiped out, and the sea will turn into a toxic soup for centuries -- becoming the worst environmental disaster in history.
Bottom of Strut A, underwater.
Raiden looks up at the surface; the thick film of crude blocks out the sun entirely. To the front are numerous lights affixed to the strut. Tiny white precipitates drift down like marine snow from the surface, brilliant in the beams of the spotlights. The shimmering bands of light and particles are reminiscent of MGS1's Alaska. Raiden moves over the ocean floor and locates the plant's barnacle-encrusted maintenance outlet. He climbs up the ladder into the hatch.
Raiden's mission is explained during this sequence.

COLONEL

You have two mission objectives. One: infiltrate the offshore decontamination facility "Big Shell" and safeguard the President and other hostages; and two: disarm the terrorists by any means necessary.
Bottom of Strut A, inside facility pool.
Raiden breaks the surface of the infiltration pool. A POV sweep of the water's surface reveals a glimpse of a figure in a diving suit, a possible enemy. Raiden moves up the ladder with utmost caution; in this cutscene, the climb is accomplished all at once. (In the game, the climb is accomplished interactively every time the player falls into the pool.) The C4 attached to the side of the submersible (placed there by Fatman) moves across the camera (foreshadowing). Having cleared the ladder, Raiden kneels and raises the Colonel on the Codec in a manner similar to MGS1.

COLONEL

You should know... that SEAL Team 10 is also conducting a rescue operation.

RAIDEN

Is this a joint effort?

COLONEL

No. FOXHOUND remains a covert body. Don't alert them to your presence -- that is an order.
Opening Infiltration 2
Codec Call 1
(mandatory outgoing call to the Colonel)
Raiden climbs up to the poolside area and uses the Codec. The Codec screen appears. In both the left- and right-hand side windows are middle polygon cranial models. Raiden's head is completely covered by his mask. In order to trick those players who have completed the Tanker Chapter into believing that this chapter features the same protagonist, Snake, the voice effects are modulated accordingly. Raiden's appearance differs from Snake's, but the deception will continue until he takes off his mask.

RAIDEN

This is Snake. I am now inside Strut A of Shell 1.

COLONEL

How are things?

RAIDEN

We're in luck. Looks like there are no sentries posted here.

COLONEL

What's the visibility?

RAIDEN

The lights on the plant's struts are functioning. I won't have to use the IR goggles.

COLONEL

Any problems?

RAIDEN

There was a brand-new hole cut through the oil fence. There's someone else besides me that wanted to get in badly.

COLONEL

That's not possible.

RAIDEN

What about SEAL Team 10?

COLONEL

They landed on the roof of the Big Shell as planned. And by the way Snake, we're changing your codename for all following communication.

RAIDEN

What's wrong with "Snake"?

COLONEL

Just a precaution. You are now designated "Raiden."

COLONEL

All right, Raiden. You've already covered infiltration in VR Training.

RAIDEN

I've completed three hundred missions in VR.

RAIDEN

I feel like some kind of legendary mercenary...
Up until now, Raiden was using the same codename he used during his VR training.

COLONEL

Okay, we'll skip that part.
*If player hasn't completed the Tanker Chapter

COLONEL

This will be your first sneaking mission.

COLONEL

The arms will naturally have to be procured on-site.
The lines that follow are taken straight from MGS1.

COLONEL

Make sure nobody sees you.

COLONEL

If you need to, contact me by Codec. The frequency is 140.85.

COLONEL

When you want to use the Codec, push the Codec Button.

COLONEL

When we need to reach you... *changes wording to match that in MGS1* contact you, the Codec will beep.

COLONEL

When you hear that noise, press the Codec Button.

COLONEL

The Codec's receiver directly stimulates the small bones of your ear. No one but you will be able to hear it.

RAIDEN

All right. I'll contact you if anything changes.

COLONEL

First, make your way to the upper section of the Big Shell.

RAIDEN

How do I get up to the next level?
A game clip of the elevator appears on the Codec screen. Preview images of Raiden looking up at the elevator and a POV shot of the elevator. The purpose of this video is to show both the elevator's location and an indication of its function.

COLONEL

There's an elevator at the far end of that area. Use that.

RAIDEN

Sounds good.
Video ends.

COLONEL

Your new Sneaking suit uses electrofiber technology, a byproduct of fiber-optics research.
Opening Infiltration 3
3D Cutscene 2
(NM Skull Suit)
Display a full-body rotating model of Raiden.

COLONEL

The texture isn't far removed from rubber, but the material protects against a wide range of toxic substances. The suit itself has a wide array of built-in sensors.

COLONEL

It is referred to as "Smart Skin" in military R&D. Data about damage to different regions of the body, including blood loss, is exchanged between the suit and the intravenous nanomachines to create a feedback system.

RAIDEN

There's a lot of pressure on my torso.

COLONEL

Relax. The suit applies varying pressure to major internal organs to maximize performance and safeguard their functions.

COLONEL

They call this the "Skull Suit" in FOXHOUND.

RAIDEN

Skull Suit -- seems appropriate somehow.
Opening Infiltration 4
Codec Call 2
(mandatory outgoing call to the Colonel)
A video of a door appears on the Codec screen.

COLONEL

The hatch with a circular handle will open into the elevator area. Locate the hatch first.
It shows a door with a circular handle.

RAIDEN

Copy that. Moving onto main mission objectives.
Bottom of Strut A, Hatch 1
In-Game Sequence 1
(bottom of Strut A, Pool)
Raiden locates the watertight hatch into the elevator area and opens it.
On the other side is an L-shaped connecting passageway leading into the elevator hall. Raiden takes a closer look. The section of the corridor within his field of vision is no more than 10 meters (30 feet) in length, wih the rest turning off to the right. Raiden takes a step, then, sensing someone nearby, freezes. At the far end of the passageway (in front of the sliding door to the elevator hall), a sentry regains consciousness after being knocked out by Snake. A "?" flashes above his head to indicate his state of mind. The man is a Gurlukovich guard, outfitted with an Abakan AN-94 assault rifle, a Makarov sidearm, tiger stripe urban camo, and a balaclava (no backpack). He takes his radio off his hip and tries to reach the others, but the crackling static (sound effect) forces him to give up. Raiden conceals himself behind the hatch door and touches his fingers to his neck to use the Codec.
Bottom of Strut A, Hatch 2
Codec Call 1
(mandatory outgoing call to the Colonel)

RAIDEN

Colonel, I've sighted an enemy sentry.

RAIDEN

AN-94 and a Makarov...

RAIDEN

Those grenades... all his equipment is Russian-made.

COLONEL

Must be a Gurlukovich man.

RAIDEN

Gurlukovich?

COLONEL

A Russian private army that was in line to work with the Shadow Moses takeover group, four years ago.

RAIDEN

What's their stake in this one?

COLONEL

They must have made a deal -- an arrangement with the terrorists.

COLONEL

They've become a band of mercenaries, an army without a country.
Snake's Elevator Ascent 1
3D Cutscene 1
((MC) - Elevator Hall)
Raiden enters the elevator hall. Unlike the infiltration pool, the area is lit. Straight ahead, the elevator has just started its ascent. The Russian sentry from a few moments ago is ejected from the rising cage (courtesy of Snake's roundhouse kick). The sentry crumples to the floor, out cold again. Raiden takes stock of the situation: other soldiers are lying unconscious in the elevator hall. Raiden stares after the ascending elevator, and catches a glimpse of a figure in an outmoded Sneaking Suit (Snake is not yet dressed in a flight suit). The stranger's back is turned to the camera and Raiden's gaze. (Snake made his own infiltration through this route a few moments ago. Unfortunately, several sea lice made their way into his equipment during that time. The lice manage to make an appearance when Raiden first comes face to face with Snake, contributing to the former's distrust.)
This scene should be reminiscent of the cargo dock from the start of MGS1.
The elevator has risen out of view. Raiden sinks down on one knee to use the Codec.
Snake's Elevator Ascent 2
Codec Call 1
(mandatory outgoing call to the Colonel)

RAIDEN

Colonel, there's definitely another intruder in here besides me.

COLONEL

That's not a possibility.

RAIDEN

Not a team -- looks like a solo job.

COLONEL

*thinks a little* One man...?

RAIDEN

We may not know who he is, but he managed to take care of every sentry in the area; they're all out cold. Whoever he is, he's got some skills. (Hinting that it's Snake.)

COLONEL

We need to get an ID... But for now, you can take advantage of the situation and get to work.

COLONEL

There's a terminal in front of the elevator, a node.

RAIDEN

Did you say "nerd"?

COLONEL

Not "nerd" -- "node."

RAIDEN

Oh.

COLONEL

Use the node to gain access to the Big Shell's facilities network.

RAIDEN

Then what?

COLONEL

Pull up the map of the structure; that'll let you activate the Soliton Radar.

RAIDEN

The Soliton Radar?

RAIDEN

True, that radar came in useful during VR training.

COLONEL

A radar system -- uses biological magnetic fields as input.

COLONEL

These estimated enemy positions are projected onto a map according to reference points collected via GPS signals and field personnel reports.

COLONEL

We need to get to the map through the Big Shell's node to put this data processing to practical use.

COLONEL

The node unit is about three feet high -- should be colored blue. Each area has at least one.
Game screen video appears on the Codec screen.
The player can see where the node is positioned.

RAIDEN

How do I gain access?

COLONEL

Just push the Action Button in front of the node.

COLONEL

The nanomachines in your body will take care of the security clearance, and allow you access to the node.

COLONEL

Complete the procedure before those sentries gain consciousness.

COLONEL

If they spot you, you won't be able to gain access for a while.

COLONEL

Stay on guard.

RAIDEN

Got it.
First Access to Node 1
3D Cutscene 1
((MC) - near node)
Raiden spots the node and holds his palm out. The nanomachines inside his body begin to respond, and electric arcs (ribbons of plasma) spew out, causing Raiden's hair to stand on end! The access message appears on the node screen.
First Access to Node 2
Codec Call 1
(mandatory incoming call from the Colonel)
Having followed the Colonel's instructions, Raiden succeeds in gaining access to the node. The Colonel raises him on the Codec.

COLONEL

Good work, Raiden.

RAIDEN

The radar should be functioning now?
*If player has played Tanker Chapter

COLONEL

Remember your VR training sessions.

COLONEL

The tool is exactly the same one -- it maps the terrain as well as the position of enemy personnel.
*If player hasn't played Tanker Chapter

COLONEL

Let me explain about your Soliton Radar system.
The view changes to the game screen, with the radar displayed (it could also be video of the radar explanation from MGS1 displayed within the Codec screen). Game screen is shown.

COLONEL

The bright dot in the middle is you, Raiden.

COLONEL

The red dots are your enemies and the blue cone shape represents their field of vision.

COLONEL

Your radar isn't affected by the weather, but if you're discovered by an enemy you won't be able to use it.

COLONEL

It gets jammed easily I'm afraid.

COLONEL

It's all made from currently existing technology.

COLONEL

You won't be able to use it in an area with strong harmonic resonance. So be careful.

COLONEL

The Big Shell's layout map should now be available after touching the Pause Button.

RAIDEN

How do I save the mission data?

COLONEL

I've set aside a proprietary frequency for saves. And an analyst to work on the data too.

ROSE

Jack -- is everything all right?
Rose replaces the Colonel in the window.
She wears a beige suit with a light blue blouse. There are traces of makeup. Her being here, in this situation, doesn't feel quite real.

RAIDEN

What are you doing here!?

ROSE

Jack, can you hear me?

RAIDEN

Rose! You're not supposed to be involved!

RAIDEN

What's going on!?

ROSE

Jack, I'm a part of this mission.

RAIDEN

Colonel, what the hell is going on?

COLONEL

Raiden, meet the mission analyst. She'll be overseeing the data saving and support.

RAIDEN

Why her?

COLONEL

The FOXHOUND analyst that was supposed to take part in this mission was in an accident. Rosemary was brought in as a replacement.

RAIDEN

An accident...?

COLONEL

And according to the files, she knows you better than anybody else.

RAIDEN

Rose may be in the service, but an intelligence analyst is no field officer.

COLONEL

Not to worry. She has our technical staff at her disposal.

RAIDEN

She's never been a part of a field mission. This is insane.

COLONEL

I have my own reasons for selecting her for this mission, soldier.

RAIDEN

Colonel, I fail to see --

COLONEL

I know your VR training performance in and out. But sometimes that's not enough. You're familiar with the Shadow Moses incident?

RAIDEN

You know I covered it in VR.

COLONEL

If there's a crucial tactical detail that case taught us, it was the power of the operative's will to survive.

RAIDEN

I was trained to fight. My personal feelings have no place in a mission.

COLONEL

We've learned that it doesn't work that way. And on the field, you need all the help you can get.

ROSE

Jack? You're stuck with me whether you like it or not.

RAIDEN

Rose...

ROSE

You need someone to watch your back. But --

ROSE

*stubbornly* I have conditions that need to be met, Colonel.

COLONEL

What is it?

ROSE

I'll perform my duties and save that mission data.

ROSE

But I'm aware that technically, I'm not part of the mission control team.

ROSE

After all, I'm just a normal girl who's worried about Jack.

ROSE

But that means, Colonel, that I am not required to follow your orders outside of my immediate duties.

ROSE

Jack is not simply a field personnel for me to track.

ROSE

His safety comes first to me, not the mission.

ROSE

And because of that, I will be monitoring... and keeping a record of every communication you have with him, Colonel.

COLONEL

... Given the circumstances, you're free to do what you see fit.

ROSE

*speaking to Raiden* Hey, I prefer this to being kept in the dark, waiting.

COLONEL

I'd like to make a request, if I may.

ROSE

Of course.

COLONEL

His handle is Raiden. For the duration of the mission, could you call him that?

ROSE

Yes sir.

ROSE

All right -- Raiden. (It's a little hard for her to call him this.)

ROSE

Let me know when you're ready to turn in a save.

ROSE

*perfunctorily* The proprietary save frequency is 140.96.
The Codec frequency automatically switches to 140.96.

ROSE

*gently* I just switched frequencies.

ROSE

Jack? (Speaking quietly, but thinks that the Colonel can't hear them.)

RAIDEN

What?

ROSE

Do you know what day it is tomorrow?

RAIDEN

April 30th -- is there something special about it?

ROSE

Isn't there?

RAIDEN

I can't remember. I'm sorry.

ROSE

Oh well, I'll keep trying 'til I hear the answer.

ROSE

I'm going to let you go now, Jack. Take care.
Raiden's Elevator Ascent 1
3D Cutscene 1
((MC) - bottom of Strut A, Elevator)
Raiden slips past the guards and gets on the elevator.
Raiden enters the elevator, and the see-through cage comes to life. A sequence of cuts that mirror those from MGS1: a metal forest of girders and supports falls out of view at high speed. Roll main staff credits, again in a manner similar to MGS1. The briefing exchange with the Colonel runs over this sequence. Raiden sheds his diving gear; the mask obscuring his face comes off. A longish mane of hair tumbles out and hides his face again. The elevator clears the water and a stunning panorama comes into focus. Manhattan can be seen in the distance, over an expanse of shimmering water. The clear, sunlit day cannot offer a more radical contrast to the Tanker Chapter. Raiden tosses his head in an almost feminine gesture to swing his hair to the back. Slow-motion and using the hair physics simulation to its fullest. Behind him, seagulls wheel with unforced elegance. His somewhat androgynous features visible to the camera at last, Raiden raises his face, echoing Snake in the title scene of MGS1. The elevator comes to a halt at the top of the offshore plant. Display title ("MGS2").
Editor's Note: Title and credits are not shown for those who have already played the Tanker Chapter.
"METAL GEAR SOLID 2"
The name of the terrorist group is explained during this sequence.
"SONS OF LIBERTY"

COLONEL

The terrorists call themselves "Sons of Liberty."

RAIDEN

Sons of Liberty?

COLONEL

The name of their leader is Solid Snake.

RAIDEN

The hero of Shadow Moses!? So that's why you changed my code name.

COLONEL

Right. But it can't be THE Solid Snake. He died two years ago, on that tanker... after he blew it sky-high.

RAIDEN

Could he have survived?

COLONEL

Not a chance...
Display subtitles in sync with dialogue.
Raiden's voice effect ends at this point.
To Shell 1, Strut A upper section.
Raiden's Elevator Ascent 2
3D Cutscene 2
((MC) - Strut A Roof)
The elevator arrives at the roof of Strut A, startling a flock of birds perched on the fences into flight. The sky is momentarily darkened by a cloud of wheeling shapes. Raiden takes in the area.
Sunny, clear skies. The drone of the SEAL team's choppers can be heard, but they are nowhere in sight. There is no sign of the enemy on the roof either. Raiden walks over to the closest cover and crouches down to make a Codec call.
Raiden's Elevator Ascent 3
Codec Call 1
(mandatory outgoing call to the Colonel)

RAIDEN

Colonel, I'm on the roof. There are no sentries, but it would only take one to spot me in this light.

COLONEL

You never had daylight VR training, after all.

COLONEL

Stay extra sharp until you can find a node to log in from.

RAIDEN

What about the commandos?

COLONEL

SEAL Team 10 has landed on Struts B and C.

RAIDEN

And the President?

COLONEL

Seems he was spotted on Strut B.

RAIDEN

Strut B?
Raiden's Elevator Ascent 4
3D Cutscene 3
(NM Big Shell map)
The Big Shell's exterior (3D).

COLONEL

The Big Shell is comprised of Shells 1 and 2. Each unit consists of a central core and six struts surrounding it.

RAIDEN

So the whole thing is shaped like two hexagons connected end-on-end.

COLONEL

Exactly. And you're on the roof of Strut A, Shell 1 at the moment.
Raiden's Elevator Ascent 5
Codec Call 2
(mandatory incoming call from the Colonel)

COLONEL

First, get to a node. Log into the network.

RAIDEN

Got it.
Strut A Wire Fence 1
Codec Call 1
(mandatory incoming call from the Colonel)
A mandatory call from the Colonel after Raiden crawls through the wire fence on Strut A.

COLONEL

Raiden, SEAL Team 10 is in.

RAIDEN

Do we really have no line of communication with the SEALs?

COLONEL

They don't know a thing about us. You know we work in the dark, and this mission is no exception. Only a few people know about your presence here.

RAIDEN

...

COLONEL

There's no need for concern. This operation is under Pentagon's direct command, and the NSDD (National Security Decision Directives) came from the Vice President and the Secretary of Defense. Your mission may be top-secret, but it's gone through the usual channels.
Strut A In Front of Node 1
Codec Call 1
(mandatory outgoing call to the Colonel)
Raiden gets to the node, but enemy security is too tight. He raises the Colonel on the Codec.

RAIDEN

Colonel, I've located the node, but it's under heavy surveillance. I can't get in any closer.

COLONEL

Distract them. Try making some noise to draw their attention away.

RAIDEN

How?

COLONEL
