Flatten yourself against a wall and hit the Punch Button.

RAIDEN

Got it.
AB Connecting Bridge 1
Codec Call 1
(mandatory incoming call from the Colonel)
Raiden arrives at the bridge connecting Struts A and B. However, there are enemy sentries stationed in the middle of the bridge. The Colonel calls in at that moment.

COLONEL

Raiden, watch out. There are sentries posted on the connecting bridge. They will spot you if you continue on course.

RAIDEN

Any recommendations?

COLONEL

Use the Hanging mode.

RAIDEN

Hanging?
Video of the hanging action appears on the Codec screen, demonstrating the move.

COLONEL

Face any waist-high railing and push the Action Button to clear the railing and hang over the side. Once there, you can move sideways while keeping out of enemy sight.

RAIDEN

All right, I'm giving it a try.

COLONEL

Don't forget the Grip Gauge. It will keep decreasing during a Hanging maneuver, and once it runs out, you will fall.
The hanging action video disappears from the Codec screen.
-->To convergence point
Cypher Encounter 1
Codec Call 1
(mandatory incoming call from the Colonel)
Raiden encounters a Cypher (a disc-shaped unmanned aerial surveillance craft). The Colonel calls to warn him.

COLONEL

Raiden, watch your back! That's a Cypher, a type of UAV!
This Gun Cypher is a new model.

COLONEL

If it spots you, it will alert enemy personnel. Exercise extreme caution.

COLONEL

But you can use chaff to set up an interference field. That'll knock its sensors offline for a while. Try to locate some chaff.

COLONEL

You can also destroy the engine or the camera. Some of the UAVs may be armed -- be careful.
-->To convergence point
(Convergence Point)

RAIDEN

Copy that.
At this point, the Colonel intercepts new SEAL communications!

COLONEL

Wait a second, I just intercepted new intelligence on the operation being executed by SEAL Team 10.

RAIDEN

Intercepted?

COLONEL

As I said before, they need to be kept in the dark about our presence.

RAIDEN

So we just listen in...

COLONEL

I'm patching it through.
The SEALs' faces are not shown. Raiden and the Colonel remain on-screen.

SEAL α 0

This is Alpha Zero. We have the President.

COMMANDER

Is he safe?

SEAL α 0

He is safe.

COMMANDER

What about the package? (Code for the Black Case.)

SEAL α 0

Tell the guys upstairs that we've secured the package. Easy money.

COMMANDER

Good work. Your retrieval is on the way. Come on home...

SEAL α 0

H-holy!
Gunfire, then static!

COMMANDER

Alpha Zero! Report!!

SEAL α 0

Dammit! Cover the President!!

COMMANDER

Come in, Alpha Zero!

SEAL α 0

This is Alpha Zero. We are under attack!

SEAL α 0

This is crazy! Is that (Fortune)...!?

COMMANDER

Alpha Zero, respond!

SEAL α 0

...

COMMANDER

All Alpha, respond!
The line is dead.

COLONEL

Raiden, the President's life is in danger! Head to Strut B now!
Vamp Encounter 1
3D Cutscene 1
((MC) - BC Connecting Bridge Straight Corridor)
Raiden hurries toward Strut B after hearing the intercepted SEALs' communication.
He reaches the straight corridor that leads to the bridge connecting Struts B and C. To the right is the door to the transformer room, and the body of a Navy SEAL (Body 2) lies in front of it. The man has been slashed apart, and the walls and the floor are splattered with copious amounts of blood. A trail of blood indicates that the body was dragged. The scene is reminiscent of the "carnage corridor" from MGS1. A smell like that of iron hangs in the air.
Raiden moves down the corridor with caution (if he has a gun/M9 in possession, have him hold it).
Inside the transformer room.
A SEAL fires blindly (Body 3) about him, wild with terror. Every light fixture in the room has already been destroyed, and only daylight filtering in through narrow slits of a skylight gives a degree of visibility to the surroundings. Flashes of the M4 fire illuminate the room. Another SEAL (Body 4) shouts a running commentary as they vainly struggle against a seemingly invisible enemy.
A response from the SEAL command post crackles out of one of the men's radios.

COMMANDER

Alpha Zero, respond!
The corridor outside the transformer room.
The gunfire can be heard outside. Raiden approaches the door carefully.
Back inside the Strut B transformer room.
The shadowy figure of Vamp flits through the air mockingly, easily evading the SEAL team member's dancing fire! Vamp kicks and propels himself off of transformers, walls, and the ceiling with great speed and superhuman, gravity-defying agility. The flapping black (dark olive drab) coat gives his figure an appearance like that of a giant bat. The SEAL's bullets miss their target with stark consistency. His enemy lands on the ground, and with the grace and elegance of a ballet dancer, does a deadly pirouette that cuts the SEAL's arms into ribbons.
Vamp aims with lethal accuracy for the man's jugular. Blood spurts up to the ceiling! The M4 clatters to the floor. Vamp finishes up by slitting his throat. Sprays of blood cloud the shaft of sunlight, and the soldier's scream reverberates through the room. Vamp nimbly avoids the showers of blood while the Alpha Team member's lifeless body thuds to the floor.

COMMANDER

All Alpha, come in!

COMMANDER

What's going on? Alpha, respond!
There is nobody left to respond to the commander's call.
Back in the corridor outside the transformer room.
Raiden takes a deep breath in front of the door, then makes his way inside.
Inside transformer room.
The tight room is filled with smoke from all the gunfire, severely limiting visibility. Shafts of sun from the skylight give the place an oddly solemn, church-like air. On the floor is a scattering of shell casings from the SEALs' M4s, and the walls and transformers are pockmarked with bullet holes. The damage from the gunfire has shorted out the machines, and the whole scene suggests a vain struggle against some gigantic creature. Fresh blood coats the walls and the floor, and bodies that apparently belonged to Navy SEAL commandos until moments ago lie underfoot. The extensive blood loss—evident not just from vital areas but their arms and legs as well—and the general state of the room indicate a cause of death far worse than a common gunshot. It is a truly hellish scene, the work of a butcher.
At the far end of the room is an open locker (behind this door is one of the C4s). Two transformer units in the middle of the floor dominate the chamber. On either side of them are stairs leading down to the lower level.
Suddenly, a slurping sound breaks the silence.

VAMP

*sucks blood*
Raiden cautiously proceeds deeper into the room. He can see an area in the northeast corner of the room, on the lower level, that comes to a dead end. There, Vamp stands with his teeth in a SEAL's neck, drinking his blood. The man is already limp, held against the wall by his killer; because of Vamp's height, the hapless SEAL's feet jerk and twitch in mid-air. Sensing Raiden, Vamp bears his fangs (overdeveloped canines) at him in a snarl.

VAMP

*is menacing*

RAIDEN

!!
His breath is white, despite the room not being cold. The idea is that since Vamp came back from the dead at one point, he has an abnormally low body temperature. The pistol belt he wears over his coat gives him a silhouette, when both his arms are extended, resembling that of a Japanese giant flying squirrel. Raiden aims his gun (if he does not yet have one, he adopts a fighting stance). The nightmarish specter before him has Raiden unsettled and unsure; the surrealism of the situation has momentarily deprived him of decisiveness.
Vamp releases his hand. The SEAL crumples to the floor like a broken marionette.

RAIDEN

What are you? (Similar to when Snake met the Cyborg Ninja in MGS1.)
Vamp removes a large knife from a sheath positioned between his legs and cuts into his own bared chest, already scored with similar marks. Blood runs out of the newly-made wound.
Raiden looks on with bewilderment as the man leaves five cuts on his chest. There are other, older marks all over his arms and stomach. At a glance, the scars are almost tattoo-like.

VAMP

Five today...
He exhales mist every time he opens his mouth.

VAMP

Or rather, six?
Vamp completes the thought by making a superhuman leap (somersault). With a dancer's precision, he manages to get behind Raiden's back; he stands dazed, still shocked by the strange turn of events.

MAN (PLISKIN)

Get down!!
A man's voice rings out from the direction of the door (north)! Those who have played MGS1 should think that it's Liquid, as the man's appearance is similar to his.
Raiden hits the floor immediately, and several gunshots ring out. Visibility is momentarily reduced due to the gun smoke. Raiden raises his face and scans the room, but Vamp is nowhere to be seen. A man with an M4 cautiously enters the room. He wears a SEAL uniform, the sleeves rolled up to the elbows, and his features are covered with a balaclava save for the piercing eyes. On his head is a large pair of radio headphones (the kind squad leaders carry).

MAN (PLISKIN)

Where is he?
He demands an answer from Raiden, the latter still on the floor! As the masked man moves slowly forward, M4 aimed, his boots make unpleasantly sucking noises from the blood-covered floor. Cut to a low-angle shot of Vamp clinging to the ceiling. He drops down without a sound, knife flashing like a slithering snake over the SEAL's arm! Blood spurts out from multiple wounds on the man's limb, and the gun (M4) clatters to the floor as its owner falls to his knees.

MAN (PLISKIN)

Agh!
He crawls across the floor, nursing the arm, but Vamp lifts him up by the neck with one hand. The monster shoves its prey against the wall easily, and studies him with detached curiosity.
Raiden aims his weapon, but cannot get a clear shot with the SEAL in the way. If Raiden doesn't have a weapon, he picks up the other man's M4!
Vamp is about to bite into the man's neck when suddenly, he starts sniffing.

MAN (PLISKIN)

Urgh...!

VAMP

Hmmm? Strange smell...
White exhalation swirls across the captive's face.
Vamp tilts his head down and peers at the man.

VAMP

*speechless* You smell like -- !
Vamp jerks away from the man like he has laid his hand on rotting flesh. The SEAL crumples to the floor.
Vamp knows Solidus' scent, and knows equally that this cannot be Solidus. Therefore...

VAMP

Are you -- it has to be! (He recognizes him as Dead Cell's sworn enemy.)
The freed captive rolls across the floor. He manages a cry.

MAN (PLISKIN)

Shoot him! What are you waiting for?

RAIDEN

!
Roused, Raiden pulls the trigger. Vamp launches into a pirouette again. For some reason, Raiden cannot draw blood from him, even after firing an entire magazine at him. Raiden ejects the spent magazine.
A message from Fortune crackles into Vamp's radio (inside his ear), and he comes to a halt. A woman's voice can be faintly heard from the earpiece.

FORTUNE

Vamp --

VAMP

Yeah, Queen.

FORTUNE

Are you all done cleaning up?

VAMP

Yes. But wait till I tell you what I found... (He is going to share that he discovered Snake.)

FORTUNE

Something interesting?

VAMP

I'll tell you in person. Where are you?

FORTUNE

In the central unit, with the President.

VAMP

Be right there.
Raiden finishes reloading his weapon.
But Vamp has all of a sudden disappeared.
Raiden hears a strange cry from Vamp within the gun smoke!

VAMP

*strange cry* !!!
Raiden regains his composure and turns the gun on the wounded man.

MAN

Hold on, I'm not an enemy. Calm down.
Raiden's aim remains unwavering.

MAN

My name is S...
He (Pliskin) is about to state his name, then checks himself and searches for an appropriate false one.

MAN

My name is... Pliskin. Iroquois Pliskin. Lieutenant Junior Grade.
Raiden does not answer. The man pulls up his balaclava with one hand to reveal his face—one of a man in his 50s. His face is stubbled, and there is no bandana in sight. His appearance is approximate to that of Liquid in MGS1.
Raiden continues to stare him down.

RAIDEN

Are you a Navy SEAL?
Pliskin does not answer.

PLISKIN

...

RAIDEN

How did you get in?

PLISKIN

Fast rope descent, from a Navy chopper.
He looks Raiden over carefully, his reply indifferent and distracted.
Sea lice previously seen at the infiltration pool come crawling out of Pliskin's gear.
Raiden stares at the bugs, his suspicions mounting.

RAIDEN

Have I seen you before?
Because of his resemblance to Snake/Solidus, Raiden finds Pliskin vaguely familiar.

PLISKIN

That suit (the Sneaking Suit) -- are you FOXHOUND?

RAIDEN

... That's right.
Raiden concedes reluctantly.

PLISKIN

FOXHOUND was disbanded. (Said affirmatively.)

RAIDEN

...?

PLISKIN

Where were you before FOXHOUND? Delta Force?
Vamp Encounter 2
Movie Cutscene 1
(Force XXI)
Real footage, training exercise footage of Force XXI (high-tech unit), etc. + VR mission visuals...

RAIDEN

I was a part of the Army's Force XXI trials...

PLISKIN

Force XXI? That's about tactical IT deployment, right?

PLISKIN

Any field experience?

RAIDEN

No -- not really. (A lie.)

PLISKIN

So this is your first.

RAIDEN

I've had extensive training -- the kind that's indistinguishable from the real thing.

PLISKIN

Like what?
VR training visuals (from MGS1)... Snake as the protagonist.

RAIDEN

Sneaking mission 60, Weapons 80, Advanced --

PLISKIN

VR, huh. (Said with disappointment.)

RAIDEN

But realistic in every way. (Offended.)

PLISKIN

A virtual grunt of the digital age. That's just great.

RAIDEN

That's far more effective than live exercises.

PLISKIN

You don't get injured in VR, do you? Every year, a few soldiers die in field exercises.

RAIDEN

*defends himself* There's pain sensation in VR, and even a sense of reality and urgency. The only difference is that it isn't actually happening.

PLISKIN

That's the way they want you to think, to remove you from the fear that goes with battle situations.

PLISKIN

War as a video game -- what better way to raise the ultimate soldier?
Vamp Encounter 3
3D Cutscene 2
((MC) - Strut B Transformer Room)
Back on Raiden and Pliskin.
Raiden returns the M4 to Pliskin.

RAIDEN

So you're saying that VR training is some kind of mind control?
Raiden becomes somewhat aggressive; he feels his qualifications as a soldier have been belittled by Pliskin.
Then, the Colonel checks in on the Codec! Raiden takes the call, his back turned to Pliskin. Pliskin cannot hear the conversation since it is a silent exchange carried out through nanomachine communication.

COLONEL

Raiden? What's going on?

RAIDEN

The Alpha Team from Navy SEAL 10 is dead... no, a single survivor. (Remembering Pliskin.)
Pliskin realizes Raiden is using nanomachine communication, and mutters to himself.

PLISKIN

The kid's wired with nanomachines.
Vamp Encounter 4
Codec Call 1
(mandatory incoming call from the Colonel)

COLONEL

What about the President?

RAIDEN

Looks like they took him somewhere else...

COLONEL

I see... You said there was a survivor from SEAL Team 10?

RAIDEN

Yeah. Lieutenant J.G. Pliskin.

COLONEL

Has he seen your face?

RAIDEN

What?

COLONEL

This is a top-secret mission. No one can know that we're involved.

RAIDEN

It's a little too late for that.
Vamp Encounter 5
3D Cutscene 3
((MC+KF) - Strut B Transformer Room)
Raiden ends the call.
In the meantime, Pliskin has sorted out his gear and walked over to the node to the southwest. The arm wounds from Vamp's attacks have been bandaged.
Pliskin is looking at the body lying in front of the node. It is a Navy captain. Raiden walks up to Pliskin.

RAIDEN

What's up?

PLISKIN

Take a look.
Pliskin points to the dead captain's right wrist. A broken handcuff, the lock damaged, dangles from it as though whatever was on the other cuff has been removed. The Black Case (aka the football), containing launch codes for nuclear weapons, had in fact been tethered to the man, but Raiden does not realize this fact.

RAIDEN

What the hell...?

PLISKIN

*realizes what has happened to the Black Case* A Navy Captain...
Pliskin sits down on the stairs, dizzy and pale with blood loss.

PLISKIN

Aghh...

RAIDEN

You all right?

PLISKIN

Give me a few minutes. Must have lost a few more pints than I thought.
He takes out a cigarette, but cannot find his lighter.

RAIDEN

What was that man -- just now?

PLISKIN

That bloodsucking freak?

PLISKIN

*unfazed* That was Vamp...
Vamp Encounter 6
Movie Cutscene 2
(Dead Cell)
Vamp illustration (Shinkawa art).

PLISKIN

He's Romanian, a wizard with knives as you saw.

RAIDEN

The way he moved -- didn't seem human.

PLISKIN

You won't see that in VR, I guarantee.

RAIDEN

What is he?

PLISKIN

One of the members of Dead Cell.

RAIDEN

Dead Cell... Him?
Group illustration (Shinkawa art) of all Dead Cell members: Fortune, Vamp, Fatman, Solidus.

PLISKIN

A special forces unit created by Ex-President George Sears.
Dead Cell member introductions (Silhouettes/Shinkawa art).

PLISKIN

The name was originally intended to reflect its anti-terrorist functions. The unit would launch unannounced assaults on government complexes, for the ultimate terrorism simulation. They were needed to show VR troopers like you how to deal with the real thing.

PLISKIN

But around the time their original leader (Fortune's husband) died in prison, the unit began to unravel.

PLISKIN

They were always close to the edge, but they became more and more extreme. Began to go after U.S. allies, even civilians. We estimate that no fewer than a hundred people died as a result of "accidents" the Dead Cell arranged on their own. They were out of control -- and it all came to a head six months ago.

RAIDEN

What happened?
Pliskin does not answer.
Images of Dead Cell members stumbling about on a battlefield, on the verge of death. Vamp carries a wounded person in his arms. Chinaman and Oldman die.

PLISKIN

The unit was devastated. There are only three left now -- and you just saw one of them.

RAIDEN

Why would they go after the Big Shell?

PLISKIN

How should I know? I told you they were on the lunatic fringe.

RAIDEN

What about the leader? He says he's Solid Snake?
Pliskin reacts to the name "Snake." His voice suddenly becomes formal, as though preparing for a speech.

PLISKIN

Snake died two years ago.
Vamp Encounter 7
Movie Cutscene 3
(Tanker Chapter)
Roll footage from the Tanker Chapter as a movie cutscene.
This occurs even for those who haven't played the Tanker Chapter. Show cutscene footage from the end of the chapter. Everything is structured to make Snake look like the perpetrator.

RAIDEN

You mean the incident that made this Big Shell necessary in the first place.

PLISKIN

Right. And he was the one that sank that tanker.

RAIDEN

But he's a legend --

PLISKIN

Legends are usually bad news. There's not a lot of difference between heroes and madmen...

RAIDEN

You're saying Snake is still alive and pulled another one?

PLISKIN

No, he's not involved in this one. His body was positively ID'd two years ago.

RAIDEN

Snake is dead...

PLISKIN

And buried.
Raiden broods over this revelation. He's somewhat dejected. He idolizes Snake, and had wanted to meet the legend in person someday.
Vamp Encounter 8
Movie Cutscene 4
(Enemy Soldiers)
Shot of enemy soldiers (game screens shown as movie footage).
Shots of enemy personnel on the plant. Gurlukovich mercenaries guarding a bridge. A squad of soldiers in high-tech gear pulling out of an area. Shots of guards at infiltration pool, Strut A, the AB Connecting Bridge, and assault teams (even if Raiden has not yet been spotted). Show the Cypher and other details as well.

RAIDEN

What about the other soldiers?

RAIDEN

I saw Russian equipment too.

PLISKIN

Former Soviet military. They're probably mercenaries.
Insert long shot of the plant (game footage).

PLISKIN

The Big Shell is too much ground for just Dead Cell members to hold down.

PLISKIN

You weren't briefed on any of this? ...And you came in alone to boot?

RAIDEN

... (He can't explain.)

PLISKIN

What are you really doing here?
Vamp Encounter 9
3D Cutscene 4
((MC) - Strut B Transformer Room)
Raiden does not respond.

PLISKIN

Can't tell me, huh? Fine with me...
Pliskin offers Raiden a pack of cigarettes.

RAIDEN

I don't smoke.

PLISKIN

Keep it anyway. May come in handy.
Raiden tucks the cigarettes away. Cigarettes are added to the player's inventory.

PLISKIN

Take this too.
Raiden takes the SOCOM. It is added to the player's inventory.
*Only if player has the Shaver
From out of nowhere, Raiden gives Pliskin the Shaver in return.

RAIDEN

Here. Have this.
Pliskin takes the Shaver. It disappears from the player's inventory.
The radio suddenly crackles to life.

SEAL B 0

Come in Alpha Zero! This is Bravo Zero, currently at the bridge between Struts B and C. The President is --
The voice is coming from a dead SEAL member's radio. Close-up of the radio.

SEAL B 0

Damn! I can't hit this thing! It's like some bad dream --
Pliskin shows no inclination to respond to the call.

SEAL B 0

Alpha! Anyone! Come in, all Alpha! This is Bravo Zero!

RAIDEN

Aren't you going to answer him!?
Pliskin slowly reaches for the radio, as though buying himself some time.

SEAL B 0

Aaaah!!!
Sound of static after an agonizing scream.

PLISKIN

The BC connecting bridge.

RAIDEN

We need to get there. Can you handle it?

PLISKIN

I need a few more minutes.
Pliskin is pretending to be worse off than he is. He intends to go separate ways from Raiden, then observe him to ascertain whether he is friend or foe. Explanation to come later (standard Codec).

PLISKIN

Remember my frequency -- it's 141.80.
Pliskin twists around to show the large radio on his left shoulder.

RAIDEN

141.80. Got it.

PLISKIN

I've been briefed on this plant's layout. If you need information on the place or about Dead Cell, contact me.

PLISKIN

You're using nano communication, right?

RAIDEN

Yeah. But I can patch into your frequency.
Vamp Encounter 10
3D Cutscene 5
((MC) - Strut B Transformer Room)
Raiden starts up the stairs. Pliskin, sitting on the floor, calls up to him.

PLISKIN

Hey -- what's your name?
Raiden stops, then after a few moments spent wondering what to say, answers him.

RAIDEN

Raiden.

PLISKIN

Raiden? Strange code name.

RAIDEN

Makes up for the boring one my parents gave me.

PLISKIN

Maybe I'll find out someday.
Pliskin half-raises his hand in a "See ya" gesture.
BC Connecting Bridge
Codec Call 1
(mandatory incoming call from Rose)
Raiden, having left Pliskin, heads for the BC Connecting Bridge and the SEAL team. He is about to open the door to the bridge when a call comes in from Rose.

ROSE

Jack, it's me...

RAIDEN

Everything okay, Rose?

ROSE

Don't you need to save the mission data?

RAIDEN

Oh yeah -- thanks for the reminder.
A menu appears, and the player chooses.
The choices are: "SAVE" or "DO NOT SAVE".

ROSE

Jack, do you remember what day tomorrow is?

RAIDEN

*mutters* That again...

RAIDEN

I'm sorry, but I still don't have a clue.

ROSE

*disappointedly* That's okay.

RAIDEN

What is it, Rose? Talk to me.

ROSE

I'd rather you figure it out. It's important.

RAIDEN

How important?

ROSE

Important enough. And we'll talk about it, tomorrow.

RAIDEN

Why not now?

ROSE

Tomorrow seems more -- appropriate. I need all the help I can get so that I won't chicken out anyway. (She's going to tell him that she's a spy and that she's pregnant.)

RAIDEN

Is that the reason you decided to be part of this mission?

ROSE

... (Basically hit the mark.)

RAIDEN

OK... I'm going to finish this thing by tomorrow, no matter what.

ROSE

You know I'll do everything I can to help you.

RAIDEN

*changing the atmosphere* Rose, there's something I need you to do as an analyst.

ROSE

What is it?

RAIDEN

It has to do with Solid Snake. The leader of this takeover incident is claiming that he's Snake himself.

ROSE

The legendary mercenary? Hm.

RAIDEN

I need as much data on him as possible. Everything they have on him after the Shadow Moses incident.

ROSE

He's dead now, isn't he?

RAIDEN

Yes. Should be a burial record somewhere too.

RAIDEN

You should be able to request top-level security clearance from the Colonel. That should get us into the most classified material.

ROSE

I'm on it.

ROSE

I'll contact you as soon as I find out something.
Fortune Encounter 1
3D Cutscene 1
((MC) - BC Connecting Bridge)
Raiden arrives at the connecting bridge between Struts B and C, only to find SEAL 10 Bravo Team engaged in a firefight.
The SEALs are firing continuously from the BC Connecting Bridge proper to a target positioned on the part of the bridge running to the central area. The weapons in use here are SOCOMs or M9s.
Raiden pulls out his gun and moves forward on full alert. As he passes the large column that was blocking his view, an incredible sight greets his eyes.
The adversary is a queenly, slender Black woman, carrying a linear rifle almost equal in length to her own height. Around her shoulders is draped a black leather coat; the hem flutters lazily in the sea breeze. A sidearm (M9) rests on her hip, and at her feet are the President (unconscious) and the Black Case. She seems to have no interest whatsoever in engaging the soldiers.
The SEAL team fires on the woman, but the bullets fail to find their target. The woman carries with her a visible aura like a pale fire (actually an electromagnetic pulse). The bullets curve away from Fortune as they close in. Raiden (prone) watches the whole scene unfold from the shadows.

RAIDEN

What the hell is that?
A flock of seagulls clusters around the woman, reinforcing the illusion of peace and normalcy—like a park in the early afternoon.

FORTUNE

Come, put me out of my misery!

SEALS 0

This is impossible! Nothing will hit her!

SEALS 1

Is she the one they call Fortune?
Vamp emerges from the central area.
He picks up the President like a rag doll and slings him over his shoulder. He grabs the Black Case as well.

VAMP

Queen.
Fortune gives a slight nod.
Vamp walks off, with a kind of effortlessness despite the man he is carrying over his shoulder, into the central area.

SEALS 1

Don't let them take the President!
Three backup members of Alpha Team (SEALs) come running out of Strut C. They look at Raiden for a moment, then continue onto the BC Connecting Bridge.
Two of the Bravo men clatter down the stairway to the central area, toward the woman.

SEALS 0

Ready grenades!
He fires a grenade from the launcher attached to his M4.
It flies straight at the target, but comes to a halt in mid-air right in front of the woman, then drops to the ground. It fails to detonate.

SEALS 3

A dud!?
The SEALs in the rear move in closer! The woman wearily raises her face, as though surrendering to an inevitable inconvenience.

FORTUNE

Today is another bad day...
She swings the body-length linear rifle up to her hip.
The seabirds about her scatter into the air. The ocean breeze lifts her long, tightly curled hair, and the SEALs' terror-stricken visages bounce off the twin mirrors of her sunglasses.

FORTUNE

Is there anyone here that can give me happiness?

SEALS 0

!
The woman pulls the trigger. With every whine of the linear rifle, members of Bravo Team are blasted through the air.

SEALS 0-3

*screams* !
The linear rifle fires with a shattering sonic boom. There are no cartridges to be ejected since the ammunition is caseless. Fortune continues to pull the trigger, until this upper area of the Shell resembles a crash scene. The stair area where Bravo Team made its final stand has been obliterated by the rifle fire (the rounds cut through metal with ease), and the bridge is tilted from the stress. A few wires that had connected Struts B and C sway in mid-air, sheared off in the middle. The men who were bringing up the rear slide uncontrollably down the destroyed bridge to their death.

SEALS 0-3

*shouts* !
The bridge breaks off a few inches from where the woman stands, cutting Raiden off from the central area. Not a single body remains in sight. The seabirds continue to fly about over Fortune.

FORTUNE

I'm so sorry, my beauties... I'll see you again someday. (She's apologizing about the birds.)
Fortune turns and walks away. (The battle is over.)
Death comes for the birds at the same moment, and their bodies begin a long drop toward the water.
Fortune continues her progress down what remains of the walkway to the central area.
Raiden, still watching Fortune depart, kneels and contacts the Colonel.
Fortune Encounter 2
Codec Call 1
(mandatory outgoing call to the Colonel)

RAIDEN

Colonel, SEAL Team 10's Bravo Team was wiped out.

COLONEL

*not undisappointed* I see.

RAIDEN

What happened to the cargo choppers?

COLONEL

Both of them are at the bottom of the harbor. Looks like your new hosts have a Harrier 2.

RAIDEN

A Harrier? What is this?

COLONEL

Calm down. It just means they anticipated the attack.

RAIDEN

What?

COLONEL

Besides, since the SEALs drew their fire, your infiltration went off without a hitch. On top of that, we know their defensive capabilities.

RAIDEN

Are you saying this was all a feint?

COLONEL

Raiden, get a hold of yourself. The entire mission is in your hands now, do you understand?

RAIDEN

But...

COLONEL

There's no time for questions. They could decide to retaliate for that failed assault.

RAIDEN

You mean the hostages?

COLONEL

They could be in danger, yes. But we need to consider the possibility that they'll blow the whole Shell. If that toxic spill does take place, it'll devastate not only the harbor, but poison the coastline for generations.

RAIDEN

...

COLONEL

Raiden, we've had to adjust the mission objectives. The priority is now on removing those C4s that the terrorists wired over the Big Shell. The President can wait, but this can't.

RAIDEN

Colonel, you know I'm no bomb disposal expert.

COLONEL

That's not a problem -- the Bravo Team brought an explosives pro in with them. He was supposed to stand by on Strut C according to their mission plan. You should find him there.

RAIDEN

Is this according to simulation too...?

COLONEL

What are you talking about? Get to Strut C and find him!

RAIDEN

Understood... But I need to ask you something before I go.

COLONEL

Make it quick.

RAIDEN

Who are they -- Dead Cell, I mean?

RAIDEN

*mutters* They couldn't hit her, no matter how hard they tried...

RAIDEN

And that vampire too. It's-- it's like... (He's at a loss for words.)

RAIDEN

It's like being in a nightmare you can't wake up from.

ROSE

Jack, snap out of it!

RAIDEN

And you Rose -- I can't believe you're on this mission. I keep thinking I'll wake up...

COLONEL

Raiden, this is real. And that's why you won't wake up.

RAIDEN

But nothing seems real.

ROSE

I've made up my mind to stay with you. Whether this is real or a bad dream, I'll keep watching you, till it's over.

RAIDEN

Thank you, Rose. And I won't let you be just a dream... (Foreshadowing.)

COLONEL

Are you two done? Raiden, you're needed on Strut C.
Peter Encounter 1
3D Cutscene 1
((MC) - Strut C Living Quarters, Kitchen)
Raiden infiltrates Strut C in search of the bomb disposal instructor. Strut C serves as living quarters for Shell personnel, and contains the cafeteria, the kitchen, etc. There are no signs of the enemy.
As Raiden enters the kitchen, he hears something. He continues on cautiously and discovers a man at work in front of the long counter. An array of tools and equipment lines the countertop. The person, a well-built Black man in his late 50s (only his upper body is visible), is so wrapped up in his work that he does not notice Raiden's arrival. He is wearing a leather jacket with "NYPD Bomb Squad" emblazoned on the back (Raiden cannot yet see this). His head is a smooth egg-shape, completely devoid of hair. To Raiden, he looks like a bomber at work.

RAIDEN

Freeze!
Raiden aims his gun (SOCOM). Peter jumps at the intrusion.
Peter raises both his hands. There are pliers (which look like a weapon) in one hand.
The lettering on his jacket is now visible to Raiden, who weighs its implication.

RAIDEN

You a cop?

PETER

I'm not NYPD. I came in with the Bravo Team.
Raiden's nerves are not in the best shape thanks to his encounters with the vampire and Fortune. He keeps his finger on the trigger and the gun pointed at the man. Raiden remembers what happened to Alpha Team. The man fires a barrage of questions at Raiden.

PETER

Who are you with? And what happened to SEAL Team 10?

RAIDEN

They're all dead...

PETER

All of them!? That's bad...
The man mutters, unnerved.
Peter rises slowly. He sinks into thought, and inadvertently lowers his hand. Raiden immediately goes into high alert (isosceles stance) and points his weapon at Peter.

RAIDEN

Did I tell you you could move?
At that moment, a noise sounds from the double swinging doors on the cafeteria side.

PLISKIN

It's all right. He's not one of the bad guys.
Raiden swings the barrel toward the voice. Pliskin enters from the cafeteria side, an M4 slung over one shoulder. He has more color in his face than he did before.

PLISKIN

Don't go pointing that thing everywhere, kid.
Raiden, recognizing Pliskin, lowers his gun. Pliskin walks up to Peter. He appears completely at ease.

PLISKIN

What's your name?

PETER

My name is Peter.
Pliskin digs into his memory for facts about Peter.

PLISKIN

Lecturer at NAVSCOLEOD Indian Head ... Also a consultant for the NYPD3 bomb squad.
Peter's face darkens (because Pliskin has heard of him, and also for having his past accomplishments enumerated in this way).

PETER

A poor old man who got dragged along for this picnic.
Peter gets up and walks over. His right leg is disabled, and he limps heavily.

PLISKIN

I thought you'd retired.

PETER

I did. Can't keep up with everybody, as you can see.
His right leg is a prosthesis. In his right hand is a cane.

PETER

A famous church got wiped off the map thanks to me. With too many lives inside. All I lost was this leg.
Raiden does not understand much of the conversation. What he can follow is that this is the explosives expert that came in with Bravo Team.

RAIDEN

So you're the bomb disposal guy?
Peter Encounter 2
Movie Cutscene 1
(Peter)

PLISKIN

Kid, this is THE bomb disposal guy. Open any explosives disposal textbook and you'll see his name.

RAIDEN

...
Raiden is put off at being treated like a rookie by Pliskin. Peter, sensing his chagrin, speaks up.

PETER

Heh, just ancient history now.

RAIDEN

Why did they bring you out of retirement then?

PETER

Because the terrorist group here includes one of my students.
Fatman illustration (Shinkawa art).

PETER

The Emperor of Explosives -- Fatman. He built an atomic bomb when he was only ten. I created him in a sense.

PLISKIN

And that's why you're here...

PETER

I'm pretty rusty. I was supposed to supervise the bomb disposal -- looks like it was taken care of before I had my turn.

PLISKIN

I wouldn't say that.
Peter Encounter 3
3D Cutscene 2
((MC) - Strut C Living Quarters, Kitchen)
Pliskin looks toward Raiden.

PLISKIN

There are at least two people here who can claim to be experts at bomb disposal.
Raiden looks back at Pliskin, then glares at him as the implication sinks in.

RAIDEN

?
Peter studies the two of them.

PETER

Are you two with SEAL Team 10? I didn't see you at the mission briefing.

PLISKIN

*lies* Oh, we're with another squad.
He tries to change the subject.

PLISKIN

My name is Pliskin, Lieutenant Junior Grade. Honored to meet you, sir.
Pliskin holds out his hand, but Peter ignores it.

PETER

Mr. Pliskin, do you have any experience with explosives disposal?
Peter inquires earnestly.

PLISKIN

Don't worry about me. And he looks young, but he can do it. But we need more manpower.

RAIDEN

*halfheartedly* I'm ah --

PETER

What's your name?

RAIDEN

Raiden.

PETER

That's an odd name.
Raiden looks away, then asks a question.

RAIDEN

Any other survivors?

PETER

There was also an engineer with me.

RAIDEN

An engineer?
Peter Encounter 4
Movie Cutscene 2
(Otacon)
Illustration visuals.
Illustration of Otacon, depicting when Peter met him on the helicopter.
Visuals of the descent, etc.

PETER

A skinny guy. He went in with us... (Talking about Otacon.)

RAIDEN

Where is he?

PETER

I haven't seen him since that skirmish.

RAIDEN

Was he killed?

PETER

I don't think so. I didn't find his body.

PLISKIN

*murmurs to himself, smiling internally* I see... (He's glad that Otacon is apparently safe.)
Otacon on the chopper (silhouette).

PETER

They told me he was the security systems architect for the Big Shell.

RAIDEN

Why would they take a civilian along?

PETER

Everything in this structure is computer-controlled. He was supposed to get us past all the security measures.

RAIDEN

I never heard anything about that.

PETER

He had official orders with him.

RAIDEN

... (He's suspicious.)

PLISKIN

*changes the subject* We'll leave that for later. Right now, we need to figure out how to deal with all the bombs.

RAIDEN

But there's no one left... from the SEAL's EOD (Explosive Ordnance Disposal) squad.

PLISKIN

Yep. So we have to do it ourselves.

RAIDEN

*weakly* But I've never defused a bomb before...
The Codec call sound interrupts Raiden mid-sentence.

RAIDEN

Hold on a sec.

PLISKIN

Off to confer with the CO again?
Peter Encounter 5
Codec Call 1
(mandatory incoming call from the Colonel)

COLONEL

Glad to hear Stillman is safe. Assist him in any way possible to clear the C4 from the structure.

RAIDEN

Colonel, you know I've never been trained in bomb disposal.

COLONEL

It's all right. The man you're working with is the best in the field. All you have to do is follow his directions.

COLONEL

You will of course keep your identity and mission objectives to yourself.

RAIDEN

Is it true that an engineer came in with Stillman?

COLONEL

I wasn't informed of that. It's probably something the SEALs decided on their own.

RAIDEN

...

COLONEL

There are more important issues at hand, Raiden. The enemy may retaliate for the failed assault. Get those C4s neutralized now.

RAIDEN

*weakly* Colonel, I'm not qualified for bomb disposal.
Rose cuts in.

ROSE

Jack, it's me.

RAIDEN

Rose?

ROSE

You can do this. Trust me.

COLONEL

You haven't had bomb disposal training per se in VR, but you're more than capable of handling C4.

RAIDEN

... This is a little different from using C4.

ROSE

You're up for this. You know that.

PLISKIN

How about it, kid? Are the results in yet?
Pliskin interrupts the Codec call.
Peter Encounter 6
Interactive First Person Cutscene 1
(Strut C Living Quarters, Kitchen)
Raiden looks at the tabletop (First Person View). The player can pan the camera up, down, left, and right, but they cannot move. The lines below are spoken while the player is free to move the camera. Pliskin is next to Raiden but situated behind him, so he does not fall into his field of vision.

PETER

There's no need to think about this so much.

PETER

You won't actually be dismantling the bomb. That's not for amateurs. What we'll try here instead is a temporary freezing measure.

PETER

Here, look at this --
Peter's demonstration.

PETER

This is a C4 bomb...
He flips the switch and the diode attached to the C4 lights up green.

PETER

It's live. You can see it pulsing.
The flickering rhythm of the green light does resemble a pulse. Peter takes out a coolant spray.

PETER

Now you spray this on the sucker and...
Peter sprays the contents on the C4. The C4 is frozen, and the disposal is complete. The green indicator dies. A close or wide shot of the bomb.

PETER

... there we go. Simple, huh? The spray freezes the detonator instantly.

RAIDEN

How long does the effect last?

PETER

There's no way the thing can detonate in this condition. Even if you leave it alone, it'll stay out of commission for at least 24 hours.

PLISKIN

That's enough time.

PETER

If we had the manpower, I'd recommend complete disposal. But this will have to do. The spray can be used from several yards away. Now, check the floor, ceiling, walls, under a table -- everywhere. Try to imagine the locations the bomber would choose.

PLISKIN

That won't be easy. We don't know a thing about Fatman.

RAIDEN

Is there anything that'll help us locate the bombs?

PETER

Here, take this with you.
Peter takes out Bomb Disposal Sensor A and holds it up for Raiden and Pliskin.

PETER

It's what they call an Ion Mobility Spectrometer. It can recognize ionized gas emitted by C4s.
Close-up of Sensor A.

RAIDEN

... The what?

PLISKIN

In other words, that little gadget sniffs out C4's scent. (Summarizing because it's clear Raiden doesn't understand.)

PETER

That's right. I've established a linkup with your radar network, so any scent detected will be represented visually. Have the sensor activated and keep your eye on the radar.

RAIDEN

*worried* What if he's using some other, odorless substance?
Peter Encounter 7
Movie Cutscene 3
(Fatman)
Illustration of Fatman, from when he was at Indian Head.
Peter reminisces about Fatman, becoming nostalgic.

PETER

I know Fatman well. I know how into his own aesthetics he is.

PLISKIN

Signatures?

PETER

Yes. On every bomb he builds, he always leaves a trace of the cologne he uses. The sensor also picks up that particular scent spectrum.

PLISKIN

Is that something he learned from you?

PETER

No, it was his own quirk. He wouldn't work by any rules except his own, and he followed them like a religion. And common sense wasn't one of his strong points.

PETER

I thought I taught him everything I knew...

PETER

I have no children of my own, and I... thought I found a son in him.

PETER

He had the right stuff, you know.

PETER

There's something very unusual about an ability like that.

PETER

Even at Indian Head, he got special treatment.

PETER

I remember some people called him one of the "fat cats."

PETER

Maybe that's what started all this.

PETER

I didn't teach him the most important thing I had to tell him.

PLISKIN

There are some things you have to pass on. The trick is to know which one.

PETER

Right... All I taught him were skills.

PETER

And now I have to stop him from using it to destroy us all.
Peter Encounter 9
Game Screen Sequence 1
(Strut C Living Quarters, Kitchen)
Game overhead screen sequence (top-down view).
CinemaScope aspect ratio (letterboxed). The Soliton Radar appears on-screen. On the radar is a map of the kitchen (wireframe), along with bright dots representing Pliskin, Raiden, and Peter. When Peter throws the switch, the result is immediately apparent. A green, mist-like representation covers the entire area of the women's restroom partially visible to the south of the kitchen section. The radar does not show the whole of the women's room; only its southern half. Even if the player has the radar switched off, it will appear on-screen for this sequence.

PLISKIN

Let's see how well that sensor works.

PETER

All right...

PETER

I'm activating them. Watch.

PETER

You see the green stuff on the radar? That's a visual representation of the C4 scent detected by the sensor.

RAIDEN

It's a pretty big area, isn't it?

PLISKIN

Don't complain. It's better than nothing. (Not really encouraging.)

PETER

*a little hurt* Just activate the sensors and search the area, okay?

RAIDEN

All right.

PETER

Don't forget that you need the radar to use this system.

PETER

Log into the node at every strut and turn the radar on.

PLISKIN

We have to keep out of the enemy's sight too.

RAIDEN

Because the radar gets knocked offline when we're spotted?

PETER

Exactly.

PETER

Fatman would have allotted some C4s here in Strut C as well.

RAIDEN

Here?
Peter Encounter 10
3D Cutscene 3
(NM Plant wide shot)
An aerial shot of the Big Shell. Bird's-eye view, wide shot. Full exterior shots of Shells 1 and 2. Brilliance of the ocean surface. Show both the complete structures as well as details (Shell struts, connecting bridges, wires, etc.). Also use illustration of the entire map screen.

PETER

I know the structure of this facility.

PETER

And, if he wants to take out the plant, where he would target...

PLISKIN

You know this for sure?

PETER

I taught him the techniques he uses. His ideas are based on my theories. Demolition is a kind of ideology; it makes no exceptions for time or place.

PETER

Big Shell consists of two hexagons joined end-on-end, north to south. There should be packets of C4s on each of the vertices, or the struts in this case. You need at least that to take a building of this integrity out.

PLISKIN

Six on Shell 1, another six on Shell 2 ...a total of twelve bombs, at least?

PETER

Considering the Shell's architecture and composition from an engineering standpoint -- that's my conclusion.

PETER

And it's exactly what he would have decided as well.
Peter Encounter 11
3D Cutscene 4
((MC + KF) - Strut C Living Quarters, Kitchen)
Back in the kitchen. Both Raiden and Pliskin have their sensors and spray containers.
Player acquires Coolant Spray and Sensor A.

PLISKIN

Kid, this place is all yours. I'll take care of Shell 2.

PETER

Take this.
He hands a Level 3 card to Pliskin, and a Level 1 card to Raiden.
Pliskin and Raiden take the cards.

RAIDEN

What's this?

PETER

Security card issued to Shell personnel.
Peter Encounter 12
3D Cutscene 5
(NM Door Explanation)
3D cutscene (door visual).
A look at a card-locked door (warehouse/Level 2).

PETER

The Big Shell's security layout includes varying levels of clearance.

PETER

The clearance level is identified by the number printed on these doors.

PETER

Raiden, your card key can open doors with security clearance Level 1.

PETER

Pliskin, your card can get you into Level 3 areas.

PETER

You'll need it to get next door to Shell 2.
The door (control room) leading to the passageway to Shell 2.

RAIDEN

How did you get this?

PETER

That engineer (Otacon) I told you about gave it to me.

PETER

He was supposed to program a set of all-access cards once we were on-site.

PETER

Unfortunately, this card won't get you into every area of this structure.
Peter Encounter 13
3D Cutscene 6
((MC + KF) - Strut C Living Quarters, Kitchen)
The cutscene returns to the kitchen. Pliskin quickly puts away his card.

PLISKIN

We'll have to deal with the remaining security lockouts as they come up.

PLISKIN

Let's get going.
Peter, assuming he is going with them, starts to move out. Pliskin stops him.

PLISKIN

You stay here.

PETER

No, I'm going.

PLISKIN

The two of us can handle it, don't worry.

PETER

But --

PLISKIN

You'll just slow us down with that leg of yours. (Being intentionally cold to cause discomfort.)

PETER

... (Can't admit that his leg is fine.)

PLISKIN

There's a war going on here. I don't have time to babysit anymore.
Peter looks down, and Pliskin continues to stare at him coldly. A beat of silence.

RAIDEN

*trying to mediate* Why don't you let us handle the grunt work? You can tell us what to do over the radio, like in the original mission plan.

PLISKIN

*laughs at Raiden's predictable reaction* ...

PETER

All right.
Peter sits down heavily.

PETER

I'll give you instructions from here. I may also need to prepare a backup plan just in case... (Referring to preparing Sensor B.)

RAIDEN

In case of what?
Peter pointedly ignores Raiden's query.

PETER

Good luck to both of you. This is a dangerous one.

PLISKIN

"Who Dares, Wins." (The motto of the S.A.S.)
Peter registers Pliskin's words with some suspicion.

PETER

If anything comes up, let me know. My frequency is 140.25.

PLISKIN

Good luck, kid. I'll see you later.
He pats Raiden on the back.

PLISKIN

"Semper fi."
He utters the motto of the United States Marine Corps (Gung ho, semper fi; i.e., Let's fight, always faithful) then leaves the kitchen. Peter watches Pliskin as he walks out of earshot.

PETER

That man's no SEAL. I don't even think he's a Navy man.

RAIDEN

What?
He is taken aback by Peter's words.

PETER

Semper fi...

PETER

Marine Corps talk4.
Peter Encounter 14
Movie Cutscene 4
(Pliskin)
Visual of the assault team, then of Pliskin.
Visual of Pliskin (flashback).
Snake with his radio headphones on (flashback).

PETER

Normally, team leaders stay in the CP (Command Post) and give orders with those headphones. And as far as I know, SEALs keep their officers away from the field.

RAIDEN

...

PETER

And -- "Who Dares, Wins" is a motto of the British Special Air Service5

RAIDEN

Is he one of the terrorists then?

PETER

No, somehow I don't think so.

PETER

If there's someone to suspect, I'd put my money on you.
Peter Encounter 15
3D Cutscene 7
((MC + KF) - Strut C Living Quarters, Kitchen)
Peter stares at Raiden.

RAIDEN

I'm --
Peter laughs at Raiden's confusion.

PETER

Just take care of those bombs for now.
Raiden is concerned for Peter's safety.

RAIDEN

What about you? They could be back in this area soon.

PETER

I'll hide out in this pantry for a while.
Peter opens the door to the pantry, located behind them.

PETER

If I lock the door, it should be all right. Plenty of food in here too, so you won't need to worry about me. I'll give you instructions by Codec from here. Good luck -- kid.
Peter borrows Pliskin's use of "kid."

PETER

Bomb disposal is a face-off with your own mortality. Don't let the fear get to you.
He seems to be talking to himself.

PETER

When you give in to fear, the darkness comes...
Peter closes the door behind him and locks it.
Footnotes
1A special operations force of the U.S. Navy. Mainly tasked with infiltrating ahead of allied forces and performing reconnaissance as well as diversionary and other operations. Known for its highly skilled operators.
2A stable plastic explosive used by the United States Armed Forces. It is made by mixing a high-performance explosive with materials such as resin and wax.
3Acronym for the New York City Police Department.
4In the Japanese script, Stillman refers to Pliskin's "Semper fi..." comment as "jarhead talk"; jarhead is a nickname for members of the United States Marine Corps that comes from their trademark haircut—short on the sides, flat on top.
5Acronym for the U.K. military's Special Air Service, one of the most elite counter-terrorism units in the world.
Codec Conversations
•Colonel
Prior to Meeting Stillman
Deep sea dock - get on the elevator

COLONEL

Raiden, first get to the upper section of the Big Shell. Take the elevator in the north end of the area.

COLONEL

To get to the elevator area, go through the connecting passageway to the north. The passage is behind a watertight hatch. It should look like a door with a circular handle.
Near submersible

COLONEL

Raiden, over there is the submarine for deep-sea dives.

COLONEL

It is apparently used in repairing submerged areas of the Big Shell... and for studying deep-sea ecosystems and changes in water quality.

COLONEL

It can dive to depths of around 500m, at a maximum speed of roughly 3 knots.

COLONEL

In addition to its normal water-resistant lighting—it is also outfitted with lighting resistant to muddy water.

COLONEL

I doubt that you will get it to work, though.

COLONEL

That submarine is not operational. It doesn't pose any threat. Forget about it and return to your duties.
Diving suit

RAIDEN

Colonel, there's a JIM suit.

COLONEL

Hmm. Looks like a high barometric pressure diving suit. By maintaining barometric pressure within the suit, it should allow its wearer to carry out work at sea depths of as much as 300m.

COLONEL

But it doesn't look even remotely usable. It's a very old model.

RAIDEN

Yeah. And it's rusted all over. It doesn't even look like it's been used...
*Second and subsequent times

COLONEL

Raiden, that diving suit doesn't look like it works. Forget about it and return to your duties.
Sea lice

RAIDEN

Look at all these bugs! The seawater is polluted with crude oil and yet they can still survive...

COLONEL

It's an "altered" bug that can resolve crude oil.

RAIDEN

Altered?

COLONEL

Yes, through genetic engineering. It was created in the lab to combat frequent oil spills. It doesn't exist naturally.

COLONEL

The bug is genetically altered with DNA from a bacteria called Pseudomonas, which can decompose crude oil.

COLONEL

It has an enzyme in its body that can break up oil, and was modified so it instinctively consumes any crude oil that it absorbs.

COLONEL

One of the reasons the "Big Shell" has little oil pollution is because of this bug.

COLONEL

It also helps in reducing costs and the number of spill maintenance workers.

COLONEL

It's a form of bio-remediation. It's for the most part innocuous, so no need to be worried.

COLONEL

Those bugs have ravenous appetites. Be careful that they don't end up eating your rations.

COLONEL

Shake your equipment to protect the items from sea lice.
*If sea lice are eating the player's rations

COLONEL

Raiden, the sea lice are getting fat on your rations. Shake the equipment window to get rid of the bugs.
Wire fence door that won't open

COLONEL

Raiden, I don't think that door will open. Find another route to the other side.
Near duct

COLONEL

Look down near your feet. See that duct? Ducts can be crawled into.
-->Intrusion View (p. 206)
Near somewhere player can crawl into

COLONEL

You could probably get in down there if you crawl.

COLONEL

If you hide well, you can probably escape when being pursued by the enemy.
-->Intrusion View (p. 206)
Intrusion View
(1)

COLONEL

Whenever you crawl into a narrow space, the camera will automatically switch to Intrusion View.

COLONEL

Push the left analog stick up to move forward, down to move back. Push left and right to turn in those directions.

COLONEL

Keep an eye on the enemy and proceed under cover at all times. You absolutely cannot afford to be spotted.
(2)

COLONEL

Unlike in VR training, you can use your gun from Intrusion View in the field. Keep that in mind.
(3)

COLONEL

Intrusion View does not guarantee your safety. If you're spotted, you will be attacked.

COLONEL

Make sure you're not spotted sliding into Intrusion position.

COLONEL

A patrol could also start checking the spot where you're likely to be hiding in Intrusion View.

COLONEL

In that case, remain in Intrusion and keep moving to stay out of the enemy's sight.

COLONEL

The Intrusion View is no free lunch. Got that?
How to swim above water (incoming call after entering water)

COLONEL

Got your feet wet? These are the basic controls for swimming.
*If player is in water
(Movement)

COLONEL

When you're on the surface, you can swim in corresponding directions using the up, down, left and right movement of the left analog stick.

COLONEL

Push the Punch Button to dive down from the surface.
How to swim underwater

COLONEL

Stroke the water and move forward by pushing the Punch Button. Push it in rapid succession to swim faster.

COLONEL

Change your heading by moving the left analog stick. Up will take you up, down takes you lower, left and right to face those directions.

COLONEL

The O2 Gauge will appear under your Life Gauge while you're underwater. The gauge corresponds to the amount of air you can hold from a single deep breath.

COLONEL

Once the O2 Gauge falls to zero, the Life Gauge will start to drop. You need to be aware of that.
High-speed turns (right stick while underwater)

COLONEL

Use the right analog stick to make high-speed turns. Move it to the left or right to make 90-degree turns in those directions, and down to make a 180-degree spin.
Underwater - no weapons

COLONEL

A word of warning: weapons become useless when you're in water. Though I doubt you'll be encountering any enemies underwater...
Underwater - rationing air

COLONEL

When you start to feel the lack of air, hit the Action Button repeatedly. This will let you ration your air supply better and slow the decline of your O2 Gauge.
Skull Suit secret (underwater, about Skull Suit)

COLONEL

Raiden, that Skull Suit of yours is designed to minimize drag when you're underwater. Try feeling the suit's skin.

RAIDEN

Sort of sandpapery...

COLONEL

What you're feeling is a series of microscopic grooves. This water-repelling scale structure cancels out the force of the currents.

COLONEL

The suit cuts drag by a full 10%. You'll be swimming like a fish -- the technology is extrapolated from the structure of sharkskin.

COLONEL

The concavity of the skin surface is designed to cut down on air drag on dry land as well. Same idea as the surface of golf balls, but improved upon.

RAIDEN

Sounds good. I think I'm ready for the Olympics.
Near ladder

COLONEL

Raiden, do you see the ladder? Walk up to the ladder and push the Action Button to start climbing.
Urging the player along
*If the player has been in the Strut A Deep Sea Dock area for a while

COLONEL

Raiden, you should be used to the controls by now. Proceed with your mission -- the clock is ticking.

COLONEL

Get on the elevator on the far side of this area and get to the upper section of the Big Shell.
Near watertight hatch

COLONEL

Raiden, that door is watertight.
*If player has played Tanker Chapter

RAIDEN

Yeah, I know how to open it. We covered it in VR training.

COLONEL

True. Proceed with caution.
*If player hasn't played Tanker Chapter

COLONEL

Turn the handle to open the door.

COLONEL

Face the door and press down on the Action Button and the handle will turn.

COLONEL

Punch the Action Button repeatedly if you need to turn it faster.
Find the node

COLONEL

Before you head for the upper section of the Big Shell, log into the node.

COLONEL

The node is at the far end of that area, to the east of the elevator.
There's another intruder?
*Deep Sea Dock, after catching a glimpse of Snake

RAIDEN

Colonel, that figure just now...!

COLONEL

I don't know...

RAIDEN

Who do you think it was?

COLONEL

It wasn't a SEAL, that's for certain. Keep your eyes open.
Find the elevator

COLONEL

Raiden, the elevator is at the extreme north end. Take the elevator to the upper section of the Big Shell.
Explanation as to why the player can't use enemy weapons (Elevator Hall)
*Incoming call when near an enemy after taking them out

COLONEL

Raiden, you won't be able to use any of the enemy's equipment.

RAIDEN

Why not?

COLONEL

You should know that all active weapons are equipped with a personal identification system.

COLONEL

The owner enters the required user ID information during the weapon registration—or at the start of a mission.

COLONEL

If anyone other than the registered user tries to fire the weapon, the ID system will not authorize the action.

RAIDEN

But these are black-market Russian weapons. How can they be equipped with identification functionality?

COLONEL

They must have been customized by the terrorists themselves. These are professionals we're dealing with, and they certainly won't let their own equipment be used against them.

RAIDEN

I'm guessing it's the same for the Navy SEALs' gear.

COLONEL

Right.

RAIDEN

How am I supposed to procure weapons then?

COLONEL

Find the ones that haven't yet been individualized.

COLONEL

Everything you find in the Item Box is clean. You should know this from your VR training.

RAIDEN

OK, I know those.

COLONEL

Items in the Item Box are yours to use at will.

COLONEL

They will be your supply source with regards to weaponry and gear.
VR Mission Level One (foreshadowing)
*Near entrance. Only for those who have played Tanker Chapter

RAIDEN

Colonel, I remember this place...

COLONEL

Of course you do. This is Level One from the VR missions.

RAIDEN

You're right -- I see it now.

COLONEL

You may not have field experience, but you've been trained in the hyperreality of simulated combat.

COLONEL

Don't give into fear. Just do as you were trained, and everything will be all right.
Life has almost run out (incoming call)

COLONEL

Raiden, your Life Gauge is about to run out!
*If player doesn't have Rations

COLONEL

Locate some rations. You'll be able to recover some LIFE with it, and there should be some in the eastern section of the South area.
*If player has Rations

COLONEL

Use your ration!
Rations explanation (incoming call when picking up)

COLONEL

You've acquired some rations. Good -- this is a portable field food source that can be consumed to recover LIFE.

COLONEL

Select the ration in your window and push the Enter Button. You can use it on the spot and regain some LIFE.

COLONEL

If you have it selected, you can automatically consume the ration—the moment your LIFE runs out and avoid death.

COLONEL

Rations not only provide nutrition, they also stimulate the immune system and lessen psychological stress.

RAIDEN

Not exactly gourmet, though, is it...?

COLONEL

Stop complaining, Raiden...
*If Rose is present

ROSE

Hang in there, Jack. When the mission is over, I'll make you my specialty.

RAIDEN

Yeah, right.

ROSE

Hm?

RAIDEN

Oh, nothing. I can't wait!
Node infodump

COLONEL

Nodes are the terminals of the operations support computer network for the Big Shell.

COLONEL

Of course, only Big Shell staff can gain access, with their job description—determining their system authority and access.

COLONEL

I installed a program in your nanomachines that automatically enters the passcode for unrestricted access.

COLONEL

Press the Action Button in front of the node to activate it. Use the node by pressing the Action Button in front of the terminal.
Prior to connecting to node

COLONEL

Raiden, the computer terminal you see over there is what's called a node.

RAIDEN

This...?

COLONEL

Right. Log into it right now. Stand in front of the node and push the Action Button.
*Additional dialogue depending on difficulty

COLONEL

You won't be permitted to log into a node during the Alert Mode. Make sure you're not under pursuit when you need to log in.

COLONEL

You can only access the node in Normal Mode.

COLONEL

To access the node, you must approach it without being seen by the enemy.
Node features (1)

COLONEL

Logging into a node will permit you to use the radar and the overview map of the area.

COLONEL

You will also be able to access other functions such as Option changes. Customize the settings according to your needs.
Node features (2)

COLONEL

Raiden, radar utilization is key. The ability to check the enemy's movements and field of vision through the radar will be indispensable in a sneaking mission.

COLONEL

But don't be so reliant on the radar that you miss the obvious. Always check your surroundings in First Person View as well.
In front of elevator, before connecting to node

COLONEL

Hmm, the elevator seems to be stopped on the upper floor. You will have to wait for it to come down.

COLONEL

You see the node to the east? Access it for now.
In front of elevator, after connecting to node

COLONEL

Raiden, the elevator is on its way down. It will be a few more minutes before it gets there, however.

COLONEL

Wait until the elevator is here, but find some cover in the meantime. Make sure you're out of the enemy's sight.
*First time only

RAIDEN

Waiting isn't my strong point.

ROSE

I know -- you always left that job for me, didn't you?

COLONEL

Raiden, is remembering priorities also not your strong point? Just go into hiding until the elevator arrives.
Enemy has woken up

COLONEL

Raiden, the enemy sentry is regaining consciousness.

ROSE

Be careful, Jack!

COLONEL

Find somewhere to hide until the elevator arrives. You must stay out of sight!
After elevator has arrived

COLONEL

Raiden, the elevator is there. Get on quickly and get to the upper part of the Big Shell.
After elevator has arrived, Alert Mode
*Additional dialogue depending on difficulty

COLONEL

Raiden, the elevator is inactive during Alert Mode. Get out of there for now and shake off the enemy's pursuit.
After elevator has arrived, Alert Mode (2)

COLONEL

Raiden, you have no weapons and not a chance in hell against them in a confrontation. Get out of there and head south! Retreat down the corridor!

ROSE

Jack, get out of there! Please!!

COLONEL

There's some cover back in the south area. Get yourself over there right now.
After elevator has arrived, Alert Mode (3)
*On Hard difficulty or higher

COLONEL

Raiden, the elevator is inactive during Alert Mode. Get out of there for now and shake off the enemy's pursuit.
If you trigger Alert Mode, run (incoming call)

COLONEL

Raiden, you have no weapons and not a chance in hell against them in a confrontation. Get out of there and head south! Retreat down the corridor!
*First time only

ROSE

Jack, get out of there! Please!!

COLONEL

There's some cover back in the south area. Get yourself over there right now.
Clearing explanation (incoming call)

COLONEL

Raiden, stay still. The enemy is engaged in Clearing.

ROSE

What's Clearing?

COLONEL

A systematic sweep of high-risk zones where intruder presence is either suspected or confirmed.

COLONEL

It makes use of a variety of CQB techniques, but can be divided roughly into two types.

COLONEL

One is the so-called "dynamic entry" method, which relies on speed and the element of surprise to storm the area and take control of the enemy.

COLONEL

The other is "stealth entry," which involves infiltrating the area, covertly acquiring the targets and seizing control.

ROSE

In either case, he'll be discovered unless he stays out of sight. Am I correct?

COLONEL

Absolutely. They're trained professionals. Keep that in mind when you look for a good hiding place, Raiden.
•Colonel
Strut A Roof
Strut A roof, head for Strut B

COLONEL

According to the SEAL Team 10's communications, the President was sighted on Strut B.

COLONEL

Raiden, head for Strut B. It's to the northwest of Strut A, your current location.
*If player is on Strut A roof

COLONEL

Cross the connecting bridge between Strut A and B.

COLONEL

You can get to the connecting bridge from the first floor. Get down from the roof to the first floor.
*If player is at Strut A 1F

COLONEL

There's a door on the northwest end of this floor. You can get onto the connecting bridge between Struts A and B through there. Cross the AB connecting bridge to Strut B.
*If player hasn't accessed node yet

COLONEL

The node is on the first floor of Strut A. Don't forget to log in, understood?
Seagulls on the roof

COLONEL

I see a lot of birds over there...

COLONEL

The tanker accident two years ago released crude oil—containing massive quantities of Endocrine Disruptors.

COLONEL

The fish that absorbed them were then eaten by seagulls, which further concentrated the Endocrine Disruptors in their bodies.

COLONEL

What sort of outcome this will lead to is still currently under review and is yet unclear.

COLONEL

It just goes to show that finishing the cleanup of ocean oil spills does not mean that environmental restoration efforts end there as well.
Strut A roof, unable to use elevator

COLONEL

Raiden, the elevator's gone down. There's no need for you to return to the deep-sea dock. Proceed with the mission.
Strut A roof, crawl through fence

COLONEL

Raiden, look at that wire fence. You may be able to crawl through it.

COLONEL

Crouch down using the Crawl Button, then push the left analog stick in the direction you want to move.

COLONEL

Push the Crawl Button again to stand up.

COLONEL

You can use weapons even while Crawling. This is different from VR training, so you keep that in mind.
Near wire fence

RAIDEN

Colonel, don't you think it's strange that the fence is missing this spot right here?

COLONEL

Yes, I do.

RAIDEN

You don't think that he got away...

COLONEL

It's possible. Be on the alert.

RAIDEN

Roger that.
Seagull droppings

COLONEL

That area is caked with seagull droppings. You'll slip if you run over it. Be careful.
Locked door

COLONEL

Raiden, that door is locked. You most likely won't be able to get through. Find another way in.
Hurry to Strut B (1)

COLONEL

Raiden, didn't you hear what the SEALs said? The President is in trouble. Head for Strut B.
Hurry to Strut B (2)

COLONEL

On the northwest end of the first floor of Strut A, there's a door that leads to the AB connecting bridge. Cross the bridge to get to Strut B. Hurry!
*If player is at AB Connecting Bridge

COLONEL

Go northwest of the AB connecting bridge you're on to get to Strut B! Move!
*If player is elsewhere

COLONEL

Strut B is to the northwest of Strut A. First, make your way to Strut A on the double. The President's life is at stake here!
•Colonel
AB Connecting Bridge
Don't get spotted on the bridge

COLONEL

Raiden, stay out of sight at all costs. The bridge is too narrow to offer any way out. If you're spotted, you won't last too long.

COLONEL

The sentries aren't checking over the railings. Hanging will let you travel right in their blind spot. Try Hanging.
Near noisy surfaces

COLONEL

That floor will make a racket if you run on it. Noise tends to bring enemy soldiers to the scene.

COLONEL

Tilt the left analog stick lightly to walk quietly.

COLONEL

Crawling also lets you move noiselessly. Consider both of these options.
Careful on those railings

COLONEL

If you fall from that height, you would never make it. Climb up before your Grip Gauge runs out.

ROSE

Don't even think about letting go, okay?
Pitfalls

COLONEL

Raiden, watch out for that board. You'll probably fall off. Make a run for it and you should be all right.
•Colonel
FA Connecting Bridge
Cyphers
(1)

COLONEL

The Cypher is a type of unmanned surveillance craft. It will alert the patrols upon discovering an intruder. If you're spotted by one, the reinforcements will come running.
(2)

COLONEL

Raiden, you need to stay out of the Cypher's field of vision. You can't afford to be apprehended.

RAIDEN

But Colonel, there's nowhere to hide...

ROSE

Jack, snap out of it.
*Second and subsequent times

COLONEL

Hang from the railings and let the Cypher pass you by. Try Hanging, and keep an eye on the Grip Gauge!
(3)

COLONEL

Use the chaff grenade to set up electronic interference. The Cypher will be offline for as long as the chaff is active.
(4)

COLONEL

The Cypher can be taken out by destroying its camera.
•Snake
After Encounter with Vamp
Sleepy Pliskin
*After meeting Raiden, Snake takes a little nap to bounce back from his anemia

SNAKE

Zzzzz... (Snoring.)
*Raiden can even hit Snake while he sleeps; Snake will get angry

SNAKE

What do you think you're doing!

SNAKE

Stop fooling around, kid!

SNAKE

What's your problem!?

SNAKE

Leave me alone.

SNAKE

Let me sleep!
*If Raiden points a gun at Snake, he wakes up

SNAKE

*daringly* What're you trying to do, kid?

SNAKE

*daringly* I wouldn't do that if I were you.

SNAKE

*daringly* Think you can shoot that thing?
*If Raiden actually fires, Snake shoots back

SNAKE

Moron!

SNAKE

Damn kid!

SNAKE

What are you thinking!?
Snake's sleeping

RAIDEN

He's -- asleep?
*Quip about Snake sleeping (1)

RAIDEN

How much longer is this guy going to sleep...?
*Quip about Snake sleeping (2)

RAIDEN

Wish I were that relaxed...
*Quip about Snake sleeping (3)

SNAKE

*mumble mumble* (Talking in his sleep. It seems that he's dreaming of the events of MGS1.)

RAIDEN

... He's still sleeping...

SNAKE

Liquid!!

RAIDEN

Huh?

SNAKE

... zzz...
Vamp
(1)

SNAKE

Vamp is a member of Dead Cell. Born in Romania, his specialty is knives. But I guess you know that by now.

SNAKE

When he was just a kid, he lost his family to a terrorist bomb that went off in a church they were attending.

SNAKE

His body pierced by a crucifix, Vamp was buried under the rubble for two days before he was finally rescued.

SNAKE

During those two days, he survived by feeding on the blood of his family to quench his thirst.

SNAKE

That was how he acquired a taste for blood...

RAIDEN

So that's why they call him "Vamp"...

SNAKE

No. "Vamp" isn't for vampire. It's because he's bisexual...
(2)

SNAKE

Rumor has it Vamp was the lover of Scott Dolph, the Marine Commandant who accidentally died two years ago.

SNAKE

Scott Dolph was also the father of Fortune, the Dead Cell leader.

RAIDEN

Fortune's old man? But Fortune and Vamp...

SNAKE

You noticed, eh? Not bad for a rookie...

RAIDEN

Uh... right.
(3)

SNAKE

As you say, Vamp and Fortune are very close. Not lovers, but very close...

RAIDEN

Friends?

SNAKE

No. There's more to their relationship than that.

RAIDEN

But Vamp was her father's lover!

SNAKE

Would it have been better if it was with her mother?

RAIDEN

Well...

SNAKE

I don't really think they care what you think. Focus on the mission.

RAIDEN

...
(4)

RAIDEN

By the way, have you ever met the guy before?

SNAKE

No.

RAIDEN

But he seemed to know you...

SNAKE

Right. Well, I... no... it can't be...

RAIDEN

What?

SNAKE

Nothing. I told you that Dead Cell is a group of madmen... I wouldn't take anything they say very seriously.
Other members of Dead Cell

RAIDEN

Tell me a little more about Dead Cell.

SNAKE

Dead Cell was a shadow unit within the SEALs organization.

RAIDEN

Right. They handled surprise raids on vital government facilities, didn't they?

SNAKE

Yes. They were originally put together to check the nation's military security system.

SNAKE

The unit was the brainchild of ex-president George Sears...

SNAKE

Dead Cell was a secret unit positioned at the opposite end of anti-terrorist outfits such as Delta Force and SEALs.

RAIDEN

Were they always a...

SNAKE

... group of madmen?

RAIDEN

Yeah.

SNAKE

No. They got weird when Colonel Jackson -- Fortune's husband -- was sent to jail.

RAIDEN

Sent to jail? For what?

SNAKE

Corruption. He misappropriated government funds.

RAIDEN

Sounds like he deserved it...

SNAKE

That's what everybody else thought. Except for the members of Dead Cell. They felt the Colonel was falsely accused.

SNAKE

Fact is, they took the case to the powers that be. But they never managed to reopen the case.

RAIDEN

Was there any truth to their claim?

SNAKE

Who knows? Whatever the situation is, Dead Cell's name was tainted.

RAIDEN

And Colonel Jackson...?

SNAKE

He was being held at Leavenworth...

RAIDEN

"Was"... Meaning he's been released?

SNAKE

Well... in a manner of speaking. The Colonel's dead.

RAIDEN

Oh.

SNAKE

Apparently he lost the will to live and died in prison.

SNAKE

The members of Dead Cell snapped with the loss of their leader.

SNAKE

They underwent a radical change and became uncontrollable.

RAIDEN

And that's why they undertook this terrorist operation?

SNAKE

Seems as good a reason as any...
Fortune

RAIDEN

What do you know about that strange woman?

SNAKE

You mean Fortune? She's the Dead Cell leader.

SNAKE

Her real name is Helena Dolph Jackson... known to her friends as Lady Luck.

RAIDEN

Lady Luck?

SNAKE

Yeah. She got the name because bullets seem to veer away from her in battle.

RAIDEN

...

SNAKE

People have heard her say that her fortune in battle was payback for the lousy luck she's had in life...

RAIDEN

Lousy luck?

SNAKE

The death of her father, the Marine commander...The conviction of husband and Dead Cell leader, Colonel Jackson...

SNAKE

These events were followed by her mother's suicide -- the loss of a husband and the idea of a convict in the family apparently took her over the edge...

SNAKE

Fortune was three months pregnant at the time and the shock of her mother's death led to the loss of her child. Add to this her husband's death in prison a few months later and...

SNAKE

To sum it up, in the six months after her father's death, she lost her family and everything that mattered in her life.

RAIDEN

Geez, she's had it rough...

SNAKE

Yeah. The thing is, she didn't grieve long. Instead, she joined the military.

RAIDEN

Now why's that?

SNAKE

Do I look psychic? My best guess is revenge. I heard that she firmly believed that her husband was framed...

SNAKE

Anyway... by the time she came out of basic training, she'd proven many times over that she was "gifted" with an unusual streak of luck.

SNAKE

In fact, some say she sold her soul for it.

RAIDEN

Her soul?

SNAKE

Her uncanny luck earned her a reputation that led to her appointment as the head of her husband's unit, Dead Cell.
Fortune (2)
*If player hasn't heard about Vamp and Fortune

SNAKE

She's the widow of Dead Cell's former beloved leader. I'd heard that she was welcomed with open arms by Vamp, who was the temporary leader at the time.

SNAKE

For Vamp, it also meant welcoming the daughter of his former lover...

RAIDEN

Vamp and Fortune's mother...?

SNAKE

*casually* No. Vamp and Fortune's father... Vamp's bisexual.

RAIDEN

Oh... Wait a sec. I thought Vamp and Fortune...

SNAKE

You noticed, eh?

RAIDEN

Uh... yeah.
-->Vamp (3) (p. 224)
The SEALs

RAIDEN

Pliskin, SEAL Team 10's Bravo Team's been wiped out...

SNAKE

Is that right.

RAIDEN

Is that all you have to say? I thought they were your comrades!

SNAKE

Yeah. Too bad.

RAIDEN

Too bad!? Did you know they were used as a decoy to support my infiltration?

SNAKE

No. But it doesn't surprise me.

RAIDEN

Man! You're cold! They were your friends!

SNAKE

What do want me to say! That you killed them!?

SNAKE

Or do you want me to say it wasn't your fault!?

RAIDEN

I jus --

SNAKE

Listen, kid. I don't have the time to wet-nurse you or provide you with a shoulder to cry on!

SNAKE

You got a problem with your conscience, you take care of it! Don't bother me!
The Navy captain and the black case

RAIDEN

Pliskin, you seemed pretty focused on the Navy Captain. Something catch your eye?

SNAKE

Yeah. Remember the handcuffs were cut? There was something on the other end of that.

RAIDEN

Do you know what it was?

SNAKE

Well, I... no. Forget it.

RAIDEN

Whattya mean "forget it"!?

SNAKE

Just what I said... Forget it.

RAIDEN

I...

SNAKE

Talk to you later, kid.
Pliskin (Snake)

RAIDEN

Hey, Pliskin... Were you really a SEAL?

SNAKE

That's what I told you.

RAIDEN

But...

SNAKE

But what?

RAIDEN

Uh... nothing. (He's suspicious, but doesn't have the confidence to say anything.)

SNAKE

Listen, kid, you're on a mission. Thinking about anything else can get you killed...
•Colonel
Strut B
Strut B, prior to Vamp cutscenes

COLONEL

Raiden, the President should be somewhere in Strut B, where you are now. His life is in danger. Hurry!
After encounter with Vamp - about Dead Cell

RAIDEN

Colonel, who are Dead Cell?

COLONEL

They are pretty much what that guy Pliskin described them as.

RAIDEN

A Special Forces unit, the brainchild of the former president...

COLONEL

Chances are someday we'll find ourselves in a gunfight with them.

RAIDEN

The thought leaves me uneasy...
*If player has played Tanker Chapter

COLONEL

You have experience combating FOXHOUND during VR training, right? You'll be fine. Don't be apprehensive.
*If player hasn't played Tanker Chapter

ROSE

Jack, don't run unnecessary risks, okay?

RAIDEN

Yeah, I don't want to, but...

ROSE

I know. Is there anything I can do?

RAIDEN

Yeah. Could you check for any data on them for me?

ROSE

Okay. I'll do it. Good luck.
Vamp

RAIDEN

Someone mentioned the name Vamp. Do you have any info on him?

ROSE

Wait a moment, I'll look.
Details on Vamp

COLONEL

Raiden, looks like Rosemary has something for you.

ROSE

Jack, I found some information on Vamp.

ROSE

He's been a member of Dead Cell since it was first founded, and like Lieutenant J.G. Pliskin said, he's a master with knives. He is originally from Romania.

ROSE

He's apparently no ordinary knife specialist.

RAIDEN

What do you mean?

ROSE

*disbelievingly* He can parry bullets.

RAIDEN

Yeah, I saw him do it. How the heck...?

ROSE

I don't know. Also, it looks like he secluded himself from other humans on several different occasions. There is no detailed information on him, though. Be careful.
Do not trust Pliskin

COLONEL

Raiden, I trust that you don't actually believe what that guy Pliskin told you, right?

RAIDEN

... I believe him. There is something about him... like, like an iron will... enough to trust.

COLONEL

Raiden!

RAIDEN

!?

COLONEL

He's not included in the simulation. Don't trust him. Ever. You got it?

RAIDEN

... Roger that.
VR training

COLONEL
