Raiden, don't dwell on what Pliskin said. The VR training you underwent is the best training program there is.

COLONEL

There is no reason to be apprehensive. Be confident. Do you understand?
Solid Snake

RAIDEN

Colonel, do you think the terrorist ringleader is really Solid Snake?

COLONEL

Yes, I do.

RAIDEN

But during the Shadow Moses incident, Snake was a...

COLONEL

A hero?

RAIDEN

Yeah.

COLONEL

Certainly. You went through VR training, but it is not as if the simulation is faithful to every fact.

COLONEL

It... changes people.

RAIDEN

... You too, Colonel?

COLONEL

Raiden, focus on the task at hand. Solid Snake is the terrorist kingpin. He is an opponent you can't underestimate. Understood?
The Tanker Incident
*If player has completed Tanker Chapter

COLONEL

That tanker accident that happened over there two years ago; the tanker sank and...

RAIDEN

I know. I went through it in VR training. The tanker didn't sink because of Snake, though...

COLONEL

Raiden. VR training does not exactly simulate everything with absolute fidelity.

RAIDEN

What do you mean?

COLONEL

Okay, listen. Here are the facts.

COLONEL

Known terrorist Solid Snake sank that tanker loaded with crude oil, the end result being severe environmental pollution in Manhattan Bay.

COLONEL

Put any misperceptions of Snake as some kind of hero behind you. He is a terrorist. And that's that.
If player hasn't connected to the node

COLONEL

Don't forget to log into the node in Strut B.

COLONEL

The node for Strut B is on the south side of the transformer room. It's to the west of where you found the Navy Captain.
Gunfire will attract attention

COLONEL

I see you've acquired a gun.

RAIDEN

Pliskin gave it to me.

COLONEL

Don't trust that man... But the gun itself seems all right.

COLONEL

However, it's not equipped with a suppressor. If you fire it, the noise will be loud enough to alert any enemy personnel within hearing distance to your presence.

COLONEL

Infiltration is the art of making your presence invisible. Try not to end up in a situation where you need to rely on firepower. Combat must be avoided unless absolutely necessary.
Near sleepy Pliskin

COLONEL

Raiden, forget about that guy.

ROSE

I think you should just let him sleep.

COLONEL

Return to your duties. Head for the BC connecting bridge. Be quick about it.
Player shot Pliskin while he was sleeping

COLONEL

Raiden, what reason could you have to shoot someone while they are sleeping?

ROSE

I can't believe you! And he was on our side, right?

COLONEL

I strongly disapprove... Hurry up and return to your duties!
Near the body of the Navy Captain

COLONEL

A Navy Captain and the President... unbelievable. Raiden, get to the President. Head for the BC connecting bridge.
In front of Strut B transformer board

COLONEL

That's a transformer board over there. You can open and close the door by pushing the Action Button when you're in front of the door.
Hurry to the BC Connecting Bridge

COLONEL

Raiden, SEAL Team 10 has engaged someone on the BC connecting bridge. The President is most likely there as well.
*If player is at BC Connecting Bridge

COLONEL

The conflict is just to the north of your current location, at the center of the BC connecting bridge. There isn't a second to lose. Head directly to the scene.
*If player is elsewhere

COLONEL

The BC connecting bridge is on the north side of Strut B. The President is in danger. Go now!
*If player hasn't accessed node yet

COLONEL

Don't forget to log into the node in Strut B.
•Colonel
BC Connecting Bridge
The sounds of Fortune versus the SEALs

RAIDEN

Colonel, you hear that?

COLONEL

The SEAL Team 10 and the President are under attack.

RAIDEN

Dead Cell?

COLONEL

No confirmation of that, but probably.

ROSE

*worried* Jack...

RAIDEN

*unconfidently* I... I...

COLONEL

This is not time to hesitate. Raiden! Go!
Find Stillman

COLONEL

It's possible the terrorists will attempt to destroy the Big Shell in retaliation for the SEAL strike. Defuse the bombs before they make that move.
*If player is not at Strut C

COLONEL

Go to Strut C and locate the bomb disposal expert. Take the BC connecting bridge on the north side of Strut B to get to C.
*If player is at Strut C

COLONEL

The bomb disposal expert is somewhere in Strut C where you currently are. Locate him and request his assistance.
The collapsed bridge

COLONEL

Raiden, you can see the core of Shell 1 to the east. The connecting bridge though, has been completely destroyed.

COLONEL

There's no way to get to the core from where you are. You'll have to use the EF connecting bridge on the opposite side.
The terrorists' retaliation

RAIDEN

Colonel, do you really think they will blow up the Big Shell?

COLONEL

It's highly possible. We'll have to listen to their demands in full. They are pros. They won't hesitate to take the upper hand if they see an opening.

RAIDEN

Do you plan on meeting their demands?

COLONEL

Absolutely not.

RAIDEN

Argh!

COLONEL

You're the only person I can depend on. You must remove the explosives quickly.
Toxic substances

COLONEL

If the Big Shell explodes, massive quantities of chlorinated chemicals used in killing marine bacteria will go up in flames along with the crude oil.

COLONEL

If that happens, expect a large amount of harmful chemical substances, including dioxins, to be released into the atmosphere.

COLONEL

Dioxins are common nomenclature for Polychlorinated Dibenzodioxin and Polychlorinated Dibenzofuran.

COLONEL

They are organic chloride compounds that are highly acute and toxic, and are powerful chemicals that can cause cancer, genetic disorders, and birth defects.

COLONEL

On top of that, they do not decompose easily nor dissolve in water, making it easy for them to accumulate within the bodies of living organisms.

COLONEL

The environmental impact on the bay and coastal area ecosystem would be unfathomable.

COLONEL

Environmental restoration would likely require several generations.

COLONEL

That is why we cannot allow them to blow up the Big Shell. Raiden, you must disarm the C4.
•Colonel
Strut C
Strut C women's bathroom, before meeting Peter

COLONEL

Raiden, I doubt that the bomb disposal instructor would be in there... Look someplace else.
If player is looking at a toilet in First Person View

COLONEL

Raiden, what are you looking at? Oh, I see. Rosemary.

ROSE

What?

COLONEL

Could you excuse him for a moment?

ROSE

Huh?

COLONEL

You know, so he can...

ROSE

Ahh, I get it.

RAIDEN

...

ROSE

Jack, uh, let me know when you're done, okay?

RAIDEN

...
Strut C men's bathroom, crouched down and looking at a toilet in First Person View

COLONEL

Raiden, I didn't know you had such weird interests...

COLONEL

Not that, uh, there's anything wrong with that, though. Just that, well, it's a little weird.

ROSE

Jack... I think that's a little weird.

RAIDEN

...
Women's bathroom, before meeting Peter

ROSE

I can't believe you, Jack. Do you know what that place is?

RAIDEN

Err, I just thought maybe the bomb disposal instructor might be in there...

ROSE

Why would he be in there?

RAIDEN

You never know. He's AWOL, and...

ROSE

Even AWOL, a normal guy wouldn't go into a woman's bathroom!

ROSE

You're the only one I know who would! You're, like, really strange!

COLONEL

Rosemary, settle down.

ROSE

But...

COLONEL

It's all right. Raiden, Rosemary is right. You should probably look someplace else.

COLONEL

... I can really sympathize with you there, though...

ROSE

What, sir?

COLONEL

Err, nothing. Raiden, that's that. Return to your duties.

RAIDEN

...

ROSE

... You guys are unbelievable...
Strut C women's bathroom, looking at a toilet in First Person View

COLONEL

*dumbfounded* Uh, Raiden...

ROSE

Jack, give it a rest! I can't bear watching you do that!

COLONEL

I disapprove. Return to your duties.

COLONEL

... That's what I feel like saying, but I'm beginning to feel like putting you in charge was not such a good idea.
Strut C women's bathroom, crouched down and looking at a toilet in First Person View

COLONEL

Raiden... I'm at a loss for words.

ROSE

I'm afraid to ask -- do you do that in my room too?
If player has been in the women's bathroom a while

COLONEL

... Raiden, that's long enough. Hurry up and get back to your duties, if you've seen enough.

ROSE

Jack, in retrospect I'm really glad that I took this assignment.

RAIDEN

Huh...?

ROSE

It's given me a chance to see you for who you really are. Good-bye!
If player equips a Magazine while in a stall

COLONEL

Raiden, what are you doing there, with that?

ROSE

I don't believe it! What are you thinking? And during your duties!?

COLONEL

I highly disapprove.

ROSE

Even though every one of us is scrambling to do our best to support you... this!?

ROSE

And what exactly are you going to do? Drool over pictures of voluptuous girls?

COLONEL

Exactly...

ROSE

At least use a picture of me instead!

RAIDEN

Wha... I... what?

ROSE

I mean...

COLONEL

*exhasperated* ... I completely disapprove...
Section 4
Start of Bomb Disposal Event – Fatman Battle
Disarming, First Bomb 1
Codec Call 1
(mandatory outgoing call to Peter)
Raiden, having disposed of the first bomb, raises Peter on the Codec. Upon finding out where the bomb was set, Peter is perturbed.

PETER

That's not like him...

RAIDEN

Anything wrong?

PETER

Maybe. Pliskin's reported other locations too, and none of them are effective demolition points.

RAIDEN

What do you mean?

PETER

It means that they wouldn't be the best places to choose if you wanted to destroy this place.

RAIDEN

Are you saying they don't plan on blowing the Shell up?

PETER

It certainly seems that way. So far, we haven't seen anything but a waste of good explosives. Unless of course, we're missing something...

RAIDEN

A trap?

PETER

He couldn't have overlooked the fact that I would be called into this. There's something going on.
Disarming, Halfway Done 1
Codec Call 1
(mandatory outgoing call to Peter)
Raiden, having disposed of half the bombs, contacts Peter. He listens to Raiden's description of where the bomb was and becomes even more unsettled.

PETER

This is all wrong. This is something only an amateur would do.

RAIDEN

What do you mean?

PETER

All the bombs that have been found so far don't appear to be in the right kind of locations. And the quantity of explosives isn't sufficient either.

RAIDEN

Even Fatman can make mistakes, right?

PETER

No. There's something else going on here...

PETER

Get a move on with the disposal, Raiden. I've got a bad feeling about this.

RAIDEN

Do you think it's a trap?

PETER

I don't know, but I'm going to tell Pliskin to watch his back too. Just hurry.
During Disarming, Rose Part 3
Codec Call 1
(mandatory incoming call from Rose)
Rose calls Raiden while he's disposing of the bombs. She tries to help him relax.

ROSE

Jack, do you remember the day we met?

RAIDEN

I'm kinda busy right now, Rose.

ROSE

You're right, sorry.

RAIDEN

*realizing her intentions* I do remember.

RAIDEN

It was right after I transferred to New York. There were all these tourists around you, in front of the Federal Hall.

ROSE

A group of middle-aged Japanese ladies came up and asked me, which building it was that King Kong was climbing in the movie.

ROSE

I said it was probably the Chrysler Building.

ROSE

And then you showed up and started mouthing off.

ROSE

You were like, "No, it's the Empire State."

RAIDEN

I said the Chrysler Building was in Godzilla.

ROSE

*laughs at the memory* Ha ha ha...

ROSE

We started arguing, and I forgot all about the tourists.

ROSE

I was insisting that I was right, and you were doing the same...

RAIDEN

The next thing we knew, the Japanese women had gone away.

ROSE

And we ended up going to the Skyscraper Museum to see who had the better recall.

RAIDEN

We argued all the way to Battery Park.

ROSE

And for nothing!

RAIDEN

Since the museum was closed.

RAIDEN

We went our separate ways from the museum. (Because they were both embarassed.)

RAIDEN

And then I found you again by coincidence out in the base corridor (at FOXHOUND).

ROSE

An amazing coincidence -- that we were actually working at the same place. (It wasn't really a coincidence.)

RAIDEN

That night, we went up to the top of the Empire State.

ROSE

It was so beautiful -- I could look down on the Chrysler Building from a hundred and twenty stories above ground.

RAIDEN

I felt -- overwhelmed.

RAIDEN

I didn't care anymore who was right.

ROSE

*reminding him* And that was our first date.

RAIDEN

We watched "King Kong" in your apartment a bunch of times that night.

RAIDEN

Didn't sleep till morning...

ROSE

*sighs*

RAIDEN

If it weren't for that coincidence, we wouldn't be together.

ROSE

*filled with self-loathing* I know...

ROSE

I'm sorry, Jack. I'm taking up your time again. (She got close to him on orders from the Patriots.)

RAIDEN

*confused* What?

ROSE

*coldly* Take care.
Minefield 1
Codec Call 1
(mandatory incoming call from Mr. X)
Raiden moves through the plant in order to dispose of the bombs. When he reaches the EF Connecting Bridge, he receives an abrupt Codec call from an unknown individual.

MR. X

Be careful!

MR. X

There are Claymore mines around there.

RAIDEN

Who is this?

MR. X

Stealth-equipped Claymore mines, invisible to the naked eye.

MR. X

Use the mine detector.

RAIDEN

Identify yourself.

MR. X

Just call me "Deepthroat."

RAIDEN

Deepthroat? You mean from Shadow Moses?

MR. X

Mr. X, then.

RAIDEN

Mr. X now, is it? Why would it matter if I called you Deepthroat?

MR. X

Never mind about that.

RAIDEN

Why did you contact me?

MR. X

Let's just say I'm one of your fans.
Raiden asks the Colonel to chime in.

RAIDEN

Colonel, someone calling himself Mr. X just contacted me. Do you know anything about it?

COLONEL

No -- and whoever it was, it wasn't a burst transmission. The transmission was sent from within the Big Shell.

RAIDEN

He called himself "Deepthroat" at first. Do you think -- ?

COLONEL

I caught that part too, but the possibility of it being true is none. Gray Fox was the one who used that alias in Shadow Moses, and he's dead.

RAIDEN

Is it an enemy trap?

COLONEL

Could be. Exercise extreme caution.
Disarming, Enter Olga 1
3D Cutscene 1
((MC) - Strut E Rooftop Heliport)
Raiden neutralizes the bomb on the second floor of Strut E, then heads for the rooftop heliport.
He clears the door and emerges outdoors in time to hear someone talking (through a radio). Shades of Snake and Olga in the Tanker Chapter.

SOLIDUS

I've taken care of that annoying fly. What's the situation over there? (Talking about the SEALS helicopter.)

OLGA

Puzzling. I saw a man dressed like a ninja just now.

SOLIDUS

Ninja?

OLGA

It's the only way to describe it. A kind of cyborg ninja, complete with a sword.

SOLIDUS

*surprised* What...!
Raiden walks out in the direction of the voices. He can see Olga at the top of the stairs. She wears tiger stripe urban camo over her Ninja innerwear.

OLGA

Are you hiding something from me?

SOLIDUS

Are you sure it wasn't an Arsenal Tengu (a new type of Metal Gear, refers to Arsenal Gear's armaments)?
Olga denies the suggestion vehemently.

OLGA

Don't be a fool. Think I wouldn't know the difference? I've never seen field gear like that, ever.

SOLIDUS

All right. We'll intensify patrols. Anything else?

OLGA

Actually -- one more thing. You'll find it hard to believe, though.
Olga seems reluctant. She leans on the railings of the stairs.

OLGA

I saw a man hiding under a cardboard box.

SOLIDUS

Where?

OLGA

On the connecting bridge to Shell 2.

SOLIDUS

Hmm...

OLGA

So you believe me this time?

SOLIDUS

I've seen someone use that box trick before. We'll lay a trap on the Shell 2 connecting bridge.

OLGA

Over and out then.
Olga puts away the radio.

RAIDEN

Freeze!
Raiden is already quite close. Olga, the radio tucked into a hip harness, turns around.

RAIDEN

You must be one of Dead Cell.
Olga seems unafraid, as though she had been waiting for Raiden.

OLGA

Of course not. What a thing to say.

RAIDEN

Drop your gun.
Olga smiles widely.

OLGA

Not a chance!
She leaps over the railing. Raiden rushes to the spot, and looks down, but there is no trace of Olga in the water. Raiden kneels down and makes a Codec call.
Disarming, Enter Olga 2
Codec Call 1
(mandatory outgoing call to Pliskin)

RAIDEN

I saw a female soldier -- Russian.

PLISKIN

Must be Olga Gurlukovich.

RAIDEN

How do you know?

PLISKIN

Unlike you, I've been briefed.

RAIDEN

She's not a Dead Cell?

PLISKIN

No, she commands a Russian private army.

RAIDEN

They must be the ones patrolling the Big Shell.

PLISKIN

That's right. She's led the group ever since her old man, Colonel Gurlukovich, died.

PLISKIN

Watch yourself with her. She's a tough one.
Disarming, Next to Last Bomb 1
Codec Call 1
(mandatory outgoing call to Peter)
Raiden, having disposed of the next to last bomb, calls Peter.

PETER

Good work. Only one more left to go...
Pliskin jumps in.

PLISKIN

This is Pliskin. Do you read me, Pete?

PETER

I'm here. What's up?

PLISKIN

Raiden, you need to hear this too.

RAIDEN

I'm listening.

PLISKIN

I checked out the bottom of Strut H for you, Pete.

RAIDEN

Wait -- what's this about? (He hasn't heard about this.)

PETER

I asked Pliskin to look around. Knowing Fatman, I can't shake the feeling that all the bombs so far were just wrong.

RAIDEN

So did you find anything?

PLISKIN

A hell of a lot of C4s packed into the bottom of the strut. Pete called it right.

PETER

I knew he had the real thing up his sleeve...

RAIDEN

So all the other ones were dummies?

PETER

No, they're a threat all right, but the detonation wouldn't be enough to destroy the entire Shell. But the C4s Pliskin found would inflict serious structural damage.

PLISKIN

That's not the bad news either. These are sensor-proof.

PETER

What!?

PLISKIN

New model, I guess. The ionization sensor can't detect them.

PLISKIN

The whole thing is sealed tight to prevent vapor leak, and there's no trace of that cologne signature. Pete, looks like he fooled you.

PETER

... Yes. (He's noticing that Fatman has abandoned his usual aesthetics and is behaving oddly.)

RAIDEN

*grateful* But you managed to find the thing anyway?

PLISKIN

It was sheer luck.

RAIDEN

*worried* Bombs that are invisible to the sensor...

PLISKIN

Any ideas, Pete?

RAIDEN

Are there more out there?

PETER

*determined* I'll go see for myself.

RAIDEN

You can't move fast enough.

PLISKIN

He's right. I can try the spray from a distance.

PETER

Hold on! There's something not right about this one, I can feel it.

PLISKIN

Well, Pete? Should I come back and get you?

PETER

No, there's no need. Raiden, you have one left to go, correct?

RAIDEN

Right -- except for those scentless ones.

PETER

How about you, Pliskin?

PLISKIN

I have two left not counting this one.

PETER

*considers* OK... It'll have to be me. I have the Level 4 card that'll get me into Shell 2 in any case.

RAIDEN

You'll never make it. With that bad leg of yours, they'll spot you for sure.

PETER

That won't happen. I... (He hesitates.)

PETER

I can walk just fine.

PETER

*confesses* I can even run...

PLISKIN

*confused* What do you mean?

PETER

That bomb, five years ago. I messed up. Even with all my experience, I lost it.

PETER

And a church was lost in the explosion. All those kids playing nearby too... These past five years, I've lived a lie.

RAIDEN

Lied?

PETER

Yes, lied. I didn't lose my leg in the explosion.

PLISKIN

...

PETER

So many dead -- all because of my mistake. All I could think about was hiding from the crime, shielding myself from the public outcry. I wanted people to be sorry for me, for my weakness...

RAIDEN

... (He's speechless.)

PETER

I faked being a victim myself because I couldn't bear to face the families of the real victims.

PETER

This is no prosthetic. I can keep my footing on catwalks and hike over deserts.

PETER

I lived my lie so well I haven't even answered to myself for my sins...

PETER

It was supposed to be a shield.

PETER

And it's become a shroud instead.

PETER

I've killed my soul by playing the victim.

PETER

Instead of protecting me, it's made my life even more hellish.

PLISKIN

What good can that do the victims?

PETER

I know -- I'm a coward!

PLISKIN

Hey, Pete...

PETER

God forgive me...

PETER

I can walk with my own two feet.

PETER

And I need them to stop Fatman. His crimes are also mine -- one of omission, and arrogance. No one should teach the skills I taught him without a clear conscience.

PETER

This is the only way I can defuse my own sins.

PLISKIN

I get you, Pete. That one's all yours. You got it, Raiden?

RAIDEN

I understand.

PLISKIN

Pete, I've taken care of guards in Struts G and H of Shell 2. I wouldn't recommend you go into any of the other struts.

PETER

I owe you one.

PLISKIN

I'll get back to freezing the baby bombs then.

PETER

You do that too, Raiden.

RAIDEN

I'm on it.

PETER

I'll have the radio with me, if you need to get in touch. Just don't ask for "Peg-Legged Peter." He's gone for good.
Disarming, Last Bomb 1
Codec Call 1
(mandatory outgoing call to Peter)
Raiden defuses the last bomb and calls Peter.

RAIDEN

I have the last C4 frozen. There's nothing showing up on the sensor now.

PETER

Good work, Raiden.

PLISKIN

You're way ahead of me, kid. I still have one to go.

RAIDEN

How's your bomb, Peter?

PETER

It's a bomb all right. Sealed C4, and in huge quantities...

RAIDEN

You think there's another one in Shell 1?

PETER

For sure. Somewhere at the bottom of Strut A.

RAIDEN

Why are you so certain?

PETER

If this bottom section of the strut is demolished, Shell 2 will be well on its way to destruction.

PLISKIN

You mean that Shell 2 will actually sink?

PETER

Not immediately. There'll still be five struts left.

PETER

But, if Shell 1 loses a strut at the same time, it'll be a very different story.

PETER

The Big Shell's structural integrity depends on a very exact balance. If both Shells lose a strut each, the whole structure will tear itself apart under its own weight.

RAIDEN

What do we do?

PETER

I have a sensor that can locate even those scentless C4s. It makes combined use of a neutron scintillator and a hydrogen bomb detector.

RAIDEN

You brought that stuff with you?

PETER

Of course. I made the calibrations while I was in the pantry.

RAIDEN

Does it work?

PETER

I just tested it, and it definitely responds. But the best I can do is a sound beacon, not the radar.

RAIDEN

Sound?

PETER

The shorter the interval between beacons, the closer the target.

RAIDEN

I get you.

PETER

There's another one in that pantry I was in. You can go back and get it.

PLISKIN

It's all yours, Raiden.

PETER

I'm going to study it some more, and see if the freezing process will work. Don't touch the other one until I say so.

RAIDEN

OK. I'll stand by until you radio in.
Disarming, Getting Sensor B 1
Codec Call 1
(mandatory outgoing call to Peter)
Raiden gets Sensor B in the Strut C kitchen according to Peter's instructions. He contacts Peter.

RAIDEN

Peter, I have Sensor B.

PETER

Good. Head to the bottom of Strut A.

RAIDEN

How's your invisible bomb?

PETER

I'm looking at it, but I'm keeping my distance. How's Pliskin doing?

PLISKIN

A few more minutes... I just got to the last strut, but there are a few enemy sentries I have to take care of.

RAIDEN

Does it look bad, Peter?

PETER

Maybe. It's an odd one -- the detonator hasn't been activated.

RAIDEN

What!?

PETER

*thinks* But the sensors are live... Which means...

PLISKIN

This is Pliskin. I've located the last C4.

PETER

*realizes* Is that it!?

PLISKIN

I'm about to freeze it. Then --

PETER

Wait! Pliskin!
The hiss of the spray.
After a brief pause, the sound of the bomb activating.

PETER

Damn! That WAS it!

PLISKIN

What's going on?

PETER

The detonator just woke up. It's counting down!

RAIDEN

What happened!?

PETER

The big ones were rigged to be activated when all the baby C4s went offline...

PETER

Raiden, the one in Shell 1 should be counting down too. Hurry!

RAIDEN

What's the remaining time!?
*According to difficulty level:
(Extreme)

PETER

200 seconds.

RAIDEN

200 seconds?
(Hard)

PETER

300 seconds.

RAIDEN

300 seconds?
(Easy/Normal)

PETER

400 seconds.

RAIDEN

400 seconds?
*Convergence point

PETER

Raiden, move! Get to the bottom of Strut A now!
Disarming, Elevator Descent 1
Codec Call 1
(mandatory incoming call from Peter)
Raiden heads to the bottom of Strut A in order to defuse the bomb before the countdown ends. He reaches Strut A and gets on the elevator he used shortly after arriving at the plant. After the elevator descends to a certain point, Raiden gets a call from Peter.

PETER

Raiden, Pliskin, listen carefully.

RAIDEN

What is it?

PETER

*calmly* I fell for it.

PLISKIN

Fell for what?

PETER

*calmly* Fatman has my number.

PETER

A proximity trigger. Microwave1.

RAIDEN

*nervously* Microwave?

PETER

With a 7-foot range.

PETER

It's not a technique I taught him. Neither was that multi-bomb booby trap. Looks like he's far surpassed me as far as explosives technique goes. As for the rest --

PLISKIN

Pete, get the hell out of there!

PETER

There's less than 30 seconds left. It's too late.

RAIDEN

No!

PETER

Pliskin, get away from Strut H, as fast as you can.

PLISKIN

Pete --

PETER

Raiden, keep your distance.

PETER

Use the spray from as far away as possible.

RAIDEN

*timidly* Me!?

PETER

You can do it. I know that.

RAIDEN

*timidly* I'm not so sure...

PETER

*confidently* But I am. Do it, I know you can.
The sound of the countdown's termination (long beep).

PETER

*screams* !!
The transmission abruptly cuts off!
End of Bomb Disposal 1
Codec Call 1
(mandatory outgoing call to the Colonel)
Raiden's elevator reaches the bottom of Strut A. He successfully defuses the odorless bomb at the bottom of the strut using Sensor B. Raiden calls the Colonel.

RAIDEN

Colonel, I've neutralized the bomb.

COLONEL

Good work, Raiden.

RAIDEN

It was a great loss for everyone.

COLONEL

Yes it was.

RAIDEN

Colonel, any damage report on the explosion?

COLONEL

Seems that the duct for diverting the contaminated sea water was destroyed. And the central section of Shell 2 is flooding.

COLONEL

The explosion's ignited the oil slick on the surface.

RAIDEN

What about the toxins?

COLONEL

The chemicals stayed in containment. There's no immediate danger.

RAIDEN

Is the Big Shell stable?

COLONEL

Shell 1 was unaffected. The price was high, but the threat of the bomb is over for now.

RAIDEN

What's the next objective?

COLONEL

Rescue the President. Get back to the upper level.

RAIDEN

Roger that.
Post-Disarming, Elevator Hall 1
Codec Call 1
(mandatory incoming call from the Colonel)
Raiden returns to the elevator hall to begin his new task of locating the President. Another call comes in from the Colonel.

COLONEL

Raiden, the terrorists have retaliated for our bomb neutralization.

RAIDEN

What!?

COLONEL

A hostage has been killed -- shot in the head.

COLONEL

They shot one of them on the roof, just to make sure we caught it. One of our satellites caught it, clear as day. (This is actually a lie. No hostages have been killed.)

RAIDEN

Damn!

COLONEL

They announced that they would kill one every hour from now on.

RAIDEN

What are my orders? What should I do?

COLONEL

Stay with your mission objective. Rescue the President.

RAIDEN

What about the other hostages?

COLONEL

President Johnson is your first priority.

RAIDEN

*emotionally* Priority my butt. They're all in danger!

ROSE

Jack, be reasonable. I know what you're feeling, but you can't save them all.

RAIDEN

No, not by myself.

COLONEL

Are you expecting that Pliskin to come through?

RAIDEN

Well...

COLONEL

Looks like he's turned his radio off too.

RAIDEN

I can't complete this mission by myself.

COLONEL

That man was not included in the simulation (the S3 Plan).

COLONEL

He is not a factor in this mission.

RAIDEN

What do you mean by that, Colonel?

COLONEL

Your mission must remain a solo effort.

RAIDEN

What about the SEALs? No second attempt?

COLONEL

They haven't even gotten to planning that.

COLONEL

All we can do is wait. In the meantime, you're our only hope.

RAIDEN

... I understand.

COLONEL

Raiden, go and rescue the President. You can start off by getting to the upper level of Strut A.
Post-Disarming, Fortune Returns 1
3D Cutscene 1
(Bottom of Strut A, Elevator Hall)
In the elevator hall, Raiden waits for the elevator to arrive. After a short while, it descends into view.
The elevator comes to a stop, and the door opens. A slender Black woman steps out. Fortune has shed her coat, dressed only in a leather leotard that leaves her arms and legs bare. She has a physique resembling more a model than a battle-hardened soldier, and appears totally incongruous in her present surroundings. Her hair is tossing about, though there is no hint of a breeze in the hall (the cause is the electromagnetic field). The sea lice (from the pool) make a beeline for Fortune as if they had been waiting for a shepherd. Rather than make contact with Fortune's skin, they simply range about her.
Raiden conceals himself behind some objects in the center of the elevator hall. Fortune, completely at ease, takes aim with her long linear rifle. She begins to talk, seemingly completely aware of Raiden's presence; in actuality she believes he is Snake. Vamp has informed her of the arrival of Snake, her father's killer, in the Big Shell. Assuming he is responsible for the neutralization of the bombs, Fortune has come to seek him out. Her objective is to kill him—or alternately to be killed by him.

FORTUNE

I can't tell you how happy I am that you were alive after all. I knew this moment would come.

FORTUNE

Show yourself and finish me -- like you finished off my father!

FORTUNE

Otherwise, you'll be the one to die!
Fortune fires the rifle two or three times. The shots take out the upper part of the container concealing Raiden.
One of these shots will blow away a pipe at the top of the door to the previous area, bringing down a shower of rubble, blocking the way.

RAIDEN

Oh crap!
Raiden moves to another concealment, and Fortune sees his face.

FORTUNE

That's not -- him?
Raiden ducks into the shadows.

FORTUNE

This could be -- interesting. You've seen the fires of hell, haven't you?
Fortune, with her uncanny ability to sense terror in others, realizes that Raiden carries with him a dark past. His childhood, in fact, was spent as a boy soldier on the ruthless fronts of Liberia's civil war. Foreshadowing.

FORTUNE

Maybe you can give me death...?
Behind her, the elevator begins its ascent.
Fortune glances at it, then smiles in satisfaction.
Raiden also looks to the departing elevator, but with frustrated longing.

FORTUNE

My name is Fortune, lucky in war and nothing else...

FORTUNE

And without a death to call my own.
She turns to Raiden and coolly utters her request.

FORTUNE

Hurry, kill me please!
Fortune Battle
Codec Call 1
(mandatory incoming call from the Colonel)
None of Raiden's attack options will work on Fortune, so he has no choice but to stay on the move continuously.
After approximately four minutes of this, the Colonel calls.

COLONEL

Raiden, Fatman just contacted us directly.

RAIDEN

Fatman called US?

COLONEL

Yes. Looks like he placed a bomb on the heliport. He specifically asked for you, Raiden.

RAIDEN

What!?

COLONEL

He's killed off Peter. Now he's after you.

RAIDEN

Why me?

COLONEL

How should I know?

RAIDEN

Look. This is really not a good time for this.

COLONEL

The countdown's already begun, Raiden!

RAIDEN

Great, how much time do I have left?

COLONEL

I'll show you the count.
*According to difficulty level

COLONEL

200 seconds remaining. (Extreme)

COLONEL

300 seconds remaining. (Hard)

COLONEL

400 seconds remaining. (Normal)

COLONEL

500 seconds remaining. (Easy)
*Convergence point

RAIDEN

So he's planning on taking this place out.

COLONEL

It looks like he has a different agenda from that of Dead Cell.

RAIDEN

What about backup?

COLONEL

None. There's no time.

RAIDEN

Which type of explosives is it?

COLONEL

He didn't say.
Fortune Battle End 1
3D Cutscene 1
(Bottom of Strut A, Elevator Hall)
Raiden cannot hit Fortune at all. On the other hand, he is fast losing points of cover to her linear rifle. When all the hiding places are lost or after five minutes of battle, the elevator arrives, carrying Vamp.
The elevator comes to a stop, and Vamp steps out.
He walks up behind Fortune.

VAMP

I'll take over, Queen.

FORTUNE

What is it?

VAMP

It seems our friend Fatman is out of control.

FORTUNE

He'll actually try to destroy this place?

VAMP

Yes. This could unravel everything we've planned.

FORTUNE

But why would he do such a thing?

VAMP

Who knows? But he's nothing more than a stereotypical mad bomber now. He's completely lost sight of our ideals.

VAMP

And with it... his loyalty to Commander Jackson (the leader of Dead Cell, and Fortune's husband, who was falsely(?) accused, incarcerated, and died in prison).

FORTUNE

All right. I'll take care of the wayward soul.
Fortune indicates Raiden with her chin.

FORTUNE

*pouts* It wasn't him (Snake)...

VAMP

Unfortunate.

FORTUNE

I expected more of this one, really.

VAMP

But he couldn't kill you, I see.

FORTUNE

*sulks* Completely useless.
Vamp smiles in an unpleasant manner.

VAMP

Then he's all mine.
Fortune puts her linear rifle down and returns it to her back.
Raiden, listening to them speak from his hiding spot, wonders if he could land a shot.

FORTUNE

Later, Vamp?
Fortune takes her leave in a sultry, intimate voice, then turns and walks toward the elevator. Her guard is completely down, and Raiden cannot fail to miss the opportunity!

RAIDEN

Now!
Raiden lets loose a burst of gunfire (2-3 shots) at Fortune!
Slow motion: The bullets veer away in front of Fortune and instead find Vamp's brow and side! A gaping hole appears on his forehead, and he crumples, incapable of believing this has happened.

VAMP

Urgh.

FORTUNE

!
Fortune swivels at the hips and catches Vamp on his downward arc. His weight forces her down on her knees. Vamp is bleeding from the side as well. Raiden continues to fire, but the rounds miss Fortune once again.

RAIDEN

Damn...!
Raiden returns to cover.
Fortune places her hand on Vamp's forehead.

FORTUNE

Vamp? Are you gone?
Vamp is dead (or so it appears).

FORTUNE

No. No, that death was meant for me.

FORTUNE

Why am I the only one that can't die!?
Fortune has lost her will to fight.

FORTUNE

Alone again... Cheated out of death again... How long will you force me to live!
Crouched on the floor, she weeps hysterically (almost indistinguishable from laughter).

FORTUNE

*sobs* How much longer, Dad? You've punished me enough...
Raiden rises to his feet (his gun still aimed) and approaches Fortune cautiously.
Fortune is lost in her anguish, Vamp in her arms. Raiden walks up to her and places the barrel of his gun against the back of her head.

FORTUNE

I thought you could give me peace.

FORTUNE

But you couldn't kill me either.
Raiden, chastened by the thought of the bomb and the countdown, steps into the elevator, remaining on full alert as he does so.
It begins its ascent. Fortune glances sideways at Raiden, her eyes full of tears.
The elevator climbs higher, and Fortune disappears from view.
Her despairing cry echoes in the elevator cage.

FORTUNE

*sobs*
Raiden heads for the upper level as Fortune grieves.
Her tears fall on Vamp's forehead—and suddenly, he opens his eyes.

VAMP

There's no need for sorrow, Queen.
White breath curls from Vamp's mouth. Fortune comes to with a start.

FORTUNE

!?

VAMP

I died once already.

FORTUNE

Vamp?

VAMP

I can't die twice.
Fortune clasps Vamp's face between her palms and caresses him.
Enter Fatman 1
3D Cutscene 1
(Strut E Rooftop Heliport)
Leaving Fortune and Vamp behind, Raiden hurries to the heliport, where Fatman waits for him. There are no enemy soldiers in sight.
The air is still, and the area is eerily silent. Fatman's voice booms through this stillness.

FATMAN

So you're the one...
He has been ordered by the Patriots to test Raiden. No explanation is offered. Foreshadowing.

FATMAN

You're right on time, I see. I like a punctual man.
The sound of a clock fades in.
Raiden looks around, searching for the source of the noise and the voice. Fatman is not yet in sight. The sound of inline skates.

RAIDEN

Is he Dead Cell?

FATMAN

I am Fatman.

FATMAN

I am the greatest that humanity has to offer, and the lowest.
Raiden, thinking of Peter, clenches his fist.

FATMAN

Can you hear it? Hear this rhythm?
The sound grows louder and louder. A shadow swishes among the containers.

FATMAN

It's the rhythm of time. And life!
A click and a new sound join the existing rhythm (This is the sound of Fatman setting C4s.)

FATMAN

Don't you love the sound?

FATMAN

I used to hang around department store clock counters.
Raiden checks the area, but the containers block his view.
Suddenly, Fatman appears from behind one of the containers. He wears a green blast suit, the high blast-shield collar hiding his chin and mouth. On his feet are a pair of inline skates, and in one hand, a cocktail glass filled with wine and topped with a twist-straw. The hand that holds the glass is as white and slender as a debutante's. The high collar leaves everything but his piercing eyes covered. He has gone bald; in fact, he appears to no longer have a single strand of hair on his head.

FATMAN

Life is short.

FATMAN

Bombs tell the time with every moment of their existence. And nothing else announces its own end with such a fanfare.
Fatman makes his declaration, then raises his glass to Raiden.

FATMAN

Glad you could make it. The party's about to start...
He sucks up the wine in a single slurp. The long straw delivers the glass's content into his mouth, over the restricting collar.

FATMAN

Yum... Good year. Let's drink to Stillman, shall we?
A wide shot of the heliport.

RAIDEN

If you destroy the Big Shell, you'll never collect your ransom.

FATMAN

Ransom? What are you talking about?

RAIDEN

Thirty billion dollars in cash!

FATMAN

*abruptly breaks into peals of laughter*

RAIDEN

!?

FATMAN

So that's what's going on, huh?
Solidus has made no demands. Fatman is working with the Patriots, so with his inside knowledge, he realizes that Raiden is being lied to by his CO, the Colonel, in order to recreate Shadow Moses.

RAIDEN

What the hell are you talking about?

FATMAN

Oh, you'll know soon enough. And I could care less what they plan to do. My ambitions are much more simple: To be the most famous bomber of them all. (Referring to the Patriots, but meant to make the players think he is talking about Solidus.)

RAIDEN

You're nuts. No one's going to give a damn about you.

FATMAN

Oh, yes they will. I'll go down in history -- as the man who beat Peter Stillman. That's the only reason I assisted them (the Patriots).

RAIDEN

Like hell you beat Stillman. He had your number.

FATMAN

*angry* What did you say?

RAIDEN

You have nothing of his courage or --

FATMAN

*sneering laughter*

RAIDEN

What're you laughing at!?

FATMAN

That crock died a dishonorable death... six months ago. (Referring to the downfall of Dead Cell.)

RAIDEN

Six months ago -- the liquidation of Dead Cell.

FATMAN

Call it what you want. Only the right stuff survived that hell. It set me free, you know. Opened the way to a new dimension...

FATMAN

*proudly* So that I could become the emperor among detonation devotees!

RAIDEN

You're nothing but a common criminal. And that's the only way people will ever remember you.
Fatman flings his glass to the floor, where it shatters into pieces.

FATMAN

How dare you! I'm an artist!
Raiden aims his gun at Fatman, but he whisks himself away behind a container.

FATMAN

That is why I dislike boorish military types.
Fatman sticks his head out and informs Raiden:

FATMAN

It's time to start the party...

FATMAN

This is how it works: I plant a bomb...

FATMAN

And it will explode soon after that.

FATMAN

If you prefer to stay in one piece, you'll have to disable my bombs.
Raiden catches sight of a bomb that has already been planted.
Fatman breaks into a sudden peal of laughter.

FATMAN

"Laugh and grow fat!" (This is Fatman's catchphrase.)

FATMAN

Let's move!
Fatman Dies 1
3D Cutscene 1
((MC) - Strut E Rooftop Heliport)
Fatman leans against a wall (position predetermined), wheezing. A blood stain spreads across the blast suit.
Fatman looks at his suit in dismay.
Raiden walks up to Fatman.

FATMAN

My suit... Oh no... I've nothing to wear to the party...

RAIDEN

The party's over for you.
Fatman looks up at Raiden.

FATMAN

That's what you think.

RAIDEN

What do you mean!?
Fatman extends one hand and presses a button of some sort. An electronic beep sounds, and Raiden goes on alert.

RAIDEN

What did you just do?
Fatman smiles widely. Since his mouth is hidden, his eyes need to express the glee.

RAIDEN

What is this?
He grabs the device from Fatman's hand. Fatman stares at his own slender fingers.

FATMAN

I have beautiful hands.

FATMAN

These delicate hands can craft works of art.
Raiden removes Fatman's collar, revealing his face. From this point on, lip flaps required. Raiden grills the now-fading Fatman.

RAIDEN

Answer me! What the hell is this!?

FATMAN

It's the switch for the biggest bomb in the entire place.

RAIDEN

!?
Raiden tries to destroy the controller.

FATMAN

No use. Once it's activated, there's no stopping the count.

RAIDEN

Where did you plant it?
Raiden looks around.

RAIDEN

Where is it?

FATMAN

Somewhere in this area. Don't worry, it's very close by.
Raiden pushes the barrel of his gun against Fatman's temple.

RAIDEN

Where is it!?

FATMAN

Go ahead, shoot me. I'm already dead...

RAIDEN

Damn!

FATMAN

Think you can find it? When it goes off, it'll take the Big Shell with it.

RAIDEN

Tell me where I can find the bomb.
Fatman only smiles.

FATMAN

That's your problem.
He starts to laugh out loud in unadulterated glee.

FATMAN

This is the highlight of the party! Bring it on I say. They'll be happy too. (Referring to the Patriots. Will players on notice this on subsequent playthroughs?)
Raiden rises.

FATMAN

I die here -- and start my legend. Too bad you won't be around to see the movies...

FATMAN

"Laugh and grow fat!"
Fatman dies, his face still wreathed in a grotesque smile.
Footnotes
1Radio waves of particularly short wavelengths (sub 3GHz). Used in a wide range of applications, including television and other communications, observation equipment such as radar, and even home microwave appliances.
Codec Conversations
•Colonel
After Meeting Stillman, Strut C
The dining hall

COLONEL

Looks like there's a lot of stuff laying about. Make sure not to scatter it around. The enemy will increase their security if they discover anything out of place.
*First time only

RAIDEN

Don't worry, I'm used to cleaning things up. Rose's room is...

ROSE

Jack, don't say any more!!

RAIDEN

*overpowered* Fine...

COLONEL

Err... anyway, the key element of covert operations is to not leave anything behind. Understand?
First info on Peter

COLONEL

Raiden, Stillman is a top-notch explosives technician. Follow his orders and disarm the explosives.

RAIDEN

Okay. But exactly who is Peter Stillman?

ROSE

Gotcha. I'll look him up. Hold on a moment.
Details on Peter

COLONEL

Raiden, Rosemary has some information to report.

ROSE

I looked into Mr. Peter Stillman's file.

ROSE

Full name is Peter Stillman. Known as "Peg-Legged Peter." He is a legendary bomb disposal technician.

ROSE

He is also a longtime instructor at the Naval School Explosive Ordnance Disposal, and a consultant for the NYPD bomb squad.

ROSE

But five years ago he lost his leg in an accident... and since then he hung up his gloves to focus on being a lecturer.

ROSE

He was called back into service because, as he said, he is the only explosives specialist who can stop Fatman.

ROSE

Although no longer an active consultant, he is still without a doubt the number one guy when it comes to disarming explosives. He should be very helpful to you.
Fatman

RAIDEN

Tell me what you know about Fatman.

ROSE

Okay, hold on a minute. I'll look him up.
Details on Fatman

COLONEL

Rosemary has completed her data search.

ROSE

I looked up information on Fatman.

ROSE

Fatman, the Emperor of Explosives. You've already heard how he manufactured an atomic bomb at the age of ten.

ROSE

He appears to have been known throughout the world of explosives since he was a child.

ROSE

He entered the Naval School Explosive Ordnance Disposal at Indian Head, and graduated at the top of his class. That's around the time that he met Stillman.

ROSE

He was assigned to the Nuclear Emergency Search Team (NEST). He quit soon after, though.

ROSE

After that he joined Dead Cell as an explosives specialist. He's been there ever since.
*If player hasn't asked Peter about him

ROSE

Why don't you ask Mr. Stillman? I'm sure he knows lots of other details about him.
Strut C bomb disposal - access the node
(1)

COLONEL

The sensor you received from Stillman visualizes the C4s detected odor on the radar screen.

COLONEL

This means that the radar must be enabled in order for you to take advantage of the sensor.
(2) *If player hasn't accessed node, all struts

COLONEL

Raiden, log into the node first.
*Strut A

COLONEL

Strut A's node is in the north block of the first floor.
*Strut B

COLONEL

Strut B's node is to the south of the transformer room.
*Strut C

COLONEL

Strut C's node is to the northwest, in the corner of the mess hall.
*Strut D

COLONEL

Strut D's node is in the east block of the lower section.
*Strut E

COLONEL

Strut E's node is in the northeast corner of the first floor.
*Strut F

COLONEL

Strut F's node is in a small room in the southwest block of B1.
*Struts A - F, continuation

COLONEL

Make doubly sure you stay out of the enemy's sight. If the radar goes offline, the sensor is useless. The C4s will become invisible to you again.
For any questions on bomb disposal, talk to Peter

COLONEL

Raiden, Stillman is an authority on bomb disposal. You need all the advice he can give. His frequency should be 140.25.
Near Strut C Dining Hall cardboard boxes

COLONEL

Raiden, look. There's a pile of cardboard boxes over there.

COLONEL

If you blend into the background, you should be able to trick the enemy.
*If player hides under a cardboard box that doesn't blend in

ROSE

Um, Jack... You seem to... kind of stand out.
Outside pantry door

COLONEL

Stillman is safe as long as he's in there. You worry about defusing those C4s instead.
•Snake
After Making Contact with Stillman
During bomb disposal event - advising player to eliminate the enemy first (1)

SNAKE

Raiden, don't get yourself worked up. It's safer to take out the enemy first, then look for the bomb.

SNAKE

Don't even think about searching for the bomb while looking over your shoulder for the enemy.

SNAKE

Knock them unconscious or take them out altogether first.
During bomb disposal event - advising player to eliminate the enemy first (2)

SNAKE

Looks like the enemy sentries have the defensive perimeters of each strut covered.

SNAKE

You'll be safe as long as they don't radio for more men, but if you're spotted, run for it. Find a good concealment and wait until the backup leaves.

SNAKE

You won't be able to defuse the bombs while you're being chased down, believe me.
During bomb disposal event - urging (1)

SNAKE

Raiden, I've frozen the first bomb. How are you doing?

RAIDEN

Nothing yet...

PETER

Pliskin, what was the exact location of the explosive?

SNAKE

The heliport. It was behind some cargo. Thought I was going to have some trouble with the patrols, but it was an easy job.

PETER

I see... (Something's not right).

SNAKE

What's the matter?

PETER

Nothing, really. Pliskin, just don't let your guard down. Don't relax even after you think you've defused it.

SNAKE

I know that. Raiden, Shell 1's all yours.

RAIDEN

Sure...
Bomb disposal progress report (1)

SNAKE

Raiden, another C4 down.

SNAKE

There was one planted pretty high up, on the ceiling. The coolant spray couldn't reach that far, so I had to get up on a stand and do it.
Bomb disposal progress report (2)

SNAKE

Raiden, I'm done with one more C4.

SNAKE

This one was in a spot so narrow I had to crawl in to get at it.
Bomb disposal progress report (3)

SNAKE

One more bomb defused.

SNAKE

There was one I managed to find only because I took a good look in First Person View. You should try it too.
Bomb disposal progress report (4)

SNAKE

Everything's going smoothly over here. I just finished defusing another C4.

SNAKE

For some reason, there was one planted on an enemy soldier's back...
Peter

RAIDEN

Pliskin, what do you know about Stillman?

SNAKE

He's a bomb disposal expert. Probably the best in the world.

RAIDEN

What else?

SNAKE

What do you mean?

RAIDEN

Like why he retired...

SNAKE

Are you here to gossip?

RAIDEN

... No.

SNAKE

Then get back to work defusing those C4s. If there's something you need to know about Stillman, go ask him yourself.
Fatman

SNAKE

Fatman... Supposedly he's nicknamed after an atomic bomb, but to me he's just a fat man.

SNAKE

Something straight out of a sideshow.

SNAKE

If he even has a bit of spare time, he spends it disassembling and assembling his Glock, over and over again. He can't stand to have his hands still.

SNAKE

He's extremely vain about his hands -- keeps his fingers as slender and soft as a woman's.

SNAKE

They say he's always looking at his hands, giving himself manicures.
Strut C women's bathroom

SNAKE

Raiden... here are you?

RAIDEN

I... um... I...

SNAKE

What're you embarrassed about? You're on a mission... Anything goes!

RAIDEN

Pliskin...

SNAKE

I've snuck into similar places in the past myself...

RAIDEN

Huh...?
•Peter
After Meeting Stillman
Outside Strut C pantry door

PETER

Never mind about me. Get on with disposing of those bombs.
After knocking on pantry door repeatedly

PETER

What are you doing there? Hurry up and dispose of those bombs.
*Peter gets annoyed if player continues to knock

PETER

I'm all right.

PETER

If you need to talk to me, use the Codec!

PETER

No need to worry.

PETER

Everything's okay in here. Get to work on those bombs.

PETER

You need to go and take care of the C4s now.

PETER

Stop bothering me!

PETER

Lay off the knocking already!!
Outside Strut C pantry door during Alert Mode

PETER

*pretending not to hold his breath* ...

PETER

I'm not going to open the door!
After player does their best to destroy the kitchen

PETER

What are you doing? Someone with such an appetite for destruction is probably not cut out for bomb disposal. Are you sure you're up to it?
Hinting at Sensor B

RAIDEN

Stillman, are you all right over there?

PETER

Yeah, no problem.

RAIDEN

You must be bored.

PETER

Hardly. Between dealing with you guys and calibrating this, I've got my hands full...

RAIDEN

What did you say?

PETER

Ah, nothing. It's just that it would be best if we didn't have to use this. Anyway, get to those bombs.
Bomb disposal report - Strut A

RAIDEN

This is Raiden. The C4 found in Strut A has been frozen and disposed of.

RAIDEN

Explosives were planted in the Pump Room on the first floor.
Bomb disposal report - Strut B

RAIDEN

Raiden reporting. The C4 in Strut B has been disposed of.

RAIDEN

The wall containing the transformer panel was set to blow.
Bomb disposal report - Strut C

RAIDEN

Raiden here. I took care of the C4 in Strut C.

RAIDEN

The ceiling of the Women's Bathroom was set to blow.
Bomb disposal report - Strut D

RAIDEN

This is Raiden. Disposal of the C4 in Strut D is complete.

RAIDEN

Explosives were planted on the maintenance hatch.
Bomb disposal report - Strut E

RAIDEN

Raiden reporting. All C4 in Strut E has been frozen and disposed of.

RAIDEN

The baggage moving on the conveyer belt was set to go off.
Bomb disposal report - Strut E roof

RAIDEN

Raiden here. The C4 reported on the roof of Strut E has been taken care of.
*If it was near the Harrier

RAIDEN

Explosives were planted on the Harrier 2 stationed on the roof.
*If it was on an enemy soldier's back

RAIDEN

The back of an enemy soldier was laced with explosives.
Bomb disposal report - Strut F

RAIDEN

This is Raiden. I just finished disposing of the C4 in Strut F.

RAIDEN

Found explosives on B1.
Bomb hints - basics

PETER

There are still bombs in that area that haven't been disposed of. Search carefully.
Bomb hints - Strut A crawling

PETER

No one's going to leave a bomb in a place that easy to reach. It would be more worthwhile to search convoluted areas that can't be reached simply by walking.
Bomb hints - Strut B door (1)

PETER

Raiden, a bomb's been detected in that vicinity.

RAIDEN

I know, but I don't see it anywhere.

PETER

Fatman takes pride in bluffing his opponents. Try putting everything back to how it should be.
Bomb hints - Strut C women's bathroom (1)

PETER

Raiden, there's still C4 in the strut where you are.

RAIDEN

Where?

PETER

Alright. Let me give you a hint.

PETER

Look for a place that guys have never entered up to this point. A special place that guys have wanted to enter but simply couldn't...

PETER

A place that you couldn't enter if the situation wasn't as such...
*If player is already in there

PETER

Oh... looks like you were in there already. My, my.
Bomb hints - Strut C ceiling

PETER

Raiden, there is no doubt that C4 is planted in that vicinity.

PETER

Up, down, left, right... Be sure to thoroughly examine your surroundings through the First Person View as you change location.
Bomb hints - Strut D multi-level space

PETER

Strut D, in which you're currently located, has a solid makeup. Thoroughly search the lower as well as the upper level.
Bomb hints - Strut D inside hatch

PETER

Raiden... it's not always the case that C4 is set in visible areas such as the floor and walls.

PETER

Thoroughly search the vicinity, as there's a possibility that bombs may have been placed in unseen areas.
Bomb hints - Strut D inside hatch obvious hint

PETER

See the maintenance hatch on the floor? Check the hatch by positioning yourself nearby it and pressing the Action Button.
Bomb hints - Strut E moving packages
*Packages moving around on Strut E 1F conveyor belt

PETER

Raiden, it would appear that some C4 has been planted on a moving object. Search carefully.
Bomb hints - Harrier

PETER

You won't be able to see the bombs with a quick glance. Search carefully with the First Person View. Try to look under things -- look everywhere.
Bomb hints - Harrier obvious hint

PETER

He certainly favors unusual locations. I didn't anticipate he'd put one there, though...

PETER

Right on their own equipment -- try searching the Harrier.
Bomb hints - rooftop (Struts E and A)

PETER

Raiden, the roof of that strut is accessible. Check there as well.
Bomb hints - 1F (Struts E and A)

PETER

Raiden, there's a possibility that C4 was planted indoors as well as on the roof. Go inside and confirm this.
Bomb hints - Strut F jumping (drop down from hanging)

PETER

Strut F has a solid makeup, with areas that can't be accessed simply by walking. If you jump off from the top, there should be an area that you can access.
No bombs on connecting bridges (if player is currently on one)

PETER

It appears that Fatman placed bombs within each of the struts. It's likely there are no bombs planted on the connecting bridges.

PETER

Head for the struts for which you have not yet finished disposing of the C4.
•Colonel
CD Connecting Bridge (After Meeting Peter)
After seeing a man under a cardboard box

RAIDEN

Colonel, I just saw this guy go running by wearing a cardboard box.

COLONEL

A cardboard box?

RAIDEN

Who do you think he was? A Dead Cell?

COLONEL

The Dead Cells are a bunch of weirdos, that's for sure, but they don't wear cardboard boxes.

ROSE

I'll look into it.

RAIDEN

I'm counting on you.
Cardboard box man (2)

COLONEL

Raiden, Rosemary has something to report.

ROSE

Jack, I looked into that guy a few minutes ago wearing a cardboard box, but...

RAIDEN

Did you find anything?

ROSE

No. There is no corresponding data in the files for neither Dead Cell nor Colonel Gurlukovich's private army.

COLONEL

How about as a surviving member of SEAL Team 10?

ROSE

Of course, I looked into that possibility too, but...

RAIDEN

You didn't find anything?

ROSE

No. I'm sorry I couldn't be of any help.

RAIDEN

Wonder who the heck he was...?

COLONEL

Raiden, be on the lookout!
•Snake
CD Connecting Bridge
The mysterious box man
*After witnessing Snake hiding under a cardboard box

RAIDEN

Pliskin, I saw someone wearing a cardboard box just now...?

SNAKE

*feigns ignorance* A box? I don't know anything about that. You sure you weren't imagining things?

RAIDEN

Of course I'm sure. Do you think it's one of the members of Dead Cell?

SNAKE

How should I know?

RAIDEN

I don't want to fight someone like that...

SNAKE

Why not?

RAIDEN

Because it looked so dumb. Anyone who's willing to be seen like that must be completely insane. I mean, he's a psycho; there's no question about it.

SNAKE

*a little hurt* Um, yeah...
•Colonel
EF Connecting Bridge (After Meeting Peter)
EF Connecting Bridge - Claymores

COLONEL

Raiden, there are Claymore mines planted there for sure.
*If player doesn't have the Mine Detector
(1)

COLONEL

The risk of proceeding is too great. Acquire a mine detector first.
(2)

COLONEL

Acquire a mine detector. Look on B1 of Strut E like that man just suggested.
(3)

COLONEL

Acquire a mine detector. Look on the first floor of Strut E like that man just suggested.
(4)

COLONEL

Acquire a mine detector. Look on Strut F like that man just suggested.
*If player has the Mine Detector
(1) If player has already connected to node

COLONEL

Select the mine detector and the mines will show up on the radar.

COLONEL

Avoid the mines altogether, or pass over them and pick them up while Crawling.

COLONEL

Make sure you're not spotted by patrols on the second floor of Strut E.
(2) If player hasn't connected to node yet

COLONEL

The mine detector interfaces with the radar to pinpoint the location of the mines. The first step is to enable the radar.

ROSE

Log in to the node in Strut E or F.
Who is Mr. X?

RAIDEN

Colonel, do you know anything about Mr. X?

COLONEL

He is not a member of the FOXHOUND unit.

RAIDEN

He called himself Deepthroat, almost like he was the Shadow Moses...

COLONEL

Raiden, I know what you are trying to say, but that possibility is nil.

RAIDEN

...

ROSE

Jack, I'll look into it for you. Hold on a moment.
Details on Mr. X

COLONEL

Rosemary has dug up some information on Mr. X.

ROSE

Jack, I looked into Mr. X... I mean, Deepthroat.

ROSE

During the Shadow Moses incident Solid Snake did receive help from a guy who called himself Deepthroat.

ROSE

His true identity appears to be that of former FOXHOUND unit member Gray Fox.

RAIDEN

Gray Fox, huh...

ROSE

Correct. His real name is Frank Jaeger. The only member of FOXHOUND allowed to use the title of Fox; he was its best member.

ROSE

In Outer Heaven he holed up in the stronghold ahead of Snake. He helped him, and brought an end to the standoff.

ROSE

But in Zanzibar he joined forces with Big Boss and became the leader of the upheaval. That's where he fought and lost to Snake.

ROSE

Fox was mortally injured, and was picked up by the military.

ROSE

After that it looks like he was used as the guinea pig in power exoskeleton and gene therapy experiments.

RAIDEN

Power exoskeleton?

ROSE

Cyborg ninjas, as some people called them. Detailed records were lost in the research center fire, though...

RAIDEN

After that he ended up in Shadow Moses?

ROSE

Yes. But why he showed up there is not in the records.

ROSE

Some people believe that it was to get revenge against Snake, but there is nothing definite to go by.

RAIDEN

So now he's...

ROSE

No, he died in Shadow Moses. That is for sure.

RAIDEN

So, then who is Mr. X?

ROSE

I don't know. But be careful.
•Snake
EF Connecting Bridge
The location of the Mine Detector
*First time only

RAIDEN

Pliskin, there are landmines in this area...

SNAKE

There should be a mine detector on Floor B1 of Strut E.

SNAKE

There should be a mine detector on the first floor of Strut E.

SNAKE

There should be a mine detector in Strut F.

RAIDEN

How do you know?

SNAKE

Use your head. They can't see those Claymore mines either, even if they did the planting. So they need to keep a mine detector handy.

RAIDEN

I wouldn't have thought of that. You're right.

SNAKE

I don't think they taught you this in all that VR training, but intuition counts for something in battle. Use your wits and senses to detect the danger. Got it?
•Colonel
Strut F (After Meeting Peter)
Strut F Warehouse - after acquiring weapon

COLONEL

Raiden, I see you found a weapon.

RAIDEN

Why are there weapons here, of all places? The Big Shell is supposed to be just a facility for marine filtration, right?

ROSE

The terrorists probably brought it in with them.

RAIDEN

Dunno, looks like it's been here from before them.

ROSE

What're you saying?

COLONEL

Raiden, there is no time for armchair theories. Concentrate on the task at hand.

RAIDEN

Roger that.
•Colonel
Strut E (After Meeting Peter)
Strut E Parcel Room - hide behind packages

COLONEL

I don't see a lot of adequate cover in that area.

ROSE

There's some cargo on those conveyor belts. That's about it.

COLONEL

Good thinking.

COLONEL

Raiden, take cover behind the cargo on the conveyor belt. Match your movement to the belt's.
Surveillance camera

COLONEL

There's a surveillance camera. Don't stray into its sight.

COLONEL

Stay out of the camera's field of vision. There's a blind spot right underneath the unit; flatten yourself against the wall and move forward.
Surveillance camera - how to avoid (line of sight)

COLONEL

You can also run for it while the camera is pointed the other way. Time it carefully.
Surveillance camera - how to avoid (chaff)

COLONEL

Use the chaff to create electronic interference. The camera will be blind during that time.
Surveillance camera - how to avoid (destroy)

COLONEL

Surveillance cameras can be shot out.

COLONEL

However, someone will show up sooner or later to investigate if the camera stops functioning. If you do choose to do it, you should be prepared to leave the scene quickly.
Edge of heliport

COLONEL

You won't survive a fall into the sea from that height. Stay away from the edge.
Near Harrier

COLONEL

Raiden, that's a Harrier 2 you see over there.
*First time only

RAIDEN

That's what shot down the SEAL chopper?

COLONEL

That's right.

COLONEL

Unfortunately, the weapons you have at the moment aren't up to the task of neutralizing this plane. Leave it alone for now.
•Snake
Strut E
After Olga cutscene - about Olga

SNAKE

Raiden... don't ever turn your back on that Olga woman.

SNAKE

Olga Gurlukovich... Daughter of Colonel Sergei Gurlukovich, ex-GRU and former Spetsnaz commander...

SNAKE

She's the leader of Colonel Gurlukovich's private army that's been wandering around the Big Shell.

SNAKE

Those men were gathered by Colonel Gurlukovich. Following his death, she inherited his command and now exercises full control.

SNAKE

Her father's name was widely respected throughout the old Soviet regime and he was the goal of just about every military man.

RAIDEN

Why would a respected soldier become a leader of those cutthroats?

SNAKE

The collapse of the republic resulted in a lot of unemployed soldiers.

SNAKE

Most found themselves suddenly cast out into the civilian world, hopelessly lost.

SNAKE

The Colonel took these men in...

SNAKE

He organized a mercenary army, and led his men from battle to battle in various disputed regions around the world... hoping that one day he would rebuild his homeland.

SNAKE

Rumor has it that during the Shadow Moses incident, he planned to rendezvous with Liquid Snake's men and assist in their uprising.

SNAKE

I assume that the revolt figured into his reconstruction plans for the Soviet regime.

SNAKE

I also heard that Ocelot -- Liquid's right-hand man -- was an old friend of the Colonel's back in the old days of the Soviet Union.

SNAKE

In any case, Olga inherited her father's military genius and has become a force to be reckoned with.

SNAKE

She was born and raised on the battlefield, and she's as tough as she looks. Not my ideal choice for a date...

RAIDEN

You sound like you've met her.

SNAKE

No. I haven't had the pleasure. Just remember what I said... don't turn your back on her.
•Colonel
Strut D (After Meeting Peter)
Strut D sediment pool, in front of Shell 2 door
(1)

COLONEL

The connecting bridge to Shell 2 is on the other side of that door. It's inaccessible unless you have a Level 3 card.
(2)

COLONEL

For now, concentrate on neutralizing the C4s on Shell 1. We'll have to trust that man to take care of Shell 2...
Near maintenance hatch

COLONEL

Raiden, at your feet there's a hatch for pipe or gauge maintenance.

COLONEL

Face the hatch and push the Action Button to open it. There may be something you can use, so check the inside thoroughly.
•Colonel
Near End of Bomb Disposal
Peter's headed for Strut H

COLONEL

Raiden, leave the odorless C4 on Strut H to Stillman.

COLONEL

Your job is to dispose of the C4s left on Shell 1. Locate every last one.
After first bomb is disposed of - there's definitely something off about Pliskin

COLONEL

Raiden, how is Pliskin doing?

RAIDEN

Looks like he's doing fine.

COLONEL

Stillman said it, too. There is something strange about that guy. Don't let your guard down. Understood?
Before acquiring Sensor B

COLONEL

Raiden, go pick up the new sensor Stillman told you about -- the one that can detect odorless C4s.

COLONEL

Head for the kitchen off Strut C's mess hall. That's the room Stillman was hiding in, and he's left the sensor there for you.
Player has Sensor B

COLONEL

Raiden, stay on your toes. The unscented C4 charges are still out there.

COLONEL

You probably missed the ones at the bottom of Strut A. Head for the bottom of Strut A.
After acquiring Sensor B
*If player is somewhere other than Strut A

COLONEL

Raiden, get to the bottom of Strut A ASAP! Engaging the enemy would waste valuable time; avoid detection at all costs!
*If player is on Strut A

COLONEL

Raiden, get a move on. Use the elevator on the roof to get down to the bottom of Strut A.
Peter's death

RAIDEN

Colonel, Stillman is dead.

COLONEL

I know. Pull yourself together, Raiden.

RAIDEN

I can't -- I can't do this alone.

ROSE

Jack, are you listening? All right, calm down.

RAIDEN

Stillman is dead. There are no more explosives specialists.

ROSE

You're fine. I won't let you die.

RAIDEN

Rose?

ROSE

All right, then, is Sensor B equipped?

RAIDEN

Yes...

ROSE

See if it responds or not. Jack, no matter what, you have to bring an end to this crisis.

RAIDEN

Okay.
Aftermath of the explosion

RAIDEN

Colonel, how far-reaching was the explosion?

COLONEL

We are currently surveying minute details.

RAIDEN

How about Pliskin?

COLONEL

I don't know.

RAIDEN

I hope he is okay.

COLONEL

Raiden, if you have enough time to worry about that guy, then get back to bomb disposal. Do you understand?
Odorless bomb event - bottom of Strut A

COLONEL

Raiden, there's a C4 somewhere on the bottom of Strut A, where you are. Select Sensor B and get to work.
*Elevator hall

RAIDEN

There's nothing here.
*Connecting passageway

RAIDEN

Nothing here either.
Near bomb in deep sea dock

RAIDEN

Colonel, the sensor's picking up something.

COLONEL

It must be somewhere nearby. We're running out of time -- locate the bomb as quickly as you can.
Odorless C4 obvious hint

COLONEL

Raiden, look at the underside of that submersible -- that's a C4. Freeze it down right now.
•Snake
Near End of Bomb Disposal
About the odorless C4 at the bottom of Strut H

SNAKE

Raiden, like I said before, there's a huge load of C4s at the bottom of Strut H that won't show up on the radar.

SNAKE

The old man's right -- there's got to be the same thing in Shell 1. Watch your back.
Peter can walk

SNAKE

I just got a call from Pete. He made it to Shell 2 -- I guess he really can run.

RAIDEN

Pliskin...

SNAKE

I'll take good care of Pete. Don't worry.
Go get Sensor B

SNAKE

Raiden, go pick up that sensor for odorless C4's.

SNAKE

It should be in that room in Strut C where you found Pete.
Get to the bottom of Strut A

SNAKE

Raiden, the odorless C4s should be at the bottom of Strut A. Head to Strut A's bottom level now!
•Peter
Near End of Bomb Disposal
Dispose of the last one (Codec call)

RAIDEN

Stillman, where are you?

PETER

I haven't arrived at Strut H yet.

RAIDEN

Are you all right on your own?

PETER

Believe it or not, I used to be a cop. As far as the enemy, Pliskin is already taking care of that for me.

PETER

But it's hard to just run after not having done so in five years. My legs just don't work like they used to.
*Second and subsequent times

PETER

I should arrive at Strut H by the time you finish disposing of the C4 in Shell 1. Be sure to take care of it.
Go get Sensor B

PETER

Raiden, I've readied a sensor that's capable of detecting odorless C4.

PETER

It's stashed in the safe I was hiding in, in the Strut C pantry. Fetch it.
*If player already has Sensor B

PETER

If odorless C4 is planted in Shell 1, it's going to be at the bottom of Strut A. Head over there, Raiden.
While investigating the odorless C4

RAIDEN

Stillman, how are you doing over there?

PETER

I'm checking it now. It just can't simply be a bomb that doesn't respond to an odor. There must be something else planted there.

RAIDEN

Exactly what is it?

PETER

I'm not certain. Give me a little more time.
Get to Strut A

PETER

The countdown has been initiated. Listen up -- time is absolutely critical. Hurry to the bottom of Strut A by the shortest possible route.
*First time only

RAIDEN

Should I apply coolant to the bomb in the same way as before?

PETER

Wait, I'm still not sure yet. I'll try testing it out here first. For now, get yourself to the bottom of Strut A ASAP.
•Colonel
After Odorless Bomb Disposal
Take the elevator up

COLONEL

Raiden, all the bombs have been defused. The President's safe return is now top priority. First, take the elevator to the upper section of Strut A.
Fortune
*If player hasn't heard about Fortune before

RAIDEN

Colonel... who exactly is that woman?

COLONEL

Her name is Fortune. She leads Dead Cell.

ROSE

Hang on a moment, I'll look her up for you.
Details on Fortune
*If player hasn't heard about Fortune before

COLONEL

Rosemary researched Fortune for you.

ROSE

Jack, here's the data I found on Fortune.

ROSE

She goes by Fortune. She leads Dead Cell. Her real name is Helena Dolph Jackson.

ROSE

Two years ago, her father, Commandant of the Marine Corps Scott Dolph, was killed in a training accident.

ROSE

Her husband was the former Dead Cell leader, Colonel Jackson... Died in Captivity... my data says.

ROSE

After her husband's death, she joined the military.

ROSE

She didn't have any combat experience, but was soon singled out for a particular trait and was reassigned to Dead Cell.

RAIDEN

What trait?

ROSE

Luck. She was real lucky, like miraculously lucky. Wherever she went, bullets curved away, and missions always ended in success.

RAIDEN

Is that some kind of joke?

ROSE

I thought so, too. But there is not a single record of her ever being wounded. Not even a scratch.

ROSE

Jack, be careful, please.
Fortune battle - I can't beat her
*First time only

RAIDEN

What is she, a witch!? For some reason, I can't hit her!

COLONEL

I don't understand. She's obviously impervious to attack...

RAIDEN

What are my options?

COLONEL

Disengage her and get out.

RAIDEN

The elevator is still upstairs. My retreat's been cut off.

COLONEL

Hang on until the elevator comes down again. Your weapons can't hurt her, and you need to stay alive. Use whatever cover you can find and evade her.
Railgun specifications

COLONEL

Raiden, Rose did a bit of research on Fortune's weapon.

ROSE

The big rifle that she carries appears to be a personal rail gun.

RAIDEN

Rail gun?

ROSE

Yes -- an electromagnetic gun that fires bullets with magnetic force. As a movable conductor it uses plasma electrons to boost acceleration capabilities.

ROSE

The kinetic energy of the ammunition is approximately ten megajoules. Incidentally, that of a 140mm smooth bore gun ammunition is twenty megajoules.

RAIDEN

I can't believe something like that even exists!

ROSE

It's not available, though. What she has is only a prototype.

RAIDEN

That thing sure doesn't sound like a prototype!

ROSE

Problems with the rail plasma and inner-rail electromagnetic release have yet to be solved.

ROSE

Evaluations exist that criticize it as unacceptable as a field weapon... because of the high risk of accidental discharge.

RAIDEN

But hers doesn't...?

ROSE

... Most likely... probably because she's lucky.

RAIDEN

Unbelievable...

ROSE

Either way, it's a weapon that she alone can wield, that's for sure.

RAIDEN

Yeah, and a weapon that's uncontrollable, too.

ROSE

Be very careful, Jack.
Hide behind containers

COLONEL

Fortune's rail gun packs some power. A direct hit will kill you. Do not present her with a target under any condition, stay behind cover.
Keep your distance

COLONEL

Don't even think about attempting melee combat. Keep your distance and evade her attacks. Just buy some time until the elevator arrives!
There's no turning back!

COLONEL

Raiden, it's no use. That door is jammed shut with rubble.

COLONEL

There's no way out. You're going to have to manage.
After start of Strut E bomb countdown - stay on the move
*First time only

RAIDEN

Colonel, what about Fatman's bomb?

COLONEL

It's counting down.

RAIDEN

I'm running out of time myself over here...

ROSE

Jack, the elevator's started moving down. It should be there soon. Please, just hang on until it does!

COLONEL

Raiden, the elevator should be down there any moment. Just stay out of her reach until then.
After Fortune encounter - the Harrier

RAIDEN

Colonel, do the terrorists have a Harrier?

COLONEL

Yes, an AV8B Harrier 2 designed for the Marines.

COLONEL

It is a V/STOL attack aircraft outfitted with a 25mm gun, air-to-air missiles, and anti-ground rockets.

COLONEL

It's not something you want to try to take on in a SEAL helicopter.

RAIDEN

Yeah, even more so if unprotected. Colonel, where did they get such a weapon?

COLONEL

I don't know.

RAIDEN

Are they really just run-of-the-mill terrorists?

COLONEL

Relax, Raiden. Right now just think about your mission at hand. Do you understand?
After Fortune battle - get to the heliport

COLONEL

The clock is ticking, Raiden. Get to the heliport on the roof of Strut E.
Get your weapons in order (Strut F)

COLONEL

Raiden, I expect your encounter with Fatman will involve combat. There isn't a lot of time, but if you're not happy with your equipment, now is the time to get everything ready.
Before Fatman battle, heliport

COLONEL

Raiden, there should be a C4 planted somewhere on the heliport. Locate it ASAP! If it detonates, we're finished.
•Colonel
Fatman Battle
Fatman battle - take care of the bombs

COLONEL

Fatman will plant the C4s, then activate the timer.

COLONEL

Once the timer is online, the countdown begins. Detonation takes place at the zero count. If that happens, the mission fails.
*Second and subsequent times

COLONEL

When you see him push the timer button, use the coolant spray to freeze the C4 before the countdown ends.
Time until detonation

COLONEL

The countdown timer will tell you how long you have until the C4s detonate.

COLONEL

When the count goes to zero, the C4 will blow and we will be finished. Defuse the bombs before that can happen.
You can only damage his head

COLONEL

Raiden, as you can see, Fatman is wearing a blast suit.
*First time only

ROSE

A blast suit?

RAIDEN

It's protective clothing worn for bomb disposal work. Gunfire can't really penetrate that thing either.

COLONEL

You can do very little damage through the suit. Use the First Person View to go for the head.
*On higher difficulties

COLONEL

His guard will be completely down. Push the advantage and go for a head shot.
Bomb blast suit facts and figures

COLONEL

Fatman is wearing a bomb blast suit.

COLONEL

It is worn when disarming explosives, and protects its wearer from the blast, heat, and shards. Essentially it resembles a bulletproof vest, made out of special material.

COLONEL

The front of the head and body are guarded by a laminated ballistic insert.

COLONEL

The back, too, is guarded with a protector to ease the impact on the spine from a fall after a blast.

COLONEL

Attacks to his torso will likely have little effect.

COLONEL

At first it might look to be cumbersome, but in fact it is made to be extremely flexible... so as not to hinder bomb disposal.

COLONEL

One could even do apparatus gymnastics like the pommel horse or parallel bars in it.

COLONEL

The problem is that it is poorly ventilated, and having it on for long periods of time runs the risk of leaving its wearer mildly overheated.

COLONEL

However, the suit is equipped with a cooling system like a space suit in which the coolant is run through inner-suit tubes.

COLONEL

He will not likely overheat in the suit.

COLONEL

With those configurations, however, the total weight of the suit should exceed fifty kilograms.

COLONEL

That's too heavy for skating around. An impact might easily make him lose his balance and he'll fall down.

COLONEL

Shooting a part of the suit with a gun will do minimal damage at best. Aim for exposed areas of his head. If he falls down, when he tries to get up is your best chance.
Glock facts and figures

COLONEL

Fatman carries a Glock 18, a fully-automatic version of the Glock 17 pistol.

COLONEL

It can fire twenty 9mm bullets per second. Getting caught in its line of fire is extremely dangerous.

RAIDEN

Weren't machine pistols originally used for VIP security assignments, though? In order to stop terrorists?

COLONEL

Correct. As portable weapons with major firepower.

RAIDEN

That he would have such a gun, and use it with only one hand...

COLONEL

Don't forget, he's a member of Dead Cell.

RAIDEN

...

COLONEL

What's more, he walks around wearing that suit. He must have a lot of faith in his own strength.

COLONEL

Don't engage him in a firefight from the front. Attack him when he reloads.
Easier to target his head after he falls (while fallen)

COLONEL

There's a long lag between the time he falls down to the point where he manages to get up. His guard will be completely down. Push the advantage and go for a head shot.
Multiple attacks will knock him down

COLONEL

The blast suit can't protect him from the impact of the shot itself.

COLONEL

A series of rapid fire will knock him off-balance and create an opportunity for attack. Use it.
Claymores are also effective

COLONEL

You can also anticipate Fatman's course and plant a Claymore in his path.
Careful when hanging

COLONEL

Raiden, you're completely defenseless while Hanging. If he manages to knock you off that ledge, you wouldn't survive the fall. Keep that in mind.
Fatman has a gun too

COLONEL

Bombs are not the only weapons Fatman has. He's also carrying a machine pistol, and he'll use it if you offer yourself up as a target.

COLONEL

Stay hidden!
The remaining bomb after Fatman dies

COLONEL
