Raiden, Fatman may be dead but don't relax just yet; there are still bombs set by him remaining. Dispose of all the bombs.
Fatman's final bomb
(1)

RAIDEN

Colonel, where's that bomb?

COLONEL

We have no information on that. Sweep the area.

ROSE

Hurry, Jack!
(2)

COLONEL

The bomb has to be somewhere on the heliport. Use whatever means necessary to locate it.
Final bomb hint (1)

COLONEL

Raiden, have you located the bomb yet?

RAIDEN

No, not yet.

ROSE

Hurry, Jack! We don't have a lot of time left!

COLONEL

He wouldn't have had the time to find a good hiding place; it must be somewhere near him. Take a closer look.
Final bomb obvious hint

COLONEL

Raiden, the bomb?

RAIDEN

Nothing yet.

COLONEL

Where is that damned thing...? We're running out of time.

ROSE

Have you checked under Fatman's body?

RAIDEN

What? Of course not. It can't be there.

ROSE

You don't know that.

RAIDEN

OK, what evidence do you have that it's there?

ROSE

Just a hunch, all right?

RAIDEN

Look Rose -- I know what I'm doing, and this is my life on the line. You don't have any experience in this type of work, so ju...

ROSE

...

COLONEL

Raiden, don't turn down a good suggestion when you hear one. Check it out.
Section 5
After Fatman Battle – Harrier 2 Battle
Fatman Bomb Disposal End 1
Codec Call 1
(mandatory incoming call from the Colonel)
The last of Fatman's bombs is under his body. Raiden, having located it, freezes it with the Coolant Spray. Once the process is complete, the Colonel calls in.

COLONEL

Good work, Raiden. Looks like all the bombs are neutralized. One of their main leverages is now gone. That leaves --

RAIDEN

*interrupts* Colonel, Fatman didn't seem to know about the ransom demands.

COLONEL

*lies easily* Intentionally kept in the dark, I'd say. He seemed to be coming from a very different place from the other terrorists.

RAIDEN

*unconvinced* Hmm...

COLONEL

Raiden, a lot of hostages -- our President included -- are still in danger. Keep your mind focused on protecting them.

RAIDEN

*still unconvinced* ... What are my orders?

COLONEL

Rescue the President.

RAIDEN

We have no idea where he is.

COLONEL

You haven't been in the central core yet. I suggest you start there...
Sound of another call.

RAIDEN

Wait, I have another call. Want me to take it?

COLONEL

No, I'll go offline. Best to keep our presence unknown.
The Colonel signs off.
Pliskin radios in!

PLISKIN

How're you doing, kid?

RAIDEN

Pliskin!? Is everything all right?

PLISKIN

Could be better. Looks like I was out cold for a while.

RAIDEN

How did you manage to stay alive?

PLISKIN

Had a little help from a friend.

RAIDEN

Friend?
Snake once again changes the subject.

PLISKIN

What about the bomb?

RAIDEN

Defused. And Fatman too.

PLISKIN

That's good news.

RAIDEN

How's Shell 2?

PLISKIN

It's a mess. The bomb crippled H Strut.

RAIDEN

What about the toxins?

PLISKIN

The what?

RAIDEN

If the Big Shell blows up, the explosion is expected to produce massive amounts of toxins...

PLISKIN

Never heard anything about that. (The Colonel has lied to make the situation similar to that at Shadow Moses.)

RAIDEN

Huh?

PLISKIN

Well, looks like there's not much danger of that in any case. But the central core is starting to flood. It won't last much longer.

RAIDEN

*unconvinced* What about the President and the other hostages?

PLISKIN

They weren't in Shell 2. They must be in Shell 1.

RAIDEN

We need to get the hostages out of here now.

PLISKIN

It's too far from Manhattan for a swim.

RAIDEN

What about the lifeboats?

PLISKIN

There doesn't seem to be any. Doesn't make sense.

RAIDEN

So a chopper is our only extraction?

PLISKIN

Right. And it comes with a passenger limit. Intel has it that there are about thirty hostages.

RAIDEN

It'd take more than a single trip.

PLISKIN

We'll have to come back.

RAIDEN

Can you pilot a chopper?

PLISKIN

No, but I brought a gearhead with me. He's a good guy. I'll introduce you later.

RAIDEN

Pliskin, I'm on the heliport right now, but I don't see their Harrier. It's out somewhere.

PLISKIN

We'd better move now then. Our chances with a Harrier after us are close to nothing.

RAIDEN

Do you know where the President is?

PLISKIN

No. That one's all yours.

RAIDEN

The President is at the top of our rescue list. These are our orders, Lieutenant J.G..

PLISKIN

Your orders. Not mine.

RAIDEN

What?

PLISKIN

See you later.
Enter the Ninja 1
3D Cutscene 1
((MC) - Strut E Rooftop Heliport)
Raiden, having disposed of all the bombs, leaves the heliport to search for the President.
He is about to go down the heliport stairs when the new Ninja leaps laterally into view. Its movements are clearly those of Olga, and the scene is crafted to remind players of the Olga encounter sequences. The Ninja's form is similar to the Cyborg Ninja from MGS1 (and its entrance resembles that Ninja's too—part of the S3 Plan). Those who played MGS1 should believe this to be the same character. A closer look, however, reveals different details that mark it as a newer model. The build is androgynous rather than feminine. The lines are not as sharp as the previous one's either, since this Ninja is wearing a suit, while the previous one had an exoskeleton grafted onto his body.

NINJA (OLGA)

You passed with flying colors. (Foreshadowing referring to how Raiden passed Fatman's test, which was put in place by the Patriots.)
Raiden points his gun at the strange intruder. The appearance of the Ninja is accompanied by the faintest hint of the "Nose Electric Railway" sound effect (MGS1).

RAIDEN

Identify yourself!
The Ninja draws its blade and holds it out toward Raiden. The gesture seems more like a defensive move (indicating that its intent is not hostile) rather than a prelude to an attack.

NINJA

I'm like you... I have no name.
The Ninja bears traces of its predecessor, such as the sensor eyes surrounding its head. The body is bulkier, however, compared to the slim former model; it appears to be wearing the suit rather than being a part of it.
For a second, the face shield loses its opacity and shows a glimmer of a face (Olga). The moment passes too quickly to identify the person, but it drives home the fact that there is a human being inside the suit.

RAIDEN

*recognizes the voice from the Codec call he received* Are you Mr. X?

NINJA (OLGA)

Hm. If you like. But come, let's get out of the open.
The Ninja has its guard completely down. Raiden begins to relax.

NINJA (OLGA)

Follow me.
It puts the sword away and starts walking briskly. Fade out before it reaches the staircase.
Enter the Ninja 2
3D Cutscene 2
((MC) - Strut E 1F)
They move to Strut E 1F (eastern guard passage), in the area facing the node. A view of the sea beyond the railing. The spot is relatively protected from outside eyes. Raiden still has his gun in his hand, but it is not pointed at the Ninja. The Ninja's sword is sheathed.
The Ninja rests its hands on the railing and looks at the water, back turned to Raiden.

RAIDEN

Are you with FOXHOUND too?
The Ninja turns around.

NINJA

Neither enemy nor friend.

NINJA (OLGA)

Just a messenger from the La-li-lu-le-lo.
A burst of static obscures the word "Patriots." Raiden is under constant digital surveillance, and the name "Patriots" is censored out.
The Ninja taps the side of its neck to mime the Codec (internal communication) to Raiden. The Codec rings.
Enter the Ninja 3
Codec Call 1
(internal communication with the Ninja)
Codec call. Static in the Ninja's window.

NINJA (OLGA)

This is safer, I think.

RAIDEN

Safe from what?

NINJA (OLGA)

Eavesdropping, of course.

RAIDEN

All right -- why did you contact me?

NINJA (OLGA)

I've been ordered to give you backup, including the relaying of necessary intel.

RAIDEN

Ordered by whom?

NINJA (OLGA)

...

RAIDEN

Why won't you identify yourself?

NINJA (OLGA)

There is no need for you to know.

RAIDEN

I'll decide whether I need to know.

NINJA (OLGA)

You are not yet trusted to make such decisions.

RAIDEN

...

NINJA (OLGA)

I'll tell you something you do need to know, instead.

NINJA (OLGA)

The current location of the President.

RAIDEN

What!?

NINJA (OLGA)

Or rather, the person who knows the current location of the President.

RAIDEN

Who is it?

NINJA (OLGA)

A Secret Service1 agent named Ames, currently being held with the other hostages.

RAIDEN

Secret Service, huh.

NINJA (OLGA)

The head of the President's security detail. Ames has been fitted with the same type of VIP nanomachine system as the President. If you're within range, you should be able to communicate.

RAIDEN

Why are you telling me this?

NINJA (OLGA)

Do I need to repeat myself?

RAIDEN

There's no reason for me to believe any of this. You understand that?

NINJA (OLGA)

Of course. But you also have no choice but to believe.

RAIDEN

...

NINJA (OLGA)

Do you have any other leads?

RAIDEN

... Where are those hostages?

NINJA (OLGA)

Ha ha ha ha. (Laughing because he's suddenly motivated.)
Enter the Ninja 4
3D Cutscene 3
(NM hostage room)
Situational briefing (hint) cutscene.
An overhead shot of the B1 core interior. The camera captures the hostages without closing the distance.
Every hostage (male and female) is dressed in a black suit. Their expressions cannot be read due to the blindfolds over their faces. Their attire and appearances are uniform throughout, as one might expect for a conservation group.
Russian mercenaries (in Kevlar vests) patrol the room. Their outfits are identical to what Raiden will receive.

NINJA (OLGA)

The hostages are being held in the B1 conference hall in the Shell 1 core. You'll find Ames there.

RAIDEN

What does he look like?

NINJA (OLGA)

We don't know if it is indeed a "he." I've never met this person either.

RAIDEN

How am I supposed to look for someone without even a description?

NINJA (OLGA)

Use your ears.

RAIDEN

What's that supposed to mean?

NINJA (OLGA)

Ames has a pacemaker. You'll be able to hear the machine sound in the heartbeat.

RAIDEN

You expect me to walk up to these hostages... and listen to every one of their heartbeats?

NINJA (OLGA)

The sound is too minute to detect unamplified. You'd be captured immediately.

RAIDEN

So what am I supposed to do?

NINJA (OLGA)

Use the directional microphone.

NINJA (OLGA)

There's one somewhere in the core.
Enter the Ninja 5
3D Cutscene 4
((MC + KF) – Strut E 1F)

NINJA (OLGA)

Take this.
The Ninja hands Raiden a Level 2 card. Remain in First Person View as Raiden reaches out and receives the card. Raiden acquires the Level 2 card.

NINJA (OLGA)

This security card will unlock all Level 2 security doors, including the one into the core.
The Ninja's voice changes to that of the DARPA chief in MGS1.

NINJA (DARPA CHIEF)

It's called a PAN card. It works together with your body's own electronic field.

NINJA (OLGA)

And watch yourself. The core is more heavily guarded than any other section of the Big Shell. You'll get nowhere dressed like that.
The Ninja stares pointedly at Raiden's Skull Suit. Raiden looks down at it also, struck by the comment.

NINJA (OLGA)

Try this instead.
The Ninja tosses Raiden some Russian merc camo fatigues, complete with vest. Raiden catches it. The grunts wear tiger stripe urban camo.

RAIDEN

One of the terrorists'?
Enter the Ninja 6
3D Cutscene 5
(Core 1F Elevator Hall)
Situational briefing (hint) cutscene.
Elevator hall in the 1F of the core section. The camera is moving.

NINJA (OLGA)

The surveillance camera won't let you on the elevator without the right uniform.

RAIDEN

You want me to disguise myself?

NINJA (OLGA)

Men assigned to the core and those on perimeter duty are given different colors to wear. Your new outfit will work in some areas, not others.
The core guards wear the brownish camo from the Tanker Chapter, the plant perimeter sentries are dressed in urban camo.

NINJA (OLGA)

The uniform alone won't fool them either.

RAIDEN

You're talking about weapons.

NINJA (OLGA)

Right. You need an AK.

RAIDEN

But I saw them carrying an AN-94.
Show the difference in arms between regular soldiers and soldiers in the core.

NINJA (OLGA)

All men assigned to the core section carry AKs.

RAIDEN

So without an AK-74u, someone will see through me really quick...

NINJA (OLGA)

You can take care of the weapon issue yourself.

NINJA (OLGA)

One other thing --

RAIDEN

There's more?

NINJA (OLGA)

You'll also have to pass a retinal scan to get into the conference hall.
Enter the Ninja 7
3D Cutscene 6
((KF retinal scan) - Core B1)
Retinal scan security system in B1 of the core section. A soldier opens the door by looking into the scanner.

RAIDEN

Biometrics. Crap.

NINJA (OLGA)

Nothing but the real thing will suffice. Deception is not an option here.
Enter the Ninja 8
Codec Call 2
(internal communication with the Ninja)

NINJA (OLGA)

I suggest you hurry. They have the nuke on their side.

RAIDEN

The nuke!? They have a nuclear weapon WITH them?

NINJA (OLGA)

You didn't find their continuing presence here unusual? Even with the President as hostage, this is an island -- and they have no visible means of escape...

RAIDEN

... Even if they do have a nuke, the warhead is no good without an access code. The security lockout can't be bypassed...

NINJA (OLGA)

They don't need to. They have the code.
Enter the Ninja 9
Movie Cutscene 1
(Black Case flashback)
Scene showing the severed handcuff.

NINJA (OLGA)

You saw it too, I believe. The Navy man with half a handcuff. The other half of it is on the football, or the Black Case if you like. The nuclear button.
Visual of Vamp walking away from the BC Connecting Bridge, carrying the President and the Black Case.

NINJA (OLGA)

And now they have it.
Enter the Ninja 10
Codec Call 3
(internal communication with the Ninja)

RAIDEN

Why did they have to bring the football along? To a decontamination plant, of all places.

NINJA (OLGA)

But they did have to. Because, after all, the Big Shell is the farthest thing from a cleanup plant there is.

RAIDEN

What!?

NINJA (OLGA)

Dead Cell didn't have to bring a nuke along with them. It was right here to begin with. Nothing in this affair is what it seems...

RAIDEN

A cover-up -- but why? For what?

NINJA (OLGA)

For Metal Gear, that is housed here.
Enter the Ninja 11
3D Cutscene 7
(visuals of Metal Gear RAY)
Visuals of RAY. Rotate RAY from the Tanker Chapter for this cutscene, or use a movie. The model here shows a manned RAY; the mass-production model hasn't been revealed yet.

RAIDEN

*surprised* Metal Gear!?

NINJA (OLGA)

The very same. Bipedal nuke-capable vehicle of Shadow Moses infamy. This place is the R&D center for its newest incarnation.

RAIDEN

What the hell is going on?

NINJA (OLGA)

*cold chuckle*

NINJA (OLGA)

Better ask Ames the rest.
Enter the Ninja 12
3D Cutscene 8
(Strut E 1F)
Back to Strut E 1F.
Finally, the Ninja hands Raiden a cellular phone.

RAIDEN

What's this for?

NINJA (OLGA)

You might be glad you have it.

NINJA (OLGA)

Keep the controller's vibration function on.
Raiden stares at the cell phone (either an old-fashioned or current model).

RAIDEN

What do I need a cell phone for?
He looks up to find the Ninja gone. He looks around, but there is no trace of the Ninja.
Raiden kneels down for a Codec call.
Enter the Ninja 13
Codec Call 4
(mandatory outgoing call to the Colonel)

RAIDEN

Colonel, who was that man just now?

COLONEL

He's not one of ours.
The Colonel uses the same line Naomi used in MGS1.

COLONEL

No -- we have no one like that in our unit.

RAIDEN

*disbelievingly* He said that the Big Shell was housing a new model of Metal Gear.

COLONEL

*feigning ignorance* First I've heard of it.

RAIDEN

Colonel, what are you not telling me?

COLONEL

I've been completely open with you, Raiden. I've told you everything.

RAIDEN

Is that everything you know -- or everything I need to know?

COLONEL

Snap out of it, Raiden!

RAIDEN

...

COLONEL

I'll have the Metal Gear rumor looked into. You need to make contact with this Ames.

RAIDEN

So you believe that Ninja?

COLONEL

Since we have no leads on the President's current location, we have no other alternatives. Right now, collect as much data as you can, including anything on Metal Gear.

RAIDEN

Are those my orders?

COLONEL

Yes they are. Disguise yourself as an enemy soldier and infiltrate the Shell 1 Core.

RAIDEN

... Understood.
Snake's Body 1
Codec Call 1
(mandatory incoming call from Rose)
As Raiden infiltrates the core in search of Ames, he receives a Codec call from Rose.

ROSE

Got a minute, Jack?

RAIDEN

Rose?

ROSE

I found some information on where Solid Snake is interred.

RAIDEN

Great. Shoot.

ROSE

I've located the grave site.

RAIDEN

And the body?

ROSE

Exhumed for DNA testing.

RAIDEN

Well? Do you have the results?

ROSE

The right arm was missing, but there was no doubt that it was him. That body belongs to Solid Snake.
Raiden, somewhat of a fan of Snake, is disappointed.

RAIDEN

Hrmmm... So the head of the terrorist group must be --

ROSE

An impostor.

RAIDEN

*disappointed* Right...

ROSE

You sound disappointed.

RAIDEN

I guess -- I guess I was kind of hoping to meet the legend in the flesh.

ROSE

I get you. But it looks like he's not behind this incident.

COLONEL

Raiden, the President needs you, I think.

COLONEL

Disguise yourself as enemy personnel and infiltrate the core section. Your priority is to contact Agent Ames.
Retinal Scan 1
In-Game Sequence 1
(Shell 1 Core B1 Elevator Hall)
In search of Ames, Raiden infiltrates B1 of the Shell 1 Core dressed as an enemy mercenary.
He cautiously exits the elevator and steps into the corridor. Sensing the enemy up ahead, he ducks halfway back into the elevator. A Gurlukovich soldier (sans assault vest) is standing in front of the conference hall door, leaning in to have his retina (one eye) scanned by a biometrics sensor (monitor) installed on the wall. Once the sensor has captured the pattern of the man's retina and matched it to a database entry, a computerized voice announces the result.

SECURITY SCANNER

Retinal pattern recognized. You are cleared to enter.
Once the announcement has been made, the door (sliding) is unlocked and it opens. The man walks inside.
*If Raiden has himself scanned

SECURITY SCANNER

Retinal pattern is not recognized.
*If he drags a dead enemy soldier to the scanner

SECURITY SCANNER

Retinal pattern cannot be scanned.
*If he drags an unconscious or sleeping enemy to the scanner

SECURITY SCANNER

Retinal pattern cannot be scanned. Please open your eyes.
Hostage Room Infiltration 1
3D Cutscene 1
((MC) - Shell 1 B1 Conference Hall)
Raiden infiltrates the conference hall located in B1 of the Shell 1 Core, disguised as an enemy soldier. His objective is to make contact with Ames, who is being held hostage inside the room.
Raiden is dressed in a Gurlukovich uniform. He enters the conference hall, his blue eyes staring out of the ski mask eyeholes. He looks down to the floor below and sees the mass of hostages. This view gives players a basic grasp of the size and layout of the space, as well as the number and general state of the hostages. However, there is no way to tell where Ames is.
Locating Ames 1
3D Cutscene 1
((MC) - Shell 1 B1 Conference Hall)
Raiden, disguised as an enemy soldier, looks for Ames in a conference hall full of hostages.
When Raiden points the directional microphone at one man's chest, he hears a high-pitched electronic tone from his pacemaker. He looks at the man again, and puts away the microphone in favor of the AK.

RAIDEN

You must be Ames.
Ames cocks his head, unsure of the speaker's identity. He can clearly hear, if not see. Raiden lowers his voice further, wary of having his cover blown.

RAIDEN

Keep still and listen to me.
He moves his face closer to the man's ear.

RAIDEN

I'm not a terrorist. I got in here using one of their uniforms.
The man is clearly still on guard, half-doubtful.

RAIDEN

I'm taking off the tape. Stay quiet.
The man nods slightly, and Raiden removes the tape covering his mouth. The man takes deep, greedy gulps of air.

MAN

Who told you about me?

RAIDEN

An informer calling himself Mr. X, dressed like a ninja.

MAN

I see. (It doesn't look like it's a trap.)
Upon hearing the codename "Mr. X," the man relaxes.

MAN

Take this thing off me, will you...
Raiden removes the blindfold. The man looks at Raiden, eyes narrowed against the sudden brightness.

MAN

I'm Richard Ames.

RAIDEN

Secret Service?

AMES

No -- I was sent in by the La-li-lu-le-lo, just like you.
He is prevented from uttering "the Patriots," so he cannot articulate that phrase.

RAIDEN

*confused* What?
In the communications studio on the north side of the hall. Ocelot sits there, intently monitoring the conversation between Raiden and Ames with the help of a surveillance camera. Solidus and Olga have yet to arrive in the studio.
Back to Raiden and Ames.

AMES

You're here to find out where the President is.

AMES

We have little time, so I'll be brief. How about switching to nanocommunications first?

RAIDEN

Nanocommunications?

AMES

Right. Silence beats talk when it comes to safety.
Back in the communications studio on the north side of the hall. The incoming visuals remain the same, though the voices have ceased. Raiden and Ames are still looking at each other, but their lips are not moving.

OCELOT

Tsk!
Ocelot clicks his tongue in irritation, deprived of a chance to eavesdrop any further.
Locating Ames 2
Codec Call 1
(internal communication with Ames)
Raiden and Ames appear on the Codec screen.

AMES

Are you on?

RAIDEN

Right here.
The President had conspired with Solidus and together they moved against the Patriots, but he was betrayed and is now being held prisoner. Ames is a spy originally sent in after the Patriots deduced the President's intent.

RAIDEN

Do you really know where the President is?

AMES

Almost certainly. He was moved to the first floor of Shell 2's core section.

RAIDEN

The first floor, the core of Shell 2...

RAIDEN

Is he still there?

AMES

I don't know. I can't get a response.
The President is in a reinforced room built to block out all signals.

RAIDEN

You don't think he's been (killed) -- like the other hostages...?

AMES

?

RAIDEN

A hostage was killed in retaliation after the SEAL 10 disaster, remember?

AMES

What are you talking about?

RAIDEN

...? (Foreshadowing that the Colonel has been lying.)

AMES

Regardless of what they do to other hostages, they won't touch the President.

RAIDEN

What makes you so sure?

AMES

The case.

RAIDEN

You mean the nuclear button they took?

AMES

Right. And the case won't do a thing by itself.

AMES

That case may be the single most advanced example of a weapons fail-safe system. The password is nothing less than the physiological data of the U.S. President.

RAIDEN

Physiological data?

AMES

The President's own vital signs -- heartbeat, brainwave pattern, blood pressure and so on -- are constantly monitored and relayed by his internal nano-machines. This information along with the DNA pattern serve as a biometric password, unbreakable even by the latest parallel processor supercomputers.

AMES

The password entry itself cannot be performed unless brainwave patterns and heartbeats fall within normal parameters, rendering chemical and other forms of coercion impractical. In other words, the login must be made of the President's own free will.

AMES

As a fail-safe, the input must also be reconfirmed hourly, even after the initial login. If a valid confirmation is not forthcoming, the system will automatically cancel the login.

RAIDEN

And that's why they can't harm the President...

AMES

At least until the bird flies.

RAIDEN

Is there really a new model of Metal Gear here?

AMES

Absolutely. The Black Case serves as the launch key to Metal Gear as well.

RAIDEN

Why would they hide a Metal Gear in an offshore plant?

AMES

...Haven't they told you anything? (An ally of the Patriots should know this, so he's suspicious.)

RAIDEN

...

AMES

The entire thing was planned -- the oil spill, the tanker accident that caused it, everything. The Big Shell was built specifically for the development of a new Metal Gear model. The inspection tour was to check its progress...

RAIDEN

What's going on around here... (He's irritated that his suspicions were correct.)

AMES

Wait!
Locating Ames 3
3D Cutscene 2
(Shell 1 Core B1 Conference Hall)
Back to the conference hall.
Solidus (a figure wearing a coat) walks into the studio.
Raiden and Ames are still communicating internally, so their lips aren't moving.

AMES

Here comes Snake.
Ames indicates the studio with a look. The tinted glass makes it difficult to see in.

RAIDEN

That's him?
The silhouette is not unlike that of Snake. Ocelot closes the window's blinds once Solidus is in the room, preventing anyone from seeing in.

AMES

Use the microphone to listen in.
Locating Ames 4
Interactive First Person Cutscene 1
(Shell 1 Core B1 Conference Hall)
Raiden listens in on Solidus and the others using the directional mic.
Automatically switch to First Person View, with the mic in one hand. Player can pan the perspective with the up, down, left, and right inputs. The volume of the conversation between Solidus and the others changes with the direction of the mic; even with the mic pointed all the way away from them, the conversation will still be somewhat audible. No other inputs will work for the duration of this cutscene, much like the torture sequences in MGS1. If the mic is pointed in the wrong direction, the player will miss hearing the dialogue below.
Solidus and Ocelot's respective positions are accurately represented through voice volumes. This serves to increase immersiveness, making the player feel like they're actually eavesdropping on a conversation. Subtitle readability (brightness) should match the volume; the lower the volume, the lighter the subtitle. Pointing the mic at Ocelot will result in his voice being louder. When Olga enters the room, the panning range from left to right grows considerably. As a result, the player is forced to move the mic depending on who is speaking. If the mic is pointed in the completely wrong direction during this time, Ames' lines become audible. Point the mic at Ames, and the volume of his lines grows louder.

AMES

Make sure you catch their conversation! Point the microphone at them!

AMES

Point that mic in their direction.

AMES

Point the microphone at them.

AMES

Can you hear anything like that?

AMES

Where are you pointing that thing?

AMES

Not this way. Point it toward them.
Pause the dialogue inside the studio during this time.
Since the blinds are down, the inside of the studio is not visible.

OCELOT

King --
He calls Solidus "King."

OCELOT

Fatman is dead.
Solidus seems entirely unmoved. He is still only a silhouette, his face in the shadows.

SOLIDUS

It doesn't matter. Saved us the trouble of getting rid of him ourselves.

OCELOT

Why did he betray us?

SOLIDUS

Who knows? They're a band of lunatics to begin with. Nothing they do should come as a surprise.

OCELOT

I'll have his background rechecked, just in case.

SOLIDUS

... You think he was working for them (the Patriots)?

OCELOT

We can't discount the possibility. Especially with that intruder still at large.

SOLIDUS

Yes... the man in the Sneaking Suit.

OCELOT

You know more about those suits than I do.

SOLIDUS

But FOXHOUND was disbanded four years ago. So it must be -- the Patriots...?
The word "Patriots" makes its first appearance.

SOLIDUS

What about the damage to Shell 2?

OCELOT

The circulation system for the contaminated water has been damaged. The water being drawn in is overflowing, and the lower block of the central section is flooding.

SOLIDUS

Seal the connecting pathway between Shells 1 and 2.

OCELOT

The Semtex and IR sensors are already in place.

SOLIDUS

Any effect on -- it? (Talking about the new Metal Gear, Arsenal Gear.)

OCELOT

No.

SOLIDUS

What about the President?

OCELOT

The password entry has already been made to the Black Case. In one hour, we'll need a confirmation from him. His work is done after that.

SOLIDUS

*showing his concern* Make sure you keep him alive until then.

OCELOT

Yes, I know.

SOLIDUS

What about the unit's activation? (Talking about Arsenal Gear.)

OCELOT

Almost complete. The code has already been entered. All we need now is for the girl to start the system.

SOLIDUS

The usual method, I assume?

OCELOT

No -- the drugs (phenobarbital) took care of everything...

SOLIDUS

Hm...
Solidus turns his back on Ocelot and speaks reflectively.

SOLIDUS

Only a few more steps to Outer Heaven...
Sounds of Olga opening the door and walking in. Olga is also just a silhouette, but the player should be able to identify her from their previous encounter(s) with her.

OLGA

Who is that cyborg Ninja, Shalashaska (Ocelot)?

OCELOT

I cannot even guess...

OLGA

*speaking to Solidus* What about you?

SOLIDUS

I'm having the matter looked into.

OCELOT

Olga! Don't cast suspicion where it isn't due!

OLGA

Where it isn't due? When you watched my father die and did nothing?

OCELOT

It's been two years ago, Olga. Let it go.
Olga speaks sarcastically to Ocelot.

OLGA

I read the case file for Shadow Moses, by the way.

OCELOT

Olga, how could you suspect me!

OLGA

I know that the Ninja is not one of MY men.

OCELOT

How meaningful you make that sound. If Sergei were still alive --

OLGA

If the old man were still alive, I wouldn't need to take orders from you!

OCELOT

*speaks reminiscently* Olga, Sergei was my best friend...
Olga thrusts her gun at Ocelot.

OLGA

If you sell us out -- I'll kill you myself.
Ocelot pulls out his own gun with his left hand and pushes the barrel into her breast.

OCELOT

Listen, daughter of Sergei. Don't ever let me see your gun pointed at me again.
Olga puts her gun away.

OLGA

If you wish. I'll put a bullet in your back instead.
Ocelot spins his gun and returns it to the holster.

OCELOT

...

SOLIDUS

Stop this infighting!

SOLIDUS

I took you both in when no one else would.

SOLIDUS

You think any government would have you as irregulars in this political climate? The worst kind of wetworks, maybe. But even that's doubtful.
He reminds Ocelot and Olga of some very relevant information.

SOLIDUS

I'd recommend against switching camps -- you've nowhere left to go.
Ocelot looks down in assent.

OLGA

Pfft.
She leaves the room.
During the conversation, Ocelot's right arm starts to move convulsively, and points the barrel of his gun straight at his own temple.

OCELOT

U-urgh!!

SOLIDUS

It's happening again?

OCELOT

This damn right arm -- Liquid!
Ocelot tries in vain to restrain the runaway arm. During the fit, two distinct heartbeats can be heard from Ocelot. One belongs to Liquid.

OCELOT

It's almost as if it's having its revenge -- !!

SOLIDUS

How much do you think we spent on that arm in Lyon? The best transplant surgery team in the world --

OCELOT

I never trust a Frenchman.
Ocelot injects tranquilizer into his (Liquid's) arm (sound of injection) and manages to bring it under control.

OCELOT

There's something going on. The incidents are becoming more frequent... Maybe that man's presence...

SOLIDUS

Ocelot, I'll leave this place in your hands. I have the intruder to take care of.

OCELOT

Yes, King.
Locating Ames 5
3D Cutscene 3
(Shell 1 Core B1 Conference Hall)
Raiden puts the directional microphone down and asks Ames:

RAIDEN

Is that really -- Solid Snake?

AMES

That's what he claims.

RAIDEN

I thought Snake was dead.

AMES

Solid Snake did die. But he's also here in the Shell. Either he survived, or there are two of them...

RAIDEN

Two of them?

AMES

And that's impossible.
Raiden faces the booth where Solidus and Ocelot are.
Locating Ames 6
Codec Call 2
(internal communication with Ames)
Raiden and Ames appear on the Codec screen.

AMES

Anyway, what did you manage to catch?

RAIDEN

They said password input was complete...

AMES

I thought so...

RAIDEN

You said the password entry into the Black Case had to be made by the President willingly.

AMES

That's right.

RAIDEN

So this means the President is cooperating with them?

AMES

It would have to be, yes.

RAIDEN

Why?

AMES

Probably tired of being a puppet. But it wasn't a smart move to betray us...

RAIDEN

... A puppet?

AMES

We're running out of time. They WILL fire a nuke. You know what you need to do before then.

RAIDEN

Fire the nuke? But it's nowhere close to the ransom deadline.

AMES

Ransom?

RAIDEN

Thirty billion dollars in cash...

AMES

What are you babbling about!? The nuclear strike is not a threat -- it's been the objective all along!

RAIDEN

They plan to slaughter millions of people!?

AMES

No -- a high-altitude detonation. You've heard of the Compton Effect?

RAIDEN

The total disruption of electronic equipment caused by EMMA pulse.

AMES

Textbook answer. Well, when an average nuclear warhead goes off within the atmosphere, the result is an electromagnetic pulse of up to 50 billion megawatts. The EMMA field can reach tens of thousands of volts per meter, and most electronic equipment will be toast in an instant.
Locating Ames 6c
Codec Call 2b
(internal communication with Ames)

RAIDEN

If one of the key movers of world economy stops functioning, it could mean the beginning of a global depression.

AMES

But that isn't their aim. What they plan to do is "liberate" Manhattan, pull it offline, and turn it into some kind of a republic.

AMES

Hence "Sons of Liberty," I suppose.

RAIDEN

"Sons of Liberty"...?
Ocelot is about to leave the studio. Ames grows anxious.

AMES

Damn, Ocelot is coming! I'm going offline.
Locating Ames 7
3D Cutscene 4
(Shell 1 Core B1 Conference Hall)
Ames grows anxious at the sight of Ocelot leaving the studio.

AMES

Search my pocket. Hurry!
Raiden searches the pocket, and finds a security card.

AMES

It's a security card. You'll be able to unlock doors of up to Level 3 security. Use it to get to Shell 2.
Raiden puts away the Level 3 card.

AMES

Take care of the President before they launch the nuke!
Level 3 card received (Ames's card).
Ocelot exits the studio and starts walking toward them.
Ames sees him, and warns Raiden.

AMES

He's coming here. Pick up your AK!
Locating Ames 8
Game 1
(Shell 1 Core B1 Conference Hall)
Real-time gameplay. The player must switch the mic for the AK before Ocelot arrives. Game changes to First Person View. The player can pan the camera, but they cannot move Raiden.
If they fail to switch to the AK before Ocelot arrives, Raiden will be unmasked and the game is over.

OCELOT

Who are you?
A guard comes running at the sound of Ocelot's voice.

ENEMY SOLDIER

Show me your face!
Attacking Ocelot or trying to run will likewise end in game over.
Once Ocelot is near, another cutscene begins.
Locating Ames 9
3D Cutscene 5
(Shell 1 Core B1 Conference Hall)
Raiden already removed Ames's blindfold and gag (tape). Raiden moves away from Ames a little, keeping his eyes on Ocelot and the guard.

OCELOT

What do you think you're doing?
Ames speaks up to cover for Raiden.

AMES

I asked him to remove these. I'm ill, you see.
Ocelot knows Ames is lying.

OCELOT

I always knew that the DIA2 turned out second-rate liars.

AMES

W-what are you talking about?
Ames tries to bluff.

OCELOT

No need for denials. We know what you are -- Colonel Ames.
Ames is frozen. He does not know that Ocelot is also allied with the Patriots.
Ocelot draws his revolver. Raiden is faced with a dilemma.

OCELOT

They (the Patriots) knew that the President was planning to betray them. So they sent you in to keep tabs on him. Am I right?

AMES

You -- !

OCELOT

Sorry, Colonel. You failed to carry out your duties.
Ames, with nothing to lose, speaks aggressively.

AMES

You'll never escape the La-li-lu-le-lo --
Ocelot spins the revolver in his left hand.

OCELOT

Is that so?
Ocelot points the revolver at Ames, but before he can pull the trigger, Ames starts to claw at his chest in agony! Raiden takes a few steps back from Ames. His convulsions as well as the scene in general is very like the DARPA Chief's death scene in MGS1. Ocelot is taken aback.

OCELOT

What the -- !
Ames turns to Raiden (still dressed as a Russian soldier) and manages to gasp out:

AMES

You -- you -- you tricked me...
Struggling to breathe, Ames then turns to Ocelot and utters his last words.

AMES

I understand now -- Ocelot... you're --
He was going to say, "You're working for the Patriots too." Ames dies.
The cause of death was a heart attack brought on by nanomachine-induced pacemaker malfunction (a calculated act by the Patriots). A stunned Raiden could only stand there and watch.
He moves in closer to try to do something for Ames. Ocelot notices the unusual behavior and rakes Raiden from head to toe with his gaze. Only Raiden's deep blue eyes are visible, through the ski mask's eye slit.

OCELOT

You -- which team are you with?

RAIDEN

...

OCELOT

Show me your face!
The guard steps up to Raiden and points his weapon at him.

OCELOT

You know who he is?
His gun still aimed at Raiden, the guard replies.

ENEMY SOLDIER

No. He's not one of mine.
Raiden remains motionless.

OCELOT

Identify yourself!
The guard pulls off Raiden's ski mask, and Raiden's blond hair falls out.

OCELOT

Hm, we meet at last...
Ocelot points his revolver at Raiden's forehead. Raiden stares ahead stoically, resignation in his eyes. But suddenly, the Ninja appears from overhead. The Ninja's sword is almost on Ocelot's left arm before the latter manages to swing it out the way.
The Ninja stands in front of Raiden.
The guard unleashes a burst of fire at the Ninja with his AK, but the Ninja deflects the bullets with its blade.
The rounds ricochet off of walls and the floor, and several of them find the hostages.
Hostages cry out! Ocelot restrains the soldiers.

HOSTAGE A-D

*scream through their gags* !

OCELOT

Hold your fire! We need the hostages alive!
The men stop firing.

NINJA

Hurry! Get away!
The Ninja moves forward.

OCELOT

You? But you died!?
Ocelot retreats. An assault team, in the meantime, rushes out of the 1F glassed-in room (in the back). Raiden runs up the stairs toward the security door. The soldiers take aim at Raiden and open fire. The Ninja leaps up to the 2F door.

NINJA

Leave this to me!
Raiden manages to clear the door and enters the corridor.
After Ames's Death 1
Game 1
(Shell 1 Core B1 Corridor)
Raiden, saved by the Ninja, steps out into the B1 corridor.
Since he has already been spotted, he cannot re-enter the hostage room, and has no choice but to go to another floor using the elevator.
Once out in the corridor, a heightened alert regarding Raiden's presence is broadcast over the P.A. system. For some reason, there is no mention of the Ninja.

ANNOUNCEMENT

We have an intruder in Shell 1! All personnel, we are on red alert!

ANNOUNCEMENT

Begin Caution Mode protocol. Search every section of the structure!

ANNOUNCEMENT

The intruder may be dressed in our own colors. Face check all personnel encountered!

ANNOUNCEMENT

I repeat...
After Ames's Death 2
Codec Call 1
(mandatory outgoing call to the Colonel)

RAIDEN

Colonel, Ames is dead. Looked like a heart attack.

COLONEL

Hm, that's unfortunate. However, we do at least know where the President is.

RAIDEN

*disbelievingly* So there really is a new type of Metal Gear in this place?

COLONEL

Apparently. We're still looking into it...

RAIDEN

I've also been told that the nuclear strike was what the terrorists were after from the start. NOT the thirty billion dollars!

COLONEL

Chri--, it was a cover-up all along...

RAIDEN

Colonel! What are you keeping from me!?

COLONEL

I am not keeping back anything! It's not as though I'm told all the facts either!

RAIDEN

...

COLONEL

I'm pulling in all the favors I can to look into all this. Just be a little patient.

COLONEL

Our priority should be with the President right now. We can take it that they've completed the password entry and are preparing Metal Gear for nuclear strike. Get to the President as soon as possible.

RAIDEN

But the President is cooperating with them --

COLONEL

According to Ames, yes. But it's also true that they're about to get rid of the President. There's something else going on here, and the President may be able to tell you what it is when you see him in person.

RAIDEN

...

COLONEL

Once they get the confirmation for nuclear launch, they'll do it. You need to rescue the President before then.

RAIDEN

...

ROSE

Jack, I agree with the Colonel. You need to protect the President for now.

RAIDEN

All right...
Shell 1-2 Connecting Bridge 1
Codec Call 1
(mandatory incoming call from Pliskin)
Having shaken off the enemy pursuit, Raiden heads for the Shell 2 Core in a bid to rescue the President. When he reaches the connecting bridge between the two Shells, he receives a Codec call from Pliskin.

PLISKIN

Raiden, can you hear me?

RAIDEN

Pliskin? Where have you been?

PLISKIN

Checking around. I'm in Strut H right now. How's the situation over there? (He was looking for Emma and investigating the plant. He'll let Raiden know about the lack of toxins, etc. in a later call.)

RAIDEN

We have a lead on the President's location.

PLISKIN

Where is he?

RAIDEN

Shell 2 Core, the first floor.

PLISKIN

I'm cut off from the core where I am. It's a mess here.

RAIDEN

All right. I'm on my way to Shell 2 right now.

PLISKIN

There are IR sensors in place on the connecting bridge between Shells 1 and 2. If you break the beams, the Semtex will go off.

RAIDEN

Yeah, I heard them talking about that.

PLISKIN

Target the control units and destroy them. Make sure you don't shoot the Semtex.

RAIDEN

What do the control units look like?

PLISKIN

Take a look with your binoculars.
Shell 1-2 Connecting Bridge 2
In-Game Sequence 1
(Shell 1-2 Connecting Bridge)
Raiden takes out his binoculars and looks at the bridge railings ahead. Zoom in on a block of Semtex.

RAIDEN

That's the Semtex...
Zoom in on a control unit.

RAIDEN

And that must be the control unit.
Infrared Sensors Cleared 1
Codec Call 1
(mandatory incoming call from Pliskin)
Raiden follows Pliskin's advice and successfully neutralizes the IR trap. He then receives a Codec call from him.

PLISKIN

Raiden, I found us a ride.

RAIDEN

I'm all ears.

PLISKIN

One of the enemy's Kasatkas (transport helicopter).

RAIDEN

Is it in good shape?

PLISKIN

Full tank. I'm heading for Shell 1 now. What about that Harrier?

RAIDEN

It's not on the heliport here.

PLISKIN

Good. I'll set this one down there then.

RAIDEN

Can you cover the hostages? They're being held on level B1 in the core.

RAIDEN

Pliskin, you didn't happen to find any other places where hostages were being held, did you?

PLISKIN

No -- nothing like that.

RAIDEN

OK... (Foreshadowing that the Colonel has been lying.)

PLISKIN

How many hostages are there?

RAIDEN

There's a few short of thirty. One dead, and several wounded.

PLISKIN

The Kasatka's cargo area will hold thirteen max.

RAIDEN

What about the other Kasatka?

PLISKIN

I sabotaged it. It can't come after us if it can't get off the ground.

RAIDEN

*disappointed* Oh.

PLISKIN

We'll have to make two trips.

RAIDEN

Can you fly a Kasatka?

PLISKIN

I have a pilot who's flown the civilian model, the KA-62, in VR. There's not a whole lot of difference between the military KA-60 and the civilian model.
Sounds of chopper rotors and instrument checks in the background.

OTACON

Cleared for take-off...

PLISKIN

Raiden, let me introduce you to my partner -- Otacon.

RAIDEN

"Otacon"?
Otacon's face appears.

OTACON

Hey, Raiden. Nice to meet you.

PLISKIN

Damn!
Sounds of gunfire, soldiers shouting!

PLISKIN

Raiden, I'll talk to you later.
The call cuts off!
Raiden changes frequency and calls the Colonel (mandatory).

RAIDEN

Colonel, I need some answers from you. Who exactly is Pliskin and his partner?

COLONEL

I know what you're thinking.

RAIDEN

It keeps coming back to Shadow Moses. And now this Otacon...

ROSE

A.k.a. Hal Emmerich, Ph.D. A Shadow Moses survivor.

RAIDEN

Rose?

ROSE

Snake and Otacon both became fugitives after Shadow Moses, wanted for acts of terrorism.

RAIDEN

An anti-Metal Gear organization...

COLONEL

They sabotaged and destroyed countless Metal Gear units throughout the world...

ROSE

And were responsible for the incident two years ago that necessitated the construction of the Big Shell.

RAIDEN

Snake and his partner aren't terrorists.

ROSE

Jack, why are you defending them?

RAIDEN

I look back on what I've done here so far and things like training and sense of duty alone won't get you through a sneaking mission like this.

ROSE

Jack, are you okay?

RAIDEN

You need something -- higher. I can't think of the right word, but... it has to be pure will, backed up by -- by courage, or ideals, or something like that.

RAIDEN

I'd stake my life on it. The Solid Snake that saved Shadow Moses couldn't turn into a terrorist.

COLONEL

Maybe that's true, but they went down with that tanker two years ago. We even recovered Snake's body.

RAIDEN

And the DNA test results on the body say it's him.

ROSE

Jack, I know what you're saying, but Snake is dead. He can't be here, not even as this Dr. Hal Emmerich.

RAIDEN

But that also means that he can't be the terrorist leader behind this thing.
Enter the Harrier 1
3D Cutscene 1
((MC) - Shell 1-2 Connecting Bridge)
Having neutralized the IR sensors, Raiden is crossing the connecting bridge to Shell 2.
He becomes aware of the sound of a chopper taking off from Shell 2 (propeller noise), and looks up. A Kasatka rises skyward from behind the bulk of Shell 2.
The chopper hovers over the bridge, and Pliskin waves from the open cargo hold. Raiden watches as the helicopter heads for the Shell 1 heliport. Raiden returns his gaze to Shell 2.
There is a man standing in front of the access door. He wears a shiny outer garment (long leather coat). Raiden tries to get a better look, but between the sun and the shimmer of hot air, he can't make him out. What little he can see of the wavering image is that of a muscular, well-proportioned man. Playing over this entrance scene for Solidus is a sound effect consisting of past U.S. presidents recited in a sort of mantra.

MAN

A messenger from the Patriots!
Solidus, seeing Raiden in person for the first time, mutters.

MAN

Where do I -- know him from? (Foreshadowing that Solidus raised Raiden as a child soldier.)
Raiden recalls the man in the studio adjacent to the hostage room.

RAIDEN

So you're the boss around here.

MAN

No, not just around here. I'm the boss to surpass Big Boss himself...

MAN

Solid Snake...

PLISKIN

No! That is NOT Solid Snake!
Pliskin's voice reaches them over the drone of propellers. The Kasatka has returned instead of heading to Shell 1. The man's coat ripples in the wind. Pliskin is leaning out of the chopper. The man gazes up at him.

MAN

What a pleasant surprise -- brother.

PLISKIN

Save it. You're no brother of mine.

MAN

Don't say you've forgotten me -- Snake.
The man steps out from the structure's shadow, offering a better look at his face. Solidus's appearance is part Pliskin (same face as Snake from the Tanker Chapter), part Big Boss (same hair and beard as him).

RAIDEN

Snake?
Raiden, caught between two Snakes, is bewildered.

SNAKE

Raiden, take cover!
Snake leans further out of the chopper and fires a burst from his M4! Raiden ducks behind the structure in the middle of the bridge.

SOLIDUS

Hrgh!
With a yell, Solidus activates his accelerator and speeds away! His leather coat burns up in an instant. The M4 rounds that Snake fired strike the Shell 2 access door instead. The vapor from the coat clears to reveal Solidus is wearing a powered suit. His movement has the look and feel of teleportation; the space where he traveled to appears to warp. It also leaves behind on the ground a fiery tracing of his accelerated travel.

SNAKE

*looks at his face* Stop impersonating him (Big Boss)!
He aims the M4 at Solidus again.
This time, Solidus deflects the bullets with his elbow shield! Sparks fly from it!

SOLIDUS

*half laughing* Brother, I'm a whole different game from Liquid!
Solidus looks at Snake and activates his powered suit.

SOLIDUS

HRRRRRR!!
As Solidus lets out a yell, the suit starts to swell rapidly. He does not yet have the serpent arms equipped.
Snake aims a grenade launcher attached to the bottom of the M4.
Snake fires a grenade at Solidus (door area)! Solidus snaps his steel collar shut and gets into a battle stance. Once again, he moves out of the way using his accelerator, and the grenade strikes the door! (This destroys it in the process. The door cannot be opened after this point.) The blast throws Raiden to the ground.

RAIDEN

Urgh!

SOLIDUS

That the best you can do, Snake!?
Snake takes aim once again and fires the grenade launcher!
Solidus jumps off the bridge just as the explosion takes place!

SNAKE

Did I get him!?
Snake stares down at the point where Solidus vanished.
Suddenly, a Harrier 2 appears from below in a rapid climb, with Solidus standing on it!

SNAKE

Otacon, we're in trouble! It's the Harrier!
Otacon does a hard turn. Solidus calls out to Snake.

SOLIDUS

The world needs only one Big Boss!
Solidus deactivates his suit's powered mode, and drops into the tandem cockpit (back seat)!

SOLIDUS

I'll drown you fools for interfering!
The Harrier fires a missile at the chopper. Otacon manages to dodge the projectile, but just barely. The missile destroys the door to Strut D instead, cutting off retreat in that direction. The Harrier flies over past Strut G. The Kasatka hovers over the connecting bridge (low altitude). Snake leans out and shouts to Raiden, who has finally managed to get back on his feet.

SNAKE

Raiden, this is the Stinger missile launcher!
Snake drops an item (the Stinger launcher) from the chopper onto the bridge. It turns into an item box that the player can pick up.

SNAKE

The Kasatka can't stand up to the Harrier!
He then drops another item box containing missiles.

SNAKE

You have to shoot the Harrier down!
The additional missiles fall through the hole in the middle of the bridge and land on the lower level.
Otacon curses at the Harrier as it turns toward them!

OTACON

Snake, we got company!
The chopper does a rapid climb!

SNAKE

I'm counting on you!
The Kasatka moves to fairly high altitude.
To game – Harrier 2 battle.
Footnotes
1A United States federal law enforcement agency under the Department of Homeland Security. Originally created primarily to combat the counterfeiting of US currency, after the assassination of President William McKinley it was also tasked with protecting the President, other VIPs, the White House, and other buildings.
2Acronym for the Defense Intelligence Agency. Operating under the direct supervision of the United States Secretary of Defense, the DIA is an umbrella organization that exercises authority over the intelligence agencies of the Army, Navy, and Air Force.
Codec Conversations
•Colonel
Prior to Meeting Ames
At the heliport after the Fatman battle

COLONEL

Raiden, let's get back to the task of rescuing the President. Head to the core of Shell 1 and investigate the area.
Pliskin survived

RAIDEN

Colonel, Pliskin wasn't killed.

ROSE

You look happy, Jack.

RAIDEN

Yeah...

COLONEL

Raiden, don't trust him!

RAIDEN

What?

COLONEL

Don't you think it's suspicious that he alone came out unscathed? Things don't add up.

RAIDEN

...

COLONEL

Raiden, don't put any faith in that guy. You will carry out your mission alone. Do you understand?
Before the Ninja appears - saved by Rose
*If player heard the final hint during the Fatman battle

ROSE

*teasingly* Jack...?

RAIDEN

Uh...what?

ROSE

You know what I'm talking about.

RAIDEN

All right, all right. The bomb was where you guessed it would be. You were right, and you saved my butt!

ROSE

As long as you realize that.

RAIDEN

I was pretty surprised though. I never expected to find it where I did...

ROSE

Hm, you must think I'm pretty clueless, huh?

RAIDEN

Of course not! And I have a pretty healthy respect for the woman's intuition thing now.

ROSE

That is such a sexist thing to say, you know that?

RAIDEN

Come on, don't be mad. I apologized already.

ROSE

Don't sweat it -- I'm just messing with ya.

ROSE

I want you to recognize that I can help you through this thing -- and that I care about you.

RAIDEN

Rose...

ROSE

Hang in there, okay?
After the Ninja appears - hostages in the Core

COLONEL

Raiden, make contact with Ames and find out where the President is.

COLONEL

Our information indicates that Ames is being held in the B1 level of Shell 1's core. Head for the core of Shell 1.

COLONEL

Shell 1's core has extremely tight security. Impersonate an enemy personnel to infiltrate the section.

COLONEL

For a proper disguise, select the enemy field uniform you received from the Ninja. This will allow you to blend in.

COLONEL

But you still need one more thing.

COLONEL

It will look suspicious if you're not carrying the standard equipment.

COLONEL

All personnel in the core are equipped with AK-74Us. Select your own AK when you're in disguise.
*If player doesn't have the AK

COLONEL

Find yourself an AK. You have a Level 2 card in your possession; go and search the warehouse in Strut F.
The Ninja

COLONEL

Raiden, make contact with Ames.

RAIDEN

Colonel, should I really believe what he says?

COLONEL

The fact is that there is no other option, unfortunately for us.

RAIDEN

I'll understand once I go to see him then, right?
Ames

RAIDEN

Colonel, who's that person Ames?

ROSE

I checked the roster of Secret Service members serving the President. There was definitely a person on the list named Ames.

COLONEL

So what that Ninja said, then, was not a lie after all.

RAIDEN

As far as the roster goes, no. Rose, do you have any other information?

ROSE

All right. I'll look into it for you.

RAIDEN

I'm counting on you.
Details on Ames

COLONEL

Raiden, Rosemary has a report for you, on Ames.

ROSE

Jack? It's about Ames.

RAIDEN

Did you find anything?

ROSE

Yeah. Only that there is nothing to find.

RAIDEN

What?

ROSE

There is not a single record. Let alone his social security number, address, or background, I couldn't even find Ames' gender, age, or full name...

RAIDEN

What does that mean?

ROSE

All I found out was "Ames," just that one word.

RAIDEN

...

COLONEL

Even still, Ames is our way to the President. We'll have to make contact. Head for Floor B1 in the core of Shell 1.
The nuke

RAIDEN

Colonel -- the stories about a Metal Gear within the Big Shell...

COLONEL

That is still being looked into.

ROSE

Sorry, Jack.

RAIDEN

And stories that the Big Shell is just a cover?

ROSE

Well, every record I've looked through only ever has it as a legitimate offshore decontamination facility. On paper, it's clean.

RAIDEN

So you're saying that we have no choice but to talk to Ames or whoever else?
Find Ames - Shell 1 Core

COLONEL

Raiden, make contact with Ames and obtain information about the President.
*If player is somewhere other than Shell 1 Core B1

COLONEL

You're in the Shell 1 Core now. Ames is being held on B1. Head for B1.
*If player is in Shell 1 Core B1

COLONEL

You're on B1 of the Shell 1 Core now. Ames is being held in the hall.

COLONEL

To get in the hall, you'll have to get through a door protected by a retinal scanner security system.

COLONEL

Raiden, get past the retinal scanner and infiltrate the hall.
Directional Microphone
*First time only

COLONEL

Ames is most likely being held with other hostages.

RAIDEN

Sure -- but I don't even know what Ames looks like.

COLONEL

Use the directional microphone to distinguish Ames from the other hostages. It's the only way.

COLONEL

According to our information, Ames has a pacemaker. This should make his cardiac pattern fairly distinct. Use the directional microphone to locate it.
*If player doesn't have mic

COLONEL

Isn't the directional microphone supposed to be somewhere in the core of Shell 1?
Shell 1 Core 1F - player isn't in disguise

COLONEL

Raiden, the corridor is too narrow. You'll have absolutely no cover and there are multiple surveillance cameras in place.

COLONEL

None of the usual infiltration methods will fly in this situation. Disguise yourself as a terrorist instead, and don't forget to select the AK.
In front of elevator panel

COLONEL

I see an elevator over there. You'll be able to travel from floor to floor now.

COLONEL

Push the Action Button in front of the panel you see next to the elevator.

COLONEL

The elevator should arrive in a few minutes.
Disguise elevator explanation

COLONEL

That elevator is a cut above the usual. Do you see that strange-looking surveillance camera above the panel?

RAIDEN

Yeah. It's not responding when I enter its field of vision. What is it?

ROSE

The camera apparently goes online only when someone activates the panel. In other words, it's there to check on the person trying to use the elevator.

COLONEL

If you're not disguised as a terrorist, you'll be spotted as soon as you call the elevator.
You can't use the elevator during Alert Mode

COLONEL

The enemies will stop all elevators during an Alert Mode to prevent intruders, in other words, you, from moving out of the area.

COLONEL

Which means that you'll need to shake off pursuit before getting on the elevator. Remember that.
When using chaff

COLONEL

If you intend to use the elevator, Raiden, refrain from using chaff on that floor.

COLONEL

Elevators on that floor are designed to conduct a camera check whenever someone activates the panel.

ROSE

Interfering with the camera would prevent that check system from functioning, and as a result, you'll stay locked out of the elevator.

COLONEL

You'll have to disguise yourself and activate the panel if you need to use the elevator. Select the enemy's field uniform.
How to use the elevator

COLONEL

To use the elevator, get in and stand in front of the panel on the left side.

ROSE

When the panel appears, choose a floor and press the Enter Button, and the elevator will start moving.

COLONEL

During this time, you can move the right analog stick to survey your surroundings. Keep an eye out for approaching enemies.
If you attack the enemy while disguised, your cover will be blown

COLONEL

Even the most successful disguise can't protect you if you decide to blow your own cover by attacking the enemy.

COLONEL

Do not engage the enemy while you are in disguise.
You still can't act suspiciously while disguised

COLONEL

Raiden, don't act in any way that will excite the enemy's suspicion.

COLONEL

A perfect disguise can be ruined by a single odd behavior. Be careful.
If you bump into an enemy while disguised the uniform will get unequipped

COLONEL

If you make physical contact with the enemy while in disguise, the disguise will be deselected. Keep that in mind.
*First time only

ROSE

That uniform's probably not even close to your size.

RAIDEN

Yeah, to tell you the truth, it feels pretty tight.

COLONEL

It's probably a better fit for Rosemary here than you.

ROSE

Excuse me?

RAIDEN

*exasperated* Er -- Colonel?

COLONEL

Just an observation. Let's get back to the mission, shall we?

ROSE

*exasperated* That was inappropriate...
Retinal scanner - Shell 1 Core B1

COLONEL

Raiden that's the biometrics-enabled door that the Ninja was talking about. The security system consists of a retinal scanner.

COLONEL

You'll have to bring one of the enemy personnel to the scanner to get through that door.
Bring an enemy with you

COLONEL

Raiden, if you need to get past the biometric security system, you need to bring one of the enemies to the retinal scanner.

RAIDEN

How do I do that?

COLONEL

Put an enemy sentry in a chokehold, then drag him over to the retinal scanner.

COLONEL

Come up behind an enemy without any weapons selected, then press the Weapon Button to put him in a chokehold.
Retinal scanner guidance (1)

COLONEL

Raiden, the retinal scanner does not work on anything but living and open eyes.

COLONEL

Don't knock the man out either. Be careful.
Retinal scanner guidance (2)

COLONEL

Retinal scanners are taken offline in Alert Mode. If you are spotted, you need to shake off pursuit completely first.
Retinal scanner guidance (3)

COLONEL

Raiden, I don't need to remind you that the retinal scanner checks every input against a database of the enemy's own men.

ROSE

As if your own retinal pattern will do any good...

COLONEL

You really need to bring a terrorist over to the scanner.
Shell 1 Core B2 - door to Arsenal Gear

RAIDEN

Colonel, what's this door?

COLONEL

I don't know.

ROSE

It's huge. What the hell is it...? It's not in our intel.
*Second and subsequent times

COLONEL

Raiden, we have no way at the moment to open that door. Leave it alone and proceed with the mission. Understood?
Emma's workstation is full of otaku merch

COLONEL

Hmm. There's a desk that stands out.

ROSE

It's awfully -- customized.

RAIDEN

What kind of a dork brings all this stuff to work? Must be a super freak.
The parrot

RAIDEN

What's that bird...?

COLONEL

Parrot, isn't it?

ROSE

Probably a large budgie.

ROSE

Parakeets get used to humans easily, and are talkative, so they are real playful and fun.

ROSE

Hurts when they bite, though, and keeping their cage clean is quite a task.

RAIDEN

You sure know a lot about parakeets.

ROSE

I had my own once.

RAIDEN

I didn't know that.

ROSE

I never mentioned it?

RAIDEN

No, this is the first time.

ROSE

Really?

RAIDEN

Yeah. There's probably a lot of other things that I don't know about you yet.

ROSE

... Yeah... Actually, well... There's a lot more.

RAIDEN

... Rose?

ROSE

Jack.

RAIDEN

What?

ROSE

After this mission is over let's talk, about lots of things.

RAIDEN

Yeah, let's.

ROSE

Good luck.
Shell 1 Core B1 conference hall - looking for Ames

COLONEL

Raiden, one of those hostages in there is Ames.

COLONEL

The only thing we know is that Ames wears a pacemaker. His heartbeat should sound different from other people's, so use the directional microphone to locate him.
*If player has the mic

COLONEL

Once you recognize Ames by his heartbeat, keep the microphone pointed toward him. Then push the Action Button and call out to him.

COLONEL

If it really is Ames, he should respond in some way.

RAIDEN

What if it's the wrong person?

COLONEL

The guards may get suspicious and come running instead. Security could get tighter too.

ROSE

Try to be sure before you take the risk.

COLONEL

Don't call out to a hostage with the Action Button until you're fairly sure that it's Ames.

COLONEL

If you do make a mistake, switch the microphone for an AK and get out of there before a guard gets suspicious.

COLONEL

If you're discovered inside, they'll cut off your retreat and call in the reinforcements.

COLONEL

The mission will be over if you're discovered. Don your disguise and look for Ames while deflecting the enemy's suspicion.
*If player doesn't have the mic

COLONEL

You don't have a directional microphone, however. Find one first.

COLONEL

The microphone is the only hope of identifying Ames among all the other hostages.

COLONEL

The directional microphone should be somewhere in the core of Shell 1.

ROSE

Have you searched B2 of the core?
How to use the mic

COLONEL

Once you have the directional microphone selected, the screen will switch to First Person View. Point the microphone toward the hostages with the left analog stick.

COLONEL

This is how you listen to the hostages' heartbeats. Listen carefully to pick up the sound of the pacemaker.

COLONEL

When you're sure that you have Ames, keep the microphone pointed in the same direction, then push the Action Button to call his name.

COLONEL

Don't randomly call out to people. You'll only draw unwelcome attention to yourself.

ROSE

Another thing -- whenever you have the directional microphone selected, you won't be able to move.
A word of warning about the mic

COLONEL

If the enemies see you with the directional microphone, they'll naturally be suspicious.

ROSE

I suggest you wait until the guards are out of sight before selecting the directional microphone.

COLONEL

If someone does get suspicious, switch the directional microphone for the AK immediately. It's all over if you're caught in the act.
If you're detected, it's an instant game over

COLONEL

Raiden, retain your cover at all costs inside that conference hall. There's only one way in and out of the area.

COLONEL

If you're discovered inside, they'll cut off your retreat and call in the reinforcements. You won't make it out of the room.

COLONEL

The mission will be over if you're discovered. Don your disguise and look for Ames while deflecting the enemy's suspicion.
Soldier reports back regularly

COLONEL

Raiden, it looks like the guards in charge of the hostages are in regular contact with other terrorists.

COLONEL

Even a temporary measure against a guard will disrupt communications and alert the enemy to your presence. Refrain from knocking any guards out inside this area.
Soldier reports back regularly (2)

COLONEL

The guards in charge of the hostages are in regular contact with other terrorists.

COLONEL

If regular contact is cut off, that means they would discover your presence. There's no way you can survive if you are surrounded by the enemy in that area.

COLONEL

Do not destroy enemy radios or use your chaff to interfere with their regular contact. Got it?
Do not kill any of the hostages
*First time only

COLONEL

I shouldn't have to tell you this Raiden, but for the record, you are forbidden to harm any of the hostages.

ROSE

You wouldn't do a thing like that anyway, right?
*Second and subsequent times

COLONEL

The guards are keeping watch over the hostages. If something happens to even one of them, they'll realize that an intruder is in the room.

COLONEL

That place is a death trap if you're unmasked and surrounded. Do not, I repeat, do not harm the hostages in any way.
Explanation of the area

COLONEL

That area is the Hall. Looks like there is going to be a presidential welcome reception.

RAIDEN

You mean, we're gonna come flyin' in and crash that party?
Player has struck one or more hostages repeatedly

COLONEL

Raiden, you appear to be enjoying yourself slapping around defenseless hostages.

ROSE

I can't believe you. I didn't think you were the kind of person to do such a thing...

COLONEL

Good thing you saw him for what he really was, huh, Rosemary?

ROSE

Yeah, I don't know this person anymore. Good-bye!
Player looked up the skirt of a female hostage

COLONEL

Raiden... What are you doing?... You forget yourself.

ROSE

I can't believe you! What's wrong with you!?

COLONEL

I highly disapprove.

RAIDEN

Ah... umm, I'm just...

ROSE

What do you mean, "I'm just"?

COLONEL

Rosemary, you're right. One shouldn't stoop to vulgar levels just because they've set foot on the battlefield.

COLONEL

But I can sympathize with you there...

ROSE

You what?

COLONEL

Err, nothing...

ROSE

How twisted, the both of you!!
Player took an upskirt photo of a female hostage

ROSE

Jack!! What the hell are you doing? You are sick, you know!

COLONEL

Rosemary...

RAIDEN

... Colonel, was I wrong in what I did?...

COLONEL

Perhaps. There are certain things that a person can and can't do.

RAIDEN

Yeah, maybe you're right...

COLONEL

Do you understand?

RAIDEN

Yes.

COLONEL

Come out of this thing alive, both for yourself and so as not to waste your training.

RAIDEN

No need to tell me that, Colonel.

COLONEL

Right. And... I recommend you not throw away that picture.

RAIDEN

Colonel.

COLONEL

... What?

RAIDEN

You're not joking...

COLONEL

...

RAIDEN

... Are you?

COLONEL

Continue your duties. Understood?

RAIDEN

Yes, sir.
•Snake
Prior to Meeting Ames
After the Ninja shows up

RAIDEN

Pliskin... do you read me?

SNAKE

What's up, Raiden?

RAIDEN

I just ran into a guy decked out like a... a ninja.

SNAKE

A ninja?

RAIDEN

Yeah. Do you know anything about this?

SNAKE

No. Can you trust that costumed freak?

RAIDEN

I don't know. But the Colonel told me to follow the guy's instructions...

SNAKE

*sarcastically* And like a good soldier, you'll do it, right?

SNAKE

I'll let you in on a little secret, kid... The ninja that was publicized in the Shadow Moses incident no longer exists. The guy you met has no connection whatsoever with the incident.

RAIDEN

And how do you know that?

SNAKE

Because I do.

RAIDEN

...

SNAKE

Just be careful who you trust. Okay?
Ames - after Fatman battle

RAIDEN

Pliskin... Do you know anything about a Secret Service agent named Ames?

SNAKE

Ames?

RAIDEN

You've heard of him?

SNAKE

Uh, no...

RAIDEN

Listen, if you know anything...

SNAKE

No. I got the name mixed up with someone else. Forget it.
Shell 2 Core 1F node location

SNAKE

Raiden, the node for that area is inside a small room to the northwest. You'd better log in.
•Colonel
After Meeting Ames
Equip your AK

COLONEL

Raiden, put on the enemy's uniform. Ocelot is headed your way! Don't forget to select the AK as well!
The hostage wasn't killed?

RAIDEN

Colonel, apparently Ames didn't even know that the hostages were killed in retaliation for SEAL Team 10's incursion.

COLONEL

Yeah. The hostages were probably in a different room.

RAIDEN

...

COLONEL

Raiden, focus on your duties. For right now concentrate on rescuing the President. Head for the first floor of Shell 2's core.
The black case

RAIDEN

Do you think Ames was telling the truth about the football?

COLONEL

Rosemary.

ROSE

Roger that. Jack, I'll look into it for you.
Details on the black case

COLONEL

Raiden, Rosemary has completed her search.

ROSE

Jack, I found data on the briefcase used to unlock the nuclear launch codes.

ROSE

It appears to be a fail-safe system using the President's DNA base order and input of his physiological data as its key.

ROSE

The lock is said to be impenetrable.

RAIDEN

In other words, the President himself is the only one who can enter the password?

ROSE

Right. On top of that, as Ames mentioned before, the password becomes invalid when the President's brain waves, heartbeat, etc. are not within normal limits.

RAIDEN

So the President entered that code by his own free will after all. But why would the U.S. President lend a hand to terrorists?

ROSE

How should I... I don't have information like that.

RAIDEN

... Yeah, I guess you wouldn't...

ROSE

Also, it seems that the need to reconfirm the code after a set amount of time is true.

RAIDEN

Meaning that the President is safe... right? How about the story of the black case also serving as the launch key to a new model of Metal Gear?

ROSE

That wasn't in the records.

RAIDEN

Hmph.

COLONEL

Stories of a new Metal Gear model aside, it is certain that they have finished inputting the code... and are trying to launch the nuclear warhead.

COLONEL

Meet with the President and ascertain the truth. Hurry. You must meet with him while he is still alive.
Solid Snake, terrorist leader

RAIDEN

Colonel, I saw the terrorist leader. Is that Solid Snake?

COLONEL

Yes. He's the terrorist who sunk the tanker two years ago.

RAIDEN

...

COLONEL

Raiden, do you think he's some kind of hero? You heard him, right?

COLONEL

Solid Snake is a terrorist. You must fight him. Do you understand?
The President

COLONEL

Raiden, rescue the President. Head for the first floor of the Shell 2 Core.

RAIDEN

Colonel, is the President one of them? Ames said that the President entered the code with his own free will...

COLONEL

But you heard how they are planning to get rid of the President, right?

RAIDEN

Yeah...

ROSE

They are going their separate ways?

COLONEL

No. First off, the President is not necessarily extra baggage for the terrorists.

RAIDEN

...

COLONEL

If you have your doubts, you should address them when you meet him.

RAIDEN

Roger that...
Outer Heaven

RAIDEN

Colonel, the "Outer Heaven" that Snake mentioned...

COLONEL

Ah, yes. It is a despotic military state built by a guy called Big Boss, the greatest soldier in history and Snake's father -- genetically speaking.

RAIDEN

He tried to restart it?

COLONEL

I don't know. But word has it that his brother Liquid Snake hoped for an Outer Heaven, also.

COLONEL

It might have had some special significance for the two brothers.
A nuclear EMP strike

COLONEL

If they caused a nuclear explosion over Manhattan, there would be serious repercussions.

COLONEL

Blast energy from a high-altitude nuclear detonation is released mostly as gamma rays.

COLONEL

This would emit a strong electromagnetic pulse through a secondary reaction within the ambient atmosphere.

COLONEL

The pulse itself would last for a mere 500 nanoseconds. But in terms of power emitted, it would instantaneously release 500 billion megawatts.

COLONEL

This electromagnetic pulse would cause a high voltage surge to antennas and cable, frying all circuits.

COLONEL

Scalar waves from a nuclear explosion have a higher degree of penetration than normal electromagnetic waves. Civilian electromagnetic protection devices would be useless.

COLONEL

The area affected would likely range over several thousand kilometers. All electronic devices within New York would probably be rendered completely useless.

ROSE

If something like this happened...

RAIDEN

Panic on a worldwide scale would be unavoidable.

COLONEL

The feasibility of using an EMP blast from a nuclear weapon as an attack has been researched for decades.

COLONEL

The Starfish Project, carried out on Johnston Island in the South Pacific in 1962, is one example.

RAIDEN

Wasn't that to study the effects of high-altitude nuclear detonation on radios and radars?

COLONEL

Ostensibly, yes. Electromagnetic weapon development had already begun prior to that, since the time of Project Argus.

RAIDEN

Now they're trying to use it for real...?

COLONEL

Aimed at the heart of our nation. We can't let them detonate the core. Hurry, Raiden!
After Ames's death - the Ninja

RAIDEN

That Ninja helped me again. Do you have any information on him?

ROSE

Sorry. I've looked around, but nothing.

COLONEL

I don't know what he wants, but he is trying to help you, that much is certain. Don't let your guard down, though.
After Ames's death - all Caution Mode

COLONEL

Raiden, this is not good. Enemies in Shell 1 are systematically searching for you.
*First time only

ROSE

It looks like they've tightened security considerably. Watch yourself.

COLONEL

Get out of Shell 1. According to Ames, the President is on the first floor of Shell 2's core.

COLONEL

Cross the connecting bridge from the north side of Strut D to get to Shell 2. That's where you need to go.
Disguise no good

COLONEL

Looks like you've lost your balaclava, Raiden. You'll no longer be able to impersonate enemy personnel.
Retinal scanner damaged after Ames encounter

COLONEL

The retinal scanner appears to be broken. You won't be able to get through to the conference hall anymore. Keep going.
•Snake
After Meeting Ames
Ames

SNAKE

Y'know, I thought I heard of Ames somewhere before... DIA would mean we're talking about Nastasha's ex-husband.

RAIDEN

Nastasha? Nastasha Romanenko? Isn't she the one who wrote "In the Darkness of Shadow Moses"?

SNAKE

Yeah. She helped me out during the Shadow Moses incident.

SNAKE

She was also actively involved in the Philanthropy organization following the incident.

RAIDEN

Where is she now?

SNAKE

Your guess is as good as mine. But she's probably still a heavy smoker...
Outer Heaven

RAIDEN

Have you ever heard of Outer Heaven?

SNAKE

Outer Heaven!?

RAIDEN

Yeah. Know anything?

SNAKE

Uh, no. What about it?

RAIDEN

The terrorist leader mentioned it. Something about being close to reviving Outer Heaven.

SNAKE

Is that right...

RAIDEN

Well? Do you know anything?

SNAKE

No. But whatever their goal is, they're probably up to no good. We've got to stop them...

RAIDEN

Yeah... right...
•Colonel
Destroying the Infrared Sensors
Shell 1-2 Connecting Bridge - sniping event

COLONEL

Raiden, what you see there is a booby trap consisting of an infrared sensor and Semtex.

COLONEL

The Semtex will detonate if the IR beam from the sensor is disturbed. Whatever you do, don't touch the IR beam.

COLONEL

But there's no way to get through there without crossing the beam.

COLONEL

Neutralize all the control units for the IR sensor.

COLONEL

Those control units in the distance are obviously out of handgun range.

RAIDEN

What do I do then?

COLONEL

Use the sniper rifle to take them out.
*If player doesn't have the PSG1

COLONEL

Those control units in the distance are obviously out of handgun range. Look for a sniper rifle.
*Before asking Snake the location

ROSE

Lieutenant J.G. Pliskin would know this kind of thing, wouldn't he?
*After asking Snake the location

COLONEL

Didn't he say that there was a PSG1 in the Strut F warehouse?
*If player has the PSG1

COLONEL

Use the PSG1 sniper rifle to shoot out control units that are farther away.
This PSG1 is different from MGS1's

COLONEL

The PSG1's controls have been slightly modified from what you learned in the VR training. Note the differences.

COLONEL

The PSG1's scope is equipped with a zoom function.

COLONEL

Zoom in for a precise strike, and zoom out when you need a wider field of view. Learn to make good use of the function.

COLONEL

The PSG1 can be aimed from upright, crouch, and prone positions.

COLONEL

The different heights of these stances will help you get a bead on targets concealed behind objects.

COLONEL

Remember, shoot from a stable position to prevent shakes.
Control unit locations (1)

COLONEL

The IR sensor cannot be taken offline until all the control units are destroyed.

COLONEL

If the sensor is still live, it means there are control units you haven't touched somewhere.
Control unit locations (2)

COLONEL

Raiden, you haven't destroyed all the control units yet. Use the First Person View or the sniper scope to look around.
Do not shoot the bombs

COLONEL

Raiden, the Semtex is equipped with shock sensors.

COLONEL

Any blow to the Semtex -- gunfire included -- will set off the sensor... and start a chain reaction that will detonate all the bombs.

COLONEL

We'll be finished if that were to happen. Aim only for the control units.
If player is somewhere other than the DG Connecting Bridge

COLONEL

You can't reach Shell 2 unless the infrared sensor trap on the connecting bridge between the two Shells is deactivated.
*If player doesn't have the PSG1

COLONEL

You'll need a sniper rifle to take out the sensors' control units. Find yourself a sniper rifle.
*If player has the PSG1

COLONEL

Use the PSG1 to destroy the sensors' control units, then head to Shell 2 to rescue the President.
After destroying the sensors - head for Shell 2

COLONEL

Raiden, the IR sensors on the connecting bridge between the two Shells are offline.

COLONEL

Go to the first floor of Shell 2's core, and rescue the President.
•Snake
Destroying the Infrared Sensors
Shell 1-2 Connecting Bridge - use the PSG1

SNAKE

Don't try to shoot out control units with the handgun when the distance is too great. The weapon doesn't have that kind of range. Use the sniper rifle.
*If player has the PSG1

SNAKE

Use the PSG1 to take out those control units.
*If player doesn't have the PSG1

SNAKE

I saw a PSG1 in the storage room on Strut F. There should be one left, so go and grab it.
If player is somewhere other than Shell 1-2 Connecting Bridge

SNAKE

In order to get to Shell 2, you'll have to disable the IR sensors on the connecting bridge between Shells 1 and 2.
*If player has the PSG1

SNAKE

Use your PSG1 to take out the IR sensors' control units. Head to the connecting bridge between Shells 1 and 2.
