Move around while you shoot

SNAKE

If some pipe or a storage tank gets between you and the control unit, find another vantage point. There will always be a spot that gives you a clear shot.
You're not done yet

SNAKE

Raiden, you didn't get all the control units. You weren't thorough enough.
-->Control unit location hints
Control unit location hints
(1) Covered by seagulls

SNAKE

Wait -- there were a lot of birds around there, right?

SNAKE

There may be control units hidden behind the birds. Fire a few shots around them and get the birds to move.
(2) Behind the flag

SNAKE

I remember seeing a flag there. It kept whipping in different directions as the wind changed...

SNAKE

Take a careful look behind the flag, and you should see a control unit.
(3) Cypher

SNAKE

I had some trouble with Cyphers flying around the area.

SNAKE

Take a good look at the airborne Cypher. You can see the control unit for the IR sensor.

SNAKE

The control unit is right above Cypher's camera. Avoid shooting the camera at all costs.

SNAKE

Looks like if a Cypher is shot down, the resulting signal will trigger an explosion. The whole bridge would blow.

SNAKE

Target only the control unit on the upper part of the Cypher. Aim for the blinking light.
(4) Look behind you

SNAKE

The control units aren't all necessarily on the Shell 2 side. Try looking around more.

SNAKE

Use First Person View to investigate the Shell 1 and Strut D sides. There should be control units above the door. Take those out too.
Semtex facts and figures

SNAKE

The stuff used in that trap is Semtex. It's a plastic explosive like C4.

SNAKE

Developed in former Czechoslovakia, the stuff was called the "Terrorist's C4" back in the Cold War days.

SNAKE

Made from RDX and PETN, Semtex is easy to handle and very powerful. The stuff can devastate an area. Whatever you do, don't get caught in its explosion.
The President's security (1)
*After the Shell 1-2 Connecting Bridge Codec call, but before destroying the infrared sensors

SNAKE

The reinforcements that rush up whenever you're discovered by the enemy are the President's special security unit.

SNAKE

They are the cream of the Secret Service, and have previously served as members of CAT -- the Counter Assault Team, which is part of the Presidential security force.

SNAKE

These guys have seen more action than you'll ever see in a lifetime.

SNAKE

Their equipment is based on the Land Warrior System, which has been an Army development project over the last century.

SNAKE

You've been with Force XXI, so you should know what I'm talking about. It's the latest infantry equipment enhanced with advanced data communication and processing features.

SNAKE

The system is designed to treat each infantry soldier as a single terminal in a network...

SNAKE

The helmet has a mounted display that provides everything from sensor and map updates to directives and commands from a command outpost.

SNAKE

Through a data link, the soldier is also provided with video and graphic information such as current location -- including the placement of friendly units -- and rendezvous points.

SNAKE

Also included with the package are various targeting systems, bio-sensors, GPS receiving units, and the latest data-processing equipment.

RAIDEN

If I remember right, didn't the Army have a problem finding a battery with enough longevity to power the equipment...

SNAKE

That's right. But the development of a sealed membrane battery capable of withstanding the wear and tear of combat situations solved that problem, making the system practical.

SNAKE

On top of that, the weight of all this equipment is no longer a problem, thanks to the DARPA-developed exoskeleton technology with human strength amplification capabilities.

SNAKE

A soldier may look slow and clumsy in all this equipment, but don't let that fool you...
The President's security (2)

SNAKE

Former members of the President's Special Security Unit are equipped with ceramic-plated armor.

SNAKE

Attacking any spot other than the head is pretty much a waste of time. For results, go for the head.

SNAKE

Actually, the best course for survival is to avoid any direct confrontation with these guys...
•Colonel
Harrier Battle
AMRAAMs

COLONEL

Harriers are equipped with Advanced Medium Range Air-to-Air Missiles -- commonly known as AMRAAM.

COLONEL

This is a type of active homing missile that uses a built-in radar guidance system for a "Fire and Forget" capability. The accuracy rate is quite high.

COLONEL

Electronic interference is probably the only way to evade it. Use the chaff to disrupt the missile's guidance system.
After hearing "AMRAAM" conversation, right before launch

COLONEL

Raiden, incoming AMRAAM! Break out the chaff!
Cluster bombs

COLONEL

That Harrier 2 is equipped with cluster bombs. Each bomb is full of bomblets -- a combined munitions weapon.

COLONEL

A cluster bomb has a huge effective range -- there's no way to avoid one on the upper level of a connecting bridge. Escape by going to the lower level.
Rockets

COLONEL

Both wings are outfitted with an air-to-surface rocket pod.

COLONEL

The rockets aren't guided, so moving should get you out of their way. Watch out for the blast, though.
Attack runs

COLONEL

Don't start scurrying about even after the Harrier has flown away and is no longer in eyesight.

COLONEL

When the Harrier is pointed in your direction... it should flash for a moment as it reflects the sun. Don't miss that flash.

COLONEL

Locate it as early as possible and hit it with a Stinger. If you delay, you'll be attacked.
Harrier battle - use your radar

COLONEL

Don't panic, even if you lose sight of the Harrier. Look at your radar.

COLONEL

The radar has been modified to show where the Harrier is. Use the radar and locate the Harrier's position.
Exhaust burns

COLONEL

The Harrier's exhaust is extremely hot. You cannot afford to get enveloped in it. When the Harrier draws near, run down to the lower level.
Flares

COLONEL

The Harrier is outfitted with IR Flares, a countermeasure that burns in mid-air with magnesium to deceive infrared homing missiles.

COLONEL

Shooting a flare will draw any launched Stinger missiles towards the flare.
Small arms won't work

COLONEL

Raiden, handguns and machine guns can't stand up to fighter jets. Use the Stinger missiles instead.
Basic strategies

COLONEL

Dodge the Harrier's attacks and launch a counterattack between their strikes.

COLONEL

That connecting bridge is divided into upper and lower sections. Use the structure to your advantage.

COLONEL

The upper level offers a clear view and better targeting opportunity, but leaves you vulnerable to the Harrier's airstrike.
*If player has RGB6

COLONEL

Use the RGB6 to your advantage.
*If player is on lower level

COLONEL

The lower level offers more cover. It makes it easier to evade the Harrier's attacks, but your own aim will suffer as well.

COLONEL

I would recommend that you use the Stinger.
Harrier battle - when to use the RGB6

COLONEL

When the Harrier is hovering near the connecting bridge, the RGB6 should also be effective.
•Snake
Harrier Battle
Harrier infodump

OTACON

The Harrier 2 is an upgraded version of the world's first practical V/STOL fighter plane.

OTACON

By shifting the propulsion of the engine nozzles on the sides, the plane can handle short-distance vertical take-offs and landings.

OTACON

The payload capacity of the Harrier 2 is considerably larger than its predecessor due to improved engine output.

OTACON

As a result, it carries more armament.

OTACON

Starting with a 25mm machine gun pod on the fuselage pylon...

OTACON

... there are air-to-surface rockets on both wings, and various pods for air-to-air missiles and cluster bombs.

OTACON

You won't be able to take out one of these with small arms fire. The fact is, you'll need to use Stinger missiles.
Harrier cluster bombs

OTACON

Raiden, watch out for the Harrier's cluster bombs.

OTACON

Cluster bombs are non-guided units packed with a couple hundred bomblets for wide-range attacks.

OTACON

The bombs are equipped with timed fuses for detonation following release. The dispenser explodes, spreading the bomblets across a wide area.
*Second and subsequent times

OTACON

Cluster bombs cover an extensive range. If you see one being launched, head for the floor beneath the connecting bridge.
Harrier AMRAAMs

OTACON

The Harrier 2's equipped with AMRAAM mid-range air-to-air missiles.

OTACON

The AMRAAM is an active homing missile designed to succeed the Sparrow.

OTACON

On the final phase of its guided approach to a target, the missile locks on to the objective with an active seeker and goes into full autonomous flight mode.

OTACON

In short, the AMRAAM is a missile with "fire-and-forget" capability.

OTACON

This aspect of the missile makes it ideal for fire-and-run tactics, significantly improving the mission survival rate of the firing aircraft.

OTACON

With a high-performance active seeker, the AMRAAM is extremely functional. Once fired, it pretty much zeroes in on its target with deadly accuracy.

RAIDEN

And how do you avoid one of these?

OTACON

I recommend chaff grenades.

OTACON

The AMRAAM's been reinforced against ECMs. In fact, the missile's been designed to home in on the source of electronic countermeasures.

OTACON

But that only applies to air combat. It's highly unlikely that the missile's equipped for tracking human targets with any precision.
*Second and subsequent times

OTACON

You should be able to sufficiently throw an AMRAAM off course with a chaff grenade. The minute you see one launched, break out the grenade.
Harrier machine gun

OTACON

The Harrier 2's fuselage pylons are equipped with 25mm machine gun pods.

OTACON

With a firing speed of 3,800 rounds per minute, rounds are launched at an initial velocity of over 1,000 meters per second. In other words, don't get shot.
*Second and subsequent times

OTACON

As soon as the Harrier's guns commence firing, take cover. Don't even think about facing off against that kind of firepower.
Rocket launchers

OTACON

The Harrier 2 comes equipped with air-to-surface rocket pods on both wings.

OTACON

The Harrier 2 rockets are not guided. You can avoid direct hits by moving away from the targeted area following a launch. But watch out for the blast.
Kasatka infodump

OTACON

We're currently aboard a Ka-60 Kasatka helicopter, a multi-purpose military aircraft of the Russian Kamov Design Bureau.

OTACON

This copter is capable of handling various missions including troop and supply transport, medical evacuation, target acquisition for attack copters, and all-weather scouting.

OTACON

Equip it with the latest avionics and electronic equipmen and the Kasatka can handle communication and electronic jamming as well as other special operations.

OTACON

The copter's designed for survival in combat and the main systems are expandable.

OTACON

The rotors are capable of functioning if they've been punctured. In addition, the Kasatka's features a polyurethane-filled fuel tank to minimize the danger of explosion.

OTACON

However, the Kasatka cannot hold its own against a Harrier. It's only suitable for providing you with air support.

OTACON

What I'm trying to say is that it's up to you to take out the Harrier.
Will provide backup during Harrier battle

SNAKE

Raiden, I'll back you up from the chopper. If I see you run short of an Item, I'll toss it down. Make good use of those.
Attacked by Raiden
(1)

SNAKE

Raiden! Where do you think you're aiming!?
(2)

SNAKE

Stop messin' around!!
(3)

SNAKE

You have something against us that we don't know about!?
Kasatka on its last legs
(1)

SNAKE

Raiden, we're not doing so well up here. This would be a good time to get rid of that Harrier.
(2)

RAIDEN

Are you two all right!?

SNAKE

Sorry Raiden, but we're just about done unless you could do something about the Harrier.
Harrier battle - basic strategies

SNAKE

The Harrier may be designed for vertical take-off and landing, but it's a fighter after all. Agility isn't one of its strong points.

SNAKE

There's always a slight pause between its attacks. That's your opportunity.
Use the Stinger

SNAKE

Raiden, you've got those Stingers I gave you earlier, right?

RAIDEN

Portable anti-aircraft missiles? I had complete VR training in those too.

SNAKE

*sarcastically* Gee, I feel so much better knowing that. Hopefully, you'll know how to use them in actual battle conditions too.
*Second and subsequent times

SNAKE

Shoot the Harrier down with your Stinger missile. But remember that while you're aiming the missile launcher, you won't be able to move around.

SNAKE

As soon as you see the Harrier headed your way, find cover.

SNAKE

Hit the First Person View Button to do a weapon quick-change. Make use of it.
Section 6
After Harrier 2 Battle – Vamp Sniping Event
Harrier Battle Victory 1
3D Cutscene 1
(Shell 1-2 Connecting Bridge)
Raiden succeeds in shooting down the Harrier with the help of Snake in the chopper.
The Harrier collides with the Strut G section of the connecting bridge during the course of its fall. The bridge is severely damaged, and Strut G now leans heavily to the left. Completely out of control, the Harrier goes into a freefall! As it plummets right past Raiden, he can see the rage on the face of Solidus in the cockpit.
But just as the plane is about to slam into the ocean, the water heaves upward. Snake, from his perch in the Kasatka, sees a giant shadow beneath the surface.

SNAKE

There's something coming up!
Metal Gear RAY (head portion), in all its size, breaks through the waves! RAY catches the Harrier in its jaws, saving it from destruction!

RAIDEN

That's Metal Gear!? It's already active! (He thinks that Metal Gear RAY is the new Metal Gear.)
The RAY (prototype manned model) fires a volley of homing missiles (multiple warhead type) from pods on its back, the Harrier still between its jaws! The missiles land on the bridge as well as on Struts G and D, exploding with terrible force! One of them detonates close to the Kasatka!
The blast sends Raiden sliding down the side (railing) of Shell 2. He grabs hold of the railing at the last moment, dangling from it! The railing bends under his weight and drops with him for another 10 feet or so. Snake and Otacon's Kasatka veers away toward Shell 1, trailing smoke.
RAY still has the Harrier firmly in its mouth.
Solidus opens the cockpit. One of his eyes has been badly damaged and is bleeding. Solidus wipes the wound with his palm, utterly unmoved.

SOLIDUS

*pleased* They got my eye.
Vamp follows him out of the cockpit where he had been sitting in the front (pilot's seat) of the tandem seats. Solidus calls toward the Harrier's cockpit.

SOLIDUS

Vamp -- go!
Solidus gestures to Vamp. The latter still has the gunshot wound in his side that he received from Raiden (by the infiltration pool).
Vamp grins and leaps down to the ocean!
Meanwhile, the chopper has limped back to the heliport after a low flight.
A look down from its cockpit reveals Raiden managing to pull himself up from the railing onto the tilted bridge.
Vamp runs across the surface of the water. He seems not to even notice the chaos around him, charging ahead with a look of nonchalance.

OTACON

Hey, what's that -- ?

SNAKE

It's running on water...!
Raiden leans over the edge of the bridge and gets a look at Vamp running below. He reaches Strut L's base column and zooms up the ladder (he doesn't use his hands; he runs on top of it) like a spider speeding up a wall.
RAY, still holding onto the Harrier, disappears from view in a matter of seconds.
Raiden stands up on the tilted bridge. His Codec rings!
Harrier Battle Victory 2
Codec Call 1
(mandatory incoming call from Snake)

SNAKE

Raiden, you all right?

RAIDEN

Yeah. How about you guys?

SNAKE

Barely managed, but we're all right.

RAIDEN

The chopper?

SNAKE

We need some time for repairs.

RAIDEN

Oh...

SNAKE

The President's all yours.

RAIDEN

OK... Can I ask you something?

SNAKE

What?

RAIDEN

Are you THE Snake?

SNAKE

...

RAIDEN

They said you were dead...

SNAKE

No, not me. There are still too many things I need to do.

RAIDEN

Snake, you're a legend -- and that's why I need to ask you this.

SNAKE

Legend?

SNAKE

A legend is nothing but fiction. Someone tells it, someone else remembers, everybody passes it on.

RAIDEN

I'm here because I was assigned to this mission, not because I want to. If I could, I'd be out of here in a second.

SNAKE

...

RAIDEN

How could you come back to all this? Why keep fighting?

SNAKE

There's something my best friend said to me once. (The Cyborg Ninja, Gray Fox, said it in MGS1.)

RAIDEN

Wha...?

SNAKE

We're not tools of the government or anyone else. Fighting was the only thing I was good at, but... At least I always fought for what I believed in...

RAIDEN

What about -- what about the DNA results from that body?

OTACON

That was Liquid's body. He and Snake are identical on the genetic level.

RAIDEN

Liquid?

OTACON

A deception -- for our own protection.

OTACON

We stole his frozen body from some organization. Kind of a hassle though...

SNAKE

That's all there is to it.

RAIDEN

...

RAIDEN

Are you two really an NGO?

OTACON

Insofar as we're a nonprofit organization of civilians advocating a cause, yes.

SNAKE

The cause happens to be the eradication of Metal Gear. We work on our own. But it's a cause worth fighting for.

RAIDEN

Why would you stick your neck out for something this risky?

SNAKE

That's the way I used to look at it, four years ago.

SNAKE

I was holed up in the middle of nowhere in Alaska, drinking too much.

OTACON

We have a responsibility to the coming generations, to the world.

RAIDEN

What responsibility?

OTACON

To keep track of the mistakes we've made as a species.

SNAKE

We need to remember -- to spread the word -- to fight for change. And that's what keeps me alive.

RAIDEN

You think you can change the future?

SNAKE

I'm not as arrogant as that.

RAIDEN

What you do isn't grassroots activism. It's more like terrorism.

SNAKE

I admit that...

OTACON

But our group, Philanthropy, received some information: a new Metal Gear prototype was being developed here, and terrorists were planning to raid the facility. The information came from a very reliable source.

RAIDEN

So you're here to...

OTACON

We're here to stop all that, but I also have a personal motive.

SNAKE

Looks like the terrorists have his sister in the Big Shell.

SNAKE

We're here on our own, not under anyone's orders. We have our own battles. Otacon's here for someone -- I'm not.

RAIDEN

This is a military mission.
The frequency changes!

ROSE

Jack? Are you all right?

RAIDEN

Just barely.

ROSE

You almost gave me a heart attack...

RAIDEN

Sorry. Wasn't intentional.

ROSE

I know that. And I know I need to stay stronger.

RAIDEN

Say a prayer for me, Rose. So I can come back...

ROSE

You will make it back. I'm with you all the way, remember...

RAIDEN

That means a lot to me, you know.

ROSE

I'm going to save the data, okay Jack?
Player chooses to save or not to save.

RAIDEN

Colonel, Metal Gear's already gone active... (Letting the players and Raiden believe that Metal Gear RAY is the newly activated Metal Gear even though it's been active since the Tanker Chapter.)

COLONEL

It's not too late. You can still prevent a nuclear strike by securing the President and preventing password confirmation from taking place.

COLONEL

Get to the President. He's in the core section of Shell 2.

ROSE

I'm checking the satellite images... Looks like you can get to the core from the other side of Strut L.

COLONEL

The core hasn't gone under yet from what we can tell. Follow the railings down, then jump onto the pipes.

ROSE

The only viable strut in the outer perimeter is the L. That attack just now doesn't make any sense -- it's like they have no more use for this place.

RAIDEN

Colonel, you were monitoring the Codec calls. That man was the real Snake, all along...

COLONEL

Maybe.

RAIDEN

Maybe?

COLONEL

Don't let your guard down with him.

RAIDEN

Why do you say that?

COLONEL

Because they were never a part of the simulation. They're an unknown factor.

RAIDEN

You can take your simulation and...! We're out here, we bleed, we die!

ROSE

Calm down!

COLONEL

I suggest that you do, Raiden.

COLONEL

Even if that is Snake, that has no bearing on your mission.

RAIDEN

Colonel, you and Snake used to be on the same side.

COLONEL

...

RAIDEN

I don't understand. I read about you and Snake in "In the Darkness of Shadow Moses1" --

COLONEL

I don't give a damn what that piece of trash said. Do you get me?
Olga, By Electrified Floor 1
3D Cutscene 1
(Shell 2 Core, In Front of Electrified Floor)
Raiden has shot down the Harrier and successfully infiltrated the Shell 2 Core, where the President is being held. When he enters the building's corridor, he hears a woman whispering (radio communication) from the south corner. The other voice, coming out of the radio, is Solidus's.

SOLIDUS

Olga -- Snake, he's here. In Shell 1.
Raiden cautiously approaches the turn (corner) in the corridor.

OLGA

My father had some unfinished business with him!
Raiden flattens himself against the corner and tries to get a look at who is speaking. Olga stands in front of the door (to the room where the President is being held), facing away from it. She holds the radio to her ear.

SOLIDUS

Olga, calm yourself!
Olga, By Electrified Floor 2
Interactive First Person Cutscene 1
(Shell 2 Core, In Front of Electrified Floor)
Raiden automatically readies the Directional Mic. The up, down, left, and right inputs work, but the player cannot move to another spot. They listen in on Olga's conversation in the same manner as before. Unless the mic is pointed in the right direction, the dialogue will be missed. The player cannot see Olga, and the Codec cannot be used during this cutscene.

SOLIDUS

We will not change the plan because of your personal feelings.

OLGA

Then screw your plan! I've been waiting for this day for two years, and I WILL send him to the bottom of the ocean, right next to my old man!

SOLIDUS

The launch comes first.

OLGA

Dammit!
Sound of a fist crashing into a wall.

OLGA

Where is Ocelot?

SOLIDUS

Not here.

OLGA

I don't trust him.

SOLIDUS

Don't talk that way about one of your own.

OLGA

He's NOT one of my own. He left my father to die, remember?

SOLIDUS

Olga, we'll talk later. We need to get started on the final checks for the unit.

OLGA

All right. I'm headed back there.

SOLIDUS

The upper connecting bridge to Shell 1 is down.

OLGA

What about the chopper?

SOLIDUS

The Kamov is out of action. Take the oil fence from Strut L.
Foreshadowing the route taken during the Emma sniping event.

OLGA

I'll tell my men to start pulling out.

SOLIDUS

Not yet. Their retrieval comes last -- the intruder's still at large.

OLGA

Snake...

SOLIDUS

What about the other man?

OLGA

He's got luck on his side, certainly.

SOLIDUS

He survived that explosion... Listen Olga, the Code confirmation is in one hour. Keep the President alive until then.

OLGA

I know -- no one gets in here. Turn the currents on.

SOLIDUS

Of course... (There's the sound of a switch.)
Olga, By Electrified Floor 3
3D Cutscene 2
(Shell 2 Core, In Front of Electrified Floor)
Electric currents crackle through the floor in front of Olga (between her and the door). Blue electric arcs pop just above it.

SOLIDUS

High-voltage currents on.
A visual of the room where the President is being kept. Camera tracks in on the circuit panel the player has to destroy.

OLGA

The door stays shut unless the President manages to take out that circuit panel from inside the room.
The President stands near the circuit panel. He is not bound or cuffed.

OLGA

And it's no job for bare hands.

SOLIDUS

All right. Come back immediately.

OLGA

One more thing...
Olga stares at the charged floor. Raiden listens intently through the wall.

SOLIDUS

What?
Olga starts to walk down the hall. Seeing she's headed in his direction, Raiden looks for a place to hide.

OLGA

We leave for Russia when this business is done. I want half the money for that.

SOLIDUS

That was part of the agreement.
Olga turns the corner, but Raiden is no longer there. He is behind a cargo box elsewhere in the corridor.
Olga, By Electrified Floor 4
Interactive First Person Cutscene 2
(Shell 2 Core, In Front of Electrified Floor)
Raiden automatically readies the Directional Mic. The up, down, left, and right inputs work, but the player cannot move to another spot. They listen in on Olga's conversation in the same manner as before. Unless the mic is pointed in the right direction, the dialogue will be missed. The Codec cannot be used during this cutscene. The player cannot see Olga from where Raiden is hiding.

OLGA

We start living for ourselves after this. If there's anyone who wants to stay here, I want you to take good care of them.

SOLIDUS

Gladly. Gurlukovich soldiers are the cream of the crop.

OLGA

It's time they went free...

SOLIDUS

What happened to rebuilding Mother Russia?

OLGA

The old man is dead. The world is a different place now...

SOLIDUS

It's your life.

OLGA

Just as a reminder, I'm going to say this again, one last time: Don't try anything on us.

SOLIDUS

The feeling is mutual...
Olga ends the transmission and exits through the hatch. Sound of the hatch closing. Raiden contacts the Colonel.
Olga, By Electrified Floor 5
Codec Call 1
(mandatory outgoing call to the Colonel)

RAIDEN

I'm in front of the room where they're keeping the President.

COLONEL

Everything all right?

RAIDEN

No sign of flooding, but I can't get close to the door. The floor is electrified.

COLONEL

Don't test it. You'll be bacon.

RAIDEN

Any suggestions?

COLONEL

Remember the Shadow Moses VR training.

RAIDEN

Take out the circuit panel?

COLONEL

Right.

RAIDEN

But there's no way into the room.

COLONEL

Try ventilation ducts.

RAIDEN

Yeah, I think I see one.

COLONEL

Look for a remote-control missile launcher. You can guide it through the duct into the room.

RAIDEN

Then target the circuit panel. Got it!
Smaller screen-within-a-screen. Visuals for the remote-controlled missile sequence. What is shown is the most difficult course.

COLONEL

Right. But make sure you don't hit the President.

RAIDEN

The President is wired with nanomachines. If we know the frequency, I can raise him...

COLONEL

We've tried that repeatedly, but there's no response. It looks like the walls have a built-in radio shield.

RAIDEN

So that's why Ames lost contact with him...

COLONEL

If you need to confirm his position, you can log into the node.

RAIDEN

Understood.

COLONEL

Locate a remote-control missile launcher first.
Circuit Panel Destroyed 1
3D Cutscene 1
((NM) – Air Purification Room)
Raiden has come to the Shell 2 Core to rescue the President, but the entrance to the room he's being held in is blocked by a floor with a high-voltage electric current running through it. Raiden uses a remote-controlled missile to destroy the power distribution panel, securing access to the president's room.
The President 1
3D Cutscene 1
(MC)
Having used a remote-controlled missile to destroy the power distribution panel, Raiden enters the Shell 2 Core 1F Air Purification Room, where the President is being held.
As far as the room goes, Raiden already knows what to expect after having viewed it through the remote-controlled missile, but out of an abundance of caution, he readies his SOCOM before breaching it. After proceeding through the first, smaller room at the entrance, the President walks over to meet him. Behind him, smoke still spews from what is left of the circuit panel. After confirming the man before him is indeed the President (he has seen his face on TV, after all), Raiden holsters his weapon. He stands opposite the 44th president of the United States, James Johnson.

RAIDEN

President Johnson...
The president looks at Raiden's gear. At first there is a sense of shock, but then feelings of resignation wash over him.

PRESIDENT

*self-deprecatingly* So you're finally here... (He thinks Raiden has come to kill him for betraying the Patriots.)

RAIDEN

You've been expecting me? (How do you know me?)

PRESIDENT

Your equipment -- that Skull Suit isn't exactly standard military issue.

RAIDEN

... Are you alright, sir?
Raiden looks the President over. There are no signs of injury anywhere.
The president can't help but be perplexed by Raiden's concern for his well-being.

PRESIDENT

Is this some kind of sick joke?

RAIDEN

?
The President pats some dirt off his suit and straightens his crooked tie.

PRESIDENT

I thought you came to kill me...

RAIDEN

?
The President approaches Raiden.

PRESIDENT

I'm prepared to face the consequences of my betrayal.

RAIDEN

What are you -- (talking about) !?

PRESIDENT

*thinking* ...
The President brings Raiden close to him (embraces him).
Raiden is taken aback by his commander-in-chief's sudden friendliness. With no warning, the president then grabs Raiden's crotch.

RAIDEN

*confused* What the --!

PRESIDENT

You're... a man...? (You aren't that woman.)
The president withdraws his hand. He realizes that Raiden is not the minion of the Patriots (i.e., the Ninja) sent to the plant.

PRESIDENT

Hmph. Well, who are you?

RAIDEN

FOXHOUND, sir. (He doesn't hesitate because it's the President asking.)

PRESIDENT

*thinks for a moment* FOXHOUND?
The President nods to himself as he turns his back to Raiden and takes a little walk.

PRESIDENT

Now things are starting to make a little sense... (He's filled with self-loathing, disappointment, and defeat.)
The President stops in his tracks. He realizes this too is part of the S3 Plan, and reluctantly accepts the hand he has been dealt. This entire time he thought this act of rebellion against the Patriots was one he had engineered through his own volition, but no—even that was something they had manipulated him into doing.
The President turns back around and faces Raiden.

PRESIDENT

Switch over to nanocommunication so nobody can listen in.

RAIDEN

Yes, sir.
The President 2
Codec Call 1
(internal communication with the President)

RAIDEN

Do you read me, sir?

PRESIDENT

Uh... yes. (He isn't used to nanocommunication.)

RAIDEN

Mr. President. It's my understanding that the terrorists have managed to input the code sequence necessary for launching a nuclear strike...

PRESIDENT

That's correct. I punched the sequence in myself. (He readily admits it.)

RAIDEN

You're working for them!?

PRESIDENT

*self-mockingly* If you asked me two hours ago, my answer would have been yes. Right now, they're keeping me alive until my vital signs are reconfirmed.

RAIDEN

They betrayed you?

PRESIDENT

I wouldn't quite put it that way. I wanted power. They sought destruction.

RAIDEN

But why stoop to terrorism!? (Doesn't really undersand since he is talking to the President.)

PRESIDENT

I wanted absolute power.

RAIDEN

But you're the President -- you have power...

PRESIDENT

No. I'm just a figurehead.

RAIDEN

Huh?

PRESIDENT

I don't have any control. The real power is in the Patriots' hands.

RAIDEN

The Patriots...?

PRESIDENT

The truth behind this country...
The President 3
Movie Cutscene 1
(the White House, etc.)

PRESIDENT

I'm not surprised you've never heard of them. Very few are aware of their existence, even among those with codeword clearance.

RAIDEN

?

PRESIDENT

Politics, the military, the economy -- they control it all. They even choose who becomes President...

PRESIDENT

Putting it simply, the Patriots rule this country.

RAIDEN

No... (That's just impossible!)
Real-life footage... The American flag.

PRESIDENT

*self-deprecatingly* Hard to believe, isn't it? But it's the truth.

PRESIDENT

The Space Defense, income tax reduction and the National Missile Defense (NMD) programs -- Every policy that's been credited to me was actually done according to their instructions.

RAIDEN

Space Defense was initiated by Congress...

PRESIDENT

That's what the Patriots want the country to believe...

PRESIDENT

It's all a show. "Democracy" is just a filler for textbooks!

PRESIDENT

Think about it! Do you actually believe that public opinion influences the government?

RAIDEN

... No.

PRESIDENT

This country is shaped and controlled as the Patriots see fit. The people are shown what they want to believe. What you call government is actually a well-staged production aimed at satisfying the public!

RAIDEN

...

PRESIDENT

Don't look at me like that -- I'm legally sane, you know.

RAIDEN

It's not your sanity that worries me...
The President 4
Movie Cutscene 2
(Patriots PICT)
Silhouettes of 12 old men—the Wisemen's Committee...

PRESIDENT

The Patriots -- even I don't know who the actual members are. Are they financial, political, or military leaders? No one knows who the Patriots really are. Even my instructions come from a cut-out.

PRESIDENT

All I've been told is that every key decision is made by a group of twelve men known as the Wisemen's Committee.

RAIDEN

*incredulously* Your Office...? The White House...?

PRESIDENT

Merely puppets. Pawns in a game.

PRESIDENT

By pledging my loyalty, an insignificant son of a senator was awarded the Presidency. Hm. Of course, that wasn't the only price I had to pay...

RAIDEN

What do you mean?

PRESIDENT

*ignores* Even if a pawn becomes a queen, it is still just a playing piece...

PRESIDENT

I wanted to leave my own mark in history. But my ambitions were (used)... (He tried to rebel, but was used in the S3 plan.)

RAIDEN

...?

PRESIDENT

*self-mockingly* You'll understand someday...
The President 5
Codec Call 2
(The President Continues)

PRESIDENT

I wished to be a member of the Patriots. I wanted to wield the power of a king, instead of being an expendable pawn...

RAIDEN

And that justifies acts of terrorism?

PRESIDENT

Yes. I'd intended to use the new Metal Gear as a bargaining chip...

RAIDEN

Bargaining chip?

PRESIDENT

But I underestimated Solidus... he actually wants to challenge the Patriots -- ... even if it means the destruction of the world!

RAIDEN

What are you saying?

PRESIDENT

Whether you believe it or not, the balance of power rests in the hands of the Patriots.

PRESIDENT

They regulate the country's various interests through controlled presentation, staging a "drama" that is palatable to the general masses. Can you imagine what would happen if they ceased to function?

RAIDEN

?

PRESIDENT

Picture a massive political vacuum, a space that every power-monger will try to fill for their own greedy ends. I'm talking about an unregulated power struggle -- panic, civil war... chaos.

PRESIDENT

Like it or not -- the Patriots is an organization that must continue to exist.

RAIDEN

*sarcastically since the President participated in terrorism* So you changed your mind because you wanted to avoid global chaos?

PRESIDENT

Exactly. When I told Solidus that I wished to prevent disaster, he replied that pawns can never become players... (He's bitter and envious of Solidus.)

RAIDEN

And who is this... Solidus?
The President 6
Movie Cutscene 3
(President Solidus PICT)
Images of Solidus when he was in office.

PRESIDENT

My predecessor... George Sears. That was the name the public came to know him by. I knew him by his codename, "Solidus Snake."

PRESIDENT

He was the third Snake, preceded by Solid and Liquid... a survivor of the "Les Enfants Terribles" project. Neither Solid nor Liquid, he was a well-balanced masterpiece that the Patriots saw fit to entrust with the Presidency.

PRESIDENT

However, he fell out of grace with the organization four years ago when, acting on his own, he started an incident.

RAIDEN

Four years ago... Shadow Moses?
The President 7
Movie Cutscene 4
(MGS1 visuals)
Cutscene consisting of game images (cutscenes) from MGS1.

PRESIDENT

At the time, the DARPA2 Chief, Donald Anderson -- together with certain influential parties -- initiated the development of Metal Gear REX and an advanced nuclear warhead. However, this did not fall in line with the Patriots' plans. What's more, Solidus decided on his own to send his most trusted man, Ocelot, to provoke Liquid Snake, bringing about the said incident.

PRESIDENT

As a result, he succeeded in obtaining REX and the data on the warhead. But in doing so, he ended up revealing the existence... of both REX and the Genome army -- a blunder that earned him the wrath of the Patriots.

PRESIDENT

Shortly thereafter, Solidus was removed from the Presidential Office.
The President 8
Codec Call 3
(internal communication with the President)

RAIDEN

I thought he resigned...

PRESIDENT

That's the story given to the general public. Following his "resignation," the Patriots selected me -- their new pawn, for the Presidency.

RAIDEN

But that would mean that the Presidential race was --

PRESIDENT

That was quite a show, wasn't it? It was a well-scripted drama staged by the Patriots for the benefit of the public. Even the Democrats and Republicans were dancing to the Patriots' tune. Everything went according to plan, but for one exception...

RAIDEN

?

PRESIDENT

Following his resignation, Solidus' health was scheduled to fail him, bringing about his untimely death.

RAIDEN

Capped...? (He's already forgotten to speak formally.)

PRESIDENT

Correct. But before the Patriots could execute their plot, Solidus went underground with the help of Ocelot. As he avoided pursuit, Solidus gained control of Dead Cell, winning over Colonel Gurlukovich's outfit. From there, he bided his time, knowing that his opportunity would soon arrive...

RAIDEN

What opportunity?

PRESIDENT

The completion of the new Metal Gear project -- an opportunity that would even his odds against the Patriots.

PRESIDENT

By stealing the Patriots' most valued project, he would be able to place them in a very uncomfortable position. It's the only chance he has for survival.

PRESIDENT

Once he has the new Metal Gear, he'll declare war against the Patriots. Needless to say, he must be stopped.

RAIDEN

*talking to himself* Metal Gear is already operational...

PRESIDENT

No. Not yet.

RAIDEN

?

PRESIDENT

What you saw was Metal Gear RAY -- Hijacked two years ago from the Marines by Ocelot. That was not the new Metal Gear.

RAIDEN

Then, where's the new Metal Gear?

PRESIDENT

Right here.

RAIDEN

What?

PRESIDENT

You're standing in it. To be more precise, this entire "Big Shell" facility is the new Metal Gear.

RAIDEN

What'd you say? (Forgetting to speak formally.)

PRESIDENT

No. I'm quite serious. The upper structure that you've seen is camouflage designed to represent an offshore cleanup facility. The main structure extends from the foundation all the way down to the ocean floor. The connecting elevator is located on the B2 floor of the Shell 1 Core.

PRESIDENT

Arsenal Gear... that's the codename for the new Metal Gear.

RAIDEN

Arsenal?
The President 9
Movie Cutscene 5
(Arsenal PICT)
Arsenal Gear blueprints, rough sketches, silhouettes, RAY illustrations...

PRESIDENT

That's right... Arsenal. We're talking about an impregnable fortress carrying a load of over a couple of thousand missiles including nuclear warheads -- all protected by a horde of mass-produced Metal Gear RAY units.

RAIDEN

Mass-produced...?

PRESIDENT

The RAY unit was originally designed for the Marines to be used as a countermeasure against the Metal Gear variations throughout the world. The Patriots had RAY redesigned to protect the new Arsenal Gear.

RAIDEN

So now anti-Metal Gears are guarding a Metal Gear?

PRESIDENT

Ironic, isn't it? (In reality, Raiden has also been remolded by the Patriots.)

PRESIDENT

That's not all. Arsenal Gear has full access to the Military's Tactical Network, giving it the ability to exercise absolute control over our nation's armed forces, not to mention our nuclear armament. In short, Arsenal was created to be the core of our country.

RAIDEN

What kind of idiotic weapon --?

PRESIDENT

Weapon? No. You're not seeing the full picture.

RAIDEN

?

PRESIDENT

Arsenal Gear is more than just a military tool...
The President 10
Codec Call 4
(internal communication with the President)

PRESIDENT

It is a means to preserve the world as it is. It will establish a new form of control. The Patriots will use it to keep their place as the country's true rulers... Right now they feel pressured and threatened.

RAIDEN

By what?

PRESIDENT

They fear an overabundance of digital information -- the world will drown in the coming flood of information, and they along with it. (Referring to the negative effects of unlimited access to unverifiable information.)

RAIDEN

?

PRESIDENT

The Arsenal plans include a system to digitally manage the flow of information, making it possible to shape the "truth" for their own purposes. In short, the Arsenal's system is the key to their supremacy.

RAIDEN

The key...?

PRESIDENT

Yes, the GW system is the Patriots' trump card. Arsenal Gear will be fully operational when GW is successfully integrated. Once operational, it will be a completely new form of power for the Patriots to wield.

PRESIDENT

I had hoped to seize the project from them so that I would be in a strong bargaining position...

RAIDEN

Bargain for what?

PRESIDENT

I'd hoped to trade my way into their ranks. But Solidus preferred rebellion. Outer Heaven -- his plan to unleash a nuclear blast over the skies of Wall Street to break the Patriots' control over the business community -- is also a key factor in his offensive effort.

RAIDEN

Outer Heaven...?

PRESIDENT

Listen. There isn't much time. The "football" served as the key for activating Arsenal Gear. I've already input the necessary code sequence...

PRESIDENT

It won't be long before GW begins to establish connections with other external systems and Arsenal Gear becomes fully operational. Stop them before that happens. That is your role.

RAIDEN

Role?

PRESIDENT

You've got to find Emma Emmerich. She's the only one who can stop that thing once it's been activated.

RAIDEN

Emma -- Emmerich? (He pauses upon hearing her last name.)

PRESIDENT

She's the system programmer for Arsenal Gear. I believe she's somewhere on level B1 in the core of this building.

RAIDEN

I thought the levels below us were flooded?

PRESIDENT

I'm sure they won't let her die just yet as she's the only remaining programmer for this project. According to Ocelot, she was being held in a locker room located in the northwest part of level B1.

PRESIDENT

Cut transmission, and get moving!
The President 11
3D Cutscene 2
((MC + KF) - Air Purification Room)

PRESIDENT

This is Card 4. It'll give you access all the way to Emma's location.
Raiden receives a Level 4 card.

PRESIDENT

Give this to her when you find her.
The President also hands Raiden an optical disc (intentionally reminiscent of the ArmsTech president).

RAIDEN

What is it?

PRESIDENT

A program for disrupting the control functions between GW and Arsenal Gear. Take Emma to the Computer Room on level B2, Shell 1 core. She'll know how to load the program into the main system.

RAIDEN

A virus?

PRESIDENT

That's right. Modeled after FOXDIE, a biological weapon designed to selectively eliminate personnel with a specific genetic code.

RAIDEN

But why do you have it?

PRESIDENT

The Patriots had it engineered as a fail-safe. And Ocelot forgot to search me. (He wasn't searched purposefully to make sure Raiden got the program. The same happened with the ArmsTech President in MGS1.)

PRESIDENT

You've got to hurry! That disc is the only way you're going to stop Arsenal!
The President backs away from Raiden and fixes his eyes on him.

PRESIDENT

Well, I've told you everything you need to know. There's only one thing that remains to be done...

RAIDEN

?
The President grabs Raiden's gun (his SOCOM) and pulls the barrel against his own chest.

PRESIDENT

Now, kill me!

RAIDEN

What the --!?

PRESIDENT

There's no time to argue! The final check for my vital ID will start any second! If you kill me now, you'll at least prevent the nuclear strike!
The president pulls the gun toward himself again and even guides Raiden's finger to the trigger.

RAIDEN

Cut it out! (Forgets to speak formally.)

PRESIDENT

Do it! That's your role! Pull!
Raiden and the President tussle.
Bang bang bang! Their struggle is broken up by several gunshots. The President has been hit in the chest.

PRESIDENT

*screams*

OCELOT

That 's abusing your right to free speech Mr. President. Or is it... Ex-president?
Raiden swings his gun around in the direction of the voice!
A revolver emerges from behind a pillar, smoke rising from its barrel.

RAIDEN

The President! Why did you --!?

OCELOT

Alas, my finger must have slipped...
Ocelot spins the revolver, then dumps out the shell casings.

OCELOT

I'll see you around, "Carrier boy"...
Like MGS1, "carrier boy" refers to the fact that Raiden is in possession of the optical disc. The Patriots wish to wipe all data on themselves from the AI. They are trying to have Raiden do here what Snake did on Shadow Moses.
Ocelot takes his leave. Raiden starts after him, but the President grabs his legs.
He pulls Raiden toward him.

PRESIDENT

Forget him... He... did us a favor...
Raiden bends down.

PRESIDENT

Without free will, there is no difference between submission and rebellion. My only real choice is to put an end to this charade... let me at least have the freedom... to end it myself...
The President lost all hope after realizing that even what he took to be his own terrorist rebellion was orchestrated as part of the Patriots' S3 Plan. Johnson's designated role in the plan was to die in front of Raiden, and he carries it out.

RAIDEN

What are you...?

PRESIDENT

Find Emma... stop Arsenal. This is my last order -- as your Commander-in-Chief... I'm counting on you...!
The President dies.
The President 12
Codec Call 5
(mandatory outgoing call to the Colonel)

RAIDEN

Colonel, the President is dead.

COLONEL

I see... I'm sorry to hear that.

RAIDEN

Where do we go from here?

COLONEL

Your mission was to rescue the President and eliminate the terrorist threat. However, given the recent turn of events, we will honor the President's last directive. You must put a stop to Arsenal Gear once and for all.

RAIDEN

Do you actually think there's any truth to his story about this "Big Shell" facility being a front for Arsenal Gear?

COLONEL

I don't have the security clearance necessary to verify the facts. However, he was the President. I'm sure he knew what he was talking about.

RAIDEN

Aren't you forgetting that he was part of the terrorist plot?

COLONEL

All the more reason why I believe his information is reliable.

RAIDEN

...

COLONEL

We're talking about a man who chose to die rather than risk a nuclear holocaust.

COLONEL

Thanks to his sacrifice, the nuclear launch authority has shifted to the Vice President, effectively eliminating the terrorist threat.

RAIDEN

Colonel, when you put it like that, it almost sounds like I should've assassinated the President to "eliminate the threat."

COLONEL

That was not my intention. I was trying to point out that there is certainly some credibility to the words of a man who chose death to protect the innocent.

ROSE

The Colonel has a point, Jack.

RAIDEN

What about the information he gave me on the "Patriots"?

COLONEL

That's a new one on me. I'll see what I can find out.

RAIDEN

...

COLONEL

Raiden, we're running out of time. Find Emma. She's supposed to be located on level B1, in the core of that building you're in, right?

RAIDEN

...

COLONEL

You've got to find her before Arsenal becomes fully operational.

ROSE

Hurry Jack!

RAIDEN

...

COLONEL

It's up to you to make sure that the President didn't sacrifice his life in vain.

RAIDEN

Understood... Raiden out.
Elucidating the Tanker 1
Codec Call 1
(mandatory incoming call from Snake)
With the President dead, Raiden leaves the room. He receives a call from Snake.

SNAKE

What's your status, Raiden?

RAIDEN

Snake? The President... he's been assassinated.

SNAKE

What!?

RAIDEN

There was nothing I could do --

SNAKE

What about the nuclear strike code sequence!?

RAIDEN

He died before his vital ID could be reconfirmed.

SNAKE

Then the enemy's lost their nuclear strike capability--

RAIDEN

But, that Ocelot guy obviously killed the President on purpose.

SNAKE

Why?

RAIDEN

It doesn't make any sense. They had to know that they couldn't launch the nuke if they killed the President.

OTACON

Maybe there's a way to launch without reconfirming the vital ID?

SNAKE

Or maybe they've found a more effective weapon within Arsenal Gear.

RAIDEN

You knew about Arsenal Gear!?

SNAKE

Yeah...

RAIDEN

*unhappy* Why didn't you tell me about it!?

SNAKE

You never asked.

RAIDEN

Am I correct in assuming you also know that the Big Shell's a front for the project!? (That's not funny. You know about it?)

SNAKE

You mean, did I know that the Big Shell, a fully functional environmental cleanup facility, was designed to camouflage Arsenal Gear? Yeah, I did. It's exactly what the President and Ames described... a massive cover story. The good news is that it hasn't really done much in terms of cleaning up the environment, so we won't have to worry about any toxic gas being released if we have to blow the house down.

RAIDEN

Right... and when did you find out about all of this? (You knew?)

SNAKE

It took a while, but we uncovered the info around the time you took out that mad bomber.

RAIDEN

...

SNAKE

There's no doubt that Arsenal Gear is being built here... then it was all set up two years ago on that day -- all of it.

RAIDEN

Two years ago... What really happened here?
Elucidating the Tanker 2
Movie Cutscene 1
(photos)
Snake shows the four photos of Metal Gear that the player took during the Tanker Chapter. They are presented as part of a website.
Snake speaks over the visuals.

SNAKE

I took these photos two years ago...

RAIDEN

I know these pictures -- they were on the news, on several websites. If I remember right, the reporters blamed you for sinking the tanker...
On another website, another photo of Snake having defeated Olga on the top deck.

SNAKE

That's right. Otacon... Me... We were used—

OTACON

We'd hoped that by going public with photos of the new Metal Gear we could 'persuade' the government. At least, that was the plan at the time...
On yet another website, a wide shot of the tanker.
*For those who haven't played the Tanker Chapter

SNAKE

The Hudson River, two years ago...

SNAKE

We had classified intelligence that a new type of Metal Gear was scheduled for transport.

SNAKE

The whole thing stank... but our noses have been out in the cold too long.
The Tanker Chapter can now be played from the title menu.
*For those who have played the Tanker Chapter

RAIDEN

I've gone through VR training of the tanker mission before.

SNAKE

Yeah? Well I doubt it accurately simulates the events of that mission.
Elucidating the Tanker 3
Movie Cutscene 2
(Tanker Chapter flashback)
3D cutscenes and in-game screens from the Tanker Chapter.

SNAKE

I'd infiltrated the dummy tanker to obtain proof that a Metal Gear was under development. Shortly after I made it aboard, an armed group led by Colonel Gurlukovich raided the ship and gained control.

OTACON

Olga and Ocelot were among the raiding party.

SNAKE

Yeah. And him... (Him = Liquid)

RAIDEN

Who're you talking about?

SNAKE

A man that was supposed to be dead.

OTACON

Their target was also Metal Gear RAY. But Ocelot eliminated Colonel Gurlukovich and Marine Commander Scott Dolph -- and he hijacked RAY.

RAIDEN

So he betrayed them?

SNAKE

I don't know what kind of deal was going down. All I remember is what Ocelot said at the time -- something like "I'm taking it back"...

OTACON

Ocelot then sank the tanker along with the soldiers of the Marine Corps...
Elucidating the Tanker 4
Codec Call 2
(Snake continues)

RAIDEN

How did you manage to get out?

SNAKE

Otacon managed to have a small boat ready for me.

OTACON

That was the easy part. The tough part was not getting dragged down with the sinking tanker -- small miracle when you think about it.

OTACON

It turned out that the whole thing was a setup to lure us.
Elucidating the Tanker 5
Movie Cutscene 3
(flashback)
Cutscene consisting of flashback visuals (3D cutscenes).
The scene with the Cypher. Snake looking up at it, etc.

OTACON

Photos of Snake -- taken by the Cypher -- were released to the public. In turn, we became the world's most wanted environmental terrorists...

SNAKE

It was definitely a move aimed at putting a stop to our anti-Metal Gear activities.

RAIDEN

But why did they choose Snake?

OTACON

Since the Shadow Moses incident, Snake became sort of a hero. I think the Patriots weren't too happy about that.

RAIDEN

You knew about the Patriots!?

OTACON

Well yes... to a certain degree.

RAIDEN

It seems like everyone knows about them except me. (He's pretty angry.)

OTACON

They didn't choose Snake to be a hero...

RAIDEN

So they decided to do a smear campaign.

OTACON

I think the Patriots wanted to make an example of him so everybody would think twice before opposing them.

RAIDEN

That's it! They set all this up just to nail you guys?

OTACON

No. There's more to it than that -- the Marines' Metal Gear RAY project headed by Commander Dolph was carried out in opposition to the Navy's Arsenal Gear project.

OTACON

To be more precise, the Patriots considered Metal Gear RAY to be a thorn in their side. Hence, they attacked the dummy tanker and stole RAY...

OTACON

They followed this up with the perfect plan. They immediately sent a fully loaded tanker to the same location and sank it, then set up the facility to camouflage the development of Arsenal Gear.

SNAKE

And we fell for it -- two more puppets in their show.
Visuals of Olga and her father.

RAIDEN

Colonel Gurlukovich... and his daughter, Olga?

OTACON

Both fell victim to Ocelot's plot.
Visuals of Ocelot killing soldiers.

RAIDEN

Was Solidus behind all this? He used Ocelot to get hold of RAY, huh?

OTACON

No. He was underground, keeping a low profile at the time.

RAIDEN

Then it must be the Patriots...

OTACON

If that's the case, what's Ocelot doing alongside Solidus?

RAIDEN

... (He has no idea.)
Elucidating the Tanker 6
Codec Call 3
(Snake continues)

SNAKE

Forget it. We're wasting time. We can figure this out later. The nuclear strike's been prevented, but Arsenal still has a massive payload of missiles to deal with.

OTACON

Right. If the opposition gets control of those missiles (it'll be real bad)...

SNAKE

Raiden -- you've got to find Emma.

RAIDEN

Wait a second. Isn't Emma Emmerich --

OTACON

My sister.

RAIDEN

What's she doing here?

OTACON

You got me. She's a computer whiz who specializes in neural-AI and ultra-variable volume data analysis using complex logic. How she got involved in weapons development is beyond me.

RAIDEN

*thinking* ...

SNAKE

Whatever her reasons, we need her in order to stop Arsenal.

OTACON

Raiden -- find her.

RAIDEN

I'm on my way.
Emma and Otacon 1
Codec Call 1
(optional Colonel call)
On his way to get Emma out, Raiden calls the Colonel to get background information on her.

RAIDEN

Colonel, I want some background information on Emma Emmerich.

COLONEL

I've got it right here, direct from the National Security Agency's3 personnel files. Apparently she was involved in some sort of high-level project, but there's no details on that. Her record shows that she resigned from the agency two years ago -- (She was reassigned to work on Arsenal Gear.)

COLONEL

Emma Emmerich. Full name: Emma Emmerich-Danziger. Members of her family call her "E.E." After divorcing Hal Emmerich's father, her mother took Emma to England and raised her there. Danziger is her mother's maiden name, but she prefers Emmerich.

COLONEL

After returning home to England, her mother married Robinson, a businessman. The following details are from a report filed with the NSA when she joined the agency...

COLONEL

Just before graduating from high school, Emma injured Robinson in self-defense during an alleged assault on her person. As a result of this incident, she followed in the footsteps of her stepbrother, Hal Emmerich, and left home to enroll in Oxford. It is believed that at this particular point in her life, she was extremely angered by the fact that her brother failed to protect her. Consequently, she lost all family connections and is very resentful. She seems to believe that her brother is to blame for everything.

COLONEL

While attending Oxford, she was noted for her success in a deciphering event sponsored by British GCHQ.

RAIDEN

They may not be blood-related, but she sure sounds like Otacon's sister.

COLONEL

There's more --

COLONEL

Raiden, do you recall a certain 'situation' that's more or less become a legend among hackers?

COLONEL

To refresh your memory -- at the time, just about all of our nation's communications and information resources were concentrated at NSA, in Fort Meade.

COLONEL

In fact, NSA's basement facility operated round-the-clock to amass data obtained not only from public communications, but everything from satellite to wiretap operations as well.

COLONEL

I don't think I'm exaggerating when I say that whoever controlled the NSA facility could move the world.

COLONEL

On January 24th in the year 2000, the facility suffered a total system shutdown for a 73-hour period.

RAIDEN

Did they ever figure out the cause?

COLONEL

It's believed that a small group within the government (the Patriots) had arranged the incident with the assistance of a notorious group of crackers. The result was a full review of NSA's safety measures, which in turn led to the decision to shift the data-gathering operations to an isolated location that would be safe from physical attack as well as cyber-terrorism. (Referring to Arsenal Gear.)

RAIDEN

And where might that be?

COLONEL

My security clearance couldn't get me that information.

COLONEL

But I did find out that one of the key members of the hacker group was none other than Emma Emmerich. Although she started off as a specialist in artificial intelligence and complex logic, Emma is now regarded as a computer genius.

RAIDEN

That would make her a prime candidate for recruitment in the intelligence community, wouldn't it? And knowing most of the intelligence agencies, I doubt fair play was a major concern in their recruiting efforts...

COLONEL

Your assumption's correct. The government (the Patriots) played on her weakness -- her strong hate for Hal Emmerich, the brother who left her when she was six years old.

RAIDEN

She hates him that much?

COLONEL

When she was six years old, Emma and her father were involved in a pool accident. She survived, but her father drowned.

RAIDEN

What did the police have to say about that?

COLONEL

Their report states it was an accidental death.

RAIDEN

Isn't that about the time that Otacon left his home and family?

COLONEL

Exactly. But I don't have any idea why he chose to do so.

RAIDEN

Does Emma blame Otacon for her father's death?

COLONEL

I don't think so. Her hate seems to stem from the fact that she believes Otacon abandoned her. You see, although the two weren't directly related, they were said to be very close.

COLONEL

It's rumored that sibling rivalry was what launched her career as a hacker. Four years ago, the government leaked her the details of the Shadow Moses incident. In doing so, they were able to recruit her for the NSA.

COLONEL

I also have little doubt... that they also used the NSA hacking affair as a means to 'convince' her to cooperate.

RAIDEN

You think that her hate drove her to frame Snake and Otacon?

COLONEL

That -- I don't know.
Coming Up for Air 1
Codec Call 1
(mandatory incoming call from Otacon)
Raiden hurries to the area of the flooded Shell 2 Core where Emma is located. Pockets of the facility are entirely submerged, forcing Raiden to swim through them. When coming up for air in one section of a passageway, Raiden receives a Codec call from Otacon.

OTACON

Raiden, are you reading me? This is Otacon. What's your situation?

RAIDEN

Wet and miserable... this place is flooded. The seawater that's been pumped up is pouring into the building.

OTACON

I see. Listen, there's something I have to tell you about E.E.

RAIDEN

Don't worry about her. I'll get her out --

OTACON

She's afraid of water.

RAIDEN

What!?

OTACON

Yeah... when she was six years old, she almost drowned with my father in our swimming pool.

RAIDEN

She can't swim!?

OTACON

Well yes and no... we used to swim a lot together when we were kids. In fact, she swam like a fish until that day when she almost drowned...
*Only if player heard the background information from the Colonel

RAIDEN

*quietly* That pretty much coincides with what the Colonel told me...
*Convergence point

OTACON

When the accident happened, I was in my room. I learned later that E.E. was calling me for help...

OTACON

She didn't doubt for a minute that I'd be there.

OTACON

You could see the pool from my room... but I didn't realize at the time that she needed my help.

RAIDEN

What were you doing?

OTACON

I... I was...
In fact, Emma witnessed what Otacon was doing right before she almost drowned.

RAIDEN

So Emma survived the ordeal...

OTACON

Yeah. But my father didn't...

RAIDEN

So you blamed yourself and left your family?

OTACON

No. E.E. seems to believe that was the case. The fact is... I betrayed her.

RAIDEN

And you think that she can't swim because of the traumatic experience?

OTACON

I haven't seen her since that day... but yes, I think so.

OTACON

I got a letter from Julie, her mother, after they moved back to England. In her letter, she mentioned that E.E. couldn't swim anymore... that she refused to even wear a bathing suit.

RAIDEN

Damn! If she still can't swim, we're in trouble... level B1 in the core is pretty much flooded.

OTACON

Look... maybe you can help her overcome the trauma.

RAIDEN

You want me to help her get over it?

OTACON

It's still going to take some time to repair the Kamov.

SNAKE

Sorry, kid. Emma's rescue is up to you.

RAIDEN

Thanks. An underwater mission... well, this is a first. Look -- I'll see what I can do. (He isn't that confident.)

SNAKE

I suggest that you drum the map of the building into your head, 'cause you won't have time to look at it when you try to bring Emma out.

OTACON

I'm counting on you, Raiden.

SNAKE

I covered most of the core when I had to take out the C4s... if there's anything you need to ask me, call me on the Codec.

RAIDEN

I'll do that.
Peter's Corpse 1
3D Cutscene 1
((KF) - Flooded Shell 2 Core)
Raiden swims his way through the deluged core toward Emma. He comes to a watertight hatch he must open to proceed.
Raiden pulls the door open, and a corpse—by the looks of it the person was killed in an explosion—comes floating toward him head-first, its arms outstretched as though it were attacking him. This is the last thing Raiden was expecting when he opened the door, and the shock causes him to expel bubbles. The door leads to Filtration Chamber No. 2, where Peter was working to defuse that bomb. Water stained red (blood) flows into the passageway. Raiden pulls back; all he can do is stare blankly at the lifeless body drifting in front of him, which is in fact Peter's (his face is still recognizable despite the horrible manner of his death).
Raiden pays his final respects to the bomb disposal expert, then closes the hatch behind him.
Pre-Vamp Battle 1
3D Cutscene 1
((MC) - Filtration Chamber No. 2)
Raiden makes it through the inundated facility to the block where Emma is being held.
He steps into Filtration Chamber No. 2. The pool sits in the middle of the room, its diffused light bouncing off the ceiling. There are also underwater lights pointing upward; the combined effect of the room's lighting creates a dream-like atmosphere. To emphasize Vamp's "shadow bind" attack, utilize elongating shadows as much as possible.
Vamp floats in a cross-legged ballet position on the pool's surface. It appears as though he isn't actually touching the water, but hovering just above it. He has shed his coat and is naked from the waist up. His eyes are shut, and the gaping hole (wound) Raiden inflicted with his gunshot to the forehead remains as it was.

RAIDEN

Still tickin' huh?
Vamp opens his eyes.

VAMP

Unfortunately, hell had no vacancies...
Vamp uses breath control to focus his energy. He slowly rises, untangling his body like a modern or ballet dancer doing calisthenics.

RAIDEN

Ha! (A yelling voice.)
Raiden opens fire without warning, but Vamp dodges the bullets with the grace of a ballet performance.

RAIDEN

Argh!
Vamp takes a bow, like a dancer waiting for applause.
A line of blood runs down Vamp's cheek—one of Raiden's shots just now grazed him. Vamp stretches his body and shoots Raiden a look. The side of his torso is still wounded as well (again from when Raiden shot him in Strut A).

VAMP

*happily* I thought so...
Vamp knows the exact trajectory a shooter's bullets will travel through his ability to read their muscle movements. Ordinarily, he can read a person 100%, but the fact that Raiden's Skull Suit applies pressure to his body alters his muscle movements, making him harder to read. Explained over an optional Codec call.
Vamp smiles, flashing his prominent canines.

VAMP

Human muscles are quite eloquent. They speak out clearly what a person's next move will be. They even tell me which way a gun is going to be pointed before the trigger is pulled. But your muscles -- they're different...

VAMP

This should be fun... well worth the wait. (He was waiting for Raiden to come rescue Emma after being told by Ocelot.)
Vamp uses his long tongue to lick up the blood running down his face, tasting it. Raiden cannot hide his bewilderment.
Vamp spreads his arms wide, like a bat spreading its wings.

RAIDEN

You knew I was coming...?

VAMP

You've become a nuisance. I can't let you interfere with Arsenal Gear.

VAMP

The girl is just ahead. She is of no use to us now... but she served us well as the live bait for the big catch. Crazy Ivan sometimes speaks the truth.
Ivan > a Russian person > Ocelot.
Pre-Vamp Battle 2
3D Cutscene 2
(Shell 2 Core B1 Locker Room)
Visuals of the locker room where Emma is being held. Water has gotten into the room and has risen considerably. Emma is hiding in a locker, so she isn't visible in this cutscene. Slow camera pan.

RAIDEN

Emma's alive...

VAMP

She was, some time ago. But the flooding has become quite serious -- I wouldn't be surprised if she's a mermaid now.

RAIDEN

...!

VAMP

Did you really think killing the President would prevent a nuclear strike? Think again.

RAIDEN

I didn't do it!

VAMP

*skeptically* Hm. Arsenal is still armed with a purified hydrogen bomb.

RAIDEN

Purified hydrogen bomb?
Pre-Vamp Battle 3
Movie Cutscene 1
(purified hydrogen bomb)
Blueprint, etc., of the purified hydrogen bomb.

VAMP

This is no ordinary nuclear bomb. This weapon is capable of heavy hydrogen nuclear fusion using lasers and magnetics to generate heat-insulated compression.

VAMP

It was a top secret project initiated by the current President... and Solidus has no idea of its existence.

VAMP

The clean thermonuclear bomb is at an experimental stage and is handled differently. Specifically, it becomes launch-capable when Arsenal is activated. A nuclear threat still exists.

VAMP

Six months ago, we lost everything we believed in...

VAMP

We were abandoned to take the fall in their cover-up. We were labeled as killers responsible for the mass-murder of civilians as well as our own allies.

VAMP

And the "public" believed every word, turning a deaf ear to whatever we had to say to the contrary.

VAMP

Our only goal is to wipe them from the face of the earth -- and destroy this world of deceit they have created along with them.

RAIDEN

You're insane.

VAMP

Insane? We might be the only ones telling the truth...
Pre-Vamp Battle 4
3D Cutscene 3
((NM + MC) - Filtration Chamber No. 2)
Wide shot pan of the filtration chamber floor. Show the player the layout of where the battle with Vamp will take place.
Suddenly, an announcement comes in over the P.A. system.

SOLIDUS

Final check for activating Arsenal has been completed...

SOLIDUS

All Arsenal personnel... report to your stations.

VAMP

Well... it sounds like Arsenal's ready to go into operation.

RAIDEN

Damn it!

VAMP

You're still hoping that the girl can install that virus you're carrying around, aren't you?

RAIDEN

You know -- !? (Ocelot told him.)

VAMP

It's a shame you're not going to be around long enough to hand her the program...
Vamp indicates with his head to the water beneath him. Visuals of the pool. Countless air bubbles rise to the surface—so many one can hardly see the water itself.

VAMP

That isn't seawater, you know --
(As Snake explains over the Codec, having aerobic bacteria in the water means air needs to be pumped into it continuously, making the water's specific gravity extremely light.)

VAMP

It's a by-product of the microbes contained in the pool4. Buoyancy is practically non-existent thanks to the high oxygen content... once you fall in, you don't come up.
Vamp indicates to the water at his feet once more.

VAMP

Take a good look at your grave.

VAMP

Show me what you've got!
Vamp Battle End 1
3D Cutscene 1
(Shell 2 Core B1 Filtration Chamber No. 2)
Raiden emerges victorious from the brutal battle with Vamp.
Vamp sinks down into the pool! The bubbles have increased to something resembling a froth, or a boiling pot. Raiden runs over to the edge and points his gun down at the pool, ready in case Vamp emerges. Instead, however, from within the bubbling chaos comes a desperate scream.

VAMP

Urrrgh...
The pool turns a solid red, and Vamp sinks to the bottom before disappearing from view (like before, he isn't actually dead yet, however).
Raiden raises the Colonel.
Vamp Battle End 2
Codec Call 1
(mandatory outgoing call to the Colonel)

RAIDEN

Colonel! They've apparently completed the final check procedure for Arsenal Gear!

COLONEL

Find Emma on the double! You've got to get her to install the virus program that the President gave you! When you find her, take her to the Computer Room on level B2 in the core of Shell 1!

RAIDEN

Snake! Did you catch all that!? I didn't make it on time... Arsenal's going active!

SNAKE

Yeah, I heard. The hostage rescue's gonna have to wait.

RAIDEN

I'm going after Emma.

SNAKE

We'll secure the Computer Room.
Visuals on the Codec miniscreen of the President giving Raiden the optical disc.

SNAKE

Looks like we can't install the virus program without Emma.

RAIDEN

Can't your partner do it?

OTACON

I would if I could. But the security for this system is no joke. I need more time...

SNAKE

That's why we need her.

RAIDEN

Understood. I'll make sure you have your family reunion...

OTACON

...

RAIDEN

What's up?

OTACON

A lot of years have passed between E.E. (Emma) and me...

RAIDEN

Then you should see her, right?

OTACON

I don't have the right to see her.

SNAKE

We can talk about this later. Raiden, I think you'd better get moving, Emma's in the Locker Room to the north, right?

RAIDEN

I'm on it!
Emma Rescue 1
3D Cutscene 1
(Shell 2 Core B1 Locker Room)
After defeating Vamp, Raiden finally arrives at the Locker Room in the Residential Section on the B1 level of the Shell 2 Core, where Emma is being held captive.
He opens the locker in which she is hiding. When the door opens, Emma falls on her butt.

EMMA

*screams* !
Emma is pretty scared (to the point that she wets her pants). Raiden tries to calm her down.

RAIDEN

Are you alright?
Emma settles down and gets her first good look at Raiden.

EMMA

Who are you?

RAIDEN

Raiden. I'm getting you out of here.
Emma doesn't quite believe him.

EMMA

Get me out...?
Emma, still sitting, confronts Raiden.

EMMA

You're lying! Where're you taking me this time!?
Emma draws back into the locker. Unable to go any further, she cowers against the wall as if hoping to pass through it.

RAIDEN

What are you talking about!? I'm here to help!

EMMA

? (She's been somewhat overpowered.)

RAIDEN

Here -- I'll prove it.
He touches his neck to indicate his Codec.

RAIDEN

Do you have nanos?

EMMA

?

RAIDEN

Well, do you?

EMMA

I do... Everybody on this project has them...

RAIDEN

Okay, good. Let's try (using internal communications)...
Emma Rescue 2
Codec Call 1
(internal communication with Emma)

RAIDEN

Can you hear me, now?

EMMA

Nanocommunication...?

RAIDEN

That's right. I have nanomachines, too.

EMMA

Then you're not one of them (the terrorists)...

RAIDEN

That's what I've been trying to tell you.

EMMA

*unbelieving* And you came to rescue me?

RAIDEN

Actually, I need your help to stop Arsenal... I understand you're the only one who might be able to do it.

EMMA

And who told you that?

RAIDEN

The President.

EMMA

... Really? (It's hard to believe.)

RAIDEN

I need you to come with me to Shell 1. Your brother's waiting for you there.

EMMA

My brother?
Emma's head is whirling.
As she tries to take in this turn of events, a small explosion shakes the room.
The sound of creaking metal reverberates throughout the chamber. Raiden extends a hand to Emma.

RAIDEN

C'mon! We have to get moving!

RAIDEN

This place'll be flooded soon!
Emma Rescue 3
3D Cutscene 2
(Shell 2 Core B1 Locker Room)
Raiden takes Emma by the hand and pulls her out of the locker.
Emma is dressed in a two-tone (red/black) t-shirt with black trousers. At first glance, she almost looks like an underwater diver. Her hair is secured behind her head by two chopsticks. She wears red-framed glasses. Her ID card (Level 5) hangs from her neck. The glasses are not prescription lenses.

RAIDEN

... (He is captivated by how cute she is.)
The room shakes violently again. Water springs from cracks in the ceiling and walls. (Though these additional leaks do occur, the water level remains unchanged.)

RAIDEN

We'd better move!
Raiden tries to rush Emma, who pulls away from him, refusing to move.

EMMA

I can't... I can't swim...
Raiden has already heard about Emma's fear of water.
Emma Rescue 4
Codec Call 2
(internal communication with Emma)

EMMA

Leave me...
Raiden pulls her close and looks into her eyes.

RAIDEN

You can swim! You used to love it!

EMMA

How did you know...?
Emma is stunned by the fact that this stranger knows about this deeply personal trauma.

RAIDEN

Your brother (Otacon) told me.

EMMA

He's (My brother's) really here?
Putting a comforting hand on Emma's shoulder, Raiden continues.

RAIDEN

That's right... He's here to rescue you.
Shaking off Raiden's hand, Emma turns away from him.

EMMA

I don't believe you! He would never come for me!

RAIDEN

And I'm telling you he's here -- waiting for us at Shell 1!

EMMA

No! He left me... my mother-- when we needed him the most! When my father died, all he could think about was himself!
Emma hangs her head in misery.

RAIDEN

Emma, we can go over all that later. But first, we have to get out of here!

EMMA

No! I hate water!
Like a stubborn child, Emma becomes emotional, screaming her objections.

EMMA

It's hopeless! I can't swim!
From her sitting position, Emma stares at the water's surface, recalling the pool accident that claimed her father’s life.
Emma Rescue 5
Movie Cutscene 1
(water surface)
Emma's pool accident movie asset. Real-life footage of water surface.

EMMA

I can't swim!

RAIDEN

You can do it!

EMMA

I can't...
Emma quakes as she recalls the accident.

RAIDEN

C'mon! Deep down inside, you know you can (technically) swim!

EMMA

I can't keep my eyes open in the water... That endless blue...

EMMA

*shaking* The water... it wants me... It won't let me go...

RAIDEN

Alright, then close your eyes. I'll guide you.
Emma tries to come up with some other reason not to swim.

EMMA

I... I was injected with something! Um... my legs! I have trouble moving them! (She's been injected with a truth serum.)

RAIDEN

Listen, Emma. Just hold your breath... I'll do the rest.
Emma Rescue 6
3D Cutscene 3
((NM) - Shell 2 Core Underwater)
The camera travels through the water.
This is the route the player will be taking.
The purpose here is to give them a chance to review where they need to go.

RAIDEN

First, we'll head for Filter Chamber 2. Then we'll take a break.

EMMA

And all I have to do is hold my breath...?

RAIDEN

That's right.

EMMA

How long?

RAIDEN

Just a little while. (He's lying to comfort her.)

EMMA

Are you sure?

RAIDEN

Of course I'm sure! That's how I got here.

EMMA

I don't think I can do it. I'm not good at holding my breath...

RAIDEN

Look Emma. I have an idea...
Emma Rescue 7
Codec Call 3
(internal communication with Emma)

RAIDEN

Put your ear against my chest and listen to my heartbeat.

EMMA

Your heartbeat?
She looks at Raiden's chest.

RAIDEN

Count the beats -- don't think about anything else. When you reach 100, open your eyes. By that time, we'll be on the other side.
Emma gives a little nod.

RAIDEN

Give me a signal if you think you're running out of breath.

EMMA

What will you do then?

RAIDEN

I'll swim faster.
Emma cannot think of anything to say to Raiden's hopeless reply.
Emma Rescue 8
3D Cutscene 4
(Shell 2 Core B1 Locker Room)
It's been a little while since the locker rescue. Raiden questions Emma. He turns her face by the chin so that she's looking at him. They have already moved to the point in front of the stairs (submerged position). They stand waist-deep in water.
Raiden moves into the water with Emma in tow. Emma stands behind Raiden.
She grabs onto him from behind.

RAIDEN

Hang on tight...
Emma holds on to Raiden tightly. The water is at waist level.

RAIDEN

Okay, let's go!

EMMA

I'm closing my eyes...
Emma wants some affirmation to take her mind off the water.

RAIDEN

Take some deep breaths...

RAIDEN

One... two... three...

EMMA

Wait!

RAIDEN

What is it?
Releasing her grip from around Raiden's waist, Emma removes her glasses.

EMMA

Let me take off my glasses...
Seeing Emma without her glasses, Raiden is even more taken aback by how cute she is.

RAIDEN

You know... you should wear contacts.

EMMA

There's nothing wrong with my eyes.

RAIDEN

?

EMMA

I wear them for show.

RAIDEN

Trying to be different from the other girls?

EMMA

No, it's not like that. I like glasses. And there's this guy I liked who used to wear them...

RAIDEN

Your first boyfriend?

EMMA

No... somebody more important. Anyway, they bring me luck. (She thinks of Otacon.)

RAIDEN

I see... (He doesn't get it, but tries to understand.)
Emma folds her glasses and holds them in her hand like they're some kind of precious good-luck charm. She puts her arms around Raiden's shoulders with the glasses in her hand.

RAIDEN

OK -- let's go.
Raiden and Emma slip into the water.
Emma Break 1
3D Cutscene 1
(Shell 2 Core B1 Filtration Chamber No. 2)
Swimming underwater, Raiden and Emma manage to reach the pool where Raiden fought Vamp.
The two are by the side of the pool in Filtration Chamber No. 2. Both are exhausted, but they have finally recovered enough to speak to each other.
They sit separately.

RAIDEN

You did good...
Emma's legs are still bothering her. She's curled up in a sitting position.

EMMA

I concentrated on your heartbeat... it reminded me of when I was a kid...
Emma's got her smile back. She stares at the red glasses in her hands (similar to Otacon).
Emma Break 2
Movie Cutscene 1
(Emma and Otacon PICT)
Otacon and Emma as kids/PICT movie.
A young Otacon carries young Emma on his back. Little Emma sleeps peacefully against his shoulder.

EMMA
