I remembered my brother giving me a piggyback ride... I was sleeping with my ear against his back... I could hear his heartbeat...

RAIDEN

Sounds like you were close.

EMMA

We were... back then.
An image of their first encounter.

EMMA

We were stepchildren in our parent's second marriages. Wherever my brother went, I used to tag along...

EMMA

My brother didn't have any close friends, so he used to take care of me. We both wanted to be loved so much... so much that we used to pretend...

RAIDEN

Pretend?
An image of two kids pretending to be a family.

EMMA

*bashfully* Yeah... we used to play "House." My brother was the husband and I was the wife. But it was always just make believe... we were only kids. You know what I mean?

RAIDEN

I never had a family... but I think I know what you mean. (These words mimic those of Snake in the Tanker Chapter. However, he doesn't really understand.)
Suddenly, Raiden receives a call on the Codec!
Emma Break 3
Codec Call 1
(mandatory incoming call from the Colonel)

COLONEL

Raiden, what's your status?

RAIDEN

Colonel? I've got Emma Emmerich here... We've managed to avoid drowning.

COLONEL

Good job. Get her over to Shell 1 as soon as you can.

RAIDEN

That's going to be hard with the connecting bridge on the upper level destroyed.

COLONEL

Didn't Olga say something about taking the oil fence at the bottom of Strut L?

RAIDEN

Yeah, I remember that.

COLONEL

You should be able to go down by way of Strut L. Try and get over there.

RAIDEN

What about Emma? She's been injected with something and she can't walk without any help.

COLONEL

Take her with you... Free your hands of any equipment and hold down the Action Button to give her a hand.
The miniscreen shows images of Emma being led (VR)...

COLONEL

To release your grip on her, take your finger off the Action Button. Emma can sit and wait until you help her back up. And be careful... you won't be able to use any weapons while you're leading her. Now, head for Strut L!

RAIDEN

We're on our way.
Emma and Otacon 1
Codec Call 1
(mandatory incoming call)
While advancing through the facility with Emma, Raiden receives a call from Snake.

SNAKE

Raiden, we've infiltrated the Computer Room. What's your situation?

RAIDEN

Emma's safe. We're heading your way.

OTACON

Good job!

SNAKE

Shell 1's deserted. Looks like everybody's aboard Arsenal.

OTACON

I had a look at the system, but there's nothing I can do. E.E.'s our only hope...

RAIDEN

Right... I'll put her on then.

OTACON

Huh? E.E.? How...?

RAIDEN

I'll use my Codec as a relay.

OTACON

Ahem, ummm... (He's preparing the node and doing a voice check.)

RAIDEN

Here she is...

EMMA

*nervously* Uh... Hal...?
On the Codec screen, Emma appears in place of Raiden.

OTACON

*fumbling* Ah... E.E.? Is that you?

EMMA

Hal...
Not sure whether that's happiness or venom in her tone, he doesn't know what to say.

OTACON

E.E...
Otacon can't bring himself to apologize to Emma.

OTACON

Uh... Why're you involved with Metal Gear?

EMMA

Huh??? (Bewildered by the lack of proper reunion.)
This was not the reunion that Emma expected.

OTACON

*critically* You knew our family's dark history, and still got involved!? What's wrong with you!?

EMMA

*dejectedly* I should've known...
Emma's at a loss as to how to react to her long-lost brother's words.

OTACON

Answer me! Why are you repeating the same mistake?

EMMA

...
Reacting to Otacon's tone, Emma takes on a harder approach.

EMMA

I wanted to hurt you... I wanted to see you suffer...

OTACON

E.E...?

EMMA

You abandoned me --

OTACON

No! That's not what happened...
Snake cuts into the conversation. Snake appears in Otacon's display window.

SNAKE

Alright -- that's enough!

OTACON

... (He's relieved to have been helped out.)

EMMA

Who are you?

SNAKE

I'm a friend of Otacon's, Emma.

EMMA

Otacon... (She's digesting his nickname.)

SNAKE

Enough with the sibling rivalry.

EMMA

That's not what this is!!

SNAKE

We haven't got time for this! Raiden! Get her over here, right now.
Emma falters after hearing Snake's sharp words.

EMMA

I -- I...
Raiden reappears in his window. He answers on Emma's behalf.

RAIDEN

Gotcha, Snake. I'll head over there with Emma.

SNAKE

Most of the enemy's aboard Arsenal. But I suggest you be careful. Make sure Emma gets here in one piece.

OTACON

Raiden... Take care of my sister.

RAIDEN

Don't worry. I'll get her there.
Raiden ends the call.
Emma and AI 1
3D Cutscene 1
((MC) - Shell 2 Core B1 Water's Surface)
Raiden continues with Emma. They pass through Filtration Chamber No. 2, then stop in front of a flooded stairway that disappears below the water's surface.

RAIDEN

Emma, Snake and Hal are waiting for us in Shell 1's Computer Room.
Emma doesn't reply. She stares at the water before her.

RAIDEN

I've got this disc that the President gave me...
Raiden shows Emma the optical disc.

RAIDEN

This disc is supposed to contain a virus that can corrupt Arsenal Gear's operating system. We need you to (upload it)...
Staring at the disc, Emma cuts Raiden off.

EMMA

This is... This is my program...

RAIDEN

What?

EMMA

Why did the President give it to you?

RAIDEN

...

EMMA

Did something happen to the President?
Saying nothing, Raiden puts the disc away.
Emma and AI 2
Movie Cutscene 1
(flashback to the President's death)
3D cutscene (flashback: 3D cutscene when the President dies).
Scene where Ocelot kills the President. The President breathing his last.

RAIDEN

The President... He's dead.

EMMA

What...? (She isn't accustomed to death.)

RAIDEN

You actually wrote this virus?

EMMA

It's not really a virus... it's more like a worm cluster. It's actually a delayed-effect autonomous program that's designed to invade GW's cerebrum and render its nerve connections useless.

RAIDEN

You know what GW is?

EMMA

Of course... I created it.

RAIDEN

*surprised* ...

EMMA

You look surprised.

RAIDEN

Uh... Well...

EMMA

*jokingly* Cat got your tongue?

RAIDEN

I'm sorry, I... How about the "Patriots"? Ever heard of 'em?

EMMA

Yes. But I only know what I've been told.

RAIDEN

Can you tell me what you know? (He didn't realize Emma was so involved.)

EMMA

Uh, sure. But it's hard to put into words.

RAIDEN

Right... (Remembers about internal communication.)
Emma and AI 3
Codec Call 1
(internal communication with Emma)

RAIDEN

Are you reading me, Emma?

EMMA

Yes -- loud and clear.

RAIDEN

The President said that Arsenal Gear was the Patriots' key to supremacy.

EMMA

That's as good a description as any.

RAIDEN

What exactly is it?

EMMA

It's a massive data processing system capable of controlling information on a global scale.

RAIDEN

A data processing system...? (He thought it was a weapon.)

EMMA

That's right. The system's a social device for maintaining the Patriots' control.

RAIDEN

You've lost me.

EMMA

In this day and age, information emerges from every direction, and is freely distributed...

EMMA

A variety of information - gathered by servers employing the latest in high-speed communication networks and P2P5 technology - is rapidly circulated to individuals. In fact, the speed of this circulation process is accelerating on an almost daily basis.

EMMA

The Patriots seem to be afraid of this development. Apparently, they believe that their role will shift from dominant to dominated.

RAIDEN

?

EMMA

Let me give you an example. You're aware of Solid Snake's anti-Metal Gear activities, aren't you?

RAIDEN

Yeah -- I know a little about it.

EMMA

That's just a small sample of uncontrolled information. I can guarantee you the Patriots did not want Solid Snake's name publicized.

EMMA

Now, look at it like this... political scandal, corporate corruption... up until now, the Patriots have managed to keep a lid on these and other self-serving events. But with their existing data processing system, they are no longer able to effectively control the flow of information generated at the individual level.

EMMA

With the newly created system, they can fully regulate digital information. High-level information can be categorized in stages, given clearance levels, and deleted as necessary -- never to be seen by the public. By deleting such information, the Patriots can shape the course of history as they see fit.

RAIDEN

Somebody's bound to catch on --

EMMA

No. The memory capacity -- not to mention the life span -- of the average individual is extremely limited. On the other hand, digital information lasts virtually forever... it doesn't deteriorate.

RAIDEN

So...?

EMMA

The alphabet... twenty-six letters, right? It could've been thirty letters. What if the 4 deleted letters were controlled by a program?

RAIDEN

Impossible.

EMMA

It's not. In fact, something similar is already underway. Do you know how many genes exist in an individual?

RAIDEN

About 30 to 40 thousand?

EMMA

Right. That's what was announced at the turn of the century. But there's actually 100 thousand, according to the original theory advanced by the scientific community. Information regarding the remaining 60 thousand was suppressed by the Patriots.

RAIDEN

No...

EMMA

Why? How would you know? Do you know what a gene looks like? Did you count them yourself?

RAIDEN

There are research organizations... (Surely they would notice.)

EMMA

Of course... and their reports have already been subtly altered. They're even beginning to believe the doctored reports. GW is a system that allows the Patriots to decide what will be recorded in tomorrow's history.

RAIDEN

So what we're talking about is one huge censorship system for deleting information which might be inconvenient to the Patriots?

EMMA

Exactly. The actual, physical core for handling the task -- GW -- is installed in Arsenal. It's the only system in the world with an optic neural AI that has a parallel processing capacity of 980 trillion hammets (a unit of measure to count complexity).

RAIDEN

I suppose that being a specialist in neural AI and complex logic played a significant role in your association with the Metal Gear project.

EMMA

That's not the only reason... (Referring to her feelings for Otacon.)

RAIDEN

What do you mean?

EMMA

*bashfully* ...

RAIDEN

I guess there're plenty of other reasons. (He's worried about butting into her business, so he pretends to understand.)

EMMA

Yes, there are -- (She actually wants him to ask about it.)

RAIDEN

I understand...

EMMA

Do you? (She feels letdown because there's no way he could understand that easily.)

RAIDEN

So Arsenal Gear was actually designed to protect the GW system, wasn't it? (He hasn't noticed Emma's feelings.)

EMMA

Uh...yes. It's armed with everything including nuclear weapons, and is fully equipped with cyber-terrorist countermeasures. Physically and logically, it's the ultimate fortress for housing GW.

RAIDEN

But is the AI actually capable of controlling everything?

EMMA

No. GW is only the system's core. It's only for deciding what data is stored or deleted. The actual sub-system for executing the task exists within our social structure...

RAIDEN

What!?
Emma and AI 4
Movie Cutscene 2
(Y2K)
Real-life footage... The Y2K problem/Millennium countdown...
Shot of an office lined with terminals and monitors.

EMMA

Do you remember the panic that gripped the computer industry prior to the end of the century?

RAIDEN

You mean the Y2K problem6?

EMMA

If you recall, our government supplied the world with a countermeasure program -- using the internet at full capacity. The program was distributed to every governmental organization... every key facility... throughout the world. In addition, the same program was included in an OS application for distribution among the public.
Emma and AI 5
Codec Call 2
(internal communication with Emma)

RAIDEN

Let me guess... the Y2K countermeasure contained a program designed by the Patriots?

EMMA

Yes. And everything supplied from that day onward contains the same program.

RAIDEN

Impossible.

EMMA

Do you know how a computer operates? Do you really know the basic principles on how data is exchanged?

RAIDEN

...

EMMA

Nobody's aware of it, but there's a sub-system in place. And it's about to be activated.

RAIDEN

Is that why Solidus wants to burn out every electrical circuit in Manhattan with a nuclear blast?

EMMA

Probably. But the overall system isn't actually complete.

RAIDEN

What?

EMMA

It still lacks the necessary factors for judging situations. I heard they were planning a major experiment in the next few days, to provide complex data for GW to study. (She's talking about the S3 plan, but doesn’t know this incident is the plan.)

EMMA

And suddenly all this happens... (People are dying and getting hurt...)

RAIDEN

Emma... it's not your fault. If it wasn't for the terrorists... (Trying to comfort her.)

EMMA

Yeah... You're right...

EMMA

Well... I think that's about all I know. (Tries to brighten up because she realizes what Raiden is doing.)

RAIDEN

Right... Uh, thanks. I think we'd better head for the Computer Room.

EMMA

My bird (Otacon) in the Computer Room! Is he safe!?
Emma and AI 6
3D Cutscene 2
(Shell 1 Core 1F Computer Room)
Close-up of a parrot in a cage. The voices of Raiden and Emma play over the scene.

RAIDEN

That noisy, overgrown parakeet?

EMMA

Excuse me, he's a parrot... and he's my best friend -- my only friend.

RAIDEN

Well... the bird's okay.

EMMA

Good! Did you know that in the old days miners used to take a canary into the mineshafts to detect toxic gas?

RAIDEN

That's what he's for...?

EMMA

I really needed someone to talk to...

RAIDEN

Right. I think we'd better get moving.
Emma and AI 7
3D Cutscene 3
(Shell 2 Core B1 Underwater)
Game visuals/3D cutscene (camera travels underwater).
Visuals of the flooded route.

RAIDEN

We've got a little longer to cover than the last time.

EMMA

I'll give it my best.

RAIDEN

Whatever you do, don't open your eyes.

EMMA

Why not?

RAIDEN

A dead body... not a pretty sight.

EMMA

Oh...
Visual of Peter's body.

RAIDEN

Once we get past it, it'll be too dark to see anything.
Emma and AI 8
3D Cutscene 4
((MC) - Shell 2 Core B1 In Front of Water)
Emma puts her glasses away again. Raiden is curious about the chopsticks in her hair.

RAIDEN

What're those sticks in your head?

EMMA

These?

EMMA

They're lacquered chopsticks.
Emma points at the chopsticks in her hair.
Emma actually believes the chopsticks are hair ornaments.

EMMA

They hold your hair in place. Did you know that they're pretty popular in Europe and South America?

RAIDEN

Can't say that I do... You're not only cute, but smart too.

EMMA

Oooh, I'm much more than cute...
Emma smiles radiantly. Raiden wipes the smile off his face and takes on a serious expression.

RAIDEN

Okay... let's go!
Raiden and Emma slip underwater.
Card 5 1
3D Cutscene 1
((MC) - In Front of KL Connecting Bridge Door)
Raiden and Emma reach the door on the KL Connecting Bridge.
Raiden lets out a frustrated grunt as he realizes he doesn't have a card to open the door.

RAIDEN

Damn it!
Raiden punches the door with his fist.

EMMA

What's wrong?

RAIDEN

This door is security level 5... I don't have Card 5.
Raiden starts thinking.

RAIDEN

Damn...

EMMA

Giving up already?
Emma baits Raiden with a little sarcasm.

EMMA

Ta-DAH!
Emma removes the ID card (Level 5) hanging from her neck and hands it to Raiden.

RAIDEN

What the...?

EMMA

Are you impressed?

RAIDEN

You should've told me you had it...

EMMA

The truth is... I just remembered it myself.
Emma Strut L 1
3D Cutscene 1
((MC) - In Front of Strut L Ladder)
To reach Shell 1 by way of the oil fence, Raiden and Emma approach a ladder in Strut L that leads down to the sea. Raiden opens a hatch in the floor. His hair is fanned by a blast of wind. Raiden peers down. There's about 40 meters (130 feet) between their location and the sea below.
Emma Strut L 2
Codec Call 1
(internal communication with Emma)

RAIDEN

I have a question for you.

EMMA

What is it?

RAIDEN

How do you feel about heights?

EMMA

I can't say I like heights... though water's higher on my phobia list. Why?

RAIDEN

Well... we have to go down a ladder.

EMMA

How far down?

RAIDEN

Just a little bit...

EMMA

*critically* Why do I feel like we've had this conversation before? How little is little?

RAIDEN

... About 130 feet?

EMMA

...
Emma peeks down and turns her eyes away.

RAIDEN

Think you can do it?

EMMA

Would you take "no" for an answer?

RAIDEN

How are your legs?

EMMA

Better. The numbness is gone.

EMMA

I can climb down on my own.

RAIDEN

Okay... follow me.
Emma Strut L 3
3D Cutscene 2
((MC) – Strut L Ladder)
Raiden goes down the ladder. Emma follows him down somewhat hesitantly.
The sun sets as the two work their way down the ladder. The sky and sea are bathed in red.
Emma Strut L 4
3D Cutscene 3
((MC) - Strut L Bottom)
Raiden and Emma descend to the base of the strut. Plumes of smoke rise from a layer of flaming oil. Far off on the horizon, the sun dips into the sea, untouched by the black stain.
Emma marvels at the setting sun. Start of sunset mode.

EMMA

The sunset... It's beautiful...

RAIDEN

If we don't hurry, it'll be the last we see.
Raiden and Emma lean out over the handrail to take a look at the pontoon bridge.
Raiden goes into binoculars mode.
Emma Strut L 5
3D Cutscene 4
(binoculars)
The binoculars sweep along pontoon bridges 1, 2, and 3, settling on Strut E. The sweep also reveals that the towers (guardhouses) along the way are occupied by enemy soldiers. Gun Cyphers can also be seen floating in the area. The large, setting sun forms a backdrop behind pontoon bridge 3—a situation that means Raiden is looking into the light, hindering his vision.

RAIDEN

Enemy soldiers... Gun Cyphers... I don't think we're going to be able to slip past all that.
Raiden gazes at the pontoon bridges through his binoculars. The bridges bob up and down with the movement of the sea's surface. Together they look like a huge serpent crawling across the sea. Periodic waves spray up from between the bridges' connecting points.

RAIDEN

Looks like it can barely support one person.
The pontoon bridges bob with each wave.

RAIDEN

How much do you weigh, Emma?

EMMA

Are you going to ask me how old I am next?
Raiden sweeps his binoculars across the route they need to take.

RAIDEN

If you go alone, I think you can make it across.
Raiden kneels and calls Snake!
Emma Strut L 6
Codec Call 2
(mandatory outgoing call to Snake)

RAIDEN

This is Raiden, do you read me?

SNAKE

Yeah. What's up?

RAIDEN

We've made it to the lower part of Strut L. We'll have to cross the water from here.

SNAKE

Can Emma walk?

RAIDEN

Yeah. She's okay. The pontoon bridge doesn't look too sturdy. Emma is going to have to cross it alone.

SNAKE

Right... the oil fence --
The view from binoculars mode is shown on the miniscreen. A pan across the pontoon bridges reveals guards and Cyphers.

RAIDEN

There's Cyphers and several guards.

SNAKE

Raiden, you're carrying a PSG1, aren't you?

RAIDEN

Yeah.

SNAKE

It's time to play sniper.

RAIDEN

Not bad. This spot gives me a good view of the targets.

SNAKE

You're going to have to cover Emma until she crosses to Strut E. I'll get there and provide some support of my own.

RAIDEN

Thanks.

SNAKE

Think you can handle it?

RAIDEN

Yeah. I know the drill.

RAIDEN

I've faced a similar situation in Advanced Mode Level 4 VR training with the PSG1.

SNAKE

VR...? Guess that's better than nothing. Make sure you don't hit Emma.

SNAKE

Right now, with Arsenal's boarding in progress, security should be at a minimum. That doesn't mean it's going to be easy. Given the situation, they've probably got Claymores in place to make up for the security shortage. Make sure you use your thermal goggles.

RAIDEN

Right.

SNAKE

Okay. I'm heading for Strut E.

RAIDEN

Emma, are you reading me?

EMMA

Loud and clear...

RAIDEN

I'm gonna clear a path for you from here.

EMMA

How?

RAIDEN

Sniper fire.

EMMA

You're kidding...

RAIDEN

Trust me.

EMMA

What if I fall into the sea? I... I can't swim!

RAIDEN

You were doing pretty good a few minutes ago.
A straight-faced Raiden. Emma smiles.

EMMA

Okay...

RAIDEN

Think you can do it?

EMMA

Would you take "no" for an answer?

RAIDEN

No.

EMMA

No. (Spoken simultaneously.)

RAIDEN

Alright, get going. You'll be fine.
To game (sniping event).
Emma Sniping 1
Codec Call 1
(mandatory incoming call from Snake)
Emma shakily makes her way across the narrow oil fence under enemy fire. Using his sniper rifle, Raiden eliminates the enemy soldiers who bar her path. In the middle of doing so, he receives a call from Snake.

SNAKE

This is Snake. Can you hear me?

RAIDEN

Yeah. Nice and clear.

SNAKE

I've reached my sniping position on Strut E. I'll provide support fire from here.

RAIDEN

Right. Do me a favor and take out whatever I miss.

SNAKE

Just call me when you want me to shoot.
From this point on, if the player calls Snake he will snipe enemies for them.
Prior to Vamp Sniping 1
3D Cutscene 1
((MC) - Binoculars)
When Emma is halfway across pontoon bridge 3, Vamp drops down from a pipe above the oil fence.
Binoculars/PSG1 mode (3D cutscene).
After leaping to the bridge, Vamp grabs Emma, pinning her arms behind her.
He then turns Emma toward Strut L where Raiden is located, as if to provoke him.
To game – Vamp sniping event.
Footnotes
1A book written by military analyst Nastasha Romanenko, who appeared in MGS1. Players can read both a review of the book and the book in its entirety in MGS2's PREVIOUS STORY menu.
2Acronym for Defense Advanced Research Projects Agency. Conducts R&D on technology with military applications.
3Acronym for the National Security Agency. An intelligence gathering agency for the United States Department of Defense, its main functions include intercepting communications, code breaking, and information security. It also exercises extensive control over military intelligence agencies.
4A facility that uses microbes to process contaminated water. Utilized by water and sewer services in Japan.
5An Internet architecture that allows users to share information directly between one another. Remains a controversial technology due to various issues related to it, including the violation of copyright laws and the misuse of unlawfully obtained data.
6General term for potential computer software and hardware errors for dates in and after the year 2000.
Codec Conversations
•Colonel
Prior to Meeting the President
Snake

RAIDEN

Colonel, Pliskin was Snake after all.

COLONEL

According to him.

RAIDEN

What?

COLONEL

Listen, Raiden. I'll say it again. He is not in the simulation.

RAIDEN

There you go about the simulation again...

COLONEL

Don't put your faith in him. Don't trust him. Do you understand?
After Harrier battle - rescue the President

COLONEL

The enemy has already entered the nuclear launch code. Secure the President before they can confirm and finalize the code input.

COLONEL

The President is on the first floor of Shell 2's core.
Path to the Shell 2 Core

COLONEL

This is the way to Shell 2's core section, where the President is.

COLONEL

First, cross the connecting bridge between the two Shells. You'll arrive on Strut G.

COLONEL

Proceed along the catwalk circling the outside of Strut G until you get to the LG connecting bridge.

COLONEL

Cross the LG connecting bridge to Strut L, then take the exterior catwalk to the KL connecting bridge.

COLONEL

You can enter the core of Shell 2 midway from the KL connecting bridge. The President is being held on the first floor. Go!
On Shell 1-2 Connecting Bridge

COLONEL

Raiden, you're currently on the connecting bridge between Shell 1 and Shell 2. Go north to reach Strut G of Shell 2.

RAIDEN

But the bridge is a mess from their attack...

ROSE

It's still a way through. Don't let the place get to you, Jack.

COLONEL

Use the First Person View to study your surroundings. Look for sections that can still support your weight. If you use Hanging and rolls, you should be able to pick your way across.
How to get across the connecting bridge (1)

COLONEL

Raiden, if you jump as far as you can, you could reach the other side. Try rolling to take off from the very edge.
How to get across the connecting bridge (2) - the pipe

COLONEL

When you're Hanging, get to the spot above the pipe, then jump down. Push the Crawl Button to go straight down.

ROSE

Don't forget to switch to First Person View to check whether there's a good landing spot.
You can't use the radar

RAIDEN

Colonel, the radar's not working.

COLONEL

With Shell 2 in this shape, I wouldn't count on the radar coming back online for a while.

ROSE

It'll be all right. Hang in there, Jack!
*Second and subsequent times

COLONEL

With the radar offline, you'll have to rely on First Person View to check for enemy presence. Proceed with extreme caution.
Tread carefully on the pipe

COLONEL

Raiden, be careful walking there. If you slip off the pipe, it's a long way down to the water.

COLONEL

Slow your pace by tilting the left analog stick only slightly, or go into a crawl.
Seagull droppings on the pipe

COLONEL

That area is caked with seagull droppings. You'll slip if you run over it. Be careful.
On Strut G

COLONEL

Follow the catwalk along the exterior of the strut where you are. It will lead onto the LG connecting bridge. Get to the outside catwalk.
Strut G damaged door

COLONEL

That door doesn't look as though it will open. You should be able to manage the fire escape on the outside of Strut G, though. Go around outside Strut G and head for Strut L.
On LG Connecting Bridge

COLONEL

You're on the connecting bridge between Struts L and G. Go straight down to get to Strut L.

ROSE

You should be able to reach the KL connecting bridge if you walk along the outside of Strut L.

COLONEL

Midway through the KL connecting bridge, there's a way into the core of Shell 2 where the President is being held.

COLONEL

Just think about getting to Strut L for now.
Eliminate the enemy first
*First time only

COLONEL

Raiden, look closely. There are enemies on the demolished connecting bridge.

ROSE

Maybe they are surveying the extent of the explosion.

COLONEL

Looks like it.

COLONEL

The connecting bridge was small to begin with, and now it has begun to crumble away. If we're spotted, there's no place to run. This could be extremely hairy.

COLONEL

Probably would be best to take enemies down from a distance first.
Flock of birds

COLONEL

Proceed carefully when you're near large flocks of birds. Disturbing them could alert the enemy to your presence.
Dropping down

COLONEL

Raiden, jump down to the corridor below you.

COLONEL

While Hanging, push the Crawl Button to go straight down.

COLONEL

Just don't forget to use the First Person View to check for an optimal landing point directly underneath.
Near ladder

COLONEL

Raiden, go up that ladder to get to the fire escape on the exterior of Strut L. Push the Action Button to start climbing the ladder.
On Strut L

COLONEL

Raiden, you're currently on Strut L. Move north along its exterior to get to the KL connecting bridge.

ROSE

You'll be able to get to the core of Shell 2 from the center of the KL connecting bridge. The President is being held in the core.
Strut L perimeter - windows

COLONEL

Raiden, look carefully -- there's a sentry just inside the window. Make sure you aren't spotted when moving past windows.

COLONEL

A preemptive strike is a viable option. Throw a stun grenade through the window, for example.
Stick to the wall

COLONEL

You can't use Hanging or Rolling to get to the other side from there. Flatten yourself against the wall and inch your way forward.
Stick to the wall and crouch

COLONEL

You can't get through there standing up. Stay against the wall and crouch down to get by.
Got hit with the urinating soldier's golden shower

COLONEL

Ugh... Uh, Raiden, my sympathies. Sneaking missions are called wetworks for a reason, after all.

ROSE

Don't worry about it, Jack. It's okay.

RAIDEN

Rose --

ROSE

That is, as long as you take a shower the second you get back. Do we have a deal?
On KL Connecting Bridge

COLONEL

Raiden, there should be a way to cross over from your present location on the KL connecting bridge to the core of Shell 2.

COLONEL

Get to the core of Shell 2. Rescue the President before the enemy can use him to reconfirm the nuclear launch code.
KL Connecting Bridge - Strut K entrance

COLONEL

Raiden, I don't see a way into Strut K, but there's no need for you to check it out in any case. Head for the core of Shell 2, where the President is.
After rescuing Emma - connecting bridge repaired

COLONEL

The collapsed section of the bridge has been repaired. Emma should be able to handle it -- take her over to Strut L.
After rescuing Emma - Strut K entrance

COLONEL

Raiden, that's the entrance to Strut K. You can't get inside, and there's no reason to go in. Go south to Strut L instead.
Shell 2 Core 1F - Olga

RAIDEN

Colonel, what do you know about that female soldier Olga?

COLONEL

Olga Gurlukovich. Just like that guy said, she commands a Russian private army.

RAIDEN

Do you know anything else?

COLONEL

Anything else?

RAIDEN

Yeah, anything else.

ROSE

Why are you concerned about her, anyway?

RAIDEN

You know...

ROSE

... Jack...?

RAIDEN

No, it's not like that.

ROSE

Ha ha. I'm joking. I'll look into her for you. Good luck.
Olga infodump

COLONEL

Raiden, Rosemary did a bit of research on that female soldier.

ROSE

Olga Gurlukovich. She's the daughter of former GRU Colonel Sergei Gurlukovich.

ROSE

After the federation collapsed the Colonel apparently commanded a group of mercenaries that drifted between area conflicts and civil wars.

ROSE

After he died, it looks like she took over control of the group.

ROSE

She has more notches on her gun than you do. Underestimating her prowess will get you hurt. Be careful.
Shell 2 Core 1F - before destroying electrified floor

COLONEL

Raiden, that floor is charged with high-voltage currents. I don't recommend you try crossing it.

COLONEL

Guide a remote-controlled missile through the duct and destroy the power source inside the room.
Remote-controlled missile basics

COLONEL

The only way to the President is past this electrified floor.

COLONEL

Use the remote-controlled missile to destroy the power source. That will cut off the high-voltage current to the floor.
*Before asking Snake the location

COLONEL

Locate a remote-controlled missile.

ROSE

Snake might know where to find them. He did sweep Shell 2 for C4s earlier.
*After asking Snake the location

COLONEL

Go and pick up the remote-controlled missile. It should be in the B1 level of Shell 2's core according to that man. Get it now.
*After obtaining remote-controlled missiles

COLONEL

Guide a remote-controlled missile through the duct and destroy the power source in the room.
When equipping remote-controlled missiles outside

COLONEL

Raiden, remote-controlled missiles cannot be used outside the Big Shell.
*First time only

RAIDEN

Why?

COLONEL

The signal will be scrambled. There's electronic interference surrounding the Big Shell.

RAIDEN

Done by the terrorists?

COLONEL

Perhaps. Probably to prevent any UAV or other searches by us.

RAIDEN

But they use radios and Cyphers too, right?

COLONEL

Of course. They wouldn't set it up to interfere with the several channels that they are using. The only thing affected is your remote-controlled missile.

COLONEL

Fortunately the interference isn't too strong.

COLONEL

While inside the Big Shell you should have no problem using a remote-controlled missile.
Somewhere other than 1F, after obtaining remote-controlled missiles

COLONEL

You have the remote-controlled missile. Good job. Now head for the first floor of the Shell 2 Core.

COLONEL

Take out the power source and make contact with the President before the launch code can be reconfirmed. Hurry!
Similar to VR

RAIDEN

I feel like I know this terrain... Wasn't it in the VR training?

COLONEL

Nikita Weapon Mode, Level 4. Do you recognize it?

RAIDEN

Oh -- so that was another rehearsal for this mission.

COLONEL

No, a simulation. Not the same thing as a rehearsal. Leverage the experience from your VR training, Raiden.

COLONEL

A perfectly real VR experience is in itself an accomplished result. Have confidence in your abilities.
Do not hit the President

COLONEL

Raiden, make sure the remote-controlled missile doesn't injure the President. You want to take out only the power source.
After destroying electrified floor - rescue the President

COLONEL

Raiden, the high-voltage current flowing to the floor in front of the room that the President's being held in has been cut off.

COLONEL

Head for the first floor of the Shell 2 Core. Hurry -- get in touch with the President before the nuclear launch code is reconfirmed.
After destroying electrified floor

COLONEL

The currents are off. The President is being held somewhere ahead. Get to him as soon as possible.
Gun camera room

RAIDEN

Damn, it's dark -- I can't see a thing. The lights are broken.

COLONEL

Try using the night vision or Thermal Goggles in the dark.

ROSE

Snake must know where to find those. Ask him.
Watch out for the gun cameras

COLONEL

Look out for the gun cameras. Those are unmanned surveillance cameras that fire at any moving object that comes into view.

COLONEL

Be careful. Gun cameras can shoot down a remote-controlled missile. You may want to take the cameras out preemptively.
Near duct

COLONEL

Raiden, that duct leads into the room where the President is being held.

COLONEL

Guide the remote-controlled missile through that duct into the room and take out that power source.
•Snake
Prior to Meeting the President
After Harrier battle - the origin of his alias

RAIDEN

So "Iroquois Pliskin" was an alias.

SNAKE

Of course.

RAIDEN

And the rank of Lieutenant Junior Grade...?

SNAKE

Made it up.

RAIDEN

That's just great... Anyway, I get the "Pliskin" part, but what about "Iroquois"?

SNAKE

"Iroquois" is a Francofied version of the Algonquin word for rattlesnakes. It's what they called their enemies.

RAIDEN

Algonquin?

SNAKE

The Algonquin Nation. One of the many groups of Native Americans who used to call Manhattan Island their home.

SNAKE

The majority of tribes in what's now the state of New York were a part of the Algonquin Nation.

RAIDEN

So this was a stronghold of -- snakes?

SNAKE

By the way, "Manhattan" means "island of hills" in Algonquin.
Rescue the President

SNAKE

Raiden, you cover the President. Make contact with him before the confirmation of the nuclear launch code.

SNAKE

We're going to start repairs on the Kamov; that should keep our hands full for a while.

SNAKE

I did a round of Shell 2 during bomb disposal. Let me know if you have any questions.
Location of the remote-controlled missiles
*First time only

RAIDEN

Snake, do you know where I can find some remote-controlled missiles?

SNAKE

Remote-controlled missiles? I saw something on B1 in the core of Shell 2.

But be careful -- contaminated seawater's broken out of the tanks thanks to that explosion. Most of B1 is probably flooded by now.

SNAKE

Raiden, the node for that area is inside a small room to the northwest. You'd better log in.

COLONEL

RAIDEN

Simulation again? What exactly are you talking about?

COLONEL

Don't put your trust in him. Just carry out your duties to the best of your abilities. Do you understand, Raiden?

RAIDEN

COLONEL

They disagreed, probably.

RAIDEN

COLONEL

What?

RAIDEN

COLONEL

COLONEL

ROSE

That's right, Jack, you're tired.

RAIDEN

Ugh...

COLONEL

Raiden, don't waste your time thinking unnecessary thoughts. Invest all your energy instead in carrying out your duties.

•Snake
After Meeting the President
The false nature of the plant

OTACON

The rumors about "Big Shell" being a big cover-up are all true.

RAIDEN

Otacon?

OTACON

I had Snake check everything out. Sure, there are some facilities to clean up the pollution, but they're not running at full capacity.

OTACON

Don't you think it's funny that even though two years have gone by since the incident, they haven't managed to clean up all the crude oil?

OTACON

Of course, the media doesn't report that kind of thing. I think they're having fresh shipments of crude oil brought in to replace the stuff they've cleaned up.

OTACON

The story you were told about toxic chemicals being released if the plant were blown up also seems pretty fishy. I don't think it's actually true.

OTACON

Information is being suppressed on a huge scale. These guys seem to think that the new Metal Gear is worth all the effort and money they're spending on it.

RAIDEN

... So I've been lied to all along...

OTACON

No, I think even your CO didn't know what was going on. That's probably what he's been telling you.

RAIDEN

I didn't mean by the Colonel. I meant by you.

OTACON

Huh? We never lied to you! We just didn't tell you everything, that's all.

RAIDEN

...

OTACON

Ha ha. You know, you're a pretty interesting guy. You're just like Snake said.

RAIDEN

... What did he say?

OTACON

That you're a weak, simple-minded, stubborn fool.

RAIDEN

*a bit shocked* A-a weak, simple-minded...

OTACON

Ah, don't worry, he didn't mean anything bad by it.

RAIDEN

"Nothing bad"? What could possibly be worse than that? That lying, useless, backstabbing, mincing son of a --

OTACON

*interrupts* Raiden, I'm his friend. I know him better than anyone else. I know he's not that kind of guy.

RAIDEN

Yeah? So what?

OTACON

And, by the way... There's one more thing you should probably know about Snake.

RAIDEN

What?

OTACON

He's right here.

RAIDEN

... Next to you?

OTACON

Yep.

RAIDEN

Did he hear...?

OTACON

Every word.

SNAKE

*glaring silently* ...

RAIDEN

I'm, uh... I'm just gonna get back to the mission now.
The spread of Metal Gears

OTACON

As the President mentioned, Metal Gear RAY was created as an anti-Metal Gear weapon.

OTACON

In the Shadow Moses incident, Ocelot returned with a disc containing data of the exercises that were held for Metal Gear REX and the new nuclear warhead.

OTACON

What's more, he sold that data not only to the nuclear powers, but to other countries as well.

OTACON

Those nations that obtained the data have commenced their own Metal Gear research.

OTACON

Where does it go from here? What happens when the world is flooded with variations of Metal Gear? We'll probably be looking at an era similar to that of the nuclear arms race.

OTACON

That was one of the reasons we organized Philanthropy.

OTACON

I understand that Fortune's father, Marine Commandant Scott Dolph, had the same misgivings.

OTACON

That's why he proceeded with the development of the anti-Metal Gear weapon, Metal Gear RAY.

OTACON

In fact, RAY alone can drastically redefine tactics when you consider its seafaring capacity to approach, strike, and break off from targets.

OTACON

I also believe that RAY was a solution for renewing interest in the Marines whose role as a rapid response force has dwindled over the last few years.
•Colonel
Prior to Rescuing Emma
Shell 2 Core B1 - find Emma

COLONEL

Raiden, locate Emma Emmerich and have her put the President's disc to use.
*If player is somewhere other than B1

COLONEL

Emma is on B1 of the Shell 2 Core. The clock is ticking -- locate her before Arsenal Gear goes online.
*If player is in B1

COLONEL

Emma should be to the northwest of your present location on B1 of the Shell 2 Core. She's in an area just on the other side of a Card Level 4 door. Hurry.
Shell 2 Core B1 flooding

RAIDEN

Colonel, B1 is completely flooded from what I can see.

COLONEL

You'll have to swim through.
-->How to swim underwater (p. 206)
Air pockets have light shining down on them

COLONEL

Some light is shining down at the spots where there is air. The light probably reaches down to the floor. Keep an eye out for that light.
Air pockets appear on radar

COLONEL

The places where the air is trapped have been inferred from the node's map data, and should appear on your radar.

COLONEL

There's air at the light blue locations on your radar. You should be able to come up for air there. Pay attention to the radar and move on.
Underwater mines

COLONEL

Raiden, watch out for the underwater mines. They'll detonate on contact. Avoid the mines and swim through the area.
Watertight hatches

COLONEL

Raiden, the procedure for opening watertight doors is the same as when you're on land. Push the Action Button in front of the door.
Underwater watertight hatch that won't open

COLONEL

Raiden, it doesn't look as though the watertight door will open. Find another route.
Find an air pocket

COLONEL

You need to catch your breath somewhere before your O2 Gauge runs out. Keep a lookout for the surface.

ROSE

There should be pockets of air somewhere even with this level of flooding. Make sure you find one, okay?
Underwater card door

COLONEL

Raiden, card-operated doors apparently don't work underwater. Find another route.
Air pocket in front of locker room

RAIDEN

Colonel, are you seeing what I'm seeing?

COLONEL

Affirmative -- that must be Emma Emmerich. You need to go around from the east though. There's no way into the locker room from the present location.

Underwater mine infodump

SNAKE

That underwater mine is believed to have built-in compound sensors for detecting acceleration speed, changes in water pressure, body temperature, and other data.

SNAKE

A light touch will trigger one of these... so be careful!

Shell 2 Core filtration unit infodump
(1)

SNAKE

Be careful, Raiden. You're a dead man if you fall into the Life Reaction Tank.
(2)

OTACON

That's right. The Life Reaction Tank cleanses polluted water with microorganisms.

OTACON

These organisms are activated by pumping them with large volumes of oxygen.

OTACON

As a result, the water's specific gravity is extremely light, making it impossible to remain afloat.

OTACON

Once you fall in, you'll never come up.
•Colonel
Vamp Battle
Vamp battle - he can dodge bullets

COLONEL

Vamp seems to be anticipating the trajectory of your shots from the minute movements of your muscles.

COLONEL

There's no such thing as a perfect system, though. There must be a way to throw him off and land a shot.
Hint - how to hit him

COLONEL

Raiden, don't use the target locking function -- he'll be able to read your trajectory. Aim from First Person View instead, and fire off a barrage with the automatic if necessary.
A fall into the pool means certain death

COLONEL

Remember what Vamp said: that Life Reaction Tank is a death trap. Make sure you don't fall in there accidentally.
Vamp battle - deflect his knives

COLONEL

You can shoot down the knives Vamp throws. Aim at them in First Person View.
•Snake
Vamp Battle
Shadow-binding (1)

RAIDEN

You can't move once his knife nails your shadow!

SNAKE

Shadow-binding? Are we talking about some kind of Ninjutsu?

OTACON

I don't think so. It's probably some form of hypnotism.

RAIDEN

Hypnotism?

OTACON

I'm guessing it's the power of suggestion augmented by his speech and movements, coupled with the manipulation of the light reflecting off the blade of his knife...

RAIDEN

What should I do?

OTACON

I can't think of any way to break his spell on such a short notice. The easiest thing to do is to make sure his knife doesn't hit your shadow.

SNAKE

Raiden, if his knife nails your shadow, you won't be able to move for a while.

SNAKE

If this happens, your only option is to rapidly press a button and move the left analog stick around to free yourself from his spell.
Shadow-binding (2)

SNAKE

You know... you can get rid of your shadow if there are no light sources. Maybe if you knock out some nearby lights, you won't have to worry about his shadow trick.
Use the Thermal Goggles

SNAKE

If the guy goes underwater, slap on your Thermal Goggles.

SNAKE

That should give you an idea where to throw your grenades.
Don't use lock-on against Vamp

SNAKE

It looks like he's anticipating the incoming bullet's trajectory from the movement of your muscles.

SNAKE

Relax, though -- he doesn't have you all figured out.
•Colonel

After Vamp Battle, Prior to Rescuing Emma
Save Emma
*If player is somewhere other than Filtration Chamber

SNAKE

Raiden, we don't have much time left! Emma should be to the north of Filter Chamber No. 2, where you fought with Vamp.

Save Emma - in water north of Filtration Chamber No. 2 (after Vamp battle)

SNAKE

You can find the locker room where Emma is to the northwest of the flooded area. Go!
Save Emma - locker room
(1)

RAIDEN

Snake, I don't see Emma...

OTACON

E.E...
(2)

SNAKE

I can't believe Emma managed to get out of that room by herself. Take a more thorough look around.
Purified hydrogen bomb

RAIDEN

Vamp mentioned a purified hydrogen bomb. Any idea what it is?

OTACON

A purified hydrogen bomb is a nuclear weapon that doesn't use a nuclear explosion to trigger a nuclear fusion reaction.

OTACON

There are two theories for triggering a purified hydrogen bomb. Of the two, our nation focused its research efforts on the "Laser Inertial Compression" theory.

OTACON

Theoretically, it's the same as laser nuclear fusion.

OTACON

By solidifying deuterium and tritium at an extremely low temperature to create fuel pellets and bombarding these pellets with a high-output laser...

OTACON

... the surface of the pellets evaporate. This creates a reaction that results in the inward compression of the pellets.

OTACON

The center portion of a pellet reaches the necessary extreme temperature and pressure conditions for confining nuclear fusion, and thereby creating a fusion reaction.

OTACON

I understand that research in this area continued into the last century. But I'd heard they hit a wall when they couldn't come up with a miniature laser capable of the necessary ultrahigh output...

OTACON

From what you tell me, I guess I'll have to assume they overcame that problem...
•Colonel
After Rescuing Emma
Where to go next

COLONEL

Raiden, take Emma to the computer room on B2 of Shell 1's core.

COLONEL

She can launch the virus that you received from the President. It's the only way to stop Arsenal Gear.

COLONEL

The flooding is getting worse. Go back to Filter Chamber No. 2 -- where Vamp was -- before the area is completely underwater. Move!
Head for Strut L

COLONEL

Raiden, go with Emma to Strut L. If you exit the Shell 2 Core and head south on the KL connecting bridge, you'll get to Strut L. There's no time! Move it!
Emma's O2
(1)

COLONEL

When you're underwater with Emma, her O2 Gauge will be displayed below your own gauge.

COLONEL

Be careful -- her O2 Gauge has lower reserve than yours.

RAIDEN

I guess we won't have any time to waste then.
(2)

COLONEL

Keep an eye on Emma's O2 Gauge. Take the shortest possible way to get through the flooded area.
Get to Strut L

COLONEL

Raiden, accompany Emma to Strut L. Descend to the lower section of the strut and cross the oil fence to Shell 1.
How to hold Emma's hand

COLONEL

Press down and hold the Action Button near Emma to hold her hand.

COLONEL

Start moving with the button pressed down and you can lead her by the hand.

COLONEL

Push the Action Button again to let go.
Holding Emma's hand - you can't use a weapon

COLONEL

You won't be able to take her hand when you're holding a weapon. Keep that in mind.
Emma's sitting down

COLONEL

Raiden, how's Emma doing?

RAIDEN

She's pretty shaky on her feet. Whatever Ocelot drugged her with, it's still having an effect on her.

ROSE

Poor thing. Look after her, okay?

RAIDEN

I'll try.

COLONEL

She can't even walk by herself because of the drugs in her system. See how she has to sit down when you let go of her hand?

COLONEL

If you have to release her hand, make sure she's somewhere safe. Don't let her go in sight of the enemy.
If Emma is unconscious

COLONEL

If Emma loses consciousness, drag her just like you drag the enemy's body around.

RAIDEN

Unconscious, hmm... (He's thinking inappropriate things.)

ROSE

Jack, what's up with you?

RAIDEN

*feigning innocence* Oh, nothing.

ROSE

Hmmph. (She doesn't believe him.)

COLONEL

Don't leave Emma in an unsafe spot when she's unconscious. Drag her if you have to, but get her to safety.
Emma's Life

COLONEL

Do you see Emma's Life Gauge underneath your own?

COLONEL

If Emma's Life Gauge were to run out -- I don't need to explain that, I think. Keep her safe and get her to Strut L.
Emma's Life recovery

COLONEL

Emma's Life Gauge will recover slowly while she's sitting down resting.

COLONEL

If her Life Gauge is starting to run low, you should let go of her hand so she can rest.
Holding Emma's hand - basic tactics

COLONEL

You will not be able to hold any weapons as long as you're leading Emma by the hand. You have no choice but to let go of her when engaging the enemy.

COLONEL

Hide Emma in a safe spot as soon as you see hostile personnel in the vicinity. After you eliminate the danger, pick her up and proceed on course.
Sea lice area

RAIDEN

Emma's terrified of the sea lice. She won't move.

ROSE

I sympathize... I wouldn't want to be anywhere near those things either.

RAIDEN

But we can't exactly sit here. Arsenal Gear is about to go online...

COLONEL

Raiden, you'll have to get through there even if it means forcing her to move. I know it seems cruel.
How to get rid of sea lice

COLONEL

We have got to move Emma past that section. Let her sleep through it -- knock her out, or use the tranquilizer gun.
If player leaves Emma behind

COLONEL

Raiden, where do you think you're going?

ROSE

I don't believe it! Are you trying to ditch Emma?

COLONEL

Get back to where she is right now!
On KL Connecting Bridge

COLONEL

Raiden, take Emma and head for Strut L. Strut L is on the south end of that KL connecting bridge.
Near door on Strut L that won't open

COLONEL

Raiden, that door doesn't seem to open. According to our information, the ladder down to the lower section of Strut L is to the south. Keep your eye on Emma and go south.
At Strut L Sewage Treatment Facility

COLONEL

Raiden, there should be a ladder down to the water somewhere near your present location on Strut L. Take Emma to the ladder.
•Snake
After Rescuing Emma
Otacon and Emma's sibling spats (1)

OTACON

Okay, Raiden. Let me talk to Emma.

RAIDEN

Sure. One condition... no arguing.

OTACON

No problem. Put her on.

OTACON

E.E.? Is that you?

EMMA

Yes. What do you want?

OTACON

Why did you get involved in weapons development?

EMMA

...

OTACON

A lot of people will get hurt... even more will die!

OTACON

I'm talking about the destruction of homes and cities... radioactive contamination for years to come. You of all people should know the horror of nuclear weapons!

OTACON

You know about our family's dark history! Why, E.E.? Why!?

EMMA

You left me... You made my life a living hell!

OTACON

I didn't have a choice!

EMMA

Don't lie to me! The pool... You could never look me in the eye after the accident!

EMMA

You took the easy way out, so you wouldn't have to face me!

EMMA

That way, you could avoid responsibility every day...

EMMA

You ran... You ran away so you wouldn't have to face the pain!

OTACON

No... that's not why I left...

EMMA

You left me and took the easy way out...

OTACON

That's not true. I left the house because...

EMMA

You're a criminal! Just like me!

OTACON

A... criminal...?

EMMA

I know what you did! You manipulated our account on the network...

OTACON

But...

EMMA

Look at what you're doing now... You're nothing but a cracker!

OTACON

No. I'm just applying my knowledge for the cause...

EMMA

The cause!? What cause!? Justice!?

OTACON

For peace, E.E.! I'm not like Snake... I can't carry a gun and face the enemy... That's why I do what I do best...

EMMA

Oh, right! Nice justification, Hal! Forget about being a criminal! You'd make a great lawyer!

SNAKE

All right already... That's enough!
Otacon and Emma's sibling spats (2)

SNAKE

What's up, Raiden?

RAIDEN

Uh...

EMMA

Out of my way! Let me talk!

SNAKE

You want to talk to Otacon?

EMMA

Yes.

SNAKE

I'll put him on...

OTACON

Yeah... what is it?

EMMA

Up to now, scientists have continued to be active participants in war. What's your opinion?

OTACON

There's no doubt that war has been an ideal event that fuels the progress of science. But therein lies the trap...

OTACON

We scientists must establish some form of work ethic.

OTACON

It's a tragedy that both the government and the military act as sponsors to modern science.

EMMA

What are you talking about? The atom and hydrogen bombs were born from laboratories owned and operated by universities and private enterprises...

EMMA

Los Alamos and the Lawrence Livermore Labs were run by universities... There's nothing strange about that.

OTACON

Weapons development and universities... This may come as a surprise, but science requires that information be exchanged freely.

EMMA

You're referring to the will of Professor Oppenheimer, aren't you?

OTACON

For me, science and weapons always existed at different levels.

OTACON

I never thought that my research results would bring about misfortune to others. That was until the Shadow Moses incident...

EMMA

I have no regrets...

OTACON

That's where you're wrong. We scientists know the dangers of a nuclear threat. It's up to us to protect the people. We can't allow it to be exploited by nations or their politics...

OTACON

Man and nuclear weapons cannot coexist. Mere mortals were never meant to handle nuclear fusion.

EMMA

Science defines me... My government respects me... Can you tell me what's wrong with that!? Can you!?

SNAKE

Okay. That's enough...
Otacon and Emma's sibling spats (3)

RAIDEN

Snake...

EMMA

Let me talk to him!

RAIDEN

Uh, yeah.

SNAKE

Otacon's busy right now. You'll have to settle for me.

EMMA

What...? O-okay...

SNAKE

Right. Now what do you want?

EMMA

Hal's wrong. Science doesn't exist to benefit the world.

SNAKE

Then what is it for?

EMMA

Science is for the individual. For me, it's a way to realize my dreams.

SNAKE

That sounds pretty greedy.

EMMA

You can't realize your dreams without greed.

SNAKE

And what's your dream?

EMMA

Take revenge on Hal... to beat him at his own game...

SNAKE

Revenge?

EMMA

I'm gonna make him regret the day he left me... I'm going to make him realize he was wrong!

SNAKE

Of all the idiotic...

RAIDEN

... I think that's enough.

EMMA

*ignores* Idiotic!? It's my goal! My reason for being alive!

EMMA

Hal is wrong! He's only being used by his country! He's pitiful! Even you guys are using him!

EMMA

Me... I'm using science to achieve my own dream!

SNAKE

Real bright, lady! That's exactly the line that scientists are never meant to cross!

EMMA

Right! I sold my soul for revenge! I will never forgive him!

SNAKE

I'll pretend this conversation never happened...

EMMA

No! You tell my brother exactly what I said! You...

SNAKE

Emma!

EMMA

W-What...? (She's been overpowered.)

SNAKE

You're speaking your mind... not your heart.

EMMA

...

SNAKE

Just leave it at that.

EMMA

Um... okay...

RAIDEN

...
After rescuing Emma - head for Strut L

SNAKE

Raiden, take Emma and go to Strut L. There's a ladder down onto the oil fence on the ocean surface from that strut.
Messing with Emma
*If player crawls on top of Emma

OTACON

What do you think you're doing to her!?
After rescuing Emma - before Snake goes dark
*Lead-up to Snake and Olga's battle

SNAKE

Raiden? I may have to sign off for a while.

RAIDEN

Anything wrong?

SNAKE

Just a small errand... Don't worry about it.

RAIDEN

What's it about?

SNAKE

Here goes -- I'm going offline! (Olga has come and this is just before their battle.)
Prior to reaching Strut L (1)

RAIDEN

Snake, are you close?

SNAKE

Keep it together -- we're almost there. Just hang on until then.
Prior to reaching Strut L (2)

RAIDEN

Snake?

SNAKE

We're having some problems. You're going to have to deal by yourself for a while. Take good care of Emma, all right?
•Colonel
Vamp Sniping Event
Near ladder

COLONEL

Raiden, where do you think you're going? Your job is to safeguard Emma. Give her a safe passage with the PSG1.
Sniping event - basic instructions

COLONEL

Stay out and give her cover until she makes it safely across the oil fence. Use the PSG1 to snipe out anyone who tries to interfere with her progress.
Vamp sniping - aim for his head

COLONEL

Raiden, Emma's in danger. Take out Vamp now!

COLONEL

You'll do serious damage with a head shot. Aim for his head!
Replenish your ammo

COLONEL

Don't forget to pick up more ammunition for the PSG1 when you run out. They should be close by.
Stances affect hand shaking

COLONEL

Hand tremors are unavoidable when sniping.

COLONEL

It can however be kept to a minimum by taking the prone position. Go into a crawl and select the PSG1.
Claymores

COLONEL

Raiden, there's a problem. They're invisible to the naked eye, but there are Claymore mines set on the oil fence.

COLONEL

The Claymores will become visible with Thermal Goggles on. Snipe them out and protect Emma.
Getting Emma to stop

COLONEL

Emma is still heavily drugged. She doesn't seem to have regained complete control of her body yet, and her judgment is not what it should be.

COLONEL

She runs the risk of walking blindly into dangerous situations.
*Second and subsequent times

COLONEL

Whenever you want Emma to pause, fire at the ground near her feet to signal her.

COLONEL

That should make her stop. Take the opportunity to eliminate whatever poses a threat to her.
Do not hit Emma

COLONEL

I know you've already heard this, but don't shoot Emma.
*If player has attacked Emma

ROSE

You would never do something like that on purpose, right?

RAIDEN

...

ROSE

Are you... Are you going to shoot again?

RAIDEN

No! I would never do something like that.

ROSE

That's what I thought.

RAIDEN

That's funny! Haha...

ROSE

Ahahaha...

ROSE

*suddenly serious* Jack, listen. If you shoot this time...

RAIDEN

If I do?

ROSE

I won't save your data. Got it?
Don't forget about tranquilizer rounds

COLONEL

If you don't want to kill, use a sniper rifle that can fire tranquilizer rounds.
*If player has tranquilizer rifle

COLONEL

Your PSG1-T fits the bill. It works just like the regular PSG1, so consider it an option.

COLONEL

The PSG1-T only fires tranquilizer rounds, so remember, it won't shoot down a Gun Cypher.
*If player doesn't have tranquilizer rifle

COLONEL

Unfortunately, you don't seem to have one of those. You'll have to eliminate the enemy instead.
When player has remote-controlled missiles equipped

COLONEL

The remote-controlled missiles cannot be used in outer areas of the Big Shell. Remove Emma's attackers with the PSG1.
Pentazemin

COLONEL

Pentazemin can temporarily steady the hand. It's something to consider when you need to do some precise shooting.
Vamp sniping

COLONEL

Raiden, Emma's in trouble. Target Vamp only -- do not under any circumstances hit Emma! Aim as precisely as you can!
Emma is close to death

COLONEL

Raiden, Emma's not going to last too much longer.

ROSE

I have a feeling Snake will be able to think of something. Contact him ASAP!
•Snake

(1)

SNAKE

Ok. I'll take care of it.
(2)

Damn -- I don't think I can do this. Snake, take over for me.

SNAKE

I'll take care of it, then.
-->After calling Snake – Snake takes care of business
After calling Snake - Snake takes care of business
*Easy (etc.)

SNAKE

I'm going to show you how sniping should be handled. Take a good look.
*Hard (etc.)

SNAKE

I'll start sniping from Strut E, but I'm not always going to hit the target, and there'll be a pause during reloads. You're going to have to keep shooting, too.
-->After calling Snake – explanation
After calling Snake - explanation

SNAKE

My sniping field will be limited to the area you're watching through your PSG1's scope.

SNAKE

Keep a good lookout on Emma's surroundings even while I'm shooting, all right?

(1)

SNAKE

Raiden, watch where you're aiming!
(2)

SNAKE

Raiden! What're you aiming at!? Cover Emma!
(3)

SNAKE

That's a pretty good shot, kid! Now how about aiming at the enemy!
(4)

SNAKE

Raiden! I'm on your side!!!
Angry Snake
*If player (Raiden) shoots Snake, Snake shoots back and scolds them

What's your problem!?

SNAKE

Watch where you're shooting!

SNAKE

Stop messing around!!

SNAKE

No more!
Snake is talking to himself
*If player points the Directional Mic at Snake during the sniping event, they can hear him talking to himself

*watching Emma* Hmm... Not bad at all...

SNAKE

Do I need to clear things with Otacon before I ask her out...?

SNAKE

Is she all right...!?

SNAKE

What is he (Raiden) doing...!

SNAKE

Look out...!

SNAKE

Phew...

SNAKE

All right...

SNAKE

Just a little more...

SNAKE

Damn... (Apparently he missed.)

SNAKE

Good shooting... (Apparently his shot hit the mark.)
Section 7
After Vamp Sniping Event – Solidus Battle
Vamp Sniping End 1
3D Cutscene 1
(MC)
Despite the fact that Vamp is holding Emma hostage, Raiden hits Vamp with one final shot, freeing Emma.
Binoculars/PSG1 mode (3D cutscene).
When Vamp dies, Emma stumbles toward Strut E with her hand pressed against her back. After taking a few steps, she suddenly falls on her face. Concerned, Snake puts down his sniper rifle and makes his way across the pontoon bridge. Firing at Cyphers in the air with his SOCOM, he rushes to Emma's side.
Snake gets Emma over to Strut E. During this time, attacking the two will result in game over. The player receives a call on the Codec!
Vamp Sniping End 2
Codec Call 1
(mandatory incoming call from Snake)

SNAKE

Raiden! Emma's been stabbed!

RAIDEN

That bastard!

OTACON

How bad is it!?

SNAKE

She's conscious... but the bleeding's bad. I'm bringing her over there right now!

OTACON

E.E...

SNAKE

Raiden! Get that disc over here as soon as possible. I'm afraid her time's running out...

RAIDEN

I'll be there!
Vamp Sniping End 3
In-Game Sequence 1
(Strut E Ladder)
Raiden goes up a ladder (automatic) along the column of Strut E. It leads to a floor hatch in a room on the B1 level of the facility. Raiden climbs out of the hatch and closes it behind him (automatic). This is the same route Snake took with the wounded Emma about 10 minutes ago.
Raiden kneels and then calls Snake (mandatory)!
Vamp Sniping End 4
Codec Call 2
(mandatory outgoing call to Snake)

RAIDEN

Snake, what's your situation over there?

SNAKE

Emma seems to be uh... doing something to GW's defensive capabilities. All we need now is your disc. (He doesn't really know what's going on.)

SNAKE

You'd better hurry -- I don't think she's gonna make it.

RAIDEN

How's the bleeding?

SNAKE

She's...

SNAKE

Just get over here. You'll find the coast is clear with everybody aboard Arsenal right now.

RAIDEN

Understood.
AG Activated 1
3D Cutscene 1
((MC) - Shell 1 B2 Computer Room)
Raiden finally arrives at the Computer Room.
Otacon is looking at Emma, who lies on the floor exhausted. He ignores Raiden as he enters the room. Snake stands alongside a computer terminal.

RAIDEN

How's Emma?
Snake looks in Emma's direction.

SNAKE

I think he got some internal organs... We can't stop the bleeding...
Emma's back and abdomen are soaked in red.
The two men stand at a distance from Emma and Otacon.
Otacon has tears in his eyes.

EMMA

Hh... Hal?
Her sight failing her, Emma reaches out with her hands to find Otacon.

OTACON

I'm here.
Otacon tries to comfort a trembling Emma. Snake pulls his eyes away from Emma and chokes out a sad whisper.

SNAKE

Got the disc?
Raiden shows Snake the optical disc. Snake nods.
Snake indicates a computer terminal with his gaze.

SNAKE

Emma's set everything up. Apparently, all you have to do is pop in the disc.
Taking the disc from Raiden, Snake inserts it into the terminal.
The screen shows the data being loaded from the optical disc to Arsenal's AI.

SNAKE

Um... that should insert the virus into the AI... (He doesn't really understand.)
A bar on the screen fills, indicating that the load is progressing.

RAIDEN

Is it working?

SNAKE

Just leave it to Emma. (He doesn't know, so he's avoiding the question.)
According to the on-screen bar, 80% of the data has been loaded.
Suddenly, a warning rings out! A program that monitors for foreign code kicks into gear. An alert message appears on the screen!
Snake turns to Otacon. With Emma still in his arms, Otacon looks toward the screen.

OTACON

An antibody agent!?
A disconnection notice appears on the screen.

SNAKE

Damn! The connection's been cut!
Snake and Raiden huddle around the screen!

RAIDEN

Is the virus upload complete?

SNAKE

I don't think so. The count's stopped at 90%.
"90%" appears on the screen.

SNAKE

Otacon...? (Do you know what's going on?)

OTACON

I don't think Emma's made any mistakes...

RAIDEN

But...

OTACON

A portion of the worm cluster might've been altered after the disc left Emma's hands.

RAIDEN

By the Patriots? (The Patriots only altered the program to erase information about them.)

SNAKE

Will the virus still work?

OTACON

I have no idea...

EMMA

Hal... is... is everything alright...?
With her hearing already failing her too, Emma hasn't heard the exchange between Snake and company.
Otacon looks at Snake as if to ask how he should reply.
Snake shakes his head ever so slightly.

OTACON

Uh... It's alright. Everything's alright.

EMMA

Good... At least I... I won't be adding... another page to our family's dark... history...
Otacon’s family tree includes scientists engaged in the development of weapons from throughout history. For example, Otacon's grandfather was involved in the Manhattan Project.

OTACON

Yeah... that's right...
Snake approaches Raiden. They both whisper so that Emma can’t hear their exchange.

RAIDEN

What if the virus doesn't work?

SNAKE

Either destroy that thing, or take out Solidus and his men.

RAIDEN

How do we get on board?

SNAKE

I don't think we can, unless somebody inside gives us a hand.
Snake hints at receiving Olga’s help. Emma’s condition deteriorates.
The sea in and around the plant becomes unsettled.
With the last of her fading strength, Emma grips Otacon’s hand tight.

EMMA

Hal... I...

OTACON

What it is?
Emma has trouble forming the words. She reaches out and touches Otacon's glasses.

EMMA

I always... wanted to see you again.
AG Activated 2
3D Cutscene 2
((NM) – the setting sun)
3D cutscene visuals (the sun setting over the horizon).
A huge sun (wide shot)—representing Emma’s life—sets over the horizon. The sea sparkles from its light. The conversation that follows is played over this scene. 3D cutscene showing the pontoon bridge (from the sniping event).

OTACON

You don't hate me?

EMMA

Never... I never wanted to get in your way... I never wanted to hurt you... I thought that with Arsenal... if I followed in your footsteps... I could be... closer. I just wanted you to look at me...

EMMA

I just wanted you to look at me... look at me as... as a woman.

OTACON

E.E... I could never do that...

EMMA

Don't be so honest. It... hurts...

OTACON

Sorry...

EMMA

Can I... Can I ask you one last favor...?

OTACON

Sure...
The sun sinks below the horizon.

EMMA

Call me... Call me..."Emma."

OTACON

What...?

EMMA

Please call me... Emma.
AG Activated 3
3D Cutscene 3
((MC) - Shell 1 B2 Computer Room)
Emma reaches up again to try to touch Otacon.

OTACON

What's wrong with E.E.?

EMMA

...
Her strength gone, her hand drops.

OTACON

Emma...
Emma remains smiling with open eyes.

OTACON

Emma?
Her expression is frozen on her face.

OTACON

Emma!? Emma!?

OTACON

Answer me!
Otacon bursts into tears. Snake and Raiden can only look on.
Otacon whispers into Emma's ear.
AG Activated 4
3D Cutscene 4
((NM) - the setting sun)
3D cutscene visuals (dark waters; the sun has disappeared below the horizon).
3D cutscene showing the pontoon bridge (from the sniping event).

OTACON

I didn't... I didn't leave you... because of the accident.

OTACON

I had... I had a relationship with your mother. She seduced me... and it went on... My father's death... was no accident. He took his own life... It was my fault. All my fault. Forgive me, Emma...
AG Activated 5
3D Cutscene 5
((MC) - Shell 1 B2 Computer Room)
Several minutes after Emma's death.
As though sensing her passing, Emma's parrot cries out from its cage!

PARROT

Hal.
Otacon goes up to the cage and lets the parrot out.
He holds out his hand. The parrot hops onto it.

PARROT

Hal.
Holding his step-sister's beloved bird in his hands, Otacon bursts into tears again.

OTACON

*sobs*
This is interrupted by an announcement playing over the intercom (enemy commander's voice).

BUILDING ANNOUNCEMENT

Attention! Arsenal Gear is ready for launch! Evacuate the upper levels immediately!

SNAKE

Sounds like they're cutting this area loose!

RAIDEN

What do you mean!?
Otacon suddenly stops crying. His white jacket is covered with Emma's crimson bloodstains.

OTACON

It means we're gonna sink...

SNAKE

We have to get the hostages out!

RAIDEN

What about the Kamov repairs?

OTACON

Done...

RAIDEN

We won't be able to get everybody aboard...

SNAKE

We'll just have to take as many as we can.

OTACON

My sister...
He glances over at Emma's body. He himself makes the call.

OTACON

*convincing himself* ... won't be able to come with us.

BUILDING ANNOUNCEMENT

We will be commencing the countdown shortly...

BUILDING ANNOUNCEMENT

Personnel in the upper levels, head for the evacuation area immediately.
AG Activated 6
Movie Cutscene 1
(Wolf's death)
In-game visuals (3D cutscene) from MGS1.
The scene where Wolf dies.

OTACON

*mumbling* I'm always the survivor...

OTACON

... Why, Wolf?
AG Activated 7
3D Cutscene 6
((KF + MC) - Shell 1 B2 Computer Room)
Otacon looks into space, asking the question at someone (Wolf) who isn't really there. Needless to say, no answer comes. Otacon's head drops.

SNAKE

Otacon, take care of the hostages.

OTACON

What about you guys?

SNAKE

We got other arrangements...

RAIDEN

?
Raiden turns to look at Snake, expecting him to elaborate.

SNAKE

There's our ride out of here.
Snake points at the massive door that leads to Arsenal, visible through the window.

SNAKE

Anyway, we're gonna have to sink that thing if the virus doesn't work.

OTACON

I should be going with you.
Snake shakes his head.

SNAKE

You've got your job, we've got ours.

OTACON

*resigned to his weakness* You mean I'd only get in your way...

SNAKE

Wrong. Only you can save those hostages. Got it?
Snake places his hands on Otacon's shoulders, trying to breathe some life back into him. Otacon smiles and nods.

OTACON

Right.
Otacon addresses Snake and Raiden.

OTACON

Listen. The two of you won't be able to destroy that thing.
His next words are directed at Snake.

OTACON

Eliminate the enemy... That's your only option.
The three of them walk out of the room.
In front of the door to Arsenal Gear on the B1 level of the Shell 1 Core.
They stop in front of the door to Arsenal. It looks way too solid to simply blast through it. There are signs that indicate "Arsenal Gear" and "No Entry", etc.
Raiden looks at Snake. Snake gives a little nod.
Emma's parrot starts talking again.

PARROT

Hal...
The bird repeats "Otacon" and "Hal" almost as if it were some sort of mantra. Otacon becomes emotional again.

OTACON

E.E...? Damn...!!
Otacon bangs his head against the wall.

SNAKE

Otacon! Try to get as many hostages out as you can. It's a short flight to the shore, so don't worry about overloading the Kamov.

OTACON

Leave it to me.
Snake and Otacon embrace each other tightly!

BUILDING ANNOUNCEMENT

I repeat! Personnel in the upper levels... Head for the evacuation area immediately.
The announcement repeats!

SNAKE

I'm counting on you, Otacon.
Taking Emma's parrot with him, Otacon heads for the elevator.

PARROT

Hal... I miss you...

PARROT

I miss you... I miss you...
The elevator doors close, and Otacon disappears from view.
The elevator ascends.
By himself in the elevator, it's as if a dam of emotions has burst, and Otacon breaks down.
Otacon cries. He speaks to Emma's parrot as though it's her.

OTACON

You and me... we're the same...
AG Activated 8
3D Cutscene 7
((NM) – reminiscence)
Wide shot of Shell 1. Otacon speaks but does not appear on-screen.

OTACON

Both you and I... We were always alone... always...

OTACON

We only wanted to be loved... we were always waiting -- waiting for somebody... somebody who would love us...

OTACON

But we were wrong... You can't wait to be loved. You have to go out and find it. Four years ago... I realized that you can't just wish for a happy family. You have to make it happen... I only wish I knew that sooner.

OTACON

I learned that I could love... as you probably did...
AG Activated 9
3D Cutscene 8
((MC) - Shell 1 Core B2, In Front of Arsenal Gear Door)
Outside Arsenal's door. Raiden and Snake watch Otacon leave.
Without saying a word, Snake hands Raiden the virus disc (though it's a fake).

RAIDEN

You think he's gonna be OK?

SNAKE

He's tougher than he looks. Consider it done.

RAIDEN

Now... how do we open this thing?
Snake grins knowingly.

SNAKE

You can come out now!
On that signal, the Ninja (Olga) drops down from the ceiling.

RAIDEN

A ninja...? What the...?

NINJA

Arsenal's going to take off.
Raiden looks at Snake as if to say "What the hell?" Snake's expression doesn't change one iota.

NINJA

We still need you to take care of a few things...
The Ninja draws its sword from its hip to keep Raiden at bay. It then points the tip of its blade at Raiden's face.

NINJA

This time, do not fail us.

RAIDEN

Snake! What's this all about!?
Raiden seeks confirmation that Snake is still on his side, but Snake doesn't say a thing. Not only that, he seems completely unconcerned by the Ninja's presence.

SNAKE

Bed time, Raiden.

RAIDEN

!!
Raiden tries to reach for his gun.

SNAKE

I wouldn't do that!

RAIDEN

You're changing sides now!?

SNAKE

Change sides? I don't recall saying I was on yours.

RAIDEN

Damn it.
The Ninja deactivates its face shield. It turns transparent, revealing Olga's face.

RAIDEN

You!

OLGA

Ready for some shut-eye?
Olga delivers an atemi (body strike) on Raiden with her sword.

RAIDEN

Ugh!
Olga's sword reacts with Raiden's nanomachines, and electric arcs (plasma) shoot out of him. His nanomachines' safeguard kicks in, which renders him unconscious. Raiden is out cold.
Arsenal Gear is activated!
Shells 1 and 2 are jettisoned, and the flooding begins!
Water rushes into the structures!
The sea churns and foams as something massive starts to rise from the seabed. Otacon looks down from the Kamov, noticing the changes in the water. While Arsenal is clearly humongous, it is not yet visible.
AG Activated 10
Codec Call 1
(mandatory incoming call from Rose)
The Codec screen fades in.
Only Rose's face appears. Raiden's window is all static.

ROSE

Jack? Are you reading me? Do you want to save your mission data up to this point?
The save menu appears.
∙SAVE
∙DO NOT SAVE

ROSE

Your mission data's been saved.
AG Activated 11
Movie Cutscene 2
(MGS1-style torture event)
Raiden regains consciousness in a torture room. First Person View slowly fades in. Like MGS1, initially only the ceiling is visible. Raiden is naked from head to toe, but at this point the player cannot look at his body. Also like MGS1, Raiden has been captured by Ocelot and his arms and legs are strapped to a torture bed.
The torture room layout is identical to the one from MGS1 (or it gives off the same kind of vibe). In fact, this room is located within Arsenal Gear. Rhythmic sounds like that of a submarine traveling the deeps can be heard.
Solidus and Ocelot are present in the room.
Raiden is still forced to stare at the ceiling. He can hear Solidus and Ocelot talking, their voices carried with an echo at first. They think Raiden is still knocked out.

SOLIDUS

Is he still alive?

OCELOT

He was when Olga brought him in.
Slow fade in. Ocelot is standing there in front of Raiden, just like he was in MGS1.

OCELOT

I've checked everything including the Genome data, but there's nothing on this guy.

OCELOT

NSA, CIA, FBI... He doesn't exist in any database.

OCELOT

He's a nonexistent operative from a nonexistent organization.

SOLIDUS

I suspected as much. However, I know this man...

OCELOT

?

SOLIDUS

Wake him up.
AG Activated 12
Interactive First Person Cutscene 1
(AG Torture Room)
Sound of Ocelot pressing a button controlling the torture bed.
The bed (torture machine) Raiden is strapped to rotates until it is perpendicular to the ground and Raiden is facing forward. Since the player is looking through First Person View, the room gradually comes into view as Raiden's body is raised.
Button inputs still work during this time, despite this being a cutscene. With the forced First Person View, the player was looking at the ceiling before, but now that the torture bed has been raised, they get a look at the room they are in. It is divided off by glass, and contains a host of cutting-edge medical equipment. On the other side of the glass is what appears to be a cell with iron bars. On the floor, a twisting mess of cables resembling arteries feeds into the torture machine (bed), just like in MGS1.
With a clear view of the room, the player can now get a look at Solidus. He wears his black powered suit, though it looks closer to a suit of armor. A scarf (a snake arm) is draped across his neck, and an eyepatch covers his left eye (he lost it in the Harrier battle). Solidus takes a look at Raiden's face, then walks a few steps toward him. He was already the spitting image of Solid Snake, but with the eyepatch, one could add Big Boss to that list too.
Solidus looks as though he's seeing an old friend.

SOLIDUS

It's been a while, hasn't it... Jack the Ripper?

OCELOT

You know this fellow?
Solidus shoots Ocelot a look, then turns back toward Raiden.

SOLIDUS

You remember me, don't you?
Solidus speaks like he's talking to a close companion. Raiden doesn't answer.

SOLIDUS

You've grown...
One of Solidus's snake arms glides toward Raiden like a tentacle, then grabs him by the neck. The player can no longer move the camera (still in First Person View).

RAIDEN

*laborously breathing* ...
Solidus's other snake arm does a quick scan of Raiden's head. The First Person View flashes!

SOLIDUS

*with pity and scorn* High concentration of cerebral implants... Have they altered your memory, too?
Refers to the nanomachines injected into Raiden's brain. They organically control synapse formation and firing, which means they can control memory and thought as well. By forming neural circuits in the dormant parts of his brain, these nanomachines also create the illusionary Colonel who has been talking to Raiden. All of this is made clear later.

RAIDEN

Aaaaaaarghaaaah!!! (Screaming to the point where he can't breathe.)
The First Person View flashes again!
AG Activated 13
3D Cutscene 9
8(MC + KF) - AG Torture Room)
Solidus withdraws his snake arms.

SOLIDUS

This is my son...
Raiden is exhausted from Solidus's examination.

SOLIDUS

I taught him everything...
Solidus traces the edge of his eyepatch. He ruminates.

SOLIDUS

Jack... I never thought I'd see you again...

RAIDEN

You... know me? (What Snake said in MGS1.)

SOLIDUS

You don't remember...?

SOLIDUS

Your name... your skills... Everything you know... you learned from me.
AG Activated 14
Movie Cutscene 3
(child soldier)
Real-life footage (child soldiers).
Actual footage of child soldiers is shown.

SOLIDUS

The eighties... The civil war. You were one of the best among the child soldiers that fought in that conflict.

SOLIDUS

When you were barely ten years old, you became the platoon leader of the "small boy unit." At the time, your outstanding kill record earned you several nicknames including "White Devil" and "Jack the Ripper."
