The Liberian flag (resistance stripes and a star) overlaps with the flag of the Sons of Liberty (resistance stripes and a snake) that is emblazoned on the collar of Solidus's suit.
AG Activated 15
Movie Cutscene 4
Visuals of an illustration presented as a movie.
Raiden as a withdrawn child.

SOLIDUS

I was your godfather, I named you. When the war ended, you disappeared from the relief center. I wondered what happened to you... I should've known they (the Patriots) would recruit you.
AG Activated 16
3D Cutscene 10
((MC + KF) - AG Torture Room)
Solidus and Ocelot talk with their backs to Raiden, who is completely naked. He listens in.

OCELOT

It's an interesting coincidence... (He knows it isn't a coincidence at all.)

SOLIDUS

If he's a lackey for the Patriots, I doubt that he knows anything of interest.

OCELOT

What should we do with him?

SOLIDUS

We'll use him like you suggested... (They will use Raiden to lure out the Patriots' spy.)
Solidus looks at Raiden's face.

OCELOT

What about Dead Cell?

SOLIDUS

Ignore them.
Suddenly, Ocelot's arm starts to throb. Snake is close.
Ocelot bites into his arm hard to get it to stop.

SOLIDUS

Happening again?
Witnessing what Ocelot is experiencing, Solidus says in a brusque manner:

OCELOT

Could it be that he's here too?

SOLIDUS

Hmph. (Now absolutely convinced that there's a traitor among them.)
After Solidus's meaningful utterance, Ocelot starts walking.

SOLIDUS

In another hour, we demonstrate the power of Arsenal Gear.

OCELOT

Attack with standard weapons, of course? (Are you going to proceed with diversionary tactics?)

SOLIDUS

Yes. Proceed as planned.

OCELOT

At last report, all is well with GW.

SOLIDUS

*satisfied* Hm. How about the troops?

OCELOT

The men are being refitted with Arsenal Gear equipment as ordered.
Ocelot looks at Solidus's eyepatch.

OCELOT

You're the spitting image of Big Boss... (Because of the eyepatch.)
Solidus laughs proudly.

SOLIDUS

Perhaps I should be grateful to this kid for that.
Solidus leaves through the south door, like when Liquid left the room in MGS1. Raiden and Ocelot are alone.
AG Activated 17
3D Cutscene 11
((MC + KF) - AG Torture Room)
Ocelot walks up to Raiden.

OCELOT

This situation... I find it very... nostalgic.

RAIDEN

Where am I?
Raiden is managing to regain his strength.

OCELOT

Why inside Arsenal Gear, of course.
Ocelot looks up at the ceiling. Arsenal is currently traveling underwater.

OCELOT

Actually, we're also inside the memory of Shadow Moses.
Ocelot looks at Raiden's naked body. He takes out the optical disc from his pocket, then holds it up so Raiden can see it.

OCELOT

I'll take this back. You don't need this anymore, do you?
Ocelot puts the disc away.
With that pregnant comment, Ocelot is keeping the disc safe on behalf of the Patriots.
With Solidus having stolen Arsenal Gear from the Patriots (their plan was for Arsenal to never be activated), they are now trying to use the virus to destroy the AI and render it inoperable.
Suddenly, Olga enters the room, dressed in her Plant Chapter fatigues. Ocelot ends the conversation.

OCELOT

A foul wind is blowing... We shall speak again.
Olga and Ocelot don't get along. She has no idea that Ocelot is actually a minion of the Patriots. Ocelot leaves the room.
Raiden glares at Olga.

OLGA

Don't move...
After cautioning Raiden in a hushed voice, Olga checks the area.

OLGA

Stay as you are...
Olga keeps her face pointed away from the camera in the room.

OLGA

We're being monitored by a camera.
The camera is up on the ceiling. Olga stands with her back to it. It cannot see her face—or her expression.

RAIDEN

What are you up to...?

OLGA

I'm switching over to nanocommunication...
AG Activated 18
Codec Call 2
(internal communication with Olga)

RAIDEN

Mister X...? Ninja...?

OLGA

Correct... It's me.

RAIDEN

I thought you were the leader of the Russian troops...

OLGA

*self-deprecatingly* No. That was just a smoke screen.

RAIDEN

A smoke screen?

OLGA

I was sent to provide you support.

RAIDEN

Support? Who sent you? The Colonel?

OLGA

No... The Patriots.

RAIDEN

What!?

OLGA

I... I deceived my troops... Betrayed them...

RAIDEN

But why?

OLGA

My child is... being held hostage by the Patriots.

OLGA

It all started two years ago when I lost my father (Sergei) during the tanker incident...

OLGA

My men and I had nowhere to go... so we joined forces with an illegal Russian organization.

RAIDEN

The Russian Mafia?

OLGA

Something like that. Actually, I learned much later that it was a subordinate organization of the Patriots.

OLGA

I was expecting at the time. When I gave birth to my child, it turned out I was in a hospital run by the Patriots. In the morning... my child was gone. My baby is being kept somewhere in this country.

RAIDEN

Have you ever met your child?

OLGA

No. Once a month, they send me a photo of my child via network. I've never even held the child in my own arms...

RAIDEN

I see... (He can't understand what it's like to have children.)

RAIDEN

Given your situation, nobody can blame you for what you did.

OLGA

That's your opinion... (She feels she is to blame.)

RAIDEN

What about Snake? I thought you were enemies...

OLGA

He wasn't responsible for my father's death. Actually, we owe him our lives.
AG Activated 19
Movie Cutscene 5
(flashback)
3D cutscene flashback movie.
In-game visuals.
The ending of the Tanker Chapter...
Snake fighting Olga / Olga speaking with her father over the radio / Olga placing her hand on her stomach.

OLGA

Two years ago, they were responsible for getting us out of the sinking tanker alive...

RAIDEN

So you were partners since the incident?

OLGA

No. I only found out the truth shortly before this.

RAIDEN

Huh?

OLGA

When I confronted him here...

RAIDEN

You fought with Snake!? When?

OLGA

Well... it was around the time you were holding hands with that girl.
Visuals of Raiden with Emma.

RAIDEN

Snake...
AG Activated 20
Codec Call 3
(internal communication with Olga)

RAIDEN

*a little sarcastically* So you joined hands with him to pay back a debt?

OLGA

No. Mutual gain...

RAIDEN

Mutual gain? (He's a little shocked to hear this coming from someone from a communist bloc.)

OLGA

My job was to assist you. If Solidus gets away with Arsenal, your mission is a failure. The Patriots would judge that as failure on my part and terminate my child. Putting it simply, my child's life depends on your success.

RAIDEN

So you did it all for your child. But why would the Patriots want to help me? Are they hoping I'll take Solidus out?

OLGA

No. You're just like me... We're just pawns...

RAIDEN

Pawns for what purpose?

OLGA

The S3 Plan...

RAIDEN

Huh?

OLGA

You'll figure it out sooner or later -- but I wonder if you'll handle the truth? (She's talking about Rose.)

RAIDEN

What do you mean?

OLGA

Listen... We haven't got time for this. Solidus will commence his attack any minute. He's got to be stopped.

RAIDEN

What about the virus?

OLGA

No results so far. I think the Patriots have tampered with the program.

RAIDEN

Will it work?

OLGA

I don't know...

RAIDEN

Get me out of this thing.

OLGA

Not yet. I'll release your restraints after I leave this room.

RAIDEN

Where's my gear?

OLGA

Snake's got everything. I couldn't bring it here.

RAIDEN

And where do I find Snake?
AG Activated 21
3D Cutscene 12
((NM: hangar route) - AG Hangar)
Preview 3D cutscene of the route through the hangar.
The camera travels along the route. RAYs can be seen on both sides of the hangar. There are no Tengu soldiers.

OLGA

The passageway ahead leads to a hangar. He'll be waiting there. I gave him a card key for the hangar.

RAIDEN

Does Snake plan to destroy Arsenal Gear?

OLGA

No. Even for Snake, it's impossible to completely destroy this thing. The only option is to stop Solidus and his men.

RAIDEN

What're you going to do?

OLGA

Stay concealed. That's my role. I still can't afford to be discovered...
AG Activated 22
Interactive First Person Cutscene 2
(AG Torture Room)
Back to First Person View in the torture room. All the player can do is move the camera up, down, left, and right. The surveillance camera is positioned at the front of the room.

RAIDEN

Olga, you can't keep this up -- they're bound to find you.
Olga's demeanor changes suddenly when she hears the words "they're bound to find you."

OLGA

Listen... I'll free you in a little while.

OLGA

Brace yourself.
Olga delivers a fierce punch to Raiden's gut as she leaves.

RAIDEN

Ugh!
Raiden's Life goes down a little.
Olga walks briskly out of the room.
She enters the corridor and leaves. Raiden moves his head to watch her go.
The player can't do anything for about 20 seconds. Even if they call Rose, the following conversation won't start yet.
AG Activated 23
Codec Call 4
(mandatory incoming call from Rose)

ROSE

Jack, are you all right?

RAIDEN

Oh, y-yeah. (It's awkward because his past has been exposed.)

ROSE

Jack, is it true? What Solidus said?

RAIDEN

... Yes.

ROSE

It's unbelievable... Drafting small children (under 15), sending them to war -- it's not allowed under international conventions.

RAIDEN

ICC rules don't mean a lot in war. Someone told me that there are over three hundred thousand children (under 18) in combat right now. I was just one of them...

ROSE

So you remember? I thought your memory had been... manipulated by them.

RAIDEN

It was -- but I have nightmares every day, pieces of the past I can't put together...

ROSE

Why didn't you tell me?

RAIDEN

You couldn't begin to understand.

ROSE

You wouldn't know that until you try me.

RAIDEN

I didn't want you to get hurt. (Actually he just didn't want to get hurt.)

ROSE

...

RAIDEN

There was never a real reason for me to fight, except that someone put a gun in my hand. And that someone was him (Solidus)...

ROSE

It wasn't your fault.

RAIDEN

If I survived the day's fight, I was praised, fed, and had a bed to sleep in. I think I was only six when I held my first AK, but I'm not even sure of that.

ROSE

Jack?

RAIDEN

I'm not like Snake, I never questioned why we fought. There was no purpose, no way out. They give you a gun, you ask how many to kill. If you didn't, you were the one they shot instead.

ROSE

It's OK. No one is blaming you.

RAIDEN

We were shown Hollywood action films every day. The kind with macho guys and big guns. They call it image training.

ROSE

...

RAIDEN

They -- they built us from the ground up, into killing machines...

RAIDEN

We were fed once a day. I can still taste the gunpowder they mixed into the food.

ROSE

Gunpowder? In the food?

RAIDEN

The gunpowder had toluene in it, giving it hallucinogenic properties. It kept us drugged, controllable.

ROSE

Oh, my God...
Rose begins to sob.

RAIDEN

When the civil war ended, those of us who survived were taken in by NGO's. They gave me a new life in the States. I can't complain.

RAIDEN

*sounds like he's going to cry* But nothing's changed. The only people who have no problem with my past have secrets and agendas of their own...

RAIDEN

Terrible nightmares -- every night. I can never forget...

ROSE

*crying* Jack...

RAIDEN

*hoarsely* I'm afraid of the night. That's why I don't sleep next to you.

ROSE

*crying* You should have told me...

RAIDEN

Told you what? That I'm a killer and always have been?

ROSE

No, no.

RAIDEN

What I hate more than anything else in the world is my own past. I didn't want you -- or anyone -- to know about it.

ROSE

*sobbing* ...

RAIDEN

Now I know why I was chosen for this mission. No one can take him (Solidus) on -- take him down -- except me.

RAIDEN

I've been kept alive this long for this. I knew, as soon as I saw Solidus.

ROSE

Jack, I love you the way you are now. You have to believe me.

RAIDEN

...

ROSE

I didn't know anything about you, I admit that. Where you were born, how you grew up -- but I know that now. And I know that what I feel for you can only get better, and I'll share in your past if that's the price.

RAIDEN

It doesn't work that way. No one can share the burden of what I've done. It's not one of those warm and fuzzy things couples share.

ROSE

I accept the good and the bad, Jack. That's what you do for someone you love.

RAIDEN

I don't want to share my past with anyone. I just want to forget about it.

ROSE

Jack? I haven't told you -- you know, about what I've done... (She can't tell him yet.)

ROSE

... (She holds back her words.)

RAIDEN

The last two years with you -- it's been more than I've ever hoped for.

ROSE

Jack?

RAIDEN

But I can't go any farther.

RAIDEN

I know you want to get married.

ROSE

*somewhat shyly* I --

RAIDEN

But --

RAIDEN

I can't.

RAIDEN

I can't risk starting a family.

RAIDEN

There's no way to erase my childhood.

ROSE

It's all right, Jack. Please, don't say any more... (She's pregnant.)
Torture Room Escape 1
Codec Call 1
(mandatory incoming call from the Colonel)
The Colonel calls Raiden after he escapes from the torture room.

COLONEL

Raiden, do you copy?

COLONEL

You must continue your m-mission. (Stuttering like he's rapping.)
Something is off about the Colonel's speech.

RAIDEN

I've lost all my gear. I need to locate Snake.

COLONEL

He was never factored into the simulation. Leave him out of this.

RAIDEN

I can't do much naked, especially in this temperature.

COLONEL

That's true -- you won't be able to attack or enter the Hanging mode, either.

RAIDEN

I think Snake has my gear.

COLONEL

Raiden, take out Solidus and his men. You must recover Arsenal intact.

RAIDEN

Colonel, are you under orders from the Patriots?

COLONEL

Your role -- that is, mission -- is to infiltrate the structure and disarm the terrorists --

RAIDEN

My role? Why do you keep saying that.

COLONEL

*defiantly* Why not? This is a type of role-playing game. The point is that you play out your part -- and I expect you to turn in a perfect performance!

RAIDEN

Colonel, I just remembered something.

COLONEL

What?

RAIDEN

That I've never met you in person. Not once.

COLONEL

...
The image of the Colonel on the Codec screen weakens. Static interference.

COLONEL

Complete your mission according to the simulation!

RAIDEN

Colonel, who are you?

COLONEL

No more questions. We have Rosemary.

RAIDEN

What do you mean by that!?

COLONEL

Over and out.
Crazy Colonel 1
Codec Call 1
(mandatory incoming call from the Colonel)
Raiden receives another call from the Colonel.

COLONEL

Raiden, turn the game console off right now!
Add an effects filter to the Colonel's voice. (The virus is starting to take effect.)

RAIDEN

What did you say?

COLONEL

The mission is a failure! Cut the power right now!

RAIDEN

What's wrong with you?

COLONEL

Don't worry, it's a game! It's a game just like usual.

COLONEL (ROSE)

You'll ruin your eyes playing so close to the TV. (Mimicking a mother.)

RAIDEN

What are you talking about!?

COLONEL

*seriously* Raiden, something happened to me last Thursday when I was driving home. I had a couple of miles to go -- I looked up and saw a glowing orange object in the sky, to the east! It was moving very irregularly... Suddenly, there was intense light all around me -- and when I came to, I was home. What do you think happened to me...?

RAIDEN

Huh?

COLONEL

*hurt* Fine, forget it...
The call ends. If Raiden calls the Colonel, he spouts more nonsensical lines. His behavior has become very, very strange.
Passageway A 1
Codec Call 1
(optional incoming call from Rose)
As Raiden continues through Arsenal Gear, he gets a call from Rose.

ROSE

Jack, it's me.

RAIDEN

Hi Rose.

ROSE

Jack -- I owe you an apology.

RAIDEN

If it's about that conversation just now, I'm the one who's sorry.

ROSE

No, it's something else.

RAIDEN

What is it?

ROSE

That day at Federal Hall two years ago -- it wasn't a coincidence. (Two years ago to the day. Everything will become clear at the end.)

ROSE

*with difficulty* I was ordered to keep an eye on you...

RAIDEN

Keep an eye on me?

ROSE

Yes -- by the Patriots.

RAIDEN

You're a spy.

ROSE

I suppose. Yes. It's an ugly word.

RAIDEN

*speechless* ...

ROSE

Are you still there?

RAIDEN

Was sleeping with me a part of the job?

ROSE

I fell in love with you...

RAIDEN

How could anyone --

ROSE

*strongly disavowingly* I can't excuse what I did. I've reported every detail of your personal life to them these two years. What you did, said, everything...

RAIDEN

Must've been fun.

ROSE

But some things I didn't tell anyone!

RAIDEN

...

ROSE

Like what I felt for you.

RAIDEN

*purposefully coolly* So that's why you were involved in this mission. I should have known. Why else would they toss an analyst into the mix at the last minute?

ROSE

I'm sorry. I know what I did was wrong...

RAIDEN

No matter where I go - I get used.

ROSE

I reinvented myself to suit your tastes. Hairstyle, clothes, the way I move, things I talked about...

ROSE

You say you love the color of my hair, my eyes. They're not even real. (I dyed my hair and I'm wearing colored contacts.)

RAIDEN

You must have gone over my psych profile with a fine-tooth comb.

ROSE

It was my job.

RAIDEN

Great performance -- had me completely fooled.

ROSE

What I really wanted was for you to see the real me. It hurt to play out this -- this artificial romance.

ROSE

It was worse to lie to myself than to you. The more love you gave me, the more it hurt -- because I knew the person you loved was just a character.

RAIDEN

*trying to convince himself* So it was artificial on my end too. It was just a game, not the real thing.

ROSE

Oh Jack...

RAIDEN

I feel better knowing that.

ROSE

*confused* What?

RAIDEN

I was in love -- or thought I was -- with someone who didn't exist. I was trying to be someone I wasn't by loving what wasn't real.

RAIDEN

I don't know who you really are. The person I knew isn't real; she's not the woman I'm talking to right now. In a sense, the deception was my own, not theirs.

ROSE

Jack, I thought I was acting, because that was my job. But I did fall in love with you, that wasn't an act. (She's using Naomi's line.)

RAIDEN

You expect me to believe that?

ROSE

...

RAIDEN

It's okay. You had your reasons, right? Hey, I understand. But I have nothing left to... (but say goodbye).

ROSE

*interrupts* Jack!!

RAIDEN

What?

ROSE

I'm... I'm carrying...

ROSE

I'm pregnant, Jack.
Rose's voice starts to go buggy. Its speed drops.

ROSE

Your baby.

RAIDEN

Rose? What's going on?
The call ends. When calling Rose from now on, the player is only given the option to save, and she doesn't appear in the Codec window either.
After the call is over, Snake reappears!
Passageway A 2
3D Cutscene 1
((MC) - AG Passageway A)

SNAKE

Amazing how you walk around like that.
Raiden looks in the direction of the voice, and there stands Snake in his Sneaking Suit. He speaks in a hushed tone, in case any enemies are within earshot. Snake is leaning against a wall to the south of Raiden (behind him), his arms crossed.

RAIDEN

Snake!

SNAKE

Been waiting long?
Snake wears his Infinity Bandana. It ripples despite the absence of any breeze. There he is—the Snake, the hero we all know and love. Snake looks just like he did in the Tanker Chapter. Raiden lets out a sneeze from the cold.

RAIDEN

Ah-choo!! Where's my gear?

SNAKE

Right over there.
Snake points to Raiden's weapons and items.

SNAKE

That's more like it.
Raiden has already donned his Skull Suit.

SNAKE

Everything you had when you were captured is still there.
Snake puts a finger to his mouth (shush gesture). He then taps the base of his neck, proposing they use internal communication to prevent eavesdropping.
Passageway A 3
Codec Call 2
(internal communication with Snake)

SNAKE

*calmly, but happily* Sorry about earlier. I had to use you as bait to gain access to Arsenal. It worked.

RAIDEN

Why didn't you tell me about Olga?

SNAKE

You never asked.

RAIDEN

*unhappy* Uh!

SNAKE

Not happy about that? Get over it.

RAIDEN

*unimpressed* ... Any effects of the virus yet?

SNAKE

Still waiting on that.

RAIDEN

So it (the virus) was rigged by the Patriots?

SNAKE

Looks like it. From what I can tell, Arsenal is headed for Manhattan. I don't know what Solidus is planning, but we'll have to deal with it one way or another.

SNAKE

There's also a troop of production-model RAYs ahead.

RAIDEN

How many units?

SNAKE

Twenty-five, according to Olga.

RAIDEN

Twenty-five!?

SNAKE

Yeah. Can't say I've faced that many Metal Gears before, but -- I think we can deal.

RAIDEN

*weakly* No way we can...

SNAKE

*calmly* We can because we have no other choice.

RAIDEN

How?

SNAKE

I've stocked up on Stinger missiles.

SNAKE

Oh yeah, Olga left this for you.
Passageway A 4
3D Cutscene 2
((MC) - AG Passageway A)
Snake hands the Ninja's sword (blade) to Raiden. Raiden takes the sword and studies it.

RAIDEN

Why?

SNAKE

Olga asked me to give it to you. Besides, I'm not a big fan of blades.
Raiden swings the sword around, testing it.
Passageway A 5
In-Game Sequence 1
(AG Passageway A)
In-game camera. The weapon window opens.

SNAKE

Use the right analog stick to control the blade. You haven't had VR training on this, so try practicing now.

SNAKE

We're going to have plenty of company ahead. This is your last chance to practice.
Raiden's moves are demonstrated with explanations.
Raiden puts his sword away by securing it on his waist (behind his back). From this point on, the sword always appears on his back, regardless of whether it is equipped or not. When he is using it (i.e., when it is equipped), he pulls it out of the sheath. Unequipping it returns the sword to its sheath. With this sword, Raiden has a new "ninja hero" look!
Passageway A After Sword 1
3D Cutscene 1
((MC + KF) - AG Passageway A)
After Raiden has practiced for some time with the sword, Snake calls to him.

SNAKE

Come on, time to go.

SNAKE

If you run out of ammo, you can have mine.

RAIDEN

You got enough?

SNAKE

Absolutely.
He points to his bandana.

SNAKE

Infinite ammo. (The infinity bandana is a prize item players received after completing MGS1. If equipped, you won't run out of ammo.)
Snake takes out his keycard. Raiden calls out to Snake.

RAIDEN

Wait up, Snake.

SNAKE

What?
Passageway A After Sword 2
Codec Call 1
(internal communication with Snake)

RAIDEN

Snake, have you ever -- enjoyed killing someone?

SNAKE

What are you talking about?

RAIDEN

I'm not sure. Sometimes it's hard to tell the difference between reality and a game...

SNAKE

Diminished sense of reality, huh? VR training will do that.

RAIDEN

No, it was field training, when I was a kid.

RAIDEN

I lied, Snake. I have more field experience than I can remember. It's not VR that's doing this to me.

SNAKE

Raiden, we don't carry guns to take people down. We're not here to help some politician either.

RAIDEN

You can say that because you're a legend, a hero. I'm Jack the Ripper, a dirty reminder -- of a terrible mistake.

SNAKE

Legends don't mean a whole lot. I was just a name to exploit.

SNAKE

Just like you.

RAIDEN

People will remember only the good part, the right part of what you did.

SNAKE

There's no right part in murder, not ever. And we're not in this to make a name for ourselves.

RAIDEN

Then what are you and Otacon fighting for?

SNAKE

A future.

SNAKE

You can stop being part of a mistake, starting now.

RAIDEN

What am I -- what am I supposed to do?
Passageway A After Sword 3
3D Cutscene 2
((MC + KF) - AG Passageway A)
Snake opens the door with the keycard.

SNAKE

Find something to believe in. And find it for yourself.
He pauses as he walks through the door.

SNAKE

And when you do, pass it on to the future.
Snake carefully scans ahead.

RAIDEN

Believe in what?

SNAKE

Come on!
Snake opens the door, and they move into the next passageway.
Otacon Safe 1
Codec Call 1
(mandatory incoming call from Otacon)
As Raiden moves further into Arsenal with Snake, he gets a call from Otacon.

OTACON

Snake, Raiden!

SNAKE

Otacon! You all right?

OTACON

Yeah. So are all the hostages.

RAIDEN

That's good news.

OTACON

How's everything on your end?

RAIDEN

All right for now. But there is something --

OTACON

What?

RAIDEN

The Colonel's last transmission was strange.

OTACON

Strange? How?

RAIDEN

Just -- strange. No idea--

OTACON

Interference?

RAIDEN

I don't know.

OTACON

Where is this Colonel (giving orders from)?

RAIDEN

I don't know. I've never met the man, actually...

OTACON

*is extremely suspicious* ... I'll dig around.

RAIDEN

Thanks. I owe you one.

OTACON

If there's anything else, call me on the Codec, I might be able to help. The frequency is 141.12.
Colonel AI 1
Codec Call 1
(mandatory incoming call from Otacon)
As Raiden moves further into Arsenal with Snake, he gets another call from Otacon.

OTACON

Raiden? About this Colonel of yours -- I found out where he is.

RAIDEN

Where?

OTACON

Inside Arsenal.

RAIDEN

What!?

OTACON

I've checked out all the possibilities, but I keep coming back to Arsenal. It isn't a relay point, it's the origin of the signal.

RAIDEN

...

OTACON

And, the encryption protocol it uses is exactly the same as that of Arsenal's AI -- the so-called GW.

RAIDEN

... What the hell does this mean?

OTACON

I think it means -- you've been talking to an AI.

RAIDEN

That's impossible!

OTACON

The Colonel probably isn't GW per se. GW was most likely stimulating cortical activity in the dormant part of your brain through signal manipulation of your own nanomachines. The Colonel is in part your own creation, cobbled together from expectations and experience...

RAIDEN

That's crazy!

OTACON

But it's probably the truth. The virus may be starting to affect GW, which would explain the Colonel's behavior.

RAIDEN

It was all -- an illusion? Everything I've done so far...?

SNAKE

Raiden!

RAIDEN

Snake -- what's happening around here?

SNAKE

I don't know. What I do know is that you're standing right here in front of me. Not an illusion -- flesh and blood.

RAIDEN

...

SNAKE

It's your call. You can drop this if you want.

RAIDEN

No, I can't do that. Let's go...
Rose Hostage 1
Codec Call 1
(mandatory incoming call from the Colonel)
As Raiden presses on deeper into Arsenal with Snake, he gets a call from the Colonel. He sounds normal again.

COLONEL

Raiden! They've got Rose!

RAIDEN

What!?

COLONEL

Rose is being held in the holds!

SNAKE

It's a trap!

ROSE

Help! (Already the synthetic sound of AI.)
Rose disappears from the screen!

RAIDEN

Rose!

SNAKE

Raiden, get a grip!

RAIDEN

But Snake!

SNAKE

It's a trap. Since the Colonel doesn't exist, there's no way he can take Rose hostage.

RAIDEN

Yeah -- you're right...

SNAKE

I am right.

RAIDEN

... OK.

RAIDEN

...

RAIDEN

Does Rose -- exist -- ?

SNAKE

Don't be weird. She's your --

RAIDEN

What if I've never really met her...

SNAKE

What?

RAIDEN

If the Colonel is something that I partly dreamt up, then... everything I remember about her could be...

SNAKE

Don't jump to conclusions!

RAIDEN

You and Otacon are the ones that say the Colonel never existed.

SNAKE

Raiden!

RAIDEN

*not listening* Is this what Olga was talking about?
AG Enter Fortune 1
3D Cutscene 1
(Room Before AG Hangar)
Raiden and Snake make their way through Arsenal Gear, reaching a room atop a giant circular stage. They are attacked by numerous Tengu commandos, whom they manage to fight off after a prolonged battle.
Raiden and Snake take a moment to collect themselves. Suddenly, footsteps ring out across the chamber. Fortune languidly enters the room from the same passageway that Raiden and Snake walked down. Tears streak her melancholic face. The linear rifle is slung over one shoulder. Sensing others in the room, she turns toward Snake and Raiden. They wince at the sight of her.
Fortune steps up onto the cylindrical elevator.

RAIDEN

Fortune... (This is bad!)

FORTUNE

It's been a long wait, Solid Snake -- the root of all my sorrows.

SNAKE

What?

FORTUNE

Two years ago, you killed my father. That was the beginning of hell for us.

FORTUNE

Everyone I love has been taken from me, one by one... and no matter how hard I try, I can't follow them.

FORTUNE

An endless nightmare... The only thing we live for is to see it end.

FORTUNE

Our wait is almost over.

RAIDEN

You can't be serious about firing the nuke!

FORTUNE

Since no one can kill me, I may as well kill everyone I can.

FORTUNE

Starting with you, Solid Snake!
Fortune aims her linear rifle.

RAIDEN

Damn!
Raiden grows anxious at the sight of one person he never wanted to see again. Snake readies his automatic.

SNAKE

Looks like I'm today's pick. You go on ahead.
Snake covers Raiden and forces him toward the ladder. Fortune turns her gaze to Raiden as he takes hold of a rung.

SNAKE

You want eternal rest? I've got it right here.
Fortune turns back to Snake.
Raiden cannot make up his mind to go up the ladder.

RAIDEN

What are you going to do? Bullets can't get near her.

SNAKE

I'll think of something. There's no such thing as a witch.
Fortune's lips curl in a sneer as she looks at Snake.

FORTUNE

You think you can kill me?
She shifts her huge linear rifle.

SNAKE

I don't know what your group's been through, but let's get one thing clear: I didn't kill your father.
Snake takes aim in a flash.

FORTUNE

Do you think anyone believes your lies!?

SNAKE

Raiden, get out of here!
Raiden climbs the ladder. Snake's voice rings out behind him!
Sounds of gunfire erupt below. Snake's shout:

SNAKE

UNHh!!
Putting his faith in Snake's abilities, Raiden clears the ladder and closes the hatch behind him.
This ceiling hatch cannot be opened from inside.
Pre-RAY Battle 1
3D Cutscene 1
(MC)
Raiden heads for the Metal Gear RAY hangar.
Raiden goes through a door and finds himself in a giant hangar housing RAYs. It is too dark to see much of anything; even the ceiling and the walls of the huge space are lost in the gloom. Solidus's voice booms out after Raiden enters the hangar.

SOLIDUS

Jack, I've been watching how you fight.
Raiden looks around for where his voice is coming from.

SOLIDUS

It looks like you've remembered the way you used to kill in the old days!

SOLIDUS

Or is it one of the S3 Plan's proud achievements?
Raiden shouts into the darkness.

RAIDEN

What are you talking about?
Pre-RAY Battle 2
Interactive Movable Cutscene 1
(AG Hangar)
The player can walk around in the dark; they can even enter First Person View or crawl around if they like. Weapons and items are equippable. If the player uses a weapon, its sound effects overlap with the dialogue. The Codec cannot be used. The player can run as far as they want; the map has no end. Also, the entrance can no longer be opened.
Solidus continues to speak.

SOLIDUS

It came as a complete surprise when Ocelot discovered the S3 data from GW. Not a bad idea, though -- using fire to fight fire, creating the perfect assassin to retire Solid Snake's brother.

SOLIDUS

S3 stands for Solid Snake Simulation... It's a development program to artificially reproduce Solid Snake, the perfect warrior. The result is a FOXHOUND commando when FOXHOUND no longer exists, a simulated Solid Snake shaped by VR regimen.

SOLIDUS

Sound like someone you know -- Jack? I'm sorry to see you reduced to one of the Patriots' puppets. But I've made use of you and their plan, too.

SOLIDUS

Solid Snake's sudden appearance, your arrival -- it was obvious the Patriots were among my ranks. I had to smoke out the agent before the mission entered the final phase. You came in handy as bait.

SOLIDUS

*reminiscently* Jack, those days during the civil war were as real as they come... Every day was absolute, split between life and death. You ran from it, and now, you've been led back to war by something less than real.
Pre-RAY Battle 3
3D Cutscene 2
((MC) - AG Hangar)
Solidus, propelled by his accelerator, blasts out of the darkness and appears in front of Raiden.

SOLIDUS

No more games, Jack. At least you know.

SOLIDUS

*sadly* There's no reason to keep you alive now...
From behind Solidus comes the sound of RAYs walking (thud, thud). Three of them emerge from the darkness.

SOLIDUS

I've given you a worthy opponent at least.

SOLIDUS

But now, you should die as the little Jackie boy I once knew.
Solidus accelerates once again and disappears.
The three RAYs move in on Raiden.
To game (Metal Gear RAY battle).
AG Surfaces 1
3D Cutscene 1
((MC) - AG Hangar)
Raiden fights the small army of Metal Gear RAYs using his Stinger missile launcher, but no matter how many he destroys, new ones take their places, wearing him down.
Raiden, utterly exhausted, is at a loss.

RAIDEN

It's no use...
The latest group of RAYs converges on Raiden, surrounding him.
Solidus's voice rings out in the hangar.

SOLIDUS

I expected a little more fight than that, Jack.
Raiden braces himself as a RAY prepares to trample him. Suddenly, Olga leaps into the fray, much like the Ninja at the end of MGS1.
Olga stands in front of Raiden, shielding him.
The RAY pauses. Solidus's disembodied voice (as projected through a loudspeaker) calls out.

SOLIDUS

So you've decided to show yourself.
The RAY backs off a few paces.

RAIDEN

Olga, don't do this. They'll know --

OLGA

I'll hold them off, give you time to get away.

RAIDEN

What about you?

OLGA

... (She's prepared to die.)

RAIDEN

This is suicide!!

OLGA

Your nanomachines -- they're transmitting your vital signs to the Patriots. If you die, my child dies. Do you understand?

RAIDEN

The child...

SOLIDUS

I see -- so that's why you sold your troops out to me. So many dead, and they all died trusting you...

OLGA

...! (This hurts her the most.)

SOLIDUS

Weren't they your comrades?

OLGA

No, not just comrades! Family!

SOLIDUS

Hah.

OLGA

I know I'm going to hell. But at least my child --

SOLIDUS

*unmoved by Olga's tears* I applaud your attitude. If you have a death wish,
An instant later, there is a loud blast, and the atmosphere jolts. Solidus appears in front of Olga using his accelerator, taking her by surprise. He holds a P90 in one hand. Raiden aims his gun a moment too late.

SOLIDUS

I'll be happy to accommodate you.

SOLIDUS

See you in hell!

OLGA

HRRRRGH!!
Olga turns the barrel of her gun toward Solidus with a cry of rage. Before she can pull the trigger, one of Solidus's snake arms flies out at blinding speed and knocks her arm out of the way. The bullets hit the ceiling instead of their intended target, while the other snake arm grabs Olga by the throat. She gasps in pain.

OLGA

Ugh...
The snake arm lifts Olga off the ground. Solidus spins the P90 in his hand like something out of a Spaghetti Western. Olga throws Raiden a pleading look (a "make my death count" type of look).

OLGA

Live -- you have to --
Slow motion. The P90 stops rotating and the trigger is pulled.
Sound of a single gunshot rippling through the air! Olga's body is blown away! Blood and brain tissue spatter onto Raiden's face.

RAIDEN

OLGA!!
Raiden falls to his knees with shock. He is paralyzed by the terrible turn of events.
Solidus turns to Raiden and grins.

SOLIDUS

Enjoy the show, Jack? Let's pick up where we left off.
Solidus signals toward the ceiling (Ocelot).
The RAYs start to move again. However, something is off about them.

SOLIDUS

Hm?
Their movements are clumsy, almost convulsive.

SOLIDUS

What's going on!?
The RAYs shake their heads like broken toys. Solidus calls to Ocelot.

SOLIDUS

What's wrong with it!?

OCELOT

The AI -- GW -- it's out of control.

SOLIDUS

What!?
The RAYs break into a frenzy of uncontrollable movements.
AG Surfaces 2
Movie Cutscene 1
(monitor visuals)
Arsenal's monitor screen!

OCELOT

I'm reading an abnormal impulse cascade throughout the neural network. I can't shut it down!

SOLIDUS

What happened!?

OCELOT

Maybe -- some kind of virus --

SOLIDUS

The Patriots!?

OCELOT

I don't know!

SOLIDUS

Ocelot! What have you been up to!?

OCELOT

It's too late!
Sirens begin to shriek throughout the hangar!

OCELOT

Arsenal's system control is going haywire...! It's on an emergency ascent course!
AG Surfaces 3
3D Cutscene 2
((MC) - AG Hangar)
RAYs have red blood; once they start to bleed, they begin attacking one another (a bug in their cognitive routine). Now totally out of control, they close in on Solidus.

SOLIDUS

Stupid machines!
Solidus snaps his steel collar shut and goes full throttle with his powered suit!

SOLIDUS

rrrRRAAAAH!
Using his accelerator, he deftly evades the RAYs's lashing tails and other attacks.
Solidus snipes their AI control modules with the P90!
The RAYs cease functioning. Solidus opens his collar.

SOLIDUS

Damn the Patriots...!
Solidus grabs Raiden (with a snake arm) and lifts him off his feet.
Solidus is about to kill him, but changes his mind.

SOLIDUS

You still have some use...
Solidus lowers his P90.
Raiden is unresisting, completely sapped of his will to fight.
Suddenly, Fortune's voice rings out.

FORTUNE

I've captured Snake.
Solidus, still holding Raiden aloft, looks back at the entrance.

RAIDEN

S-...Snake?
Behind Fortune is Snake, tied up.

SOLIDUS

Bring him in.
Solidus injects truth serum into Raiden's neck with one of his snake arms. Injection sound.

RAIDEN

Ugh...
Raiden loses consciousness.
AG Surfaces 4
Interactive First Person Cutscene 1
(AG Head)
First Person View cutscene in Arsenal's head section.
Arsenal has already surfaced. The sun has gone down; there is very little to see this far away from Manhattan anyway. The steady rain also serves to obscures the view.
The bad weather and the isolated location suggests there is very little possibility of armed intervention from concerned outside parties. First Person View cutscene, camera movement only. The player can move the camera up, down, left, and right, allowing them to take in their situation. There are drops of water on the First Person View camera lens.

SOLIDUS

Are you awake yet, Jack?
Raiden's vision is blurred. The player can use the up, down, left, and right inputs to shake off the blurriness. First Person View.

RAIDEN

U-uh...
Solidus stands before Raiden. A manned (prototype) RAY is positioned at the front of the area. At RAY's feet is Ocelot. On the left are Fortune and Snake (cuffed). Snake is still out cold. Solidus has his back to Raiden as he speaks. RAY is floating on the surface of the sea. Fine, misty rain is falling. Raindrops slide down the First Person View camera.
Since Raiden was injected with truth serum (phenobarbital), he is in a hazy, drugged state.

SOLIDUS

GW, the Arsenal AI, is corrupted beyond repair. I admit that I underestimated you...

SOLIDUS

I'll squeeze the answers out of you instead, my son...
Solidus spins around, and lashing out with his snake arm, lifts Raiden off the ground by the throat. Camera height rises. The pile of chains on the floor is pulled taut (sound effect only).
The O2 gauge appears on-screen. The O2 level begins to drop, and if the player doesn't keep pressing the endurance button, they get a game over. If the player endures for a certain period of time, continue to 3D cutscene.

RAIDEN

U-uh...uhn...

FORTUNE

What do you hope to hear? You know he doesn't know anything.

SOLIDUS

It's not him I want the answers from.
Solidus wants to obtain information on the Patriots from the nanomachines in Raiden's brain (more on this later).
AG Surfaces 5
3D Cutscene 3
((MC + KF) - AG Head)
Arsenal has ascended to the surface. The entirety of its body isn't shown yet. Raiden and the others are on the brow of the tortoise. It is too far from Manhattan to see anything. Solidus finally frees Raiden and the latter gulps in lungfuls of air, coughing and wheezing.
Fortune faces Solidus.
Solidus retracts his snake arm, leaving Raiden to crash to the ground.

RAIDEN

Ugh...

FORTUNE

What do you mean?

SOLIDUS

That's not your business.

FORTUNE

Oh really? It so happens I have some business of my own to attend to.
Fortune turns to leave.

SOLIDUS

Planning to hijack Arsenal?
Fortune, her intent exposed, stops dead in her tracks.

FORTUNE

!

SOLIDUS

You were going to screw me over, weren't you?

FORTUNE

... Who talked? Ocelot?

SOLIDUS

Not exactly. I was the one who used Ocelot to suggest the idea to you in the first place.

FORTUNE

What?

SOLIDUS

I was planning to give you Arsenal to begin with.

FORTUNE

... Why the uncharacteristic generosity?

SOLIDUS

Hm. I'm no philanthropist.
Wide shot to give some indication of Arsenal's size, though the full scale is still kept hidden.

SOLIDUS

Arsenal is far from impregnable. It needs other Metal Gears as guards, a huge payload of warheads, and full air, sea and land support to function efficiently. Against a large attack force without support, Arsenal is nothing more than a gigantic coffin.

SOLIDUS

Seizing Arsenal Gear was never the real objective.

FORTUNE

*with a quiet anger* ... What was your objective, then?

SOLIDUS

A list of names -- of the Patriots!

FORTUNE

!?
AG Surfaces 6
Movie Cutscene 2
(the Patriots)
Visual of the 12 Patriots. The Wisemen's Committee. Or, real-life footage of the Stars and Stripes.

SOLIDUS

They were planning to extend their control to digital information flow with GW and Arsenal. That means the information they want to filter out is contained in GW. Including that list of the highest twelve members of the Patriots' Wisemen's Committee.

FORTUNE

And once you knew who they were, you would cross out their name one by one... while we, with our useless Arsenal, drew their fire.

SOLIDUS

Very good.

FORTUNE

*self-deprecatingly* You were using us all along.

SOLIDUS

Were you any different?

FORTUNE

*sarcastically* But your plan's hit a snag with GW destroyed, hasn't it?

SOLIDUS

No -- there is another way. (He's referring to the nanomacines in Raiden's brain.)

FORTUNE

Really... But we have our own plans to carry out. We'll take the Arsenal since you don't care for it anyway; the purified hydrogen bomb is ready to go.

SOLIDUS

A nuclear strike won't stop them.

FORTUNE

It will damage their power source -- the mindless masses that they control. First things first.

SOLIDUS

Of course -- that was what you wanted.

SOLIDUS

I won't stop you. Good luck.

FORTUNE

Thanks, but I have quite enough of that.
Fortune is about to walk away when Ocelot, hitherto silent, bursts into laughter.

OCELOT

Hahahaha...

FORTUNE

*with a quiet anger* What exactly do you find so funny?

OCELOT

Charades usually are humorous. I wouldn't have minded watching some more of it, but we're running a little short on time...

SOLIDUS

What are you talking about?

OCELOT

Everything you've done here has been scripted -- a little exercise set up by us.

SOLIDUS

Exercise!?

OCELOT

The S3 Plan was conceived as a means to produce soldiers on par with Solid Snake. That's what I told you. But the VR training the boy was put through is not the meat of the project.

OCELOT

You think this little terrorist incident is your own doing, Solidus? THIS is the S3 training kernel -- an orchestrated recreation of Shadow Moses.

SOLIDUS

What!?
AG Surfaces 8
Movie Cutscene 3
(the points of similarity between MGS1 and 2)
Movie showing the similarities between Shadow Moses and recent events.

OCELOT

Ames and the President's deaths -- the Ninja -- the computer virus that mimics FOXDIE. Did you really think they were all a coincidence?

OCELOT

Ames' own nanomachines were used to shut down his pacemaker.

OCELOT

I arranged for the appearance of the Ninja as well.

OCELOT

As for the President -- although Johnson realized what was going on, he played out his allotted part.

OCELOT

As for the computer virus, it's a digital counterpart of FOXDIE. It was also designed to eliminate every scrap of information regarding the Patriots from GW. Your plan was invalidated even before execution, Solidus.

OCELOT

Fatman was a different story. He's one of our own people, a sort of examiner we hired to test the boy's progress before letting him tackle the exercise proper. We had to arrange for Stillman's presence to coax the maniac into agreeing. If the boy had allowed the Big Shell to be destroyed, this exercise would have ended there. The project has no room for failures.

SOLIDUS

What do you mean!?
Visuals of Raiden's feats.

OCELOT

Given the right situation, the right story, anyone can be shaped into Snake. Even rookies can fight like men of experience. An instant creation of genius -- and this training kernel will provide more than enough data to formulate such a program.
Bosses shown back to back.

OCELOT

You, Dead Cell, Olga -- you're all nothing but pawns placed to create the perfect simulation.
AG Surfaces 9
3D Cutscene 5
((MC + KF) - AG Head)

OCELOT

Solidus, you and the boy were selected because your relationship resembles the one between Snake and Big Boss.

OCELOT

Fortune, you and the rest of Dead Cell stand in for the FOXHOUND squad that Snake took on in Shadow Moses. You're the most impressive collection of freaks outside of FOXHOUND. We've gone to a lot of trouble to set you up against the boy. That story about purified hydrogen bombs is just the tip of the iceberg.

OCELOT

The project was already underway when I sunk that tanker along with your old man two years ago. Throwing your husband in the brig was a part of it too.

OCELOT

You were told that the eradication of Dead Cell six months ago was an act of the Patriots. We provoked and encouraged your hatred -- and you opted for vengeance, just as we planned.

FORTUNE

All orchestrated...?

OCELOT

Except for the appearance of the real Solid Snake. I wonder now, who sent for you...?

FORTUNE

All our misfortune was -- just a part of their project!
Fortune, her face hard, swings the linear rifle toward Ocelot, but he smoothly fires off his revolver before she can pull the trigger! An echoing gunshot! The faces of Raiden, Snake, and Solidus as they look on. Fortune looks down at her chest. There is a hole (on the left side) where the bullet has found its mark!

FORTUNE

H-how could -- !
Fortune is bewildered.

OCELOT

You're no Lady Luck. You have nothing that we didn't give you.

FORTUNE

What?
Fortune clutches her chest wound and falls to her knees.
AG Surfaces 10
Movie Cutscene 4
(flashback)
Flashback: game visuals (present clips from 3D cutscenes as a movie).
Scene introducing Fortune, where the SEALs' bullets don't hit her. The infiltration pool area, where Raiden's bullets veer away. Scene of her facing off against Snake.

OCELOT

Do you know why no bullet could hit you? It wasn't magic or some New Age mumbo-jumbo. Certainly wasn't your psychic talents. It was all staged by the Patriots.

FORTUNE

Staged?

OCELOT

You were being shielded by the electromagnetic weapons technology that the Patriots developed. Your Dead Cell comrades loved your father and husband -- we needed a pathetic wretch like you to keep them focused. You've been our puppet all along -- just like Olga.

FORTUNE

No!

OCELOT

You were hamming it up as the tragic heroine thanks to the script that the Patriots wrote for you.

OCELOT

Pure self-indulgence -- absorbed in your own "misfortune," you couldn't get enough of the drama.

FORTUNE

... I could have died whenever I wanted to...
AG Surfaces 11
3D Cutscene 6
((MC) - AG Head)
Fortune manages to get back up.

OCELOT

Hm? Thought I got her in the heart?
Ocelot is momentarily taken aback by her return.
Fortune fires her linear rifle at Ocelot!

FORTUNE

*yells feebly*
The bullet veers off right in front of Ocelot.

RAIDEN

It missed...

OCELOT

Now I remember. Your heart's on the right.
Fortune fires again. Another miss.

OCELOT

Waste of metal, my dear. Your luck's run out.
He smiles and points to the device on his waist.

OCELOT

This is the little gizmo. There's no such thing as miracles or the supernatural － only cutting-edge technology.

SOLIDUS

HRR!!
Solidus fires his P90 at Ocelot! The rounds are all deflected.

FORTUNE

You bastard...
Fortune coughs blood, and passes out.
Ocelot leaps into RAY's cockpit! Solidus continues to fire from his snake arms, but misses.
Ocelot talks while piloting the prototype RAY. Its beak remains open. Cut to a shot that shows RAY in its entirety.

OCELOT

Now that I have enough data, all I have to do is retrieve Arsenal...

OCELOT

... and clean up the refuse from the exercise.
RAY's machine gun turns toward the motley group.

SOLIDUS

Just try!
Solidus tosses away the P90 and draws his swords (Solidus uses two blades, called Democracy and Republic).
The steel collar snaps shut!
RAY starts to fire its machine gun. Solidus deflects the bullets with both swords.

SOLIDUS

*yells*
One of the deflected bullets strikes Snake's handcuffs (miraculously)!

SNAKE

!?
The cuffs look like they can be pulled apart. Snake wriggles his hands around.

SNAKE

Argh!
Ocelot retracts the machine gun, glaring at Solidus from atop the RAY.

OCELOT

How's this then!?
He opens RAY's missile pods.

SNAKE

Damn!
Suddenly, a figure rises up in front of RAY. Fortune is shielding Raiden and the others from RAY, both hands outstretched.

RAIDEN

Fortune!
Solidus opens his collar.

SOLIDUS

You idiot! Get the hell away from there!

OCELOT

I told you -- your luck's run out. Take your reward: it's all the payload RAY has. Die!!
Ocelot fires the missiles. Several dozen of them are launched from RAY's pods.

SNAKE

Everybody down!!!
Raiden and the others get down.
Once the missiles reach Fortune, they curve away from her and harmlessly detonate in mid-air.

OCELOT

What the -- ! Impossible!
Ocelot fires more missiles.
Fortune is silhouetted against the firestorm.

SNAKE

She is Lady Luck.

FORTUNE

My name is Helena Dolph Jackson. The daughter of a proud, noble soldier...
She coughs up more blood, then starts to fade.

FORTUNE

I can... see my family... again...
Ocelot has exhausted his missiles.
Fortune falls to the ground, her strength gone. She dies peacefully.
Ocelot is busy with RAY.

OCELOT

Damn!!

OCELOT

Try this instead!
Ocelot points RAY's machine gun back at them.
Solidus and Raiden have resigned themselves to imminent death. Ocelot's right hand is about to press the trigger.

SNAKE

No!
Ocelot's hand suddenly freezes.

OCELOT

Hm?
The hand is no longer his!

OCELOT

No, not now!!
Liquid has taken control of Ocelot.

LIQUID

Brothers!!

SNAKE

Liquid!
Snake inadvertently calls out his brother's name with a peculiar kind of joy.

LIQUID

I've been waiting for this.
Liquid rises to his feet inside the cockpit.

SOLIDUS

It can't be -- !
AG Surfaces 12
Movie Cutscene 5
(MGS1 visuals)
Visuals from MGS1 (present clips from 3D cutscenes as a movie).
The Ninja cutting off Ocelot's hand. Ocelot picking up his severed hand (3D cutscenes).

LIQUID

I've been inside this arm all along, waiting for the right time to awaken.

SOLIDUS

You were inside Ocelot?

LIQUID

Yes -- a sleeper in the arm of a Patriots' spy.

SNAKE

It was you two years ago!? (You were the one controlling Ocelot two years ago!?)

LIQUID

Exactly. I was controlling him (Ocelot). Snake, it was I that leaked information about Arsenal to your partner (Otacon) and got you out here.

SNAKE

What!?

LIQUID

You're the only one that can free me, after all... (Ocelot was actually the one who called on Snake and the others.)
AG Surfaces 13
3D Cutscene 7
((MC) - AG Head)

LIQUID

I'm off to bury the Patriots (with this RAY) for good.
Liquid's usual gesturing.

SOLIDUS

You know where they are? How?

LIQUID

Why do you think I chose Ocelot as my host?

LIQUID

But before I go, I have a family matter to settle with both of you. There's room for only one Snake, and one Big Boss!

SOLIDUS

Grraah!
Solidus fires his snake arm, but misses once again.

LIQUID

Time to say goodbye.
Liquid flips a switch inside RAY.
Snake struggles, trying to break the handcuffs.

SNAKE

Damn!

LIQUID

Like surfing? It's a good way to go.
Arsenal starts to shake! Raiden and the others realize it is on the move. Snake pulls the cuffs apart and breaks into a run.

SNAKE

Liquid! Stop this thing!

LIQUID

*tauntingly* Hey, Snake! You coming?

SNAKE

*masculine roar* Hrrr-eya!!!
RAY dives toward the water. Snake jumps after it and grabs onto it!
RAY crashes into the sea! (Snake followed it to attach a transmitter to it.)

RAIDEN

Snaaaake!!
The RAY remains submerged, somewhere under the foaming surface!
Arsenal starts to move, and the violent undulations leave Raiden and Solidus flat on the floor, unable to regain their footing. Arsenal continues to careen toward Manhattan. Solidus has driven his snake arms into the floor to hang on as Arsenal races north.
Arsenal Gear's Route:
Offshore plant (off the coast of New York City)
Verrazzano Bridge (Lower New York Bay)
Liberty Island (Statue of Liberty)
Ellis Island
Landfall on Manhattan
Battery Park (Castle Clinton)
National Museum of the American Indian (Battery Park)
Broadway (Wall Street)
New York Stock Exchange
Trinity Church
Federal Hall (Wall Street)
Arsenal Gear surfaces from beneath the offshore plant off the New York coast (south of Staten Island). Its AI out of control (the artificial personality cerebrum has been destroyed), Arsenal tears northward and into the Lower New York Harbor with Raiden and Solidus onboard, traveling under the Verrazzano Narrows Bridge to enter the inner harbor. As a sidenote, the Verrazzano Bridge is where Snake boarded the disguised tanker in the Tanker Chapter.
Arsenal dislodges the Statue of Liberty while skimming Liberty Island, dumping the statue on Ellis Island as it goes on its way. It continues north, landing at Battery Park (Castle Clinton) and destroying its 28 cannons. The cannons end their service without having fired a single shot in actual fighting. Arsenal then moves past the Museum of the American Indian and onto Broadway. It zips up to Wall Street, passing buildings lining the famous theatre district.
It turns right at the New York Stock Exchange (with Trinity Church on the left), scraping the building and tearing away the NYSE and the American flags. (It passes by Trinity Church (cemetery); it does not destroy the church.) The NYSE serves as a reminder of Solidus's failed plan to wreak havoc by detonating a nuclear bomb over Wall Street and obliterating its computers.
Arsenal decelerates and comes to a stop in front of Federal Hall. Federal Hall National Memorial commemorates the inauguration of George Washington as the first president of the United States.
The tip of Arsenal's shell knocks the bronze statue of Washington slightly askew.
Verrazzano Bridge--> Statue of Liberty (carries the entire statue away)--> Castle Clinton--> the Bull of Wall Street--> collides with Federal Hall!
Editor's Note: Substantial cuts were made to this scene. After Arsenal Gear reaches the inner harbor, the game transitions to the next scene atop Federal Hall.
AG Surfaces 14
3D Cutscene 8
(MC + KF)
Arsenal Gear tears past the NYSE and goes crashing into the front of Federal Hall.
The impact sends Raiden and Solidus flying off Arsenal and onto the roof of Federal Hall.
Cut to aerial shot to reveal the size of Arsenal for the first time (this is the first full view of Arsenal). Right in front of Arsenal's head are Federal Hall and the statue of Washington. Insert shots of New York landmarks and tourist attractions.
There are very few people about in the pre-dawn streets. The screams and sirens have yet to start. The pigeons (or seagulls) that roost in the Federal Hall are reeling. There is smoke everywhere from the collision impact.
Solidus rises to his feet on the Federal Hall roof and looks around.

SOLIDUS

Federal Hall...
Solidus starts to laugh.

SOLIDUS

Hahahaha!
Throwing up both hands, he breaks into a frenzied dance.
The sound of Solidus's voice snaps Raiden out of the daze he was in.

RAIDEN

What are you laughing at?
Solidus stops dancing.

SOLIDUS

Do you know what day it is today?

RAIDEN

... April 30th?
AG Surfaces 15
Movie Cutscene 6
(Stars and Stripes)
A close-up, slow motion shot of the Stars and Stripes over Federal Hall.

SOLIDUS

George Washington took office as the first president of the United States of America 200 years ago today.
The American flag raised over the building is flapping in the breeze.

SOLIDUS

And it happened right here.
George Washington's inauguration took place on the second-floor balcony of Federal Hall. The original building was destroyed in 1812; it was later rebuilt in 1842.

SOLIDUS

We were going to declare another independence -- the dawn of a new nation -- here.

SOLIDUS

The end of the Patriots' secret rule, liberation of this country -- this was where it was supposed to begin, this is where freedom could have been born.
AG Surfaces 16
3D Cutscene 9
((MC) - Federal Hall)
Solidus's expression hardens, and he turns an icy gaze on Raiden.

RAIDEN

All you want is power -- at any cost.
Solidus stops walking at Raiden's statement.

SOLIDUS

Jack, it's not power I want.

SOLIDUS

What I wanted to take back from the Patriots were things like --

SOLIDUS

freedom, civil rights, opportunities. The founding principles of this country.

SOLIDUS

Everything that's about to be wiped out by their digital censorship.
Solidus begins a rapturous speech right there on the roof of Federal Hall!

SOLIDUS

Listen to me.
He is talking not to Raiden but to himself.

SOLIDUS

We're all born with an expiration date.

SOLIDUS

No one lasts forever.

SOLIDUS

Life is nothing but a grace period --

SOLIDUS

for turning the best of our genetic material into the next generation.
AG Surfaces 17
Movie Cutscene 7
(Manhattan crowds)
Switch to footage of people in Manhattan. Shots of crows, people's legs as they walk by.

SOLIDUS

The data of life is transferred from parent to child.

SOLIDUS

That's how it works.

SOLIDUS

But we have no heirs, no legacy.

SOLIDUS

We brothers are called "Les enfants terribles" -- cloned from our father with the ability to reproduce conveniently engineered out.

SOLIDUS

What is our legacy if we cannot pass the torch?

SOLIDUS

Proof of our existence -- a mark of some sort --

SOLIDUS

When the torch is (genes are) passed on from parent to child...

SOLIDUS

It extends beyond DNA, information (wisdom and how to live) is imparted as well.
AG Surfaces 18
3D Cutscene 10
((NM + KF) - Federal Hall)

SOLIDUS

All I want is to be remembered. By other people, by history.

SOLIDUS

The Patriots are trying to protect their power, their own interests, by controlling the digital flow of information.

SOLIDUS

I want my memory, my existence to remain.

SOLIDUS

Unlike an intron of history.

SOLIDUS

I will be remembered as an exon.

SOLIDUS

That will be my legacy, my mark in history.

SOLIDUS

But the Patriots would deny us even that.

SOLIDUS

I will triumph over the Patriots and liberate us all.

SOLIDUS

And we will become the "Sons of Liberty"!
In Solidus's head, the Liberty Bell rings out. The peal bridges into the Codec call sound.
The Colonel is calling!
Call from the Colonel (different Colonel).
AG Surfaces 19
Codec Call 1
(mandatory incoming call from the Colonel)
The Colonel's voice is now clearly an electronically synthesized one, occasionally switching to Rose's voice. No visual of the Colonel; static instead, with occasional insertion of visuals like MGS1 Colonel's Codec portrait. When it uses the Rose voice, Rose's model appears. Occasionally a skull model appears.

COLONEL

Raiden, are you receiving? We're (The Patriots are) still here.

RAIDEN

How's that possible!? The AI was destroyed!

COLONEL

Only GW... (Implying there are other AIs. The one speaking now is JFK.)

RAIDEN

Who are you?

COLONEL

To begin with -- we're not what you'd call -- human.
AG Surfaces 21
Codec Call 2
(the Colonel continues)

COLONEL

Over the past two hundred years --

COLONEL

A kind of consciousness formed layer by layer in the crucible of the White House.

COLONEL

It's not unlike the way life started in the oceans four billion years ago.

COLONEL

The (corruption of the) White House was our primordial soup, a base of evolution --

COLONEL

We (The Patriots) are formless. We are the very discipline and morality that Americans invoke so often. How can anyone hope to eliminate us? As long as this nation exists, so will we.

RAIDEN

Cut the crap! If you're immortal, why would you take away individual freedoms and censor the Net?

COLONEL (ROSE)

*laughing* Jack, don't be silly.

COLONEL

Don't you know that our plans have your interests -- not ours -- in mind?

RAIDEN

What?

COLONEL (ROSE)

Jack, listen carefully like a good boy!

COLONEL

The mapping of the human genome was completed early this century. As a result, the evolutionary log of the human race lay open to us.

COLONEL (ROSE)

We started with genetic engineering, and in the end, we succeeded in digitizing life itself.

COLONEL

But there are things not covered by genetic information.

RAIDEN

What do you mean?

COLONEL

Human memories, ideas. Culture. History.

COLONEL (ROSE)

Genes don't contain any record of human history.

COLONEL

Is it something that should not be passed on? Should that information be left at the mercy of nature?

COLONEL (ROSE)

We've always kept records of our lives. Through words, pictures, symbols... from tablets to books...

COLONEL

But not all the information was inherited by later generations. A small percentage of the whole was selected and processed, then passed on. Not unlike genes, really.

COLONEL (ROSE)

That's what history is, Jack.

COLONEL

But in the current, digitized world, trivial information is accumulating every second, preserved in all its triteness.

COLONEL

Never fading, always accessible.

COLONEL (ROSE)

Rumors about petty issues, misinterpretations, slander...

COLONEL

All this junk data preserved in an unfiltered state, growing at an alarming rate.

COLONEL (ROSE)

It will only slow down social progress, reduce the rate of evolution.

COLONEL

Raiden, you seem to think that our plan is one of censorship.

RAIDEN

Are you telling me it's not!?

COLONEL (ROSE)

You're being silly! What we propose to do is not to control content, but to create context.

RAIDEN

Create context?

COLONEL

The digital society furthers human flaws and selectively rewards development of convenient half-truths.

COLONEL

Just look at the strange juxtapositions of morality around you.

COLONEL (ROSE)

Billions spent on new weapons in order to humanely murder other humans.

COLONEL

Rights of criminals are given more respect than the privacy of their victims.

COLONEL (ROSE)

Although there are people suffering in poverty, huge donations are made to protect endangered species.

COLONEL (ROSE)

Everyone grows up being told the same thing.

COLONEL

Be nice to other people.

COLONEL (ROSE)

But beat out the competition!

COLONEL

"You're special." "Believe in yourself and you will succeed."

COLONEL (ROSE)

But it's obvious from the start that only a few can succeed...

COLONEL

You exercise your right to "freedom" and this is the result.

COLONEL

All rhetoric to avoid conflict and protect each other from hurt. The untested truths spun by different interests continue to churn and accumulate in the sandbox of political correctness and value systems.

COLONEL (ROSE)

Everyone withdraws into their own small gated community, afraid of a larger forum. They stay inside their little ponds, leaking whatever "truth" suits them into the growing cesspool of society at large.

COLONEL

The different cardinal truths neither clash nor mesh. No one is invalidated, but nobody is right.

COLONEL (ROSE)

Not even natural selection can take place here. The world is being engulfed in "truth."

COLONEL

And this is the way the world ends. Not with a bang, but a whimper.

COLONEL (ROSE)

We're trying to stop that from happening.

COLONEL

It's our responsibility as rulers.

COLONEL

Just as in genetics, unnecessary information and memory must be filtered out to stimulate the evolution of the species.

RAIDEN

And you think you're qualified to decide what's necessary and not!?

COLONEL

Absolutely. Who else could wade through the sea of garbage you people produce, retrieve valuable truths and even interpret their meaning for later generations?

COLONEL (ROSE)

That's what it means to create context.

RAIDEN

I'll decide for myself what to believe and what to pass on!

COLONEL

But is that even your own idea?

COLONEL (ROSE)

Or something Snake told you?

RAIDEN

... (Bull's-eye.)

COLONEL

That's the proof of your incompetence, right there. You lack the qualifications to exercise free will.

RAIDEN

*courageously* That's not true! I have the right --

COLONEL (ROSE)

*interrupts* Does something like a "self" exist inside of you?

COLONEL

That which you call "self" serves as nothing more than a mask to cover your own being.

COLONEL (ROSE)

In this era of ready-made "truths," "self" is just something used to preserve those positive emotions that you occasionally feel...

COLONEL

... Another possibility is that "self" is a concept you conveniently borrowed under the logic that it would endow you with some sense of strength...

RAIDEN

That's crap!

COLONEL

Is it? Would you prefer that someone else tell you? Alright then. Explain it to him.

COLONEL (ROSE)

*obviously insincere* Jack, you're simply the best! And you got there all by yourself!

RAIDEN

Rrrr... (Don't make a fool out of me!)

COLONEL

Oh, what happened? Do you feel lost? Why not try a bit of soul-searching?

COLONEL (ROSE)

Don't think you'll find anything, though...

COLONEL

Ironic that although "self" is something that you yourself fashioned, every time something goes wrong, you turn around and place the blame on something else.

COLONEL (ROSE)

*mimicking Raiden* It's not my fault. It's not your fault.

COLONEL

In denial, you simply resort to looking for another, more convenient "truth" in order to make yourself feel better.

COLONEL (ROSE)

... leaving behind in an instant the so-called "truth" you once embraced.

COLONEL

Should someone like that be able to decide what is "truth"?

COLONEL (ROSE)

Should someone like you even have the right to decide?

COLONEL

You've done nothing but abuse your freedom.

COLONEL (ROSE)

You don't deserve to be free!

COLONEL

We're not the ones smothering the world. You are.

COLONEL (ROSE)

The individual is supposed to be weak. But far from powerless -- a single person has the potential to ruin the world.

COLONEL

And the age of digitized communication has given even more power to the individual. Too much power for an immature species.

COLONEL (ROSE)

Building a legacy involves figuring out what is wanted, and what needs to be done for that goal. All this, you used to struggle with. Now, we think for you.

COLONEL

We are your guardians after all.

RAIDEN

You want to control human thought? Human behavior?

COLONEL

Of course. Anything can be quantified nowadays. That's what this exercise was designed to prove.

COLONEL (ROSE)

You fell in love with me just as you were meant to, after all. Isn't that right, Jack?

COLONEL

Ocelot was not told the whole truth, to say the least.

COLONEL (ROSE)

We rule an entire nation-- of what interest would a single soldier, no matter how able, be to us?

COLONEL

The S3 Plan does not stand for Solid Snake Simulation.

COLONEL

What it does stand for is Selection for Societal Sanity...
AG Surfaces 22
Movie Cutscene 9
(in-game visuals)
Title screen, node screen, MGS1 title screen, VR screen...

COLONEL

The S3 is a system for controlling human will and consciousness. S3 is not you, a soldier trained in the image of Solid Snake. It is -- a method, a protocol, that created a circumstance that made you what you are.

COLONEL (ROSE)

So you see, we're the S3. Not you.
AG Surfaces 23
Codec Call 3
(the Colonel continues)

COLONEL

What you experienced was the final test of its effectiveness.

RAIDEN

That's crazy...

COLONEL

You heard what President Johnson said.

COLONEL (PRESIDENT)

The Arsenal's "GW" system is the key to their supremacy.

COLONEL

The objective of this exercise was to establish such a method.
AG Surfaces 24
Movie Cutscene 10
(game visuals)
Clips of 3D cutscenes from MGS1.

COLONEL

We used Shadow Moses as a paradigm for the exercise.

COLONEL (ROSE)

I wonder if you would have preferred a fantasy setting?

COLONEL

We chose that backdrop because of its extreme circumstances. It was an optimal test for S3's crisis management capacity. If the model could trigger, control and solve this, it would be ready for any contingency. And now, we have our proof.
AG Surfaces 25
Codec Call 4
(the Colonel continues)

COLONEL

Raiden, there are also reasons behind your selection. Solidus raised plenty of other child soldiers. Do you know why we chose you over them?

RAIDEN

?

COLONEL

It was because you were the only one who refused to acknowledge the past. All the others remember what they were, and pay for it daily.

COLONEL (ROSE)

But you turn your back on everything you don't like. You do whatever you like, see only the things you like, and for yourself alone.

COLONEL

Yes -- Rose can attest to that.

COLONEL (ROSE)

You refused to see me for what I was. I lied to you, but I wanted to be caught. You pretended to be understanding, to be a gentleman... You never made a conscious attempt to reach out to me... The only time you did was when I gave you no choice but to do so...

RAIDEN

I was just trying not to... (He reacts, even knowing this Rose is a fake, becase she hits the nail on the head.)

COLONEL (ROSE)

*interrupts* What? "Trying not to hurt me?" Dear, the one you were trying not to hurt was yourself! Avoiding the truth under the guise of "kindness" is all that you did!

COLONEL (ROSE)

It occurred to you to do nothing but look out for yourself. Even if you claim that it was for my sake, that feeling was nowhere to be seen. In the end, everything was for your sake... I was never part of the picture.

COLONEL

*sneers* Ha, ha, ha... exactly right.

COLONEL

So you see, you're a perfect representative of the masses we need to protect. This is why we chose you.

COLONEL

You accepted the fiction we've provided, obeyed our orders and did everything you were told to. The exercise is a resounding success.

COLONEL (EMMA)

Didn't I tell you that GW was still incomplete? But not anymore, thanks to you.

COLONEL

Your persona, experiences, triumphs and defeats are nothing but byproducts. The real objective was ensuring that we could generate and manipulate them. It's taken a lot of time and money, but it was well worth it considering the results.

RAIDEN

...

COLONEL

I think that's enough talk. It's time for the final exercise.

COLONEL

Raiden, take Solidus down.

RAIDEN

Think again! I'm through doing what I'm told!

COLONEL

Oh really? Aren't you forgetting something?

COLONEL (OLGA)

If you die, my child dies.

COLONEL

The termination of vital signals from your nanomachines means the death of Olga's child.

COLONEL

Not to mention the death of Rose. She's wired the same way.

RAIDEN

Rose -- does she actually exist?

COLONEL (ROSE)

*obviously insincere* Of course I do, Jack! You have to beLIEve me!

RAIDEN

Damn...

COLONEL

It will be a fight to the death.

COLONEL (ROSE)

Solidus, at least, wants you dead.

COLONEL

We will collect the necessary data from this last fight, then we'll consider the exercise closed.

COLONEL

So, Jack the Ripper!

COLONEL

Will it be Solidus, the Patriots' creation?

COLONEL

Or you -- Solidus' creation?

COLONEL

Our beloved monsters -- enjoy yourselves. (Same as the lines of the Secretary from MGS1.)
AG Surfaces 26
3D Cutscene 11
((MC) - Federal Hall)
Solidus and Raiden face each other. Solidus speaks to Raiden.

SOLIDUS

My son.
He continues, pointing to his patched eye.

SOLIDUS

My clone brothers and I are called monsters -- replicates of evil genes...

SOLIDUS

You are one-of-a-kind --

SOLIDUS

But still a monster, shaped by a dark and secret history.

SOLIDUS

We need to decide which monstrosity will have the privilege of survival.
Raiden has to stay alive for Olga's son too.

SOLIDUS

By the way, Jack,

SOLIDUS

I was the one who killed your parents.

RAIDEN

!!
Raiden is caught off-guard.
AG Surfaces 27
Movie Cutscene 11
(real footage + PICT)

SOLIDUS

I claimed you for my own, and raised you as a soldier in the army of the Devil.

SOLIDUS

I am your foster father, and your worst enemy.

RAIDEN

Why?

SOLIDUS

Because I needed to know whether we were really someone else's creation.

SOLIDUS

We're repeating history, Jack.

SOLIDUS

Liquid and Solid hunted down Big Boss, trying to sever the tie that bound them to him.

SOLIDUS

Unless you kill me and face your past, Jack, you will never escape. You'll stay in the endless loop -- your own double helix.
AG Surfaces 28
3D Cutscene 12
((MC) - Federal Hall)

SOLIDUS

It's time we were both free.
He tosses Raiden's confiscated Ninja blade back to him.
The sword buries its point in the ground, severing Raiden's handcuffs in the process. He is now free.

SOLIDUS

I have other reasons for wanting you dead.

SOLIDUS

The clues to the Patriots inside GW have been erased, but there are other traces. Inside YOU.

RAIDEN

What?

SOLIDUS

The information is being carried by the nanomachines in your cerebral cortex, and throughout the neural network they formed.
Both fighters ready their swords, Bushido-style. The pigeons take flight en masse!

SOLIDUS

Brace yourself!!
Solidus snaps his steel collar shut!
To game – Solidus battle.
Codec Conversations
•Colonel
After Vamp Sniping Event
Hurry to the Computer Room!
(1)

RAIDEN

Colonel, I've reached Shell 1.

COLONEL

Good. I see you managed to make it across the oil fence.

ROSE

Jack, hurry. Emma should already have reached the computer room.
(2)

COLONEL

The only way to stop Arsenal Gear is to have Emma introduce the virus you're carrying into the system.

COLONEL

There's not a second to lose. Get yourself to the computer room on the B2 level of Shell 1's core.

COLONEL

Emma is... not doing very well.

ROSE

Jack, hurry...
Strut E ladder

COLONEL

Raiden, the Oil Fence you crossed is at the bottom of that ladder.

COLONEL

You don't have the time to go back to the bottom of Strut E. Hurry to the Computer Room on B2 in the Shell 1 Core. Understood?
Strut E - Emma's blood

RAIDEN

Oh damn...

COLONEL

Yes. Emma's not doing so well.

RAIDEN

...

ROSE

Jack -- you did your best.

COLONEL

Raiden, Emma is waiting for you in the B2 level computer room of Shell 1's core. Get over there.

RAIDEN

... Got it.
•Snake
After Vamp Sniping Event
Get to the Computer Room

SNAKE

Raiden, we're in the computing room on B2 of Shell 1's core.

SNAKE

Emma's not doing so well... Get over here as soon as you can.
No enemies

SNAKE

Most of the enemy personnel's been moved inside Arsenal Gear, including the search and destroy teams.

SNAKE

Even if you're sighted, you won't have to worry about the backup being called. Just hurry over here.
Door that won't open

SNAKE

Arsenal's launch has initiated a security lockout. Otacon's managed to override anything that leads to the computing room.

SNAKE

This is no time to get sidetracked. Hurry!
Near Emma's blood

RAIDEN

Snake -- how bad are Emma's injuries...?

SNAKE

It's about what you'd expect.

RAIDEN

...

SNAKE

Just hurry.
Emma's condition

RAIDEN

How's Emma doing?

SNAKE

Not very good. I can't do a detailed examination here, but it looks like the damage to her muscle tissue is equal to the actual size of the wound.

RAIDEN

What're you trying to say?

SNAKE

That there's the possibility of intestinal damage. Added to that, she's bleeding bad... losing blood pressure...

SNAKE

She needs abdominal surgery! But this ain't the place to do it!

SNAKE

I've plugged the wound as best as I can... but it isn't gonna be enough. She's running out of time. We have to hurry!
GW's security

OTACON

I did a quick inspection...

OTACON

Arsenal Gear's security system is similar to the antibiotic function of a living creature's immune system.

OTACON

Surveillance of the inner system is handled by periodic scans using a number of agents with the capacity for detecting data that doesn't belong in the system.

OTACON

Once the agents detect any invading data, the information is passed on to an antibody production system.

OTACON

From there, a program referred to as an antibody agent is autonomously produced to neutralize or eliminate the invading data.

OTACON

Added to that, there's a solid barrier existing between GW's optic neural net -- its physical and logical base -- and the other general nets.

OTACON

Referred to as the Bit Brain Barrier, this wall is a filtering system for preventing the infiltration of foreign data.

OTACON

This security system makes it very difficult to attack the system from the outside. I'm afraid nothing can be done without sufficient preparation...
FOXDIE

OTACON

Raiden, I asked E.E. about the disc you have in your possession.

OTACON

Basically, it's a set of computer worm programs.

OTACON

Each worm is structured to mimic the data units that compose GW.

OTACON

As a result, GW's scan agents are unable to detect the program. In short, the program doesn't trigger GW's antibody production system.

OTACON

What's more, the program can penetrate the Bit Brain Barrier that surrounds GW.

OTACON

Once the worm program enters the neural net, it transforms the surrounding neurons.

OTACON

The transformed neurons become solid and can no longer function as neural nets.

OTACON

As time passes, the neurons transform and perish, stripping the overall system of its power to define and comprehend data.

OTACON

This in turn causes language disorder and memory loss, leading to the shutdown of functions as the system becomes unable to maintain itself.
•Colonel
The Torture Room
Before being released

COLONEL

Raiden, those restraints aren't something you can remove yourself. Have faith in Olga and wait for her to deactivate them.
After being released - get out of there

COLONEL

Get your equipment back first or you won't be able to do much good. Rendezvous with that man and retrieve your gear.
*If player is in torture room

COLONEL

Olga said that man would be waiting up ahead, if I recall. Get out of the room and head north.
*If player is not in torture room

COLONEL

Raiden, rendezvous with that man. Go through the northeastern door and head north.
Torture room - door that won't open

COLONEL

Raiden, that door is not going to open. Head north instead, rendezvous with that man and get your equipment back.
Evasion mode

COLONEL

Raiden, are they on pursuit? Fighting is not an option without your weapons. Find some kind of cover fast.

COLONEL

Another tactic is to trick the enemy.

ROSE

You could pretend you're still in restraints.
Near the node

COLONEL

Raiden, get yourself logged into the node. With no weapons, you're going to need to rely heavily on the radar to stay out of sight. Proceed with extreme caution, understood?
•Colonel
Prior to Meeting Up with Snake
It's cold inside Arsenal

COLONEL

Raiden, temperatures in that area appear to be real low.

RAIDEN

Yeah. Just like a refrigerator.

COLONEL

Maybe to keep GW frozen. High temperatures are forbidden for fiber-optic neuro AI processors.

ROSE

Don't catch a cold.
The Tengu soldiers

COLONEL

Raiden, be on the lookout. Those soldiers are outfitted with special gear.

RAIDEN

Roger. Armed with what?

COLONEL

Probably Arsenal Gear equipment called Tengu.

COLONEL

The suits use exoskeleton technology to augment human strength and improve mobility with artificial muscles.

COLONEL

Not the kind of opponent you want to take on without your weapon or other equipment. You'll just have to move about without being seen. Understood?
Arsenal Gear Jejunum - mass-production model RAYs

RAIDEN

Colonel, is this -- ?

COLONEL

Right, the famous mass-production Metal Gear. That entire section seems to house a maintenance line for Metal Gears.

ROSE

*worried* Jack...

RAIDEN

... I'm all right.
