COLONEL

Those mass-production Metal Gears are in adjustment phase. They're not a threat.

COLONEL

But it's entirely possible that there's an operational Metal Gear somewhere ahead. Stay focused.
Link up with Snake

COLONEL

Raiden, rendezvous with that man and get your gear back. There's a door on the northeast, second level. Get yourself over there.
The problems of being naked

COLONEL

Raiden, you won't be able to Hang, throw, or chokehold anyone in your current state.
*First time only

RAIDEN

Why not?

COLONEL

Is it really necessary to ask? It's just not a good idea to perform those maneuvers. There could be... complications.

ROSE

Oh really, Jack. Do we have to spell it out for you? Really!

RAIDEN

...?
You take more damage when naked too

COLONEL

Raiden, with nothing to protect your body, any attack you sustain will cause greater damage than usual. Avoid combat at all costs.
•Snake
After Meeting Up with Snake, Before Fortune Encounter
Practice with that sword

SNAKE

Teach yourself how to handle the blade. You're going to need it at some point.
The sword
(1)

SNAKE

Use the right analog stick to control the blade. Move the stick up and down to swish up or down, and left and right to slice the blade horizontally.
(2)

SNAKE

Rotate the right analog stick to twirl the blade.
(3)

SNAKE

Push the right analog stick forward to get a stabbing strike. It has more reach and power than normal strikes, but you're also more open to counterattacks. Weigh the pros and cons well.
(4)

SNAKE

Push the Lock-on Button with the blade selected to block. With the Lock-on Button pressed, you'll be able to deflect enemy gunfire.

SNAKE

Be careful, though -- blocking works only for frontal attacks.

SNAKE

Every time you push the Weapon Button, you can turn the blade from the blade side to the back.

SNAKE

Using a back strike allows you to knock out the enemy without killing them.
Get over here once you're done practicing

SNAKE

Are you comfortable with the blade? The enemy's straight ahead. As soon as you're ready, we're off!
NPC Snake
*Taken damage (1)

SNAKE

Agh!
*Taken damage (2)

SNAKE

Urrgh!
*Taken damage (3)

SNAKE

Urrgh!
*Encouraging Raiden (1)

SNAKE

Raiden, are you all right!?
*Encouraging Raiden (2)

SNAKE

Nice work! We'll just stay on this course.
*Encouraging Raiden (3)

SNAKE

Use your blade. Don't let all that practice go to waste!
*Encouraging Raiden (4)

SNAKE

Watch your back, Raiden. You never know where they're going to pop up.
*Urging Raiden (1)

SNAKE

Raiden, come on!
*Urging Raiden (2)

SNAKE

Raiden, hurry up!
*Urging Raiden (3)

SNAKE

Don't fall behind!
*Urging Raiden (4)

SNAKE

What's the matter? Is that the best VR kids can do?
*Snake's Life low (1)

SNAKE

*bearing with it with pride* ... What? If you've got that kind of time to spare, worry about yourself instead.
*Snake's Life low (2)

SNAKE

*bearing with it with pride* ... I'm all right. You watch your back too.
*Snake's Life low (3)

SNAKE

*bearing with it with pride* Don't worry about me. It's just a scratch...
Giving the player a hint when things are quiet
*Arsenal Gear Ileum (1)

SNAKE

There's a door at the north end of this corridor. The enemy's on the other side. We'll rush it!
*Arsenal Gear Ileum (2)

SNAKE

They must be on the other side of the door at the north end of this corridor. Security will be tight, but we'll just have to break through it. Let's go!
Fighting alongside Snake
*Snake's lines when fighting with Raiden (the player) in Arsenal Gear
(1) Raiden is falling behind

SNAKE

What are you doing?

SNAKE

Hurry up!

SNAKE

You wanna be left behind?
(2) Snake charges ahead

SNAKE

We're going in!

SNAKE

Follow me!

SNAKE

Don't fall behind!
(3) Raiden is surrounded by the enemy

SNAKE

I'll cover you!

SNAKE

I'm on my way!

SNAKE

Go on ahead of me!
(4) Snake is doing a jump-out shot

SNAKE

Now! Go!

SNAKE

Get in there!
(5) Raiden's Life is low

SNAKE

You alright?

SNAKE

Don't push yourself.
(6) Snake throws Raiden an item

SNAKE

Use this!

SNAKE

Raiden, catch!

SNAKE

Raiden, take the item!
Head north - before Tengu waves

SNAKE

There's a ladder on the north side. According to Olga, the enemy is beyond that point. Let's move out.
Wipe 'em out - Tengu waves

SNAKE

Raiden, the only way through is to take them all out. We're going to have to do it.
•Otacon
After Meeting Up with Snake, Before Fortune Encounter
The Tengu soldiers

OTACON

Raiden, watch your back. Those men have special-issue equipment.

RAIDEN

These are the so-called Tengu commandos I've heard so much about?

OTACON

They have blades that bullets just glance off of. Fight it with your own blade. You've had time to practice, right?

OTACON

Even if they can bounce bullets back with their swords, they won't be able to deflect anything too low. Use the First Person View and fire at their feet.
The mass-production model RAYs

OTACON

Metal Gear RAY was originally designed by the Marines as a countermeasure against other Metal Gear variations.

OTACON

But the mass-produced model is only based on the Marines' design. It's been redesigned to guard Arsenal Gear.

OTACON

Now it protects another Metal Gear... I heard all this from Emma.

OTACON

It seems that the mass-production model Metal Gear RAYs have Cooperative Engagement Capability, with GW as the primary control system.

OTACON

Several RAYs can connect with Arsenal Gear and mutually exchange data.

OTACON

Within this unified domain, all RAYs can cooperatively manage threats through notification, pursuit, and interception -- all in a lifelike manner.

OTACON

All for one and one for all. There's no weak spot.

OTACON

When protected by a pack of RAYs, Arsenal Gear can move without cruisers or destroyers as escorts.
The Tengus' P90s

OTACON

Tengu soldiers carry the P90 Personal Defense Weapon. It lies somewhere in between a rifle and a pistol.

OTACON

The designers of the P90 and its ammunition focused on the convenience of a pistol and the penetrating power of a rifle.

OTACON

It fires the new 5.7 x 28mm cartridge.

OTACON

The lightweight rounds feature a projectile weight of 2.02g and a muzzle velocity of 715mps, and low recoil.

OTACON

Its piercing power is also quite high. It can penetrate an ordinary bulletproof vest at a distance of 100 meters.

OTACON

The body is made entirely of plastic, and perfectly symmetrical, so even left-handed shooters can easily use it.

OTACON

It carries a fifty-round magazine. The magazine is mounted on top, so it doesn't get in the way when firing from a prone position.

OTACON

But the biggest threats are its rapid firing rate and its accuracy. It's probably best to avoid a full-frontal assault.
*If player has the Blade

OTACON

If you use the blade to defend yourself, you should be able to deflect even the attacks of the P90.
The Tengus' combat suits

OTACON

Tengu soldiers wear a special kind of combat suit that was developed by DARPA. It seems to utilize some kind of exoskeletal technology.

OTACON

The suit encases the soldier in a layer of armor, and is outfitted with actuators which utilize artificial muscle tissue to amplify the soldier's strength and increase his chances of survival.

OTACON

Using the Human Strength Amplification provided by the artificial muscle, a soldier can move faster, travel farther, and carry heavier weapons than normal.

OTACON

In other words, he has superior scouting and combat abilities, and can basically dominate the battlefield.

OTACON

Any soldiers you face who are wearing this special kind of suit will be able to move with superhuman agility. Make sure you're prepared.
Tengu waves - basics

OTACON

The enemy is as desperate to stop you as you are to get past them. Taking them all out is the only way through. Do it!
Tengu waves - striking with the back of the blade

OTACON

If you don't want to kill, use the sword to hilt-strike someone and knock them unconscious.
Before Otacon establishes the truth about the Colonel

RAIDEN

Have you found out anything about the Colonel yet? His behavior is getting stranger and stranger...

OTACON

Nope, nothing yet. Just give me a little more time.
•Otacon
Metal Gear RAY Battle
Use the Stinger

OTACON

Raiden, aim for RAY's head section with the Stinger missiles.
Use chaff

OTACON

The mass-production Metal Gear is unmanned. It's probably under the control of GW, the Arsenal Gear AI.
*Second and subsequent times

OTACON

A chaff attack should cause electronic interference and confuse RAY for a moment. Use the opportunity to fire a Stinger into it.
Use your blade

OTACON

Use the sword to deflect RAY's machine gun fire.
Putting quick change to use

OTACON

You can't move while you're aiming with the Stinger.

OTACON

But hitting the Weapon Equip Button will let you do a quick change of weapons.

OTACON

If you see RAY getting ready to attack, use the quick change to deselect the Stinger and get the hell out of there.
Stomping attack

OTACON

Approach RAY with extreme caution. There's no way you'll survive being stepped on.

OTACON

Even if you manage to get out of the way, you'd probably get knocked off your feet by the impact. You'd be wide open to an attack.

OTACON

However, if you drop and roll at just the right time, you should be able to get away without losing your footing.
The RAYs just keep on coming
*If player calls after defeating three or more RAYs

RAIDEN

Damn it! Take one down, another takes its place... How many are there?
*Second and subsequent times

OTACON

Raiden, don't give up! There's a lot of them, sure, but as long as you keep fighting, you have a chance! Fight!
Missiles are ineffective up close

OTACON

RAY's missile targeting system doesn't seem to be very effective against targets within close range.

OTACON

You could try going in really close.
Cartwheels

OTACON

For a last-ditch evasion from an attacking RAY, try dropping and rolling.

OTACON

A well-timed roll could come in handy.
RAY can't perform tight turns

OTACON

Mass-production RAY models were designed to flank Arsenal Gear.

OTACON

Their system probably isn't equipped to take on human opponents, and the scale of their movements should be larger and clumsier than yours.

OTACON

Keep moving and you'll have your chance. Don't give up!
Metal Gear missiles

OTACON

Raiden, watch out for RAY's guided missiles.

OTACON

They have HEAT warheads -- designed for anti-tank or anti-warship purposes, so it's probably not intended for anti-personnel use, but you still won't survive a direct assault.

OTACON

It's probably also equipped with an image-guided tracking head. The guidance system is quite advanced.

OTACON

But it's not designed as an anti-personnel weapon, so you should be able to jam it with some chaff.

OTACON

You should also be able to evade it if you keep moving. Dodge by rolling.
RAY's movements

OTACON

The engine system of Metal Gear RAY appears to be outfitted with artificial muscle tissue.

OTACON

The artificial muscle consists of actuators that resemble human muscle tissue. It's made of a macromolecular fiber that conducts electricity.

OTACON

This system is different from ordinary engines based on mechanical activators and oil pressure. It's capable of many different kinds of movement using a single kind of engine.

OTACON

In other words, it's capable of performing a complex series of motions smoothly and effortlessly.

OTACON

RAY's movements are both quick and precise. Be careful!
RAY's armor

OTACON

RAY's armor is made of a state-of-the-art ceramic-titanium alloy.

OTACON

A network of simple sensor arrays stretches around the body, including conductive nanotubes that connect the surface and the interior of the armor.

OTACON

When the condition of the armor changes, self-diagnostic systems located throughout the armor detect and respond to this change, like a network of autonomic reflex nerves.

OTACON

This acts as a damage control response system, performing functions such as shutting down a damaged section or rerouting signals through auxiliary circuits.

OTACON

At the same time, any holes and tears in the armor are repaired to some degree by a kind of "nanopaste" that's secreted automatically from valves near the damaged area.

OTACON

This nanopaste almost makes RAY seem like it's bleeding.

OTACON

You probably won't be able to pierce RAY's armor with the weapons you're carrying. You'll have to aim for the head, where the armor is relatively thin.

OTACON

Aim for the head using Stinger missiles.
RAY battle - its mouth is its weak point

OTACON

RAY shoots a jet of super-pressurized water from its mouth. Fundamentally, it's a hydro-cutter, but the power is on a completely different scale.

OTACON

The moment RAY opens its mouth is your chance to attack.

OTACON

Shooting a Stinger into RAY's mouth should inflict some real damage.
•Colonel
Solidus Battle
Solidus battle - lectured by the Patriots

COLONEL

Raiden, you have to beat Solidus! This is your last duty!

RAIDEN

We're not just pawns in some simulation game, you know!

ROSE

Yes, you are. You're nothing but mere weapons. No different from fighter jets or tanks.

RAIDEN

What the -- ?

COLONEL

The old model destroyed four years ago was "REX"...

ROSE

The new amphibious model is "RAY"...

COLONEL

Both of these are the same as the code names used by the U.S. Armed Forces to refer to Japanese war planes during World War 2.

ROSE

Your code name "Raiden" too, comes from the Japanese navy's name for one of its interceptors...

RAIDEN

Stop it! I'm not a weapon!!

ROSE

Oh really? Do you know the code name the U.S. Armed Forces used for the Japanese fighter "Raiden"?

COLONEL

It was "Jack."

COLONEL

Both of you are just weapons to be used and thrown away.

ROSE

Just weapons to be used on the battlefield. Just pawns in a game -- exactly as you said.

COLONEL

And a weapon has no right to think for itself! Now, it's time to fulfill your purpose! Defeat Solidus!
Solidus battle - take him down

COLONEL

Raiden, take Solidus down! Think about Olga's child and your Rosemary! You must win!
•Otacon
Solidus Battle
Solidus battle - use your blade

OTACON

Raiden, you don't have a lot going for you with just your bare hands. You have your own blade. Use it.
Snake arms

OTACON

Watch out for Solidus' snake arms. If they catch you, shake yourself free by pressing the left analog stick or the buttons again and again.
Snake arm missiles

OTACON

The missiles from the snake arms pack a punch, but they're fairly low on maneuverability. You should be able to shake them as long as you don't stop moving.

OTACON

If you can't get rid of them, slice them with the sword.
Don't attack head-on

OTACON

Don't attack from the front -- his defenses are too good.

OTACON

Go around to the side or back and get him.
Don't stay too close to him

OTACON

Don't stay in Solidus' range. It's too dangerous to try and take him head-on.

OTACON

Keep your distance. Your strategy should be to hit fast and move out.
Lunge attacks are particularly effective

OTACON

Push the right analog stick in to strike out at Solidus from outside his range.

OTACON

Make sure your aim is good, though. If you miss, you'll be wide open for Solidus' counterstrike.
Solidus's accelerator

OTACON

Solidus uses an accelerator, so make sure you don't lose him.

OTACON

If you catch fire, just go into a roll until the fire goes out.
He's blind in his left eye, so use that to your advantage

OTACON

Solidus has an eye patch on his left eye, so he should have a blind spot to his left.

OTACON

Maybe slipping into that spot will give you an advantage.
Solidus's powered suit

OTACON

The power suit that Solidus is wearing is a state-of-the-art exoskeleton that makes use of artificial muscle tissue. It gives the person wearing it superhuman motor skill capabilities.

OTACON

It's the same technology used in RAY's engine system and the Tengu soldiers' combat suits. Your skull suit uses a little bit of it, too.

OTACON

A number of sensors stretch between the surface and interior of the suit like a neural network.

OTACON

When these sensors detect an impact, the artificial muscle in the suit reacts instantaneously by automatically contracting and diffusing the damage.

OTACON

So you can't just chop him in half with your sword. Your suit uses the same technology.

OTACON

You could almost say that your suit, Solidus' suit, and Metal Gear RAY are like brothers...
Solidus battle - Solidus's defenses

OTACON

Solidus' defenses are solid. You should aim for the unprotected parts.

OTACON

If he's defending high, slash upward and cut him from below.

OTACON

When he's defending low, slash downward and cut him from above.
Section 8
Ending
Ending 1
3D Cutscene 1
((MC) - Federal Hall)
Raiden continues to duel with Solidus. He finally succeeds in inflicting a fatal blow upon the muscle suit's Achilles heel, the spinal column.
Solidus' spine is severed!
He stumbles to the edge of Federal Hall's roof.

SOLIDUS

...
Covered with blood, Solidus falls off the roof. He dies clinging to the statue of George Washington. The irony here being Solidus's unfulfilled ambition to be the architect of a new declaration of independence after he was forced out of the same office held by Washington.
Ending 2
3D Cutscene 2
((MC) - In Front of Federal Hall)
Wall Street, in front of Federal Hall, after the battle with Solidus atop the blazing wreck of Arsenal Gear. The ruins of the fortress and its debris are still smoldering.
Helicopters clatter overhead, and fleets of emergency vehicles and rubberneckers descend on the scene. The arrival of the media adds to the cacophony. At the center of all this is the body of a former president (Solidus), lying against the Stars and Stripes. Beside him is the bronze statue of Washington, standing askew. Raiden looks on, spent.
He believes that by killing Solidus, he has severed the link with his past. However, he feels no sense of resolution.

RAIDEN

Who am I really...? (The lingering memory of Solidus' confession.)
Snake cuts in. He has appeared at Raiden's side unnoticed, rescued earlier by Otacon.

SNAKE

No one quite knows who or what they are.
He lays a friendly hand on Raiden's shoulder.

SNAKE

The memories you have and the role you were assigned are burdens you had to carry.

SNAKE

It doesn't matter if they were real or not. That's never the point.
Ending 3
Movie Cutscene 1
(Manhattan crowds)
Slow-motion footage. Everyday scenes of various Manhattan landmarks, excluding Federal Hall. Daytime live-action shots would work.

SNAKE

There's no such thing in the world as absolute reality.

SNAKE

Most of what they call real is actually fiction.

SNAKE

What you think you see is only as real as your brain tells you it is.

RAIDEN

Then, what am I supposed to believe in? What am I going to leave behind when I'm through?

SNAKE

We can tell other people about -- having faith. What we had faith in.

SNAKE

What we found important enough to fight for.

SNAKE

It's not whether you were right or wrong, but how much faith you were willing to have, that decides the future.

SNAKE

The Patriots are a kind of ongoing fiction too, come to think of it...

RAIDEN

...

SNAKE

Listen, don't obsess over words so much. Find the meaning behind the words, then decide.

SNAKE

You can find your own name.

SNAKE

And your own future...

RAIDEN

Decide for myself...?

SNAKE

And whatever you choose will be you.

RAIDEN

I don't know if I can...

SNAKE

I know you didn't have much in terms of choices this time.

SNAKE

But everything you felt, thought about during this mission is yours. And what you decide to do with them is your choice...

RAIDEN

You mean start over?

SNAKE

Yeah, a clean slate. A new name, new memories.

RAIDEN

...

SNAKE

Choose your own legacy. It's for you to decide.

SNAKE

It's up to you.
Ending 4
3D Cutscene 3
((MC + KF) - In Front of Federal Hall)
Snake notices the dog tags hanging from Raiden's neck.

SNAKE

By the way, what is that?
Raiden takes the dog tags off.

RAIDEN

Dog tags?
Raiden stares at the tags. They are stamped with the name, age, gender, and blood type that the player entered at the beginning of the game. Raiden looks to Snake for affirmation, but the latter, a smile on his face, shakes his head. Raiden stares at the tags once again.

SNAKE

Anyone you know?
Raiden closes his hand around the tags.

RAIDEN

No, never heard the name before.

RAIDEN

I'll pick my own name...

RAIDEN

... and my own life. I'll find something worth passing on.
He tosses the dog tags far away over the crowd.
Snake smiles and nods. Raiden nods back, looking slightly abashed.
Snake looks at Solidus' body.

RAIDEN

They taught me some good things too.

SNAKE

I know. We've inherited freedom from all those who've fought for it.

SNAKE

We all have the freedom to spread the word. Even me.
Raiden suddenly remembers something.

RAIDEN

Snake, what about Olga's child?

SNAKE

Don't worry. I'll find him. Count on it.

SNAKE

As long as you keep yourself alive, he's safe.

RAIDEN

Do you know where Liquid went?

SNAKE

I put a transmitter on his RAY.

RAIDEN

Did he head for the Patriots?

SNAKE

Yeah. But I have a feeling they gave Ocelot a bogus location to begin with.

RAIDEN

...

SNAKE

Cheer up. We have a better lead.

SNAKE

This contains the list of all the Patriots.
Snake takes out an optical disc.

RAIDEN

But Ocelot took it!
Raiden reaches for the disc.

SNAKE

The one we gave you wasn't the real thing.
Snake takes back the disc, messing with Raiden.

RAIDEN

What?
Raiden sulks somewhat.

SNAKE

This virus is coded to destroy only a specific part of GW -- namely the information about the Patriots' identity.
Close-up of the disc.

SNAKE

Which means that there's a parameter coded in here that defines what that information is.

RAIDEN

I get it -- analyze the code and you can probably find out where they operate.

RAIDEN

Count me in --

SNAKE

No, you have things to do first.

SNAKE

And people you need to talk to...

RAIDEN

?
Rose stands alone, her back to the crowd.
She spots Raiden, and gives a big wave with her right hand.

RAIDEN

?
Raiden notices her. They face each other in the middle of the street.
Rose's hair is now blond.
Editor's Note: In the game, Rose's hair is still black.
Passersby look at Raiden, but they seem to walk past Rose without taking note of her.
Raiden, suddenly remembering Snake is there too, looks around for him.

RAIDEN

Snake?
Snake is already gone. Otacon is nowhere in sight either, but Emma's parrot can be seen taking off (Snake and Otacon left in a car Otacon was driving).

ROSE

What’s wrong?

RAIDEN

Nothing...

RAIDEN

Can I ask you something? Who am I really?
Raiden is serious. Rose smiles.

ROSE

I wouldn't know.

RAIDEN

...
Raiden is perturbed.

ROSE

But we're going to find out together, aren't we?

RAIDEN

Yeah...
He cups Rose's face between his palms as if to reassure himself of her existence.

ROSE

See me for what I am, ok?

RAIDEN

I know.
Rose caresses her stomach and lowers her gaze for a bit.
Ending 5
Movie Cutscene 2
(crowds)
Real-life footage: scenes, and groups of people.
Everyday footage of Federal Hall. The building is undamaged. People walk by.

ROSE

Do you remember this place?

RAIDEN

This is where we first met...

RAIDEN

I remember now —

ROSE

Hm?

RAIDEN

Today is the day I met you.

ROSE

That's it.

RAIDEN

I think I found something to pass along to the future.

ROSE

What?

RAIDEN

He said all living things want their genes to live on.

ROSE

Are you talking about the baby?
Similar to what Snake says in MGS1.

RAIDEN

But genes aren't the only thing you pass on.

RAIDEN

There are too many things that aren't written into our DNA.

RAIDEN

It's up to us to teach that to our children.

ROSE

What kind of things?

RAIDEN

About the environment, our ideas, our culture... poetry... compassion... sorrow... joy...

RAIDEN

We'll tell them everything... together.

ROSE

Is that a -- proposal?

RAIDEN

This is for your ears -- only...
Fade to black!
Ending 7
Staff Credits 1
"Can't Say Goodbye to Yesterday" (vocals: Carla White) begins.
Staff credits scroll from the bottom.
Music ends, credits end.
Ending 9
Movie Cutscene 4
(crowds)
Real-life footage of New Yorkers. Shots of the cityscape and its crowded streets.
Snake's lines in voiceover (like Naomi's in MGS1):

SNAKE

Life isn't just about passing on your genes. We can leave behind much more than just DNA. Through speech, music, literature and movies... what we've seen, heard, felt... anger, joy, and sorrow... these are the things I will pass on. That's what I live for.

SNAKE

We need to pass the torch, and let our children read our messy and sad history by its light.

SNAKE

We have all the magic of the digital age to do that with.

SNAKE

The human race will probably come to an end some time, and new species may rule over this planet. Earth may not be forever, but we still have the responsibility to leave what traces of life we can. Building the future and keeping the past alive are one and the same thing.
Ending 10
Voice Cutscene 1
Static MGS2 title image.
"METAL GEAR SOLID 2: SONS OF LIBERTY."
Post-credits scene. Intentionally reminiscent of the post-credits Codec call in MGS1.
A mandatory Codec call begins.
The conversation plays over a black background.

OTACON

Snake, you there? It's me.

OTACON

I've finished going over that disc.

SNAKE

Did you find the Patriots' list?

OTACON

Of course.

OTACON

It contains the personal data of twelve people.

OTACON

There was a name on it -- Snake, it was one of our biggest contributors.

SNAKE

What's going on around here?

OTACON

I don't know...

SNAKE

... Anyway, where are they?

OTACON

Well, we were right about them being on Manhattan, but...

SNAKE

But what?

OTACON

They're already dead. All twelve of them.

SNAKE

When did it happen?

OTACON

Well, ah... about a hundred years ago.

SNAKE

What the hell...?
Codec Conversations (Plant)
•Colonel
Controls and Conditions Explanations
Bleeding

COLONEL

You're currently using artificial blood primed with nanomachines.

RAIDEN

What did you do with my own blood?

COLONEL

It's being kept in cold storage. It will be circulated back into your body when you return.
*An in-game visual of Raiden bleeding appears in the Codec window. Blood can be seen at his feet.

COLONEL

If the Life Gauge drops to the red zone, you won't be able to stop the bleeding by yourself. Bloodstains can give your presence away to the enemy; be careful.

COLONEL

To stop the flow, select the Bandage from among your items...

COLONEL

You can also go into a crouch or crawl and stay completely still for a while.

COLONEL

All you have to do is stop moving for a duration of time and your nanomachines will arrange for platelets to be produced in large numbers. The bleeding will stop as a result.
Combat - empty-handed

COLONEL

You haven't acquired any weapons yet. If it comes down to combat situations, you will have to rely on your bare hands.
Combat - punch

COLONEL

The punch is the basis of hand-to-hand combat. Push the Punch Button.

COLONEL

Hit it repeatedly to do a combo and take out the enemy.

COLONEL

Unlike in VR training, you can fight in First Person View also. Use that to your advantage.
Combat - throw

COLONEL

Move in close to the enemy when you have no weapons selected. You can throw him with the Weapon Button.

COLONEL

The throw inflicts greater damage than the punch. Keep that in mind.
Combat - chokehold

COLONEL

Move in behind the enemy and push the Weapon Button without touching the left analog stick. You can put him in a chokehold.

COLONEL

If you keep applying the choke, you can take him out altogether. The level of lethality is strictly your choice.
Deep Sea Dock - escape into the water

COLONEL

Raiden, are you being pursued? They won't mount an aquatic search. Jump into the water.
Strafe left and right in First Person View

COLONEL

Raiden, push the Weapon Equip or Equipment Window Button while in First Person View to strafe right and left, respectively.

COLONEL

You can use the strafe to quickly slide out of cover and scan the area.

COLONEL

Of course, you'll be spotted more easily when you're visible.

COLONEL

If you spot a terrorist coming your way, let go of the button and duck back into cover.
Codec controls

COLONEL

Once you see the Codec screen, set the frequency by moving the left analog stick left and right.

COLONEL

Push the left analog stick up or hit the Enter Button to start a call on that frequency.

COLONEL

The Codec is also capable of retaining the frequencies that you contacted in its memory.

COLONEL

Lean the left analog stick down in the Codec screen to activate the Memory Window.

COLONEL

The Memory Window displays a list of frequencies used to date.

COLONEL

Select a frequency and push the Enter Button to start a call on that frequency.
Corner View

COLONEL

Raiden, when you're flattened against a corner, you have the ability to survey the scene behind you while staying concealed.

COLONEL

This is called the Corner View. Use it to find an opening in their surveillance and move ahead undiscovered.

COLONEL

Strafing is allowed unlike in VR training.

COLONEL

Peek by using the Equipment Window and Weapon Equip Buttons, and make Jump-out shots with the Weapon Button. Take advantage of the different options.
Knocking on a wall

COLONEL

Flatten yourself against the wall and push the Punch Button to knock and create a diversion.
*First time only

COLONEL

You can trick the enemy into coming over to investigate.

COLONEL

Deception should be one of your strong points.

COLONEL

Or is that only if the other party is a beautiful woman?
Item boxes

COLONEL

If you find an Item Box, walk up to it and take a look in First Person View.

COLONEL

You should be able to see what's inside the box.
Obtaining item boxes

COLONEL

An Item Box can sometimes fall out while moving an enemy's body. Pick it up quickly.
Using enemies as human shields

COLONEL

Once you put a chokehold on an enemy from behind, you can drag him around with you.

COLONEL

As long as you don't let go, he can serve as a human shield.
Don't get spotted

COLONEL

Keep in mind, Raiden, that this is a covert mission.

COLONEL

There's a lot of them and only one of you. You'll be surrounded in no time if they discover your presence.
First Person Attacks

COLONEL

Select a weapon and switch to First Person View with the First Person View Button. You can now execute a First Person View attack with the Weapon Button.

COLONEL

In First Person View, you'll specifically be able to target the head, feet, and other strategic areas. You can also aim your strike in directions not available from the regular point of view: overhead, straight, down and so on.
First Person Attacks – strafing left and right

COLONEL

You can strafe left and right even during a First Person View attack by pushing the Equipment Window or Weapon Equip Buttons. Also, the Crawl Button will let you go into a crouch.

COLONEL

Push the Equipment Window and Weapon Equip Buttons at the same time to stretch up on your toes.

COLONEL

This is a useful move when engaging the enemy from behind cover. Explore it.
Lowering your weapon

COLONEL

Handguns are aimed by pushing down the Weapon Button, but if you release the button gently, you can lower the gun without firing.
*If Rose is present

ROSE

I guess that means you can hold up someone without shooting them.
Tranquilizer round body part damage

COLONEL

Raiden, the tranquilizer rounds vary significantly in effectiveness depending on the part of the body they hit.

COLONEL

Hits to the extremities such as hands and feet take a long time to show effect.

COLONEL

On the other hand, a direct hit to the head or the heart will instantly knock out the target. Use the First Person View to aim carefully.
Body part damage

COLONEL

Handguns and automatic rifles inflict varying degrees and types of damage depending on where a shot lands.

COLONEL

A shot to the right hand will disable that hand, and a target will no longer be able to run following a foot shot. Shoot a vital spot like the head or the heart to take someone down with a single shot.

COLONEL

Direct your shots as the circumstance requires. Use the First Person View to aim.
Destroying radios

COLONEL

If you shoot out the radio behind the enemy's right hip, you can prevent him from calling in reinforcements. Use the First Person View for precise shooting.
Rolling

COLONEL

Push the Crawl Button while running to go into a roll.

COLONEL

You can use it to jump over a short distance, or knock out enemy personnel in your path. Use it to maximum advantage.
Walking quietly

COLONEL

Lean the left analog stick only very slightly to slow your walk.

COLONEL

You should be able to move quietly over surfaces that would otherwise clatter underfoot.
Peeking

COLONEL

Push the Equipment Window or Weapon Equip Button while in Corner View. You will be able to peek out from behind cover and scan that direction.

COLONEL

This will give you a better view of what lies ahead, but make sure that the enemy doesn't catch you exposed.
Corner View, right stick movement

COLONEL

Move the right analog stick while in Corner View to study that direction.

COLONEL

You should be able to gather more information this way than from the regular Corner View.

COLONEL

Unlike peeking out with the Equipment Window and Weapon Equip Button, this method doesn't involve leaning out. Safety is an important consideration, so be sure to use the technique.
Jump-out shots

COLONEL

If you have a handgun or an automatic rifle selected while in Corner View, you have the option to make a Jump-out shot with the Weapon button.

COLONEL

You can take cover behind an object, wait for an opportunity then strike rapidly.
Throwing from cover

COLONEL

If you have the grenade selected during a peek, you can throw it over by pushing the Weapon Button with your back still against a shielding object.

COLONEL

This should come in useful in situations, such as discovering multiple opponents around the corner. Work with it.
Shadows can get you spotted

COLONEL

Keep an eye on how long a shadow you're casting. Depending on the lighting situation, the enemy could discover your presence because of that one small detail.
Don't damage breakable objects

COLONEL

Raiden, covertness is the keystone of sneaking missions. It's unwise to leave any trace of your presence, so I suggest you leave those things intact.
Search mode

COLONEL

Once you're spotted, Raiden, you cannot afford to relax even after throwing off the pursuit.

COLONEL

The enemy will ramp up its security precautions to hunt out the intruder -- you. Patrols may be increased as well. Exercise extreme caution.
You can hide in the dark

COLONEL

Even the enemies will have a harder time spotting you in the dark. The chance of being unnoticed is higher if you stay in darker areas.
Throwing magazines
*If player has an empty magazine

COLONEL

Do you have any spent handgun or rifle magazines? You can throw those with the Weapon Button after you've exhausted all the rounds in them.

COLONEL

They have no effectiveness as weapons, but the sound of it hitting the ground may serve as a diversion.

COLONEL

It could be used as a ploy to lure the enemy in.
How to equip weapons and items

COLONEL

To select a weapon, push and hold the Weapon Equip Button and open the Weapons Window. You will see an array of weapon icons.

COLONEL

Select the desired weapon by moving the left analog stick up and down. The chosen icon will appear in the lower right.

COLONEL

You may notice a slight difference from the VR training mode -- any weapons you have from the same class are displayed on the same row.

COLONEL

You can select a weapon out of the row by moving the left analog stick left and right. The selected weapon should appear to the far right.

COLONEL

Let go of the Weapon Equip Button and the selected weapon will be in your hand.

COLONEL

Follow the window instructions on how to use each weapon.

COLONEL

Equipment, such as rations, is selected the same way. Just use the Equipment Window Button instead.
If player hasn't been accepting incoming optional calls

COLONEL

Raiden, if we need to contact you, we'll initiate a CALL.

COLONEL

If you see the CALL sign, push the Codec Button to open your channel.
Footprints
*If player is in an area where footprints can be left behind

COLONEL

Raiden, if you walk around with your feet wet, there will naturally be tracks everywhere. There's very little hope that the enemy will fail to spot those.

COLONEL

To avoid leaving footprints, crawl instead.
Infrared sensor – alarm

COLONEL

Raiden, be careful. There are infrared sensors in the area.

COLONEL

If you interrupt an IR beam, an alarm will go off. Avoid making contact with a beam.
Avoiding infrared sensors

COLONEL

There are relatively few infrared beams in place. You should be able to make it past without coming into contact with the beams.
Infrared sensor – no control unit

COLONEL

Those IR sensors do not seem to be equipped with control units.

COLONEL

It won't be as simple as taking out the control unit and knocking the sensor offline.

COLONEL

You'll have to weave your way past the IR beams.
Grip strength increased from pull-ups
(1)

COLONEL

Raiden, your grip has gotten stronger. Guess your hard work has paid off.
(2)

COLONEL

Raiden, your grip went up again!

ROSE

Jack, you're great!
(3)

COLONEL

Raiden, your grip went up again!

ROSE

Jack, you're truly amazing!
Grip strength won't increase any more

COLONEL

Raiden, how long are you going to keep doing that? Forget about doing pull-ups. It's about time you returned to your duties.

ROSE

*fed up* Jack, don't get too carried away. There are limits to everything, you know.
Lock-on button

COLONEL

Press the Lock-on Button when holding your gun to activate the lock-on function. It is very helpful when you want to fix your aim quickly.

COLONEL

Lock-on can only be used to fix your aim on an enemy's torso, however. Go to First Person View when you want to aim for an enemy's weak point.
The elevator won't move if there's an enemy on it

COLONEL

Raiden, the elevator won't move when enemy soldiers are in it. Draw enemies out of the elevator.
If player hasn't called Snake

ROSE

Maybe Lieutenant J.G. Pliskin knows something. Why don't you ask him?

ROSE

How about Lieutenant J.G. Pliskin? Did you ask him?

ROSE

Lieutenant J.G. Pliskin's radio frequency is 141.80, right?
How to use Coolant Spray

COLONEL

Raiden, you can disarm the C4 with the coolant spray.

COLONEL

The distance of the spray differs depending on how hard you press the Weapon Button.

COLONEL

When trying to disarm a far-off C4, press the Weapon Button down hard.
Near a locker

COLONEL

Raiden, there's a locker over there. It's a good place to conceal yourself from enemy patrols.

COLONEL

Face the locker and press the Action Button to open the door. Walk into the open locker and close the door to hide.

COLONEL

Push the Action Button again to get out of the locker.

COLONEL

You can see what's going on outside through the slit. Go into First Person View and make sure the coast is clear before you walk out.
Hiding enemies in lockers

COLONEL

You can also knock out and drag enemy personnel over to an open locker and hide their bodies inside.
Using locker doors as a shield

COLONEL

Open a locker and in an exchange of gunfire, the door can serve as a shield.

COLONEL

This can be helpful when there's no other cover in sight.
Destroying locker doors

COLONEL

You can also destroy locker doors. If you absolutely need to open a locked one, just break in.
Locker that won't open

COLONEL

Raiden, it looks as though that locker is secured. If you need to use a locker, find an unlocked one.
Scaling obstacles

COLONEL

Raiden, you can climb onto anything up to about waist-high with the Action Button. It should come in useful.
Hanging (1)

COLONEL

If you see an approximately waist-high railing, push the Action Button near it. You will be able to climb over the railing and Hang down from the other side.

COLONEL

This is referred to as Hanging. Not only does it allow you to stay out of the enemy's sight, you will be able to reach locations that are otherwise inaccessible.
Hanging (2)

COLONEL

You will be able to move left and right while Hanging. You can use the capability to move undetected.

COLONEL

Press the Action Button again to climb up from Hanging.
Hanging (3)

COLONEL

A Grip Gauge is displayed under the Life Gauge while Hanging.

COLONEL

The Grip Gauge indicates how firm a grip you have. It will decrease over time as long as you're Hanging.

COLONEL

When the Grip Gauge runs out, you will fall. Climb up before that happens.
Dropping down from hanging

COLONEL

Push the Crawl Button while Hanging to jump straight down.

COLONEL

But a jump from too high a location will take a toll on your Life Gauge. Check the ground below in First Person View before jumping down.
How to drag bodies

COLONEL

The risk of leaving an enemy's body lying around is too great. If his comrades discover it, they'll be on the lookout for you.

COLONEL

Whenever you take an enemy out, conceal the body to the best of your abilities.

COLONEL

You can drag an enemy personnel's body.

COLONEL

This is how to do it: first, walk up to the body, and with all weapons deselected, press the Weapon Button to pick it up.

COLONEL

As long as you have the Weapon Button held down, you can move around with the body in your grasp. Release the Weapon Button to let go of the body.
Strut A Pump Room card door

COLONEL

Raiden, that door is controlled by the facility's security system.

COLONEL

Unless you have a security card, you won't be able to open the door.
*If player has a card

COLONEL

OK, you have the card. You can open the door if you equip the card.

COLONEL

However, the door won't open if the card's security level is lower than the door's level. Be careful.
How to hide bodies

COLONEL

Got one, I see. Don't leave him lying around. Hide the body as soon as possible.

COLONEL

When his comrades come back from the roof, you don't want him being found. If they do find him, they'll be on the alert, and things can get difficult.

COLONEL

When you take a hostile down, hide the body where a patrol is unlikely to come around.
-->How to drag bodies (p. 713)
Regular check-ins

COLONEL

The enemies check in with each other on a regular basis. If a man fails to respond, reinforcements are sent in to check out a potential situation.

COLONEL

If they find their comrade unconscious or worse, they'll go into high alert. Make sure you hide the body securely out of sight to avoid this.
Enemies will call for backup

COLONEL

Raiden, exercise extreme caution. The only place where enemy communication is disrupted is the deep-sea-dock.

COLONEL

If they spot you, they will call for a backup team, and that's a tough bunch. Direct confrontation would be high-risk.
Backup teams

COLONEL

Enemy backup teams are equipped with full-body armor. The only viable target is the head, so you'll have to use First Person View.

COLONEL

Enemy backup teams are equipped with full-body armor. Targeting any part of the body except the head will bring very little success. Aim for the head from First Person View.
-->First Person Attacks (p. 704), if player hasn't heard this explanation
How to prevent enemies from calling for backup

COLONEL

Even if you are spotted, there are ways to prevent the enemy from calling in reinforcements.

COLONEL

You can take the man down before he has a chance to call in. Get him before he picks up the radio and you won't have to worry about the backup.

COLONEL

You can also set up electronic interference using the chaff grenade. The enemy's radio will be useless, and no contact will be established with other patrols.

COLONEL

Taking out the enemy's radio is of course an effective means of preventing communication. No backup can be called.

COLONEL

Enemy patrols carry the radio behind their right hip. Aim from First Person View and you should be able to put a bullet through it.
How to obtain items from enemies

COLONEL

If you take an enemy out without being spotted, an Item Box can sometimes appear. Don't forget to retrieve it.
Holdups

COLONEL

Approach the enemy undetected and train your gun on him before he can react. This is how you can hold someone up.

COLONEL

Once the enemy raises both his hands, he won't put up any resistance. How you proceed after that is up to you.
If player has killed too many birds

COLONEL

Raiden! Do you actually enjoy abusing helpless animals?

ROSE

I don't believe this! I had no idea you were that kind of a monster...

COLONEL

I don't understand you, Raiden... If you're -- satisfied, get back to the mission.
Gun Cyphers

COLONEL

Raiden, there's a Gun Cypher flying over there. Those aren't the normal Cypher UAVs. These are armed. Watch out.
Gun Cyphers - chaff

COLONEL

Gun Cyphers can be put out of commission temporarily. Use the chaff to interfere with their electronic sensors.
Gun Cyphers - shooting them down

COLONEL

You can shoot Gun Cyphers down if you target the fan section or its gun. Aim in First Person View.
•Colonel
Big Shell Explanations
The basics

ROSE

Jack, I did a search on the Big Shell.

ROSE

The tanker accident two years ago spilled a catastrophic amount of crude oil into the bay.

ROSE

The Big Shell is an offshore decontamination facility built to restore the Manhattan Bay environment by trapping and disposing the spilt oil.

ROSE

Around the perimeter of the Big Shell oil fences were erected in order to protect against any further dispersal of the oil.

ROSE

You see those steeples erected here and there in the fence? Those are piles to draw up the polluted seawater.

ROSE

Gathered seawater is carried to the pump room in Strut A first, and all of the larger garbage is collected in Sediment Pool No. 1 of Strut D.

ROSE

This is followed by a two-step purification process in the Shell 2 core water reserve in which oil is removed by microbes.

ROSE

Then it is sent to Strut L and sterilized, and finally once again carried to the surface piles and flushed back into the bay.

RAIDEN

Did the military database include information on the marine filtration facility's structure as well?

ROSE

No. I didn't use the database.

RAIDEN

Huh?

ROSE

I used a brochure.
Strut A's role

ROSE

Strut A is a pump facility that supplies the energy to circulate the polluted water drawn from the sea throughout each of the Big Shell's sections.

ROSE

The south side is the actual pump facility itself, while the north side is the control room.
Strut B's role

ROSE

Strut B is a generator facility that generates electricity for the Big Shell. The first floor is its substation.
Strut C's role

ROSE

Strut C is the Residential Area. It supports life at sea for all of the workers on the Big Shell.

ROSE

That being said, almost all systems are completely automated, so there aren't many workers to be found.
Strut D's role

ROSE

Strut D is Sediment Pool No. 1. It's a facility where extracted polluted water is stored without being disturbed so that its large pollutants settle and are purged from it.
Strut E's role

ROSE

The Strut E roof functions as a heliport, while inside it serves as an aerial transport hub for materials to each of the other struts.
*If player is on the roof

ROSE

Because its sea entrances are cut off by oil fences, there is hardly any transportation of goods into the Big Shell by seafaring vessels.

ROSE

Almost all of the materials brought in are via the roof heliport.
*If player is inside the structure

ROSE

Inside Strut E is an automated system to sort materials.

ROSE

It recognizes cardboard boxes and separates them appropriately. By automatically delivering packages to each strut, efforts have been made to streamline manpower.
Strut F's role

ROSE

Strut F is the storage center. I think a variety of materials for maintenance of the Big Shell are stored there.

ROSE

There might be something that would come in handy. Why don't you look around?
The Shell 1 Core's role

ROSE

The Shell 1 Core is what its name implies: the center of the Big Shell.

ROSE

The first basement floor is a capacious meeting hall. I'm sure that's where they held the welcome reception for the President and the environmental protection inspection team.

ROSE

But its core function is concentrated in the second basement floor Computer Room.

ROSE

This computer room is where the flow of polluted water and the status of filtration is observed, in addition to being where all tasks for other facilities are carried out.

ROSE

I can understand why security is so tight.
The Shell 2 Core's role

ROSE

The Shell 2 Core is where the actual filtration system resides, or at least it used to. Now it's just a shadow of its former self.

ROSE

Here water mixed with crude oil was filtered using antagonist bacteria in the microbial decomposition of hydrocarbons.

ROSE

Below the first floor basement is a gigantic vat for this purpose. What happened was that this vat broke and flooded the floor.

ROSE

The first floor, which is not flooded, houses the air purification facility that eliminates the stench from the polluted water.

ROSE

Manhattan is right in our backyard here, you know. There's plenty of reason to be cautious.
Strut L's role

ROSE

Strut L used to be the effluent processing facility.

ROSE

It appears to be where sea water expunged of oil was treated with chlorine and other chemicals to sterilize and disinfect the water so that it could be made suitable for flushing back into the ocean.
•Colonel
Game Over
The Colonel shouts into the Codec

COLONEL

Raiden, what's wrong!? Raiden! Raiden!!

COLONEL

Raiden, come in. Raiden! Raiden!!

COLONEL

What the hell happened!? Raiden! Raiden!!

COLONEL

Raiden, is everything alright? Raiden! Raiden!!

COLONEL

Raidennn!!!
After the Colonel has gone full crazy

COLONEL

*laughs scornfully* Mwahahahahaha!

COLONEL

*laughs scornfully* Hehehe... Is that the best you could do, huh, Raiden!?

COLONEL

*laughs scornfully* Oh, what? That's it? Oh, Raiden...

COLONEL

*laughs scornfully* Hah! All bark and no bite, Raiden!
•Colonel
Crazy Colonel Codec Calls
The Crazy Colonel

COLONEL

Raiden, we're in trouble. Look at what's on TV.
Crazy Colonel conversations – MSX2 (1)

COLONEL

... Infiltrate... the enemy fortress... Outer Heaven!

COLONEL

... Destroy... the final weapon... Metal Gear!
MSX2 (2)

COLONEL

Big Boss here... Enter the track on the bridge to the right... Over.
MSX2 (3)

COLONEL

I say again. Your duty is to infiltrate Zanzibar Land.

COLONEL

And seize Kio Marf, an abducted Czechoslovakian biologist.
MGS1 lines (1)

COLONEL

President Baker should be somewhere to the south of where you blasted through the wall.

COLONEL

Hurry and save him before the terrorists discover his code.
MGS1 lines (2)

COLONEL

You got a PSG-1? You can use that against Sniper Wolf. Hurry up and save Meryl!
MGS1 lines (3)

COLONEL

Snake, they've input both detonation codes.

COLONEL

The only way to stop the launch now is to use the card key to re-input the codes.
Ghost Babel lines (1)

COLONEL

Your mission is to infiltrate the fortress Galuade, rescue the hostages, and neutralize Metal Gear before its assembly is complete.
Ghost Babel lines (2)

COLONEL

Snake, there's a fork in the conveyor belt. The machine is automatically sorting cargo according to some system.

COLONEL

Take a good look at the device.
Ghost Babel lines (3)

COLONEL

Snake, take the power plant out. Set C4 explosives on four key points to destroy the structure.

COLONEL

Snake, destroy the power plant's main turbine. It's located in the B1 floor of the plant.

COLONEL

Break into the B1 floor.
VR Missions lines (1)

COLONEL

Variety Level 13

COLONEL

Rescue Meryl, the "Return of Genola."
VR Missions lines (2)

COLONEL

Variety Level 7

COLONEL

Shoot down the space invaders! Training will have to be postponed if we are invaded by UFOs.
VR Missions lines (3)

COLONEL

Weapon Mode Socom Level 01

COLONEL

Destroy all targets to reach the goal! Number of targets: 3.
Mei Ling's MGS1 proverbs (1)

COLONEL

Snake, remember what De Gaulle said: "The graveyards are full of indispensable men."
It means a fool who recklessly looks for a fight can only focus on one enemy at a time.

COLONEL

Snake, you're all alone and surrounded by bad guys. Try to be careful and avoid getting into a fight whenever you can.
Mei Ling's MGS1 proverbs (2)

COLONEL

Snake, like Shakespeare said: "Nought's had, all's spent, Where our desire is got without content."

COLONEL

Basically, it means that your desire can get you into trouble if you're not careful.

COLONEL

That goes for Items too. Don't get too greedy or you might be sorry. Be careful, Snake.
Nose Electric Railway station names

COLONEL

Kawanishi-Noseguchi, Kinunobebashi, Takiyama, Uguisunomori, Tsuzumigataki, Tada, Hirano, Ichinotorii, Uneno, Yamashita, Sasabe, Kofudai, Tokiwadai, Myoukenguchi.
If player has had a lot of game overs

COLONEL

I noticed this a while back, but you have far too many Game Overs. Sorry to be blunt, but you really stink at this game.
If player has been playing the game a certain amount of time

COLONEL

Honestly, though, you have played the game for a long time. Don't you have anything else to do with your time?
If player has killed too many enemies

COLONEL

You seem to get a real thrill out of slaughtering the enemy. Are you frustrated about something?
If player didn't call the Colonel before

COLONEL

Listen, you haven't reported in for a long time until now. You think you can just CALL only when you want something? You disappoint me.
An excerpt from Idea Spy

COLONEL

Communicator Entertainment Program Idea Spy 2.5 (Two-point-five) Episode 1

COLONEL

New York. Here in the city where dreams come true and desires rule, something is being bought, sold, and thrown away, even as we speak.

COLONEL

But behind the scenes of business as usual, the nefarious J.E. (Junker Expensive) Corporation lines its already bloated coffers with profits from worthless products.

COLONEL

As J.E. swindles yet another innocent into purchasing high-priced junk...

COLONEL

... the FBI mobilizes a top-secret task force to put a stop to the menace.

COLONEL

Now, the city's best-kept secret spy is out there, briefed and ready to protect the people from J.E., the catalogue of conspiracy -- just call him 2.5 (Two-point-five).
Gibberish

COLONEL

I hear it's amazing when the famous purple stuffed worm in flap-jaw space with the tuning fork does a raw blink on Hara-kiri Rock. I need scissors! 61!
Pointing out naughty behavior

COLONEL

I can't believe it -- that someone who has committed all those twisted acts in the woman's bathroom would make it this far... This is the end of the world.
La-li-lu-le-lo!

COLONEL

La-li-lu-le-lo! La-li-lu-le-lo!! La-li-lu-le-lo!!!
Eating

COLONEL

*Munch, munch...* Um? Raiden? I'm eating right now. Get back to me later... *munch, munch...*
Past lives

COLONEL

I was a North American Fall Webworm in my past life. Those were the good old days... What were you in your former life?
He'll do it himself

COLONEL

Even my patience has its limits. I just can't leave this thing up to you any longer. I'll do the fighting! You can just go home!
The Colonel's finances

COLONEL

Actually, I am in really bad shape financially. I pay money to my ex-wife as part of our divorce settlement, among other bills...

COLONEL

I just had no choice but to make you pay for lunch the other day. I'm really sorry.
Modded code

COLONEL

You wouldn't be trying to give yourself a bogus score using some ingenious trick would you? That's just about as low as anyone could possibly stoop! I can't believe you sometimes...
Who?

COLONEL

That reminds me, I saw Gubayama the other day in Shibomnigee. He said to give you his best.
Sleeping

COLONEL

*snores* ZZ... zz...
Answering machine

COLONEL

I'm not home right now. Please leave a message after the beep. BEEP
Blabbing about Rose's infidelity

COLONEL

Actually, there is something I have been meaning to tell you but I just couldn't... I think you should know, though.

COLONEL

On Saturday morning last week I saw a guy leaving Rosemary's room...

COLONEL

How should I put it, it was like they were ... "intimate." I'm sorry. Sorry to bring this up during the mission, but...
Useful trivia

COLONEL

An Anemone or Clematis plant's juice can cause a rash. When pruning them it's a good idea to wear gloves.
Raising and lowering guns

COLONEL

When using an automatic rifle, press the Weapon Button lightly to aim, and hold the Weapon Button down firmly to fire.

COLONEL

You can lower your gun after aiming by releasing the Weapon Button instead of holding it down.
Careful you don't catch on fire

COLONEL

Raiden, be careful of burning fires. If you accidentally touch an open flame, you might catch on fire yourself.

COLONEL

If you've caught on fire, repeatedly roll on the ground quickly to put out the flames.
The Crazy Conductor

COLONEL

Mind the gap. (Spoken like a train platform announcement.)
