•Patriot Rose
During Solidus Battle
Before saving

ROSE

Jack? Are you okay? How's your murdering going?

ROSE

What? You want to save? Honestly, you only rely on people when it's convenient for you!
After saving (1)

ROSE

Be strong!

ROSE

Whatever happens, don't forget that my life's at stake too. Try to do something for me for a change!
After saving (2)

ROSE

Okay, get back to your murdering!

ROSE

You're doing this to save me, right? Don't deny it! I've done so much for you, haven't I? See ya.
•Rose
Conversations After Saving
While player is under a cardboard box

ROSE

What -- I-I can't believe this! What are you wearing?

RAIDEN

Er... it's a disguise.

ROSE

A disguise? What kind of disguise?

RAIDEN

Well, I was hoping I could use it kind of like camouflage... You know, fool the enemy into thinking I was a box...

ROSE

You'd have to be an absolute idiot to be fooled by that!

RAIDEN

Yeah, maybe, but there are more idiots in this world than you think.

ROSE

... You mean like you?

RAIDEN

Huh?

ROSE

Never mind. Anyway, good luck! You'll probably need it with that stupid box on your head!
Raiden in danger Codec call (1)
*When Raiden's Life drops below a certain point and he is close to death. Or, an incoming call after the player continues.

ROSE

Jack! Are you okay!?

COLONEL

Rosemary!

ROSE

Jack, tell me you're okay.

RAIDEN

I'm all right. It was a close one, though.

ROSE

*relieved* Oh good...

RAIDEN

*apologetically* ...

ROSE

I didn't think it would be this tough.

RAIDEN

*worried* Hey...

ROSE

It's the helplessness of it, you know.

ROSE

Just watching... with no power to help you.

ROSE

It's like having a ringside seat at a boxing match.

ROSE

But much worse...

ROSE

Because it's someone I love and the stakes are -- (She can't go on.)

COLONEL

Rosemary -- maybe this was a miscalculation on my part.

COLONEL

Selecting her (a close person) wasn't the wisest choice.

ROSE

*collecting herself* No, no, I apologize for the outburst.

ROSE

I'm all right. I will see this through with you.

RAIDEN

Rose? (Don't act so tough.)

ROSE

We fight together, ok? You have nowhere to run, neither do I.

COLONEL

Rosemary, you're not obligated to continue, you know that.

ROSE

I'm all right, sir.

COLONEL

*basically convinced* Hm...

COLONEL

Raiden, how about you?

RAIDEN

I'm good.

COLONEL

Then the mission goes on.

COLONEL

But Rosemary, there's one thing you need to understand.

ROSE

Sir?

COLONEL

His name is Raiden. Got it?

ROSE

Yes, sir. I understand.
While disguised

ROSE

You know, that really looks good on you.

RAIDEN

You think so?

ROSE

Yeah. Everything looks good on you, Jack.
*If player has heard cardboard box conversation

ROSE

*absent-mindedly* Everything but that stupid box...

RAIDEN

What?

ROSE

Nothing!
*Convergence point

ROSE

It'd be nice if you were this stylish all the time.

RAIDEN

It's too much of a hassle.

ROSE

Well, at least you could care a little bit more about how you look.

RAIDEN

You care enough for both of us.

ROSE

Yeah, that's true. But I want to be beautiful.

RAIDEN

You want people to compliment you?

ROSE

Yeah... especially you.

RAIDEN

Me?

ROSE

Yes. Is that strange?

RAIDEN

Not at all.

ROSE

Really? Well then, next time be sure to compliment me!
While cigarettes are equipped

ROSE

By the way, Jack, are you smoking?

RAIDEN

Yep. (He inhales happily.)

ROSE

I thought you quit smoking! Why did you start again?

RAIDEN

There are lots of reasons...

ROSE

Look, I'm only thinking about your health, okay? Remember the last time you quit -- how hard it was?

RAIDEN

Yeah... it was pretty tough...

ROSE

Wasn't it? So you should...

RAIDEN

I've got it, Rose. I've thought of a way to avoid all that pain and suffering.

ROSE

What are you going to do?

RAIDEN

Keep smoking.

ROSE

Jack!

RAIDEN

Just kidding. I know it's bad for me. I'll quit as soon as I get back. (Still inhaling happily.)

ROSE

...
While a Magazine is equipped

ROSE

By the way, Jack... what's that you're holding?

RAIDEN

Uh, well...

ROSE

Look, if it's bothering you that much, you should just say so.

RAIDEN

Eh? And if I do?

ROSE

Uh hn...

ROSE

Just be patient, dear!
After having killed several enemies

RAIDEN

Rose... No comment?

ROSE

About...?

RAIDEN

I've killed someone.

ROSE

Jack, it's a battlefield...

RAIDEN

My opponents are living, breathing human beings! This isn't like the VR training! They have bodies. They have -- had -- lives. I took all that away from them.

ROSE

But you've got no choice if you want to survive...

RAIDEN

And yet... maybe because of the VR training... I can't help but try and block out that reality. It's the only way I can manage to fight...

ROSE

Jack!

RAIDEN

What?

ROSE

I don't care what it takes, just as long as you come back alive. Do whatever it takes. Please! Just come back in one piece!

RAIDEN

... OK.
Homecoming party

ROSE

Jack... when you get home, let's have a homecoming party. Just the two of us.

RAIDEN

Yeah, that's a good idea.

ROSE

I'll make dinner.

RAIDEN

Uh... wha... (Oh god. Please don't.)

ROSE

What's wrong?

RAIDEN

Well, that sounds good, but how about we eat out at that one restaurant instead?

RAIDEN

You know, the place that we went to recently, with the amazing lobster... I really liked that place.

ROSE

Well... yeah, I guess that's okay too.

RAIDEN

*relieved* Whew...

ROSE

Huh?

RAIDEN

Er, nothing. I-I just love lobster. Yeah. Can't wait. Woo-hoo!

ROSE

*thinks something is fishy* ...? Well then, I'll make a reservation.

ROSE

Promise me you'll come back safely.

RAIDEN

Don't worry!
Some time since the start of the chapter

RAIDEN

Rose... are you okay?

ROSE

Yes. Thank you... I-it really scared me at first, but I think I've gotten used to it.

ROSE

I'll be behind you all the way, so don't worry.

RAIDEN

I guess women really are strong.

ROSE

Not quite. It's not women that are strong -- it's me.

RAIDEN

Just as long as I can count on you.

ROSE

... Actually, that's not true. It still scares me to death. But I'll be strong. I'll try -- for you. Good luck!
Stillman

ROSE

I looked into Mr. Peter Stillman's file.

ROSE

Full name is Peter Stillman. Known as "Peg-Legged Peter." He is a legendary bomb disposal technician.

ROSE

He is also a longtime instructor at the Naval School Explosive Ordnance Disposal, and a consultant for the NYPD bomb squad.

ROSE

But five years ago he lost his leg in an accident... and since then he hung up his gloves to focus on being a lecturer.

ROSE

He was called back into service because, as he said, he is the only explosives specialist who can stop Fatman.

ROSE

Although no longer an active consultant, he is still without a doubt the number one guy when it comes to disarming explosives. He should be very helpful to you.
While disposing of a bomb (1)
*If player calls during bomb disposal

ROSE

Jack -- it must be so nerve-racking to defuse a bomb...

RAIDEN

*somewhat offended* Yeah, I'd say so.

ROSE

OK, that was a stupid thing to say. Sorry.

RAIDEN

*holding back* That's all right. It's just that I've never been trained in this stuff.

ROSE

You okay? Are you feeling well?

RAIDEN

I almost threw up a few times.

ROSE

Oh Jack...

RAIDEN

But I'm okay. It's not like I'm in this alone.

ROSE

Oh -- yeah, that's true. (He was talking about Pliskin, not Rose.)

ROSE

What do you think about when you're defusing those things?

RAIDEN

I don't think so much as remember. And I know that I need to resist that, and keep my mind blank. I can't let myself be overwhelmed by the fear.

ROSE

So, am I a part of what you try not to remember?

RAIDEN

*laughs* ...

ROSE

I was just kidding. But I guess this isn't a good time for that.

RAIDEN

No, it is. And I do think about you. I'm trying to remember what's so special about April 30th.

ROSE

Any success?

RAIDEN

No, not yet.

ROSE

You need to stay alive so you can.

RAIDEN

*laughs* Okay, that's a deal.
While disposing of a bomb (2)
*If player calls during bomb disposal

ROSE

Hey, Jack? I bet bomb disposal's a lot like starting a relationship.

RAIDEN

Huh? What are you talking about?

ROSE

Carefully dismantling emotional defenses, being on your toes constantly... you know?

RAIDEN

I guess. Neither of them are my strong point.

ROSE

*laughs* It's true that you're not the most patient man in the world.

RAIDEN

It's not that. I like to leave things as they are.

ROSE

Are you afraid of what might be hidden inside?

RAIDEN

Not afraid, just -- unwilling... to deal with complications.

ROSE

Like me?

RAIDEN

You're -- (Hit the mark on the head.)

ROSE

Hey, Jack?

RAIDEN

Yeah?

ROSE

Do you know why I took this job?

RAIDEN

?

ROSE

I wanted to see what you were really like.

RAIDEN

But we've been together a while. You know me already.

ROSE

No -- you never let me in past a certain point. And I need to know what's there.

RAIDEN

... Hahhhh (Why are you bringing this up again?). Are you trying to take me apart now?

ROSE

Hey, it's not important.

ROSE

Good luck, Jack.
During bomb disposal, Raiden jealous of Snake

ROSE

You're looking pretty good.

RAIDEN

Yeah?

ROSE

I wonder how Lieutenant J.G. Pliskin is doing...

RAIDEN

Well, he's doing pretty good too.

ROSE

Oh, really? I'm glad!

RAIDEN

Why are you so worried?

ROSE

Huh?

RAIDEN

About Pliskin.

ROSE

Well, I mean, he's defusing the bombs along with you. If he screws something up, you'll be...

RAIDEN

I guess so. He'll be all right, I'm sure. Don't worry about it.

ROSE

Okay. Hang in there.
Right after Peter's death

ROSE

Jack, are you all right?

RAIDEN

Yeah. I'm okay, but Stillman... I'm going to have to finish this myself.

ROSE

What about Lieutenant J.G. Pliskin?
*If player tried calling him

RAIDEN

I haven't been able to contact him.

ROSE

I see.
*If player hasn't tried calling him

RAIDEN

I don’t know.
*Convergence point

RAIDEN

He's not the kind of guy who'd fold that easily... I'm sure he's still alive.

ROSE

I guess there's nothing we can do but pray for his safety.

RAIDEN

Yeah. But if we don't take care of these bombs soon, there'll be nothing left to pray for.

ROSE

You're right. I know you can do it, Jack!
Pliskin envy

ROSE

Jack, I know you're probably doing fine, but don't get discouraged. Remember, Lieutenant J.G. Pliskin is with you too. You'll be all right.

RAIDEN

*sullenly* ...

ROSE

What's wrong?

RAIDEN

*moodily* Nothing.

ROSE

Don't give me that. Every time you say "nothing," it's always something. What's wrong?

RAIDEN

It's just that, you know... you seem to think pretty highly of him.

ROSE

Well...

RAIDEN

Yeah. Pliskin's the kind of guy you can really depend on. Isn't he?

ROSE

Wha-? (Are you jealous?)

RAIDEN

What!?

ROSE

Heh heh. Yeah, Pliskin is one heck of a man, isn't he? He's so cool, so -- confident!

RAIDEN

... Yeah, yeah...

ROSE

But he's nowhere near as cool as you. You'll always be my No. 1. Always.

RAIDEN

But... that's not what I meant...

ROSE

Hee hee. You know, you're kinda cute sometimes. Bye, Jack.
If player hadn't saved in a while

ROSE

*sarcastically* So, looks like you remembered I'm still here after all.

RAIDEN

Huh?

ROSE

I thought you'd completely forgotten that I existed.

RAIDEN

Of course not! What's wrong with you?

ROSE

It's just... you haven't saved in a while.

RAIDEN

That doesn't mean I forgot.

ROSE

Is that so? And didn't you think I'd be worried?

RAIDEN

But...

ROSE

I was really worried... You're okay, right?

RAIDEN

Yeah.

ROSE

Good.
After making Rose angry

ROSE

So, Jack, what do you want?

RAIDEN

What do I want...? Well, I'd like to save, if that's okay.

ROSE

Then go ahead.
*The "SAVE" option becomes "I WON'T MAKE YOU SAVE"

RAIDEN

This is a joke, right? Rose...

ROSE

What now?

RAIDEN

What do you mean, what now? Save my data, please.

ROSE

Hmph. Fine. Don't you have something you want to say before that?

RAIDEN

Like what?

ROSE

...

RAIDEN

All right, I get it. I'm sorry. There, are you satisfied?

ROSE

Close enough.

RAIDEN

*whispers* ... You selfish...

ROSE

What was that?

RAIDEN

Nothing. Just talking to myself.
Peter could actually walk

ROSE

I can't believe it... Stillman's prosthetic leg was all a big lie!

RAIDEN

Don't be too hard on him, Rose.

ROSE

But he's got no right to go around pretending he's got a prosthetic leg! That's an insult to people who really can't walk!

RAIDEN

Everyone's got their own reasons. Sometimes, you've got no choice but to lie...

ROSE

... You're right. I guess it is necessary sometimes... (She's remembered she's telling the biggest lie of all.)

RAIDEN

Rose?

ROSE

It's nothing. Well, see ya.
Rose Codec call (1)

ROSE

Jack...

RAIDEN

What is it?

ROSE

I've always been alone...

RAIDEN

Huh?

ROSE

I'm so lonely...

RAIDEN

Lonely? Rose, we've always -- (been together.)

ROSE

Not always.

RAIDEN

What do you mean? (He doesn't know what she's talking about.)

ROSE

You've never slept beside me...

RAIDEN

What are you talking about? I --

ROSE

After we've been together in my room... you stay awake all night or you head for the door.

RAIDEN

Is this really the time to bring this up?

ROSE

Why, Jack? Why?

RAIDEN

Listen, Rose. I'm right in the middle of a mission, and I...

ROSE

Why!? Why can't you relax when you're with me!?

RAIDEN

Look... the mission... I...

ROSE

Why don't you open up to me!?

RAIDEN

*getting carried away* Rose... I... I just can't!

ROSE

All I ever wanted was to share your dreams -- to spend a meaningful evening with you...

ROSE

I just wanted to find you by my side when I woke up. Is that asking too much?

RAIDEN

It's the night -- I'm scared of the night... it's got nothing to do with you... (He's talking about the past. He cries in his sleep.)

ROSE

Scared of the night? What's that supposed to mean? (That isn't an answer.)

RAIDEN

I can't relax when I'm with someone...

ROSE

Jack? You wouldn't even let me in your room! (She's a spy, so she was trying to get closer to him.)

RAIDEN

I need privacy... I just can't be bothered.

ROSE

Bothered!?

RAIDEN

Wrong word! What I wanted to say was that there are certain things that I have to keep to myself... (He doesn't want her to know about his past.)

ROSE

Do you remember that time I forced my way into your room? We'd known each other for almost a year... and you blew up! It was the first time you ever raised your hand against me! (She starts to cry.)

RAIDEN

... (He regrets it.)

ROSE

I was so worried about you... (She was really spying on him.)

RAIDEN

Look... I'm sorry...

ROSE

It wasn't your violent nature that scared me. It was your room... your heart...

RAIDEN

Stop it...

ROSE

*crying a little* There wasn't anything in your room -- only a bed and a small desk. It looked like a prison cell...

RAIDEN

Rose? (He doesn't understand why she's crying.)

ROSE

No television set... no family pictures... not even a poster...

RAIDEN

Rose, I only use that room for sleeping.

ROSE

A lifeless room... almost like your empty heart.

RAIDEN

That's why I tried to keep you out.

ROSE

I thought I was beginning to understand you -- until I saw that room.

RAIDEN

*sarcastically* Would you've been happier if I had a picture of you hanging on the wall!?

ROSE

That's not what I was trying to say --

RAIDEN

Enough, Rose. We'll talk about this later... after the mission.

ROSE

Right... after the mission... I understand.
Emma, Raiden, and Rose (1)
*Rose calls if Raiden and Emma are flirting with each other

ROSE

Well, Jack. It sounds like you and Miss Emma are getting along just fine.

RAIDEN

Rose?

ROSE

I've been monitoring your every move and conversation. I can't say it's been fun...

RAIDEN

Give me a break! I'm only trying to keep her spirits up.

ROSE

Is that right?

RAIDEN

Absolutely. My mission is to get her to the Computer Room.

ROSE

That's all?

RAIDEN

Yeah.

ROSE

You're lying. You're attracted to her, aren't you?

RAIDEN

... I'll admit she's cute.

ROSE

Cuter than me?

RAIDEN

Rose, you're beautiful. You know how I feel about you.

ROSE

Have you remembered yet?

RAIDEN

You mean April 30th?

ROSE

Yes.

RAIDEN

It's your birthday, isn't it?

ROSE

Wrong! You're not even warm!

RAIDEN

What is it then?

ROSE

Forget it... it's nothing. Maybe I'm just a little... a little jealous...

RAIDEN

Rose!

ROSE

You'd better get moving. Good luck.
While holding hands with Emma

ROSE

Right, save complete. Goodbye.

RAIDEN

Wait a minute. What's wrong?

ROSE

Nothing. What are you talking about?

RAIDEN

What am I... Aren't you being a little cold?

ROSE

Really? Aren't you just imagining things? Maybe I'm just not as warm as that hand you've been holding for quite some time now.

RAIDEN

Rose, you know this isn't...

ROSE

I know, I'm just teasing you. But I was thinking -- I was wondering whether you would be as protective if it were me instead of Emma.

RAIDEN

Of course I would!

ROSE

Think so? Oh, that's right. You're such a kind person. (She doesn't like that he's so nice to everyone.)

RAIDEN

Rose!

ROSE

Forget about it. Good luck.
A fresh perspective

ROSE

Now that I think about it, it feels kind of fresh.

RAIDEN

What does?

ROSE

Before, I could always rest assured that I'd see you again. Now, it's different. Now, it feels like every word we say to each other counts.

RAIDEN

Ha ha. That's great. We could make this into a book and sell it. "Want to improve communication in your relationship? Send your man off to fight a war."

ROSE

Jack...

RAIDEN

Rose, you know my life's at stake here.

ROSE

So is mine!

RAIDEN

Rose?

ROSE

I'm sorry. But I'm really worried too! I can't help but feel like I'm fighting this battle along with you.

RAIDEN

Yeah... I know. Thanks.
What day is tomorrow?

ROSE

Jack, have you remembered what day it is tomorrow?

RAIDEN

Uh... no.

ROSE

I see. (That's too bad.)

RAIDEN

*changing the subject* Ah, you said you had something you wanted to talk to me about. What was it?

ROSE

We'll talk about it tomorrow.

RAIDEN

Why does it have to be tomorrow?

ROSE

So I can build up enough courage first. And... so you won't run away.

RAIDEN

I would never do something like that.

ROSE

Liar. Every time I want to talk about something, you suddenly remember that you have some work you have to do, or you get a stomachache.

RAIDEN

That's not...

ROSE

You know it's true. What are you so afraid of?

RAIDEN

I'm not afraid of anything. And I won't try to run away.

ROSE

Is that so? Well, then we'll talk tomorrow.

RAIDEN

Yeah.

ROSE

So... you have to come back, okay?

RAIDEN

I know.
Least favorite subject

ROSE

Jack, how's the mission going?

RAIDEN

Fine.

ROSE

"Fine." Is that it?

RAIDEN

... Look, I don't really feel like talking about the mission. At least with you, I want to talk about something else.

ROSE

Okay, then...let's talk about you.

RAIDEN

Me?

ROSE

Yeah. Your least favorite subject.

RAIDEN

That's not...

ROSE

Oh, yeah? Then go ahead and say something!

RAIDEN

Like what?

ROSE

Anything. Tell me something about yourself.

RAIDEN

I can't think of anything interesting to say. Why do you want to talk about me so badly?

ROSE

Because I'm curious.

RAIDEN

But why?

ROSE

Is it really that strange to want to know more about someone you love?

RAIDEN

No, it's not strange, but...

ROSE

You know, sometimes I...

ROSE

Oh, look, now we're talking about me, not you.

RAIDEN

...

ROSE

Why won't you tell me anything?

ROSE

About what you were like as a child, what kind of things you liked to do, what kind of people your parents were...

ROSE

I've never heard you talk about any of that. Why?

RAIDEN

... I...

ROSE

Don't you think it's just a little bit unusual? That I don't know anything about my own boyfriend's past?

RAIDEN

Rose... when I get back, I'll tell you everything.

ROSE

Is that... a promise?

RAIDEN

Yes. It's a promise...

ROSE

... (She doesn't believe him.)
Being greedy

RAIDEN

Rose.

ROSE

*teasingly* So, have you decided to talk yet?

RAIDEN

Nope.

ROSE

*brightly since she didn't think he would* That's too bad.

RAIDEN

... Why are you so interested in me all of a sudden?

ROSE

Because I'm curious. More so than before... Does it really bother you that much?

RAIDEN

There must be some things you don't want to say.

ROSE

Like what?

RAIDEN

... You know, those things you don't want to say.

ROSE

Let's see, things you don't wanna say... like that you've been married before? That you're eighty years old? That you used to be a woman?

RAIDEN

Rose...

ROSE

What exactly is it you won't tell me? Do you think I'd hate you if I knew?

ROSE

... Do you really have that little faith in me?

RAIDEN

No, it's nothing like that...

ROSE

Then what is it?

RAIDEN

...

ROSE

*sighs* It really bothers me... the fact that there's a side of you I don't know... Sometimes... I just can't help myself...

RAIDEN

You've got me right now. Isn't that enough?

ROSE

No. It's not. I'm sorry, I know I'm being greedy, but... it's just not enough.

RAIDEN

...
No trespassing

ROSE

Jack, I've been thinking for a long time. You've got a No Trespassing sign pasted on your heart.

RAIDEN

What?

ROSE

"No entry beyond this point." You've got it written all over your heart.

RAIDEN

That's ridic...

ROSE

Don't try to deny it. You know I'm right. Stop lying to me.

RAIDEN

...

ROSE

Why do you do this? Don't you trust me?

RAIDEN

... I don't know. I like you, I really do. It's not that I'm rejecting you. It's just that...

ROSE

All right, I understand. Forget about it.

RAIDEN

... I'm sorry...

ROSE

But, someday... do you think you might let me in? To the other side of that sign?

RAIDEN

Yeah... someday.

ROSE

Okay... someday... promise me?

RAIDEN

Yeah, I promise.
The apparent problems of being a beautiful woman

ROSE

You know, Jack... there's something that bugs me sometimes...

RAIDEN

What?

ROSE

Why are you going out with me?

RAIDEN

Huh?

ROSE

Is it because I'm beautiful?

RAIDEN

Why are you asking me this all of a sudden? And where do you get off calling yourself "beautiful"?

ROSE

It's the truth, plain and simple. I'm too smart not to realize it, and not sarcastic enough to be modest about it.

RAIDEN

Ha ha. Is that so? Well, then, your schedule must be booked solid with dates.

ROSE

You bet. I've even hired a private secretary to deal with all of them. But she cancels all of my appointments except for yours.

RAIDEN

...

ROSE

*sighs* ... Sometimes it really does bother me. Sometimes I think all you want is a pretty face to accompany you to parties.

RAIDEN

What are you...

ROSE

Just to make everyone jealous when they see you with me...

RAIDEN

You're being ridiculous.

ROSE

Oh, really? But you never talk about yourself.

ROSE

I never know whether it's really me you want by your side...

ROSE

... whether you'd ditch me if you found someone prettier... (It makes me anxious.)

RAIDEN

You know that's not true.

ROSE

Really? Then would you still go out with me even if I weren't beautiful?

RAIDEN

*hesitants slightly* ... Of course.

ROSE

Do you like me for me? Or is it my reputation?

RAIDEN

Do you really think anyone would say "your reputation"?

ROSE

...

RAIDEN

I'm just joking. Of course I like you for you. Honest truth.

ROSE

Really...Thank you.
Rose's job is also important to her
*After hearing information on a boss, etc., from Rose

ROSE

Jack, tell me... am I really helping you out?

RAIDEN

Yeah. You're a huge help. I'm lucky to have you as an analyst.

ROSE

Hmmmm. But didn't you tell me just a little while ago that I should change my job or quit or something?

RAIDEN

Yeah... you were pretty pissed off.

ROSE

Why did you say those things?

RAIDEN

Well, you have to work overtime and stuff... it sounded pretty tough.

ROSE

But you didn't mean it, did you?

RAIDEN

*resigned* ... I was wrong about a lot of things then. I just thought that if we had more time to spend together that...

ROSE

You were thinking of your own danger.

RAIDEN

Uh... well...

ROSE

Don't you think it's selfish to expect everyone to be at your beck and call? I'm not your personal possession, you know!

RAIDEN

That's not how I think of you.

ROSE

Is that so?

RAIDEN

Yeah!

ROSE

... Listen. I like you. And I like the me that likes you.

ROSE

But, I do NOT like being summed up as "Jack's girlfriend." The very thought of it makes me shiver.

ROSE

There's a lot more to me than just being your girlfriend. The fact that I'm doing the job I want to do is part of that. Understand?

RAIDEN

Yeah. Of course I...

ROSE

I want to be recognized first of all for who I really am. Especially... by you.

ROSE

I don't want you, of all people, thinking that I'm just your girlfriend. (She says this because of the guilt she feels about having been ordered to play this role.)

RAIDEN

That's not what I think at all.

ROSE

Can you really say that?

RAIDEN

Absolutely.

ROSE

Really... I'm glad.
After the conversation about Rose forcing her way into Raiden's room

ROSE

Um... Jack, about trying to break into your room...

RAIDEN

Rose, just forget about it...

ROSE

No. Listen to me. I said I did it because I was worried about you, but... it wasn't just that.

RAIDEN

What?

ROSE

I was suspicious. I thought there might be someone else...

RAIDEN

Someone else?

ROSE

Another woman.

RAIDEN

Rose...

ROSE

I really thought so... because sometimes, you're so horribly cold.

RAIDEN

You know I wouldn't...

ROSE

I'm serious. Sometimes I feel like you're pushing me away. So I...

RAIDEN

Did you get in?

ROSE

Yeah.

RAIDEN

Are you satisfied now? There wasn't anyone there, was there?

ROSE

No. No, there was no one there. There was absolutely no one in your room. Not another woman. Not me. Not even you.

RAIDEN

Rose...

ROSE

I'm sorry. I just wanted to apologize, that's all. Talk to you later.
It must be hard

ROSE

Jack... it must be hard for you.

RAIDEN

Yeah. When I watch people die like this...

ROSE

No, I mean it must be hard for you in general.

RAIDEN

What?

ROSE

You always seem like you're trying to deny something within yourself, but can't...

RAIDEN

... (Bull's eye.)

ROSE

And I have no idea what's making you suffer so much. That's hard for me. If only you'd talk to me about it... (I could've helped you.)

RAIDEN

There are some things I want you to understand without me having to explain.

ROSE

You can't possibly expect me to...

ROSE

... (She comes to a sudden realization and falls silent.)

RAIDEN

Rose?

ROSE

*sighs* ... I guess you're right.

ROSE

Maybe if I were a better match for you, I could understand without being told.

ROSE

But I'm guess I'm not. I guess I'm just too different.

RAIDEN

Rose, that's...

ROSE

Not true?

RAIDEN

Yeah. You're perfect for me. The ideal woman... so to speak.

ROSE

Ideal...? (She has been ordered to play the role of Raiden's ideal woman.)

RAIDEN

Yeah.

ROSE

... If...

RAIDEN

Huh?

ROSE

... If... if I was... (an act, what would you do?)

RAIDEN

What are you trying to say?

ROSE

... Nothing, never mind. Sorry, I was about to say something stupid. Get back to the mission.
After learning that Raiden was a child soldier

ROSE

Jack... I was serious when I said I wanted you to propose to me...

RAIDEN

Rose?

ROSE

I was really worried. There are times when it seems like you're not really looking at me, and that if I looked away for a moment, you'll disappear...

ROSE

I wanted to make sure you couldn't get away. I thought that if we lived together, maybe things would change, that maybe we could change things ourselves.

RAIDEN

...

ROSE

But that wasn't the problem... There was something deeper...

RAIDEN

I'm sorry.

ROSE

... I guess it's impossible for me... (She couldn't completely achieve her spy role.)

RAIDEN

What are you saying?

ROSE

I'm sorry, Jack. I love you. I really do. Please believe me... whatever happens.

RAIDEN

Rose?

ROSE

Bye, Jack.
The Patriots

ROSE

Jack, how far do you think the Patriots' digital control extends?

RAIDEN

I don't really know, but it probably influences a lot of what goes on in our everyday lives.

ROSE

Even mundane things, like -- which movies and songs become a hit, and what kind of clothes we wear?

RAIDEN

I think taste would be the easiest thing to manipulate.

RAIDEN

I mean, think about the kinds of film and bands everyone wants to go to see --it's whatever's at the top of the charts.

ROSE

And if the charts are made up...

RAIDEN

Exactly.

ROSE

But you can't really control individual taste. It's too closely tied to personality.

RAIDEN

I don't know about that. Trends have always been about following the leader...

ROSE

Not necessarily.

RAIDEN

The age of direct personal interaction is over. So is the idea of word-of-mouth communication. Rose, you have any friends you've met online?

ROSE

Huh? Yeah, I do.

RAIDEN

How many?

ROSE

Well -- if you count only the ones I talk to a lot, I'd say about twenty.

RAIDEN

How many of those have you actually met?

ROSE

One or two, tops...

RAIDEN

Uh-huh. That's how it is for everyone, I guess. And even if your online buddies had fake identities and were circulating false information, you'd have no way of knowing.

ROSE

Fake identities... (She's worrying about herself.)

RAIDEN

Right. And there'd be no way for you to know for sure.

ROSE

Well, what about people who do meet face to face then -- like us?

RAIDEN

Us?

ROSE

Have you ever really shown me the real you?

RAIDEN

... I wouldn't even know the real me myself.

ROSE

But you're being honest with yourself now -- well that's how I see it.

RAIDEN

Well, how am I being honest?

ROSE

I've never seen you show so much -- feeling. Fear, anger, even a kind of giddiness...

ROSE

It may seem a strange thing to say, but you're living out loud for the first time that I've seen.

RAIDEN

I'm just trying to get the job done. This is war, you know.

ROSE

I do know that. I'm just saying you're different from your usual restrained self.

RAIDEN

What about you, then?

ROSE

I always want to be open with you, as much as I can...
After the Colonel goes crazy

RAIDEN

Rose, the Colonel is acting strange.

ROSE

Oh? I haven't heard from him in a while.

RAIDEN

What do you mean? Isn't he there?

ROSE

No, I'm by myself.

RAIDEN

You're telling me you've never met the guy either?

ROSE

No -- and they blindfolded me when they brought me here.

RAIDEN

I've never seen his face...

ROSE

Is everything okay?

RAIDEN

Yeah -- It's nothing. Don't worry about it.
Tengu passageway A

RAIDEN

Rose, can you hear me?

ROSE

I'm right here.

RAIDEN

Actually -- that's okay. Forget it.

ROSE

Jack? What is it?

RAIDEN

You wouldn't understand.

ROSE

Try me, Jack. Please?

RAIDEN

I can't, not to you.

ROSE

Please tell me. I can help you.

RAIDEN

No. There's no way you'd understand.

ROSE

You can tell Snake, but you won't tell me?

RAIDEN

He's different.

ROSE

Why? I'm in this war too -- with you.

RAIDEN

No, the war is out here. Not on a live feed to some control room.

ROSE

You want me to pick up a gun and fight, is that it?

RAIDEN

Lord, no. You're the one person that I'd do anything to keep out of this place.

ROSE

Then what is it?

RAIDEN

I'm a -- a killer.

ROSE

But...

RAIDEN

I see men hit, I see them die in agony. And I don't feel a thing for them.
*Rose's character model turns into the Colonel's (wires are getting crossed)

ROSE

Don't think things like that, Jack.

RAIDEN

I'm a born and bred killer, nothing like Snake. He fights for something he believes in...
*Rose's model reappears

ROSE

So do you. You're doing your duty!

RAIDEN

No, I'm not. Somewhere deep inside, I'm enjoying this -- this game.
•Rose
Miscellaneous
Game over voiceovers
Rose shouts into the Codec. The Patriots injected Rose with nanomachines programmed to carry out a specific function when Raiden flatlines. When Rose is shouting for Jack, she is on the verge of a literal heart attack; she dies shortly after saying her lines. However, players will perhaps only pick up on this detail if they pay close attention to her gasp at the very end of each of her game over lines.

ROSE

Jack! What's going on? Answer me! Jack!? Jack!!! Ohh...

ROSE

No, this isn't happening! Jack, you have to answer me! Jack! Jack!!!

ROSE

No...no!! Jack, please answer me! Jack!!!

ROSE

Oh god no... Jack! Jack!! Jack!!!
•Snake
Weapon Facts and Figures
PSG1

SNAKE

The PSG1 is an anti-terrorist automated sniper rifle.

SNAKE

It features roller-locked action which allows a full free-floating barrel.

SNAKE

The end result is an automatic rifle with precision equal to that of a bolt-action sniper rifle.

SNAKE

The rifle has a 5-round group capacity of 50 mm at a range of approximately 270 meters.

SNAKE

In my opinion, the PSG1 is one of the finest sniper rifles in the world. Although you've probably fired a few rounds in VR training, there are a few differences in handling the rifle you should be aware of.

SNAKE

First, that the PSG1 is equipped with a special magnification-adjustable scope.

SNAKE

For precision shooting, it allows you to zoom in on your target. And for wide-range viewing, all you have to do is zoom out.

SNAKE

Another difference is that you aren't limited to firing from the prone position. In short, you can fire from a crouching or standing position.

SNAKE

However, the less stable your position, the tougher it is to hold your aim steady.

SNAKE

For accuracy, the best thing to do is crawl up to your target and fire from a prone position.
PSG1-T

SNAKE

The PSG1-T that you have there is a PSG1 with a modified barrel for firing tranquilizer rounds.

SNAKE

It handles like a PSG1. The only difference is that it spares lives.

SNAKE

It's up to you whether you want to use it or not.
M4

SNAKE

Looks like you've got an M4. The M4 is an assault carbine favored by the U.S. SOCOM.

SNAKE

It's a descendant of the M1 carbine used in World War II.

SNAKE

The "4" refers to the fact that it's the fourth carbine to be officially adopted by the American military.

SNAKE

Basically, it was developed for the Special Forces using the M16A as a base.

SNAKE

The M4 carries thirty rounds of 5.56mm x 45 SS109s.

SNAKE

By the way, carbines are short-barreled rifles originally developed for cavalry use. But as far as you're concerned... you won't need to remember that.
Coolant Spray

SNAKE

The coolant spray that you have is great for freezing the C4 set by Fatman.

SNAKE

After you equip the spray, you can discharge the coolant by pressing the Weapon Button.

SNAKE

When the coolant is exposed to the open air, it changes into a gel and adheres to the C4 and stays at a low temperature.

SNAKE

Spray a lot of coolant to cover the C4 and make sure that it won't melt away.

SNAKE

This means that once you coat the C4 with this stuff, you can assume it won't explode.

SNAKE

You've got enough there so you don't have to worry about running out.

SNAKE

It's important to remember that once you equip yourself with the spray, you won't be able to move.

SNAKE

If an enemy approaches while you're spraying the coolant, the best thing to do is put it away and hide.

SNAKE

On top of dealing with the C4, you can use the spray against an enemy. Don't forget that.
Claymore

SNAKE

That's a Claymore mine. The Claymore is a directional mine that can be set up on the ground.

SNAKE

It's mainly used for ambush or defense. It can also be used against light vehicles and other soft-skinned targets.
Claymore (2) - if they disappear

SNAKE

That claymore mine has a built-in stealth function. It becomes invisible to the eye once it's set.

SNAKE

To find this type of mine once it's been set requires you'll need either a mine detector or thermal goggles.

SNAKE

When the stealth function kicks in, the mine's anti-personnel sensor goes immediately into action.
Claymore (3)

SNAKE

This mine goes off when it detects someone approaching from the front. The explosion fans out shrapnel and metal balls to create a fan-shaped destructive zone.

SNAKE

An important thing to remember is that the sensor is not selective... the mine will attack friend or foe.

SNAKE

What I'm trying to say is -- don't trigger your own trap.

SNAKE

You can recover a set Claymore by crawling up to it carefully.

SNAKE

That means you can collect enemy Claymores for your own use if necessary...
C4

SNAKE

I see you've managed to get a hold of some C4 plastic explosive.

SNAKE

Composed of 91% RDX and 9% inert plasticizers, it's a white, claylike material.

SNAKE

It's a very stable explosive with over 1.3 times the power of TNT.

SNAKE

Immune to heat or shock, C4 will only explode when triggered by a detonator.

SNAKE

Since your wireless detonator is equipped with both a scrambler and encryption, you don't have to worry about the C4 being accidentally triggered by other wavelengths such as those emitted by jamming devices.

SNAKE

You set the C4 with the Weapon Button and detonate it with the Punch Button. One other thing... don't get caught in its blast.
Directional Microphone

SNAKE

The directional microphone is a very sensitive piece of equipment that picks up the slightest sound.

SNAKE

It's a high-precision mike that's been designed to pick up sounds in front of it.

SNAKE

In short, it will pick up sounds in the direction you point it.

SNAKE

The microphone comes equipped with a miniature amplifier that will pick up a heartbeat if it's pointed properly at a living target.
RGB6

SNAKE

You've got an RGB6, a Croatian-manufactured 40mm, 6-round grenade launcher.

SNAKE

It's a weapon that was unavailable in VR training.

SNAKE

The RGB6 has a spring-driven revolver-type cylinder for handling six grenades.

SNAKE

It delivers grenades with greater accuracy than throwing the things, and it's effective for taking out enemies with body armor -- not to mention those hiding behind objects.

SNAKE

Since a launched grenade travels on a parabolic trajectory, hitting a target depends on your angle of fire.
Stinger

SNAKE

The Stinger is a portable surface-to-air missile launcher. Once you lock on to a target and fire, the missile will automatically pursue the target using its infrared seeker.

SNAKE

However, the Stinger you have hasn't been updated to deal with countermeasures.

SNAKE

The missile's seeker might be thrown off course by flares. Don't forget that.
Remote-Controlled Missile

SNAKE

You've got yourself a remote-controlled missile. Referred to as Nikita, it's a wireless guided projectile.

SNAKE

It's a surveillance missile based on Micro Air Vehicle technology. You control it by watching the image transmitted from the CCD camera mounted on the missile.

SNAKE

Although it's primarily designed for scouting missions, it carries a small explosive charge that allows a long-distance attack.

SNAKE

You can also trigger the charge by removing it from equip status following the missile's launch.

SNAKE

You won't be able to move while controlling the missile. Also, you'll have to be careful that you don't run out of fuel while it's in flight.

SNAKE

Unlike VR training, you won't have a bird's-eye view to help you control the missile.
Grenade

SNAKE

The hand grenade is an anti-personnel weapon that is manually delivered to a target. Put simply -- you throw it.

SNAKE

The blast itself and the resulting shrapnel takes out enemy targets.

SNAKE

The grenade is charged with composite B -- an explosive composed of 40% TNT and 60% RDX.

SNAKE

You press the Weapon Button to pull the pin, and release the button to throw the grenade. Throwing distance varies with how hard you press the Weapon Button.

SNAKE

After pulling the pin, you have about five seconds before the grenade explodes. Those five seconds combined with the throwing distance gives you a certain amount of tactical flexibility.
Stun Grenade

SNAKE

A stun grenade, huh? It's a non-lethal weapon designed to daze enemies with a blinding flash of light and an ear-splitting bang.

SNAKE

When it goes off, it emits a flash equivalent to 2.5 million candelas -- and an explosive sound of over 160 decibels.

SNAKE

In simpler terms, that's over 120 times the brightness of a police flashlight and the sound of a jet during take-off.

SNAKE

At the same time, it releases about 2700℃ of heat. But that's only at the millisecond level. So don't expect it to ignite anything.

SNAKE

The sound emission is also at the millisecond level, so there's no permanent damage to the victim's hearing.

SNAKE

Used properly, your enemies will lose consciousness... It's not a lethal weapon.
Chaff Grenade

SNAKE

You're holding a chaff grenade -- an electronic warfare weapon designed to disrupt electronic equipment and jam transmissions.

SNAKE

Detonated with a small charge, the grenade releases chaff and a miniature active jammer.

SNAKE

The grenade should render electronic equipment useless for a brief period of time.

SNAKE

It's important to note that radar and other equipment which you might have on hand will also be affected.

SNAKE

So be careful with the thing if you're using electronic devices.
Magazine

SNAKE

What you've got there is an empty magazine for hand guns and automatic weapons. Press the Weapon Button for the windup, and release the button to throw it.

SNAKE

Hitting an enemy with it won't do much damage. But if used properly, it will provide a distraction.

SNAKE

Throwing distance depends on how strong you press the Weapon Button.

SNAKE

It might be even more useful if you can accurately throw the magazine to a desired spot while in First Person View.
Tranquilizer Gun

SNAKE

That's a tranquilizer gun with a sound suppressor. Hit an enemy with that and it's good night, sleep tight...

SNAKE

The time in which the tranquilizer takes effect depends on where you hit your target.

SNAKE

If you want to knock somebody out with a single shot, aim carefully for vital spots like the head or heart.
*For those who have played the Tanker Chapter

RAIDEN

I think I've seen this modified gun before...

SNAKE

Yeah. It looks like the same gun used by Solid Snake two years ago.

SNAKE

Following that terrorist incident, similar models were made and sold among the fans of his exploits. I think that's one of them.
*Convergence point

SNAKE

That's an American military M9 modified for tranquilizer bullets.

SNAKE

When the tranquilizer bullets hit a target, the round uses the force of the impact to mix the drug, also producing a gas in the process.

SNAKE

The pressure of the gas drives a built-in piston that injects the target with a powerful anesthetic.

SNAKE

It's like firing a small hypodermic syringe.

SNAKE

This M9 is a tranquilizer gun that knocks out the enemy... it doesn't kill them.
SOCOM

SNAKE

That pistol you have is a SOCOM. It's a 45-caliber Offensive Handgun designed for the American Special Ops Command.

SNAKE

With twelve rounds of 45ACPs, it has outstanding stopping power.

SNAKE

The SOCOM has a minimum service life averaging over 6,000 rounds, and has a five-round group capacity that extends within a 1.4-inch radius.

SNAKE

It's a bit large, but the SOCOM is a gun you can trust. It also comes equipped with a laser-aiming module.
*If it doesn't have a suppressor

SNAKE

A suppressor can be attached to the SOCOM to silence gunshots. You should try to find one.
*If it does have a suppressor
(1)

SNAKE

You've got a suppressor, too.
(2)

SNAKE

Your SOCOM's got a suppressor.
*Convergence point

SNAKE

The suppressor uses multiple partitions to reduce gas discharge and keep sound and muzzle fire to a minimum.

SNAKE

By keeping the internal baffles moist, sound can be reduced by approximately thirty-eight decibels.

SNAKE

That suppressor can be screwed and secured to 10 different positions.

SNAKE

This function allows you to adjust the gun's impact point. But that doesn't really matter.

SNAKE

That's because the suppressor's already been adjusted. You should be able to get the same results you got when you didn't have a suppressor attached.

SNAKE

This'll reduce your chances of discovery as long as you don't leave too many bodies around...

SNAKE

Your ammo is also limited, so don't go shooting everything in sight.
AK

SNAKE

So, you've got an AKS-74u.
*Special requirement

SNAKE

If you wear an enemy's field outfit and carry an AK, you can pass for one of them.
*Convergence point

SNAKE

The AK is an outstanding rifle in terms of precision and reliability.

SNAKE

As evidenced by widespread licensed manufacturing -- not to mention large quantities of illegal reproductions -- the AK is in high demand around the world.

SNAKE

It is often used as reference for the design of new rifle models.

SNAKE

Designs for Israel's Galil, Finland's Valmet, and other rifles are based on the basic structure of the AK.

SNAKE

You have a smaller model of the AKS-74 that was designed for use by Special Forces personnel.

SNAKE

The stock will only extend to a maximum length of 726mm...

SNAKE

... a feature that makes the rifle easier to handle in small spaces.
*If there isn't a suppressor attached

SNAKE

The AK can be fitted with a suppressor. With a suppressor, you won't have to worry about your gunshots being heard.
*If there is a suppressor attached

SNAKE

So, you're using the suppressor. Now you won't have to worry about the enemy hearing your gunshots.
*Special requirement

SNAKE

Listen up, kid and don't forget this -- only the guards in Shell 1's core are armed with AK rifles.

SNAKE

The others are armed with the AN94, the official rifle of the Russian army.

SNAKE

If you hope to disguise yourself as the enemy, you don't want to be carrying an AK outside of Shell 1's core.
SOCOM - cocked and locked

SNAKE

The SOCOM I gave you has a double action trigger mechanism.

SNAKE

For tactical reasons, the gun's been engineered to "cock and lock," a feature allowing the safety to be locked with the trigger cocked.

SNAKE

Hostage rescue operations require precision shooting and response in millisecond terms.

SNAKE

Rescue team members did not think highly of the first-round double action with the switch-over to single action in the following rounds.

SNAKE

Their solution was to "cock and lock." With the trigger cocked and the safety locked, the first round could be fired relatively faster.

SNAKE

Aside from the time-saving nature of this feature, it is also of vital importance when combat shooting is the foremost consideration.

SNAKE

By making the first round a single action shot, subsequent pulls of the trigger can be conducted in the same manner.

SNAKE

In short, "cock and lock" allows for smoother and more rapid firing.
•Snake
Items
Magazine

SNAKE

Raiden... what've you got there?

RAIDEN

Uh... nothing.

SNAKE

Oh, come on... don't play dumb. That kind of thinking might even be helpful on the battlefield.

RAIDEN

Yeah, but...

SNAKE

Look... aside from its educational value, you can probably use it to distract an enemy...
Cigarettes

SNAKE

I see you've still got those cigarettes I gave you.

RAIDEN

I quit a long time ago...

SNAKE

Maybe now's the time to start again?

RAIDEN

...

SNAKE

Just joking, kid. Those things'll stunt your growth and ruin your health.

SNAKE

But in the battlefield, you'll find there's other uses for those cigarettes besides smoking.

SNAKE

I'm sure you'll figure out how to use 'em when the time comes...
B.D.U.

SNAKE

I see you're wearing the enemy field uniform (B.D.U.). Looks pretty good on you.

RAIDEN

Cut it out. It's bad enough that I'm dripping with sweat wondering when somebody's gonna see through my disguise.

SNAKE

Don't worry. And quit being so sensitive. At least your walk won't give you away...

RAIDEN

My walk? Whaddya mean my walk?

SNAKE

Nothing. Forget I said it.

SNAKE

I'd worry more about the fact that the uniform's a little small for your size.

SNAKE

It just might come off when you bump into an enemy...

SNAKE

Normally, a proper-fitting uniform is issued to a soldier. You're just going to have to fit your movement to the uniform...
Cardboard Box

SNAKE

The cardboard box that you have is ideal for fooling your enemies. It's a very important tool for infiltration missions.

RAIDEN

Really?

SNAKE

Of course. I can't begin to count the number of agents whose lives were saved by a cardboard box...

RAIDEN

*disbelievingly* You mean everyone's using them?

SNAKE

Look. I'm not exaggerating when I say the success of your mission hinges on how you use that cardboard box.

RAIDEN

...

SNAKE

But in the end, a cardboard box is only made of paper. Handle it with care or it won't be of much use to you.
*If player shot Snake while he was under a cardboard box and it fell apart

SNAKE

Y'know... I've lost a couple thanks to you...

RAIDEN

What?

SNAKE

Nothing... Forget it.
*Convergence point

SNAKE

Treat your cardboard box with care. Take care of the box and it'll take care of you...

SNAKE

Don't think of it as just another box. Treat it with love... Don't be rough. Okay?

RAIDEN

...
Anti-Personnel Sensor

SNAKE

You're using your Anti-Personnel Sensor. It vibrates whenever an enemy is approaching your position.

SNAKE

The sensor responds to the electromagnetic field and heartbeat of life forms. The closer an enemy, the bigger the vibration.

SNAKE

It's a useful device. But remember that if you're equipped with the sensor, you won't be able to feel any other vibrations around you.

SNAKE

It's like life... You gain something only to lose something else. It's up to you to decide where and when you want to use it.
Mine Detector

SNAKE

That mine detector that you're equipped with displays the location of Claymore mines that aren't visible to the naked eye.

SNAKE

It's not your run-of-the-mill mine detector. It's the latest model to use the technology developed in a private μchem lab.

SNAKE

It isn't a metal detector. It's based more on the various systems used in chemical detectors.

SNAKE

In short, it doesn't respond to a mine's metallic casing. It actually detects the elements used in explosives.

SNAKE

Basically, it's similar to the sensor that the old man gave you... the one that responds to the "smell" of C4.

SNAKE

That's why you can accurately detect the location of mines despite the fact that you're in a metal-based structure.
*If radar cannot currently be used

SNAKE

There's no point using the detector without employing the radar.
Sensor A (1)

SNAKE

I see the old man set you up with a Sensor A unit.

SNAKE

Aside from C4, explosives continually release their own specific particles.

SNAKE

Based on ion mobility spectrometry technology, Sensor A is capable of detecting particle clusters.

SNAKE

Simply put, the detector can "sniff out" C4.

SNAKE

The detected C4 appears on radar as a cloud-like shape. The cloud indicates the rough location of the explosive.
Sensor A (2)

SNAKE

This sensor looks like it's been specially tuned.

SNAKE

It's been specially modified to sniff out the signature odor of C4 combined with Fatman's special perfume that he uses to identify his work.

SNAKE

That's why it won't respond to any of the C4 that we've set up.
*Additional dialogue after end of bomb disposal event

SNAKE

We got a lot of use out of this thing. We probably won't need it anymore.
Sensor B (1)

SNAKE

You're using Sensor B. It's designed to pick out the "odorless" C4 set up by Fatman.

SNAKE

Unlike Sensor A, which detects explosive particles, this unit detects the explosive inside an object sealed by neutron emission.

SNAKE

The sensor should be able to detect C4, despite the fact that it's been securely sealed to prevent "odor" or, more specifically, the diffusion of explosive particles.

SNAKE

When neutrons pass through an object, the hydrogen material it contains interacts to produce a rear diffusion.

SNAKE

By measuring this rear diffusion with the detector, the resulting value is analyzed to determine the existence of an explosive.

SNAKE

Simply equipping yourself with this unit and the sensor will automatically scan the area around you, and will sound a warning if there's an explosive nearby.

SNAKE

Always remember that the shorter the intervals between the warning sound, the closer the location of the bomb.
Sensor B (2)

SNAKE

This sensor is adjusted to respond only to the C4 used by Fatman.

SNAKE

The composition of our C4 and that of Fatman's seems to be slightly different. I think it may be the wax materials that he uses in his explosives.

SNAKE

The old man probably concentrated the bulk of his time on making this modification.
Sensor B (3)

SNAKE

However, since we've taken care of all the C4, and given the fact that Fatman is no longer with us... I don't think we'll need this sensor anymore.
Binoculars

SNAKE

That pair of binoculars is a high-end military model with auto-focus and zoom features.
*Prior to torture event only

SNAKE

The binoculars will be particularly useful when used outside the "Big Shell."
*Convergence point

SNAKE

If you can spot an enemy in the distance at an early stage, it'll give you plenty of time to do something. Scouting out the location of your enemy is vital to the success of an infiltration mission.
Camera

SNAKE

Planning to take some pictures? Well, you've got the right camera for the task.

SNAKE

With auto-focus and zoom features, this camera guarantees clear pictures.

SNAKE

It won't wear with use... So take all the shots you want.
Night-Vision Goggles

SNAKE

Those night vision goggles will let you see in the dark.

SNAKE

The goggles are equipped with an image intensifier that amplifies even the lowest levels of light to produce clear images.

SNAKE

Night vision devices were introduced in the 1940s. Since then, they've undergone several modifications to improve both sensitivity and resolution.

SNAKE

Incidentally, the set you're using is a fourth-generation model.
Thermal Goggles

SNAKE

Those Thermal Goggles provide night vision by creating images from heat distribution.

SNAKE

The goggles have a resolution of over 400,000 pixels, and their equivalent noise thermal differential is under 0.05℃.

SNAKE

This performance is largely attributed to the use of a two-dimensional solid projection system with outstanding electric charge transfer capability.

SNAKE

With these goggles, you can probably see Claymore mines that are rendered invisible with stealth camouflage.
*If player has collected an enemy dog tag

SNAKE

If you look around the necks of enemy soldiers, you can probably make out their dog tags.
Ration

SNAKE

You've got rations. Rations are military food provisions capable of LIFE recovery.

SNAKE

Select a ration in the menu display and press the Confirmation Button for LIFE recovery.

SNAKE

If you equip yourself with rations, you can automatically recover LIFE the moment it hits zero.

SNAKE

Field rations are not just emergency food. For a soldier, it's a vital factor in maintaining combat efficiency.

SNAKE

Rations are the result of concentrated research and development efforts on the part of the U.S. Military's Cooking Laboratory.

SNAKE

Together with calories, meticulous attention is focused on balanced nutrition. Freeze-dried, the rations are easy to carry and keep well.

SNAKE

It ain't home cookin', but it'll satisfy your nutritional needs.

RAIDEN

Hmmm.

SNAKE

What's on your mind?

RAIDEN

Well, just between you and me?

SNAKE

Sure. What is it?

RAIDEN

I prefer rations over Rose's home cooking...

SNAKE

That bad, huh?
Bandage

SNAKE

I see you have the bandage equipped. Whenever you're bleeding, select the bandage in the menu display and press the Confirmation Button to stop the bleeding.

SNAKE

The bandage is an absorption pad made from alginate fiber.

SNAKE

As you probably know, when alginate fibers come into contact with blood or liquids, the colloid gels to produce a moist condition for speeding up the healing process.

SNAKE

With outstanding absorption properties in terms of speed and capacity, bandages effectively stop bleeding.
Pentazemin

SNAKE

You have the Pentazemin equipped, huh. To steady your hands when aiming with a sniper rifle, select Pentazemin in the menu display and press the Confirmation Button.

SNAKE

Pentazemin is a benzodiazepine anti-depressant used in the treatment of disorders such as depression and autonomic imbalance.

SNAKE

In addition to its calming effect, it also relaxes muscular tension and combats convulsions. The result is a steady set of hands.

SNAKE

One more thing... Pentazemin does not prevent seasickness...

RAIDEN

Seasickness...? What are you talking about?

SNAKE

I mean sometimes faith can overcome medical science.

RAIDEN

What?

SNAKE

Never mind...
Body Armor

SNAKE

I see you're wearing body armor. That's a great way to minimize damage.

SNAKE

Your body armor is interwoven with a special fiber made from high-performance polymer materials.

SNAKE

The special fiber tangles around a bullet to cushion and spread out the impact to keep damage at a minimum.

SNAKE

Bear in mind that the armor just reduces damage. It doesn't eliminate it.
•Snake
Background Objects
Fire extinguishers

SNAKE

Shoot a fire extinguisher and the contents will spew out. It's probably a good way to distract the enemy.

SNAKE

If you ever find yourself under pursuit, give it a try. Necessity is the mother of invention...
Pipes

SNAKE

If you shoot those pipes along the ceiling or the floor, jets of steam will escape.

SNAKE

Use it to distract or burn the enemy. Remember, always use the surroundings to your advantage.
Throwing distances

SNAKE

To throw something, such as a grenade or a magazine -- press the Weapon Button to cock your arm and release the Weapon Button to throw the object.

SNAKE

Remember, the distance thrown varies depending on how hard you press the Weapon Button.

SNAKE

Make sure you target the throw at the most effective spot.
Dog tags are visible with the Thermal Goggles

SNAKE

Put your Thermal Goggles on and look at the enemy's neck area. You should be able to see if he has dog tags on.
Enemy knockout timer

SNAKE

Raiden, look at the enemy you knocked out. See the stars revolving over his head?

SNAKE

When the stars disappear, the enemy will regain consciousness. Keep an eye on the spot above their heads.
Drop bodies down pitfalls

SNAKE

You can use the holes left behind from collapsing floors to your advantage.

SNAKE

Tip the bodies of enemies you've taken out into the ocean to hide them.
Cyphers

SNAKE

What you see flying before you is a "Cypher." It's a saucer-type UAV for surveillance and communication support of land and marine operations.

SNAKE

It may look strange, but it's very stable. The Cypher is capable of vertical take-offs and landings in tight areas measuring as small as 3.5 meters.

SNAKE

Also, it features a fully autonomous system that allows for tracking and analysis of man-sized targets.
*Second and subsequent times

SNAKE

You can confuse the Cypher's sensors with chaff. This not only blocks its movement, but also prevents data transmission to its controller.

SNAKE

The Cypher transmits its status and mission data to its controller via data-link.

SNAKE

Discovery by a Cypher unit means you've been discovered by your enemy. The important thing is to stay out of its visual range.
Infrared sensors, meet cigarettes

SNAKE

Infrared sensor, huh? The first thing you have to do is locate where the beam is. I always use the tried-and-true method.

SNAKE

Remember that little present I gave you? Try using that.

SNAKE

Select the cigarettes and walk up to the IR sensor. The smoke should make the IR beam visible.
Infrared sensors - the spray works too

SNAKE

You can also use the coolant spray to freeze the sensor's control unit. If you're out of bullets, it's a good backup plan.
Strut E 1F cargo elevator

SNAKE

There's a loader over there for moving cargo onto conveyor belts. Maybe you can fool the thing.
*First time only

SNAKE

It's a piece of cake -- I speak from experience.
DG Connecting Bridge - hint to use hanging to get across

SNAKE

Raiden, a full Life Gauge will slow down the consumption of the Grip Gauge. Be smart about using your ration.
Underwater - full Life Gauge

SNAKE

The consumption of the O2 Gauge will also be slower with a full Life Gauge. Make good use of those rations.
Another way to use the B.D.U.

SNAKE

Without the balaclava, you won't be able to disguise yourself as an enemy soldier anymore.

SNAKE

But aside from the balaclava, you've got the exact same gear as they have -- including those boots.

SNAKE

Select the enemy field uniform in spots where you have to leave footprints. It'll keep them from spotting your presence.
Hanging - kicking when climbing back up

SNAKE

When you swing up from Hanging, use the momentum to knock someone out. Try it when there's an enemy near the railings.
Hanging - drop and catch

SNAKE

If you see a likely handhold while you're jumping down from Hanging, try pressing the Action Button.

SNAKE

If you hit it well, you should be able to grab on. It'll work even if the direction is a little off, so play around with it.
Hanging - dropping down on enemies

SNAKE

Jump down right onto the enemy's head from Hanging to knock him out. Look down in First Person View to aim well.
Body part damage

SNAKE

Think about what the ideal spot to aim for is, depending on time and circumstances.

SNAKE

Go for the central nervous system if you absolutely have to take someone out.

SNAKE

If all you want to do is immobilize them, temporarily incapacitate their mobility.

SNAKE

If you want to make them bleed, go after their circulatory system.

SNAKE

And if radio silence is your only objective, destroy their radios.

SNAKE

Inflict only the damage that is the most effective for a given situation. Be smart. That's the key to survival.
During bomb disposal - Coolant Spray

SNAKE

The coolant spray can be a weapon as well. Spray it into an enemy's face and he won't be able to see for a while.

SNAKE

Necessity is the mother of invention. Keep improvising if you want to stay alive.
Shaking out item boxes

SNAKE

After you take someone out, shake them by pushing the Weapon Button. An Item Box may appear. Try it if you have time.
Stealing items from a holdup

SNAKE

After you hold an enemy soldier up, you could manage to seize an Item if you're lucky.

SNAKE

There are some Items you can only get from a holdup. Give it a try.
•Snake
Tactics
First Person punch

SNAKE

Punching is a basic move in hand-to-hand. To deliver a punch, press the Punch Button. Go ahead... try it.
Rolling

SNAKE

While running, you can execute a roll by pressing the Crawl Button.

SNAKE

For short distances, you can jump. And if you bump into an enemy just right, you can send the enemy flying.

SNAKE

You can also jump over any floorboards that creak every time you take a step.
Take enemies as human shields

SNAKE

Enemy soldiers will hesitate to attack if you're holding one of their own men hostage in a stranglehold.

SNAKE

This move is ideal for escaping tense situations.
Run and gun

SNAKE

You can move with your gun in the ready position by holding down either the Lock-on or Crawl button, and using the left analog stick to direct your movement.

SNAKE

If you hold down the Lock-on Button, you can move while holding your gun.

SNAKE

Should be an effective move when you need to break through some enemies. Don't forget it, kid.
C4 chain explosions

SNAKE

By setting C4 explosives within close proximity of each other, you can set off a chain of explosions with a single blast. Do it right and you can set up some very effective traps...
Bulletproof, but not grenade-proof

SNAKE

Bulletproof equipment will not protect your enemies from a grenade's blast or shrapnel.

SNAKE

A well-placed grenade could turn the tide of battle to your advantage.
Nikita speed boost

SNAKE

The less you manipulate a remote-controlled missile, the faster it'll travel.

SNAKE

Use this and you'll be able to deliver your remote-controlled missile over a greater distance.

SNAKE

Remember that the missile's range is limited by its fuel capacity. Always remember that unnecessary maneuvers can cost you fuel.
Spots where you can crouch and hide

SNAKE

You can hide behind certain objects by crouching low. It's a move that provides cover from enemy fire and also allows you to see in Corner View or to do a Jump-out shot.

SNAKE

Your survival depends on how you use the objects around you.
Tactical reloads

SNAKE

Running out of ammunition in the middle of a fire fight can be embarrassing. That's why you want to use the Tactical Reload feature.

SNAKE

Once you remove a weapon from its equip status, it will be fully reloaded automatically. You can easily do this by using the Weapon Equip Button to change equipment quickly.
•Snake
Miscellaneous
Internal responses (aizuchi)
*During Codec conversations, the player can press a button to make their character give a non-verbal response to what the other character is saying
Slight affirmation

SNAKE

Uhuh.

SNAKE

Right.

SNAKE

Yeah.

SNAKE

Hmm...
Moderate affirmation

SNAKE

I see.

SNAKE

Could be...

SNAKE

I understand.

SNAKE

Yup.
Strong affirmation

SNAKE

Right.

SNAKE

That make sense.

SNAKE

Alright.

SNAKE

Gotcha!
Very strong affirmation

SNAKE

That's right.

SNAKE

No doubt about it.

SNAKE

I'll get right on it.

SNAKE

*agrees* Yeah!
Slight repudiation

SNAKE

Really?

SNAKE

Huh?

SNAKE

I don't know...

SNAKE

Hmm?
Moderate repudiation

SNAKE

You sure?

SNAKE

I don't believe it.

SNAKE

No.

SNAKE

What?
Strong repudiation

SNAKE

Can't be...

SNAKE

I don't think so.

SNAKE

That can't be right.

SNAKE

What!?
Very strong repudiation

SNAKE

No way!

SNAKE

You gotta be joking!

SNAKE

Not in a million years!

SNAKE

Gyah!

How do you know that?

SNAKE

You do it!

SNAKE

You gotta be kidding.

SNAKE

You lied to me.

SNAKE

That doesn't sound right.

SNAKE

I don't believe it.

SNAKE

What are you talking about?

SNAKE

I don't get it.

SNAKE

It doesn't make any sense.

SNAKE

Blah blah blah.

SNAKE

Who cares?

SNAKE

Agghh! I've just about had enough!

SNAKE

Forget it!

SNAKE

No way.

SNAKE

What a big head.

SNAKE

Who do you think you are?

SNAKE

SNAKE

SNAKE

SNAKE

SNAKE

You selfish...

SNAKE

What's with this guy?

SNAKE

You make it sound easy.

SNAKE

You seem to know everything.

SNAKE

SNAKE

Game Over
*Snake shouts into the Codec

SNAKE

Raiden! Are you all right? Answer me!! Raiden!!!

SNAKE

Raiden, what's going on? Raiden! Raiden!!

SNAKE

Raiden! Is something wrong? Raiden! Raiden!!

SNAKE

SNAKE

SNAKE

SNAKE

OTACON

OTACON

Snake! Raiden, what were you thinking!?

ROSE

Snake! Jack, what the hell just happened?!
•Peter
Bomb Disposal Evaluations
*As determined by time taken and number of game overs
Player took too long

PETER

You're taking too much time. You should work a little faster.

SNAKE

There's no time, Raiden. I've got my hands full here, so it doesn't look like I can help you. It's in your hands.
Player took an average amount of time

PETER

You're faster than I expected... and more capable than you look.

SNAKE

I've done one too, finally. Let's keep our heads up.
Player was fast

PETER

You're pretty fast. Well, not bad for a beginner, anyway.

SNAKE

Hmm... it looks like VR Training does come in handy.
Player was really fast

PETER

Damn, you're fast! Even if I was still young, I couldn't operate like that.

SNAKE

What is this, a Time Attack mode or something!?
Player got spotted too many times

PETER

You're being spotted by the enemy a bit too much. Proceed with more caution.
Player killed too many enemies

PETER

Looks like you like to fight. Still, it would be wiser to proceed more stealthily.
Player ate too many Rations

PETER

Aren't you eating a bit too much?
Player engaged in too much naughty behavior

PETER

Hey, you. Has anyone ever told you you have some issues?
•Peter
Bomb Disposal Event-Related
Access the node

PETER

The Sensor A that I gave you is set so that the position of bombs will appear on the radar.

PETER

Didn't I say that if you don't first initialize the radar, you won't get anywhere? Now search for the node.

PETER

If you're not sure where the node is, ask your superior officer. He should know.
Sensor explanations
(1)

PETER

Equipping yourself with Sensor A will bring up a visual representation of the odor of C4s on your radar. It will appear as a mist-like image.

PETER

C4 is sure to be planted anywhere where there is a response. Search carefully.
(2)

PETER

Sensor A can't specify the exact location of bombs.

PETER

It's unfortunate, but only the area can be localized. Once you've got the area, you'll have to continue your search using your own two eyes.
(3)

PETER

The sensor has a high dependability factor. Consider it error-proof.

PETER

Even if a glance reveals nothing, you can be sure there is a C4 in the vicinity if the sensor responds.

PETER

Try thinking from Fatman's perspective, and you're sure to find something. Look carefully.
How to use the Coolant Spray

PETER

The coolant spray will never run out no matter how much you use it. Go ahead and utilize it freely.

PETER

Note, however, that the spray has a range of only several meters. Be sure to factor in the distance between you and the bombs when you use it.
Coolant Spray First Person pointers (1)

PETER

When you equip yourself with the coolant spray, you will enter the First Person View Screen. Now, be careful, as this means that you can't move while spraying.
Coolant Spray First Person pointers (2)

PETER

Even in places that you can't reach or narrow areas that you can't enter, the spray should reach provided you stretch out your arm.
The bombs

PETER

When the lamp on the detonator stops pulsating, it indicates that the bomb has been frozen -- meaning that the bomb has been successfully defused.

PETER

Apply the spray until the lamp stops blinking.
After first call

PETER

Still... There's something strange. It's not like him.
Bomb remaining in current area
*If yes

PETER

There are still bombs in that area that haven't been disposed of. Search carefully.
*If no

PETER

Well done. It looks like there are no more bombs in that strut. Now, head for the other struts.
Bomb locations don't add up

RAIDEN

About this bomb... it's been placed in a somewhat strange location...

PETER

Agreed. It doesn't make sense. Not for him, anyway.

RAIDEN

You sound like you've got everything figured out.

PETER

That's because I do. I know exactly how his mind works.
What are you doing right now, Peter?

RAIDEN

Stillman, are you all right over there?

PETER

Yeah, no problem.

RAIDEN

You must be bored.

PETER

Hardly. Between dealing with you guys and calibrating this, I've got my hands full...

RAIDEN

What did you say?

PETER

Ah, nothing. It's just that it would be best if we didn't have to use this. Anyway, get to those bombs.
Peter's pearls of wisdom (1)

PETER

Put simply, bomb disposal is a one-on-one with fear itself. Don't try to run away from it. Instead, acknowledge the fear, and take it straight on.
Peter's pearls of wisdom (2)

PETER

Discretion is the key when taking on a bomb.

PETER

A degree of caution that taxes your sense of meticulousness. Don't confuse this with cowardice, as it is the extreme opposite. Carefully conduct yourself with a courage that ensures you get the job done right.
Peter's pearls of wisdom (3)

PETER

Listen up, Raiden. No matter what, don't be impatient. Impatience is questionably the one state of mind absolutely guaranteed to seal your fate when defusing a bomb.

PETER

No matter how the situation presents itself, you must never lose your composure. Understood?
Peter's pearls of wisdom (4)

PETER

Bomb disposal is also a race against time. The slightest hesitation can lead to a loss of time, and inevitably, lives.

PETER

Don't do anything rash. Focus yourself on being fast and efficient.
Peter's pearls of wisdom (5)

PETER

When dealing with a bomb directly, the only one you can depend on is yourself. Don't count on anyone else. Foolishly doing so will bring death upon you. Believe in yourself and you'll be all right.
Otacon

PETER

By the way, Raiden, did you happen to see the technician that came down along with me?

RAIDEN

No, I didn't.

PETER

... I see.

RAIDEN

Wait, Stillman. Is that guy really...

SNAKE

Raiden!

RAIDEN

?

SNAKE

Disposing of the C4 is our first priority. There's no time. Get back to the task at hand.

RAIDEN

Right, I gotcha.
Pliskin

PETER

Looks like Pliskin shouldn't be having any problems. You'd better look sharp as well.

RAIDEN

Stillman, do you really believe that Pliskin is not a member of SEAL Team 10...?

PETER

He is probably not.

RAIDEN

Then exactly what is he...?

PETER

I'm not sure.

RAIDEN

...

PETER

But there are other things that I am sure of.

RAIDEN

Like what?

PETER

Like that I can believe in him, that's what. There's something about him.

PETER

A certain something that's found only in men of strength, trust-worthiness, and reliability.

RAIDEN

I see... Anyway, I'm getting back to the mission.
Peter's past
*If player hasn't heard anything from the Colonel

RAIDEN

Stillman, I heard you made quite a name for yourself in the bomb disposal field.

PETER

Nothing of the sort. It's only that you never hear people badmouth retirees.

RAIDEN

Why did you retire?

PETER

I forgot. At any rate, rather than dwelling on past occurrences, shouldn't we focus on taking care of the pressing issue currently at hand?

RAIDEN

True enough. I'll get back to work.
Fatman's backstory

RAIDEN

Stillman, tell me something about Fatman.

PETER

Hmm... Well, to start, he was born the son of a clockmaker.

PETER

Neglected by his parents and without friends, it seems that he spent a lot of time by himself in his father's workshop.

PETER

Maybe that was the reason, I'm not sure, but apparently he has had a tremendous fascination with clock mechanics since he was a child.

PETER

It was at the age of ten that a guidebook that he found on the Internet changed his life forever.

PETER

That guidebook served as the basis of his eventually piecing together an atomic bomb.

PETER

It was from there that he came to be known as Fatman, and soon enough there was no one associated with bombs that didn't know his name.

PETER

In a sense, Fatman was a hero. Although what he did was recognized only by those in the trade, I'm sure that it served to greatly stir the ego of the teenage boy at the center of it all.

PETER

But he leaves his mark nowhere else. Apparently, he was hated and shunned by everyone in school.

PETER

So, he went on to focus all his energy on explosives.

PETER

He scorned the reality that surrounded him and instead chose to embrace a world that would easily grant him recognition.

PETER

Well, to be sure, it never amounted to anything more than, say, occasionally bringing a gun into school.

PETER

Eventually, Fatman came to Indian Head, the exercise training facilities of the Naval School Explosive Ordnance Disposal at which I was a lecturer.

PETER

He absorbed all kinds of knowledge, as if he hungered for bombs.

PETER

Close to 20% of the students at Indian Head flunk out of what is truly a hellish curriculum. Despite this environment, he achieved extraordinarily high marks that were without precedent.

PETER

After leaving Indian Head, he joined up with NEST (Nuclear Emergency Search Team), said to be the most accomplished bomb disposal unit.

PETER

It was there that he apparently got into some trouble.

RAIDEN

What, exactly?

PETER

You got me. But Fatman was definitely not cut out for group operations from the very start.

PETER

Having been ousted from NEST, he was picked up by Dead Cell, which was already becoming notorious for being a motley crew of sorts.

PETER

It seems that it was through surprise attack maneuvers later conducted by Dead Cell that Fatman completely subdued his former companions from NEST.

PETER

While being the most peculiar individual among my students, he was also the most talented. Be sure not to underestimate him. Are we clear?
Peter on the move - odorless C4

PETER

Is that you, Raiden? I haven't reached Strut H yet.

RAIDEN

Stillman... Do you really think there are bombs that the sensor's not picking up?

PETER

Right... Sealing the entire casing of the bomb prevents the odor from leaking outside. It's a technique that I, for one, didn't teach.

RAIDEN

But wasn't leaving a signature of sorts Fatman's aesthetic touch?

PETER

Perhaps this Fatman is not the one I knew...

RAIDEN

What?

PETER

Fatman right now is fragile and weak... what's more, he's dangerous. Watch yourself, okay?
Explaining how he can walk

RAIDEN

Stillman, how ya feelin'?

PETER

All right. It's been a while since I've run, though...

RAIDEN

*sarcastically* Guess that means it's also been a while since you've run out of breath, huh?

PETER

Are you accusing me of something, Raiden?

RAIDEN

No, I didn't mean anything by it...

PETER

No, no. I should be condemned.

RAIDEN

Wait, everybody makes mistakes...

PETER

But it's the reasons behind those mistakes that become the real issue.

RAIDEN

What do you mean?

PETER

The reason that bomb exploded... and the reason that I was saved... is because I was confronted by fear, and I couldn't handle it.

PETER

Halfway through disposing of the bomb, I succumbed to that fear... and when I realized what was going on, I had turned around and was running away from the bomb.

PETER

The one who paid the price, however, wasn't me.

PETER

After I regained consciousness from the shock of the blast, the first thing that my eyes met were the corpses of children crushed under a pile of rubble.

RAIDEN

Stillman...

PETER

Yet, what do you think I felt at that time?

PETER

A sense of relief. Relieved that it wasn't me.

RAIDEN

...

PETER

And that's not all.

PETER

At the time, I was known as the top bomb disposal technician in the United States.

PETER

And to someone like me, who had neither a wife nor children, that reputation was everything. I didn't want to lose it.

PETER

That's why I lied about losing my leg... ran away from the responsibility that was mine... closed my eyes to the victims... stirred up the sympathy of the public.

RAIDEN

All right, Stillman. That's enough. For now, let's just worry about what we're going to do about Fatman's bombs.

PETER

... Yeah.

Raiden
*While crossing the oil fence by herself during the sniping event, Emma voices her thoughts about Raiden while she's hidden behind a column and thinks no one can hear her

Bumping into Johnny Sasaki
*During the sniping event, Emma has an encounter with Johnny Sasaki behind one of the columns

JOHNNY

Freeze!

EMMA

Ack!

JOHNNY

A girl! What're you doing here?

EMMA

It's not by choice, thank you very much.

JOHNNY

Oh.

EMMA

*cautiously* You're not gonna -- shoot me?

JOHNNY

Nope...

EMMA

Why not?

JOHNNY

Stay away from good-looking women when you're fighting. Otherwise you get hit with diarrhea.

EMMA

Huh?

JOHNNY

One of the few things I learned from Shadow Moses.

EMMA

What are you talking about?

JOHNNY

Ancient history. Don't worry about it.

EMMA

Ah, I have no idea what you're talking about, but does this mean you're letting me go?

JOHNNY

Well, you could have found a nicer way to say that, but sure. Better hurry.

EMMA

Thanks...

JOHNNY

Don't mention it, just run like hell -- oh no, my stomach -- not again --
*Johnny starts waddling toward the nearest john. He looks back at Emma.

JOHNNY

... This place is about to sink. Just get out fast, okay? Ohhh...
*Emma calls out to Johnny, who's desperately trying to make it in time.

EMMA

Wait!

JOHNNY

What!?

EMMA

What's your name?

JOHNNY

Don't have one.

EMMA

... Huh?

JOHNNY

OK, fine, it's Johnny. Ohhh -- I'm not gonna make it!
*Johnny breaks out into a full-on sprint to the toilet. Emma shouts to him before he disappears.

EMMA

If we run into each other again --

JOHNNY

*not listening at all* Ohhhh!

EMMA

Hah! What a weird guy...
